This restaurant has been on my list for SO LONG and I can say that I was not disappointed at all.

Pros:
- Take reservations
- Great service! We were slow to get a server when we were seated but as soon as they realized we hadn't been helped, we were promptly helped. Our server was very attentive and we appreciate her service. Unfortunately, I do not remember her name.
- Awesome ambiance
- Delicious food

Cons:
- Dessert portions are small for price

As you can see, we really had no complaints!

What we ordered:
- Classic red sangria
- Patatas bravas
- Baked goat cheese
- Vegetable paella
- Dessert (free with every Yelp check-in!! 4 check ins = 4 desserts!!)
Apple Empanadas
Carmel Almond Bar
Chocolate Cake
Caramelized bananas

The baked goat cheese was by far my favorite dish! Definitely planning on visiting again!

Made reservations after I friend suggest we go here. We made one to celebrate my birthday. It was really great. Food was amazing. A lot of little bites to choose from so you can taste a bit of everything. Very nice, dimly lit restaurant. Grab a 1/2 pitcher of sangria if you are a party of two. We got a whole one and it was way too much! Great service with friendly staffs

I finally was able to try this place out yesterday and it was an absolutely wonderful dining experience.  I came here with a group of friends for their happy hour and it's awesome how they have happy hour everyday (including weekends) from 4-6pm.  I also really like that they have food included in their happy hour deal, not just drinks.  I loved the ambience, the decor, and how many different rooms there were.  You don't feel like you're in Lincoln Park in there, which I like.  We had a nice table by the bar.  We ordered a pitcher of sangria for $16, really tasty and did its job.  They serve you nice bread with extra virgin olive oil at the table.  I always appreciate when restaurants do that.  

We had pretty much everything pescatarian on the happy hour menu.  I tried the potato and omelette bite, which was alright.  It had too much aioli and wasn't super flavorful.  I also tried the stuffed olive with anchovy and piparra pepper.  It was a combination of interesting and unique flavors.  I really loved the pepper in the olive.  Lots of salty bitterness, which my taste buds love.

We all shared the catalan tomato bread, which was my favorite.  It had vine ripened tomato spread on it with noticeable garlic flavor and a thin slice of what I think was Manchego cheese (?) on it.  Everything was so delicious and the flavors blended well together.  We also split the spicy potatoes with tomato aioli and that was really delicious too!  The potatoes were seasoned to perfection and the tomato aioli was a nice compliment to the potatoes.  I like when it's more tomatoey than mayo so it was perfect for me.  We also split the Moroccan chickpea stew.  It tasted authentically Moroccan to me with the mild raisins in there, it definitely brought me back to my trip earlier this year.  

We finished with the flan and cheesecake.  The flan was breathtakingly good with saffron in it.  I love that they put saffron in flan, it's unique.  The cheesecake was good too with the  fresh berries.  I can't wait to go back here again and try more things!

I could not love Ba Ba Reeba more if I tried. I've been here dozens of times in the last 5 years I've lived in the city, and it never disappoints.

Things to absolutely not miss:
- Sangria. Typically I go for the red wine sangria- their "house" sangria, and it's excellent. We've been known to order pitchers (or half pitchers!) on pretty much any occasion. They're delicious and ridiculously affordable
- Brussels sprouts salad. Seriously do not miss this- the tangy flavor of the brussels sprouts and vinaigrette tied with the cheese and nuts- I could eat bowls of this salad on its own.
- Goat cheese and tomato sauce. This is heaven- dip the table bread in it when you run out of garlic bread; it's still amazing
- Octopus. It's chewy but in the best way- if you're an octopus fan I highly recommend this dish
- Roasted potatoes with aioli. Seriously I could eat a platter of these as well- they're amazing.

For the rest of it, you can't go wrong. I recommend seeing what's on special and trying a few of their rotating dishes- this place is awesome!

Pinxtos Plater
Is the cuttest most Delicious dish i have had for brunch in many years.
Gabriel was super friendly, Awesome experience,  Highly recommended

I wish we had a tapas place like this in Phoenix! My parents and I were visiting Chicago a couple of months ago and settled on tapas for dinner one night. They had never been to a true tapas place before so I was excited to introduce them to a place like this!

The place was so busy for a Tuesday night, but luckily they got us in pretty quickly and the service was tremendous. I started with some sangria, which was flavorful and delicious.

Some of our favorite tapas were...
-Fried calamari
-Shrimp with garlic, olive oil and red pepper flakes
-Seared sea scallops
-Handmade beef empanada
-Meatballs with sherry tomato sauce (one of my faves!!)
-Roasted chicken empanada
-Chicken & ham croquetas

I will definitely return next time I am in Chicago!!

Def my favorite tapas place in Chicago and one of my fav Lettuce Entertain You Restuants and yes, it does live up to its hype.

Food: Loved their sangria, white peach is my fav, well I love anything peachy. it's kinda sweet tho, so might not for people who don't like sweet drinks.
We ordered Brussel sprouts (its kinda hard to make such a generic dish extraordinary, but I liked the manchego cheese in it); Spicy potatoes is great, mild spicy and very flavorful big chuck of potato cubes. Beef tenderloin is great too, and loved the blue cheese init and the chips.
We also ordered two servings of seafood Paella. it's tasty but nothing fancy or impressive, its kinda on the salty side, and I couldn't really taste the saffron in it tho. Still on a mission of hunting for the best paella in Chicago.

Service is good and attentive. Dining environment is great with lots of cute indoor deco and cool paintings hanging on the wall, def enjoyed watching them.

Will come back to try other dishes, I feel you can't go wrong with any of them.

I work around the corner from Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and it's one of my go-to options in the neighborhood for a nice dinner after work. The restaurant is massive and still books up every weekend, so make a reservation!

I always start with a glass of sangria. And by glass, I mean pitcher, but the pitcher is glass, so I'll just say glass. They have so many different flavors and varieties, it's awesome. The blackberry has been a particular standout.

I've never had the paella here but I bet it's great. What I come for is the tapas. I love all the sharing. It's so much fun! Do you ever go to a restaurant, order appetizers and then those apps are better than your meal? Well, tapas are ALL appetizers, so everything is great.

There are so many good ones, but one kind of secret one I like to get is the ham and chicken croquettes. They're crisp and cheesy gooey and come with TWO sauces. CBBR also has some classics. The patatas bravas are great, the tortilla espanola is an eggy delight, and you have to get some bacon-wrapped dates. They also have these chorizo-wrapped dates that are stuffed with I think manchego, and you can order them by the piece. See, they know what they're doing.

4th time here!  This time - ordered the seafood paella for 2 and it was very tasty! My boyfriend also got the mango sangria. However, you couldn't really taste the mango. It had 2 pieces of apple, 1 piece of orange, 1 piece of lemon...so maybe that's why??

The paella took about 30 minutes to arrive at our table. Good thing we had some yummy bread to hold us over! The entree comes with a side of aioli and some lemon. Overall, the paella is super delicious and filling! $17 per person but they add a lot of seafood.

As for tapas, my favorite is the potatoes!! 5 stars!! Sometimes it can be overcooked though, which it was 1 out of the 3 times i've gotten it.

Will be back, especially since it's a LettuceEats restaurant!

I've been here a
Couple times and it's so delicious and busy every time. Definitely a must try for Chicago locals and people from all over. Their happy hour prices are great for sharing and the sangria pitcher is only $16  . Highly recommend!

WHY OH WHY OH WHY?

The servers are beyond rude... like no, when I ordered my food, I didn't want it right away, thanks. I totally wanted it an hour later because clearly your conversation behind the counter was WAAYYY more important than  me, starving to death.

I used to love this place, I lived around the corner and went here all the time. Management needs to get on the quality (because it is not where it was) and their employees.

Tapas style brunch was interesting. I'm not sure what I expected, but it was okay (definitely not something to rave about but definitely not bad).

I went to brunch around noon with two friends, had a reservation for 12:30 but they were able to seat us early.

We ordered tapas separately (I know, you're supposed to share! We just really all wanted the same thing). I got an eggs benedict tapa, a paella tapa and had a cafe con leche. I wasn't super impressed but at least the poached egg on top of the eggs benedict was very runny and delicious! The hollandaise was standard as well. The paella tasted like regular fried rice and I felt that the dishes weren't salted properly (especially the bacon mac and cheese which should've been salty from the bacon). My friends and I had to add salt on multiple occasions.

Overall, the service was subpar and I think the server forgot about us for the most part of our meal. He checked in maybe once and then it took us awhile to get our bill. I would not go out of my way for this place, but I would maybe come back if I was already in the area.

I went for the first time with my brother since he was visiting me. Our waitress was amazing and really did a wonderful job. The food was very good we tried all sorts of things from breakfast to dinner. I did order the skirt steak and it came out burnt. The waitress didn't even hesitate and just took it off our bill. The atmosphere was great and casual. I really thought the bloody marry bar was such a hit and great idea. The only thing I would suggest is to have a bottomless something either bloody or mimosa.

I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a while. It's very cute and busy on the inside but has a open atmosphere.

I mostly stuck with breakfast items. I liked the egg and potato small bite I had. The French toast stick bite and deviled egg were just ok. The Nutella waffle was good but I was pretty full by the time I got it (it came very late but the waitress apologized). I did not care for the chicken waffle stick, it was like a corn dog with chicken sausage, gross in my opinion! I checked in for a free dessert which I appreciate however my dessert was awful!!! It was passion fruit sorbet and it was soooo sour that it wasn't even edible and I'm not one to pass up dessert. I don't know how anyone could ever eat that, I think it was a poor choice by the restaurant.

I was really hoping that I would like cafe ba Ba Reba more Than I did especially because I'm from the suburbs and it took me an hour to get there. I'm hoping their dinner will be more impressive than their brunch. I do love the concept and I felt full and that their pricing was fair.

pics.caption: Chicken and ham croquettes- ok not for me
Short rib with mashed potatoes- ribs were fatty

review.des:
After a long day, I was ready to eat a nice dinner with very close family friends. We started off a pitcher of red sangria. I am not a fan of pitchers since it is usually watered down, but the red sangria was very good and not too sweet.
We were all vegetarians so we tried a variety of vegetarian tapas including:
1. Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Aioli - this is a typical dish for tapas but I loved this because it had a unique spicy aioli which was made the dish overall.
2. Brussels Sprout Salad, Marcona Almonds, Manchego Cheese - this was OK, not impressed as the simple dish above. I did like that they shredded the brussels sprouts that it is not overwhelming. It was bit dry, but not terrible.
3. Garlic Potato Salad - this was very good and tasty. I would only recommend to order one potato dish because it does become overwhelming with too many potatoes.
4. Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce - this was delicious. I loved how it was such a simple dish that is very tasty. They give you a herbed and butter bread with it to dip or top the goat cheese on. It was nice it warm!
5. Burrata with Catalan Tomato Bread - I love burrata. I always have to order it if it is on the menu. This was nothing different from any other burrata from any other place, but since it is my favorite cheese, i liked it.
6. Spinach & Manchego-Stuffed Mushrooms - this was the best dish of the night. This was a nice warm, baked mushroom stuffed with cheese and spinach - YUM!!!
7. The paella was the most disappointing dish, and not the most memorable ending. First, there were 5 of us, and we ordered 2 serving of paella which was more than enough for 5. we only finished 1/2 the dish. If you are getting plenty of tapas, get the smaller portion of paella. The vegetarian paella was not flavorful with mushy vegetables. i was super excited because i usually love it, but I would definitely not order this again and would not recommend this dish.
Overall, this is great for just tapas. The vegetarian tapas options were plenty and anyone can just have a meal from that.
Great place for large groups! Food is consistently good & the service is always great.

Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is my favorite tapas place in Chicago.

I've been multiple times: my friend has his birthday dinner here every year, and I recently came with a large party for a work dinner.

The venue is a bit dark and lit mostly with candles. Great for a date! It's usually bustling as they have great happy hour deals as well.

Pros: I've gotten almost everything on the menu... favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, burrata, heirloom tomato salad, grilled octopus, short rib, hanger steak, and the white peach sangria. They're also a Lettuce Entertainment You restaurant (probably one of the top options, too).

Cons: We got the vegetable paella once which was mostly like fried rice -- not worth it in my opinion and there are many other fantastic vegetarian options. Their food can be on the salty side and they are strict on checking IDs - my friend's license was taken to the manager.

This is one of my favorite neighborhood restaurants in Chicago. Red sangria is the BEST I've had, the blue cheese and steak tapas dish and the potatoes are delicious. Frankly everything is so good, it is hard to decide what to order. Get a reservation or you'll be waiting all night.

Seriously one of my very favorite fun dinner/happy hour/brunch/any meal spots in the city.  I was first introduced to Cafe Babs by a friend about 4 years ago and have been back many many times.  It's a great place for groups, out of town guests, special occasions, or just a fun meal.

Ba-Ba-Reeba is a spanish tapas and paella restaurant and seriously, everything is so delicious.  They have great pitchers of Sangria with rotating special flavors that are so fun and STRONG.

For food, you really can't go wrong on their extensive menu of tapas. I always opt for the bacon wrapped dates which are crispy, sweet, chewy and so yummy.  The Burratta is phenomenal, as is the goat cheese in tomato sauce.  The shrimp with lemon and red pepper is another favorite, as is the brussels sprouts salad which has manchego cheese and a yummy citrus dressing.

The star of the show though (if you plan your meal properly and save enough room), is the paella.  My mom was in town last weekend and begged me to take her back to "that amazing paella place."  It takes a while to cook, and they make you order at least two servings, but the servings are huge and I've found that two servings is perfect for four people after having a few small tapas to start with.  I've had the seafood and the chicken paellas and both are phenomenal, just depends on what you're in the mood for!

I also love their little tapas desserts, which are just big enough for a bite or two, which is all I ever have room for anyways.  The butterscotch pudding and the chocolate truffle cake are outstanding.

Brunch here is so fun and amazing too - they have lots of the delicious brunch items that you crave, but they're small and tapas style so you can order/try a lot! They also have a massive bloody mary bar which is a ton of fun.

Make sure you're part of the Lettuce Entertain You rewards program because their points add up quickly to rewards dollars and I often am getting $10 rewards to spend here!

If you love delicious tapas at affordable prices, check out Café Ba-Ba-Reeba!! We came here for brunch on a weekend day. It was pretty crowded, so I recommend making a reservation ahead of time! We got 4 tapas to share for 2 people. We started with the shrimp and grits. Classic brunch item with a spicy kick to it. Very creamy grits and flavorful shrimp! Then we got the citrus French toast with the MOST delicious butter I've ever tasted. We finished off with the buttermilk fried chicken and the lamb kebabs. The fried chicken was SO good! It came in a huge portion for the money you pay. I was not a huge fan of the lamb kebabs-- they were way too salty. Keep in mind that all of their items come out individually. There was a gap of up to 10 minutes between some of the tapas.

If you check in on the Yelp app, you get a free dessert tapa!!

Overall, we really enjoyed our experience here and can't wait to come back!

pics.caption: Shrimp and grits and citrus French toast
Lamb kebabs and buttermilk fried chicken

review.des:
Really great tapas! Everything I tried was really good, and they are great at pacing everything out.

For four people, we ordered 8 tapas and 2 servings of paella. It was the perfect amount of food, and we all left stuffed (after making our way through two baskets of bread as well...). The highlight of the meal was the spicy potatoes, burrata, hanger steak, and the paella. WOW those were all phenomenal. The empanadas were really good as well.
Love the curry chicken salad!  definitely love when I get to stop here when in the city.

We went here to celebrate my birthday (thanks for the chocolate mousse)! The seafood paella was super filling. Everything was good...loved the potatoes. Would recommend the passion fruit sangria over the traditional or mango sangria. My brother claims that this is his favorite restaurant of all times!!!

This is my favorite place for tapas and Sunday Brunch. Buttermilk waffle with Nutella and banana... I will take 2 please. Breakfast paella is really good and the different sangrias top off a great meal. The scallops and chicken thighs are great from the regular menu.

I was looking for a brunch spot and came across this place. It was busy, so make sure you make reservations. For those that enjoy tapas this is a great place. Here is the breakdown:

FOOD

The tapa selection was great. I enjoyed the deviled eggs, the pork belly lollipop, paella, burata and many other small dishes. Especially this breaded chicken, I forgot what it was called but that was delicious. Perfect portion for sharing for those of you that enjoy family style. For drinks we order a sangria jar and we split with the table. Very refreshing.

DECOR/ AMBIANCE

Definitely a very "medieval" modern type of feel to it. Very cute restaurant. Perfect for small or big groups. It is kind of a loud restaurant so take that into consideration when choosing it.

SERVICE

Service was ok. The waiters were polite and took a while to stop by our table but came in, took the order and occasionally followed up to check on us.

OVERALL

Great experience. I would definitely be back for the food as it is great.
I've been going to Ba-Ba-Reeba for 10 years.  The service and food are consistently very good.  If you're in the mood for Spanish tapas, you can't go wrong.

All of their food is amazinggggggg. My fave are the potatoes and the paella, but you really can't go wrong with anything you order.

Every time I visit that place, I try out new things and have never been disappointed so yup!!!

Not a fan of the sangria though, they are watery and not that great.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is really just one of those restaurants that never disappoints. Been here a couple of times and every single time they nail the food on the head. Look, if you're looking for tapas and some great paella then look no further.

On my most recent visit we got a pitcher of Sangria, the appetizer sampler, and a paella loaded with all sorts of meat. I've got to say, the meat paella was significantly better seasoned than the seafood paella I had had previously. With that said, it's difficult to decide which is better, so I guess you should just try both!

Overall Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is and will remain a Chicago favorite for years to come. Their wonderful selection and flavorful food makes them a star.

Do you want real Spanish Tapas?  This just isn't the place.  

I have been to places like this and to this restaurant a few times.  I get that Americans love the flavors that they offer here.  Garlic and queso and olives.  But they really do not exist in Spain.  

I last came here after living in Madrid for 2 month.  I was here 2 days after landing back home.  I ordered a standard spanish stable "tortilla" which is a potato and egg kind of omelette.  I ate it almost every day in Spain and if you want to know how to properly make one, watch a youtube video.  No matter how you botch it up, it will still be better than the spongy tortilla at this place. I suspect that they bake theirs - which is not the proper way to make it.  

Another Spanish staple is "Tinto de Verano."  This is a drink that you can get ANYWHERE AND EVERYWHERE in Spain during the Spring and Summer months.  I asked if they made it.  It isn't hard folks - red wine, sprite and some fruit.  The waiter looked at me strange. The bartender had to look it up on google.  It was better than the tortilla but that sure isn't saying much.  

Yes, you will like the food if you go here. It is garlic.  It is meat.  It does taste good. It just isn't Spain.

5 stars for the food!

Hands down, the food is amazing! We did not have a single bite that wasn't delicious.
We've ordered the tuna special: raw tuna, which was very delicate and fresh. The lamb special with a warm puree underneath was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing. We've also ordered the shishito peppers, which are really hard to find, but they were chargrilled to perfection and served with a little salt on top: so good. The dates wrapped in bacon are a classic, and it did taste just like I remember it from Spain. While we were pretty full after that we still decided to order desserts, and they were just the perfect size: the flan was the right texture and tasted really good, but my favorite was the cheesecake, which reminded me of the way my mom would make it, with quark, instead of cream cheese. It was soo good I wish I had a whole pie of this cheesecake.

While the food was outstanding, I would not recommend the drinks. Maybe the bartender had a bad that, but the strawberry basil caipirinha tasted pretty bad.
Plus, we were seated at the very end of the restaurant, in what felt like a private room where a party of 15 people or so took up almost the entire room, and we were sitting in the same room with them, next to a hallway that was separated by a curtain. So sadly the table and the room didn't make for the perfect experience.

We went here a few weeks ago for my sisters birthday and I can't wait to go back. The food was absolutely amazing and even on a busy Friday night the service was great!

We ordered a pitcher of sangria and we were not disappointed. It is tappas style so depending on how many people you have with you (we had three) I would order 5-6 dishes to start with and order more if needed.

THE BACON WRAPPED DATES ARE AMAZING. I would also recommend the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce

The ambiance is very fun and I love the string lights in the room we were in. Very cozy feeling. I suggested this place to about 3 other friends. I cant wait to go back!

You just can't go wrong with a meal at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. There's a reason they still pack their large restaurant after 30 years in business. I'm especially impressed with their wine selection. Reservations are definitely recommended

As much as I love the adult menu and the meals were amazing I was really disappointed in the quality of my daughters beef meal off the kid menu. It was dry and tough and she really had to work at it. Really sub par compared to the regular adult menu. Unfortunately I will not recommend this place if any of my parent friends want to come out to eat with their children.

pics.caption: Omg- these spicy potatoes are soo delicious

review.des: What can I say...as always the food was wonderful! Patatas bravas, fried Shishto peppers, garlic potato salad, Manchego stuffed mushrooms, Beef skewers, buttermilk chicken thighs, roasted dates ALL phenomenal! But of course the highlight of the evening was again the Paella Mixta OMG! A shout out to our waiter for the free desserts.

Always go here when I'm in town, and it never disappoints. This is a great place to go with even big groups (I've been with 5-10 people each time) because you can definitely order one of everything and pass it around the table. Can't wait to come back!
Amazing food, amazing service, cute date night atmosphere. We came here with another couple for our first time! She gave us free desert! So sweet! Also, must get pitchers of peach sangria!!! Enjoy!!

Busy place. Try to make a reservation before you go there.
Worth a visit. It's what you expected from a tapa restaurant as such.

-Parking is such a pain in the lincoln park area.

Great sharable plates with a small group of friends. Enjoyed their sangria pitcher. I need to go again to try their dishes but as far as I can remember, food was decent, but nothing outstanding to me yet.

This is a great restaurant, we like to order this for delivery every once in a while. My favorite items are the Chorizo-wrapped dates, deviled eggs, and stuffed mushrooms! This would be a very cool place to bring someone visiting Chicago for the first time.

Delicious food and equally delicious sangria! I've been here a few times now and the tapas are always amazing and a pitcher of sangria will definitely have you feelin' some type of way..white or red! For tapas, I always get the spicy potatoes with tomato aioli and garlic shrimp. The paella is also pretty good and easy to share with a large group.
The back of the restaurant is a bit quieter and more spacious whereas the front has TVs and a bar. It can get very busy so be sure to make a reservation!
Nice, fun atmosphere - a little outdated, food is OK. One of the only social gathering places like this in the neighborhood so it works.
Erin was amazing and brought us dessert since we are from out of town! What a welcome! The food was great already and this just sealed the deal. Thanks Chicago!

My mother won a Lettuce Entertain You Gift card from work and we decided to give Café Ba-Ba-Reeba a shot on a bone-chilling Saturday NYE weekend. We were informed of an almost two hour wait, and while thinking about what we wanted to do, the hostess had a party of 4 cancel a reservation and we were able to be seated immediately. I have never ever been so lucky at a restaurant like that, what are the odds!?

We had a quiet little nook of a table in between the two dining rooms. One thing I must say about Café Ba-Ba-Reeba is that is it HUGE! There are multiple rooms, a ton of patrons as well as waitstaff; people were still being seated for reservations at 9:30pm. It's quite an experience to watch all the different foods and people coming and going, definitely one of the busiest restaurants I've ever seen. Super cool inside, it has a rustic Spanish/European feel to it but nice energy as well.

We started with a pitcher of the daily special sangria. That night it was a mango apple one, which was amazing, dangerously easy to drink and we all got at least 2 full glasses worth of it.

We only wanted a little bit to eat so we got 5 plates between the 4 of us. Started with the brussels sprout salad. I thought it was really good, the nuts and cheese blended together well. My mother thought it was dry but I did not agree it needed much, maybe a little olive oil (already on the table) but still, not really.

Then came the garlic bread with tomato sauce and baked goat cheese. This was really good as well, super creamy cheese and it went nicely with the acidic tomato sauce, the bread was crispy.

After the garlic bread was the short rib. This was a bigger portion plate and it was good as well. I must admit it is hard to impress me with short ribs because I've had some excellent ones in the city. This Rioja-braised one from Ba-Ba-Reeba was only good, but did not wow me. The carrots and potatoes went well with it.

Then came the grilled iberico pork with chimichurri. I really enjoyed this one, the chimichurri was potent, very garlicky with a celery flavor too that went well with the tender pieces of pork.

Lastly we ordered the sea scallops. They took a very long time to come out, but were delicious. Perfectly seared over an acorn squash puree, I liked them a lot.

I forgot our server's name but he was cheery and fun, a very good representation of Café Ba-Ba-Reeba itself!

Overall a very good experience here. I like the style and cuisine that Café-Ba-Ba-Reeba serves. It's not really fancy or upscale and is more of a fun, bustling place to get wine and some good tapas.

Really need to step up their game. Array of menu choices is good, but prep and flavor just ok. Atmosphere needs sprucing up and service was lax. Hope they can improve as I love tapas and it's 2 blocks from home....

There is a Spanish aphorism that I love, "Tapas are tiny presents for happy drunks."  Whether you're drinking or not, tapas does feel like little presents and Cafe Ba Ba Reba knows how to throw a great party. Mercat is more refined and authentic, but sometimes you just want to have fun. Cafe Ba Ba Reba is festive and bustling. And it's Lettuce Entertain You so you get points.

Food is solid. We ordered the bacon wrapped dates (tapas menu), chicken and beef empanadas, beef kebabs, meatballs, goat cheese, patatas bravas, tomato bread, grilled squid, sausages, and brussel sprouts. Everything was delicious.

Was it 100% authentic? Maybe not. But hey, we didn't eat at midnight either like the do in Spain so I can live with small compromises. It was delicious and we had fun. So I'll take it.

Made reservations for Wednesday night at 9 PM. Didn't get to see all of the inside but I love the decor of the place from what I saw.

We ordered the following:

-Spicy Potatoes: For how many reviews I read that said these were amazing, I was expecting a lot more. It tasted like normal potatoes. I wish we passed on this and ordered something else more enticing on the menu.

-Spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms: These were delicious and really flavorful. Favorite thing that we ordered.

-Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce: Can you really go wrong with goat cheese... yummm.

I also got the blackberry sangria. It tasted like straight up juice. I like my sangrias a little more alcoholic.

In conclusion: I'd come again - they have a lot of vegetarian options that I want to explore.

pics.caption: Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce

review.des:
I decided to come here because I work with several people who recommended this place to me, especially  because we also work for a small plates restaurant. We sat in the bar because to the naked eye, it didn't look busy. When we got here, there were all kinds of happy hour deals going on in which we took part of, ($16 Red Sangria pitchers?! YES PLEASE!!) however, we also ordered lots of other small plates that weren't include.

The menu has a good variety of stuff, but I didn't really feel like there was a theme to the food. To me it just seemed like they created a list based on items that could be made into small portions.

We had the spicy potatoes and beef empanada (included in happy hour) as well as the grilled squid, chicken and chorizo skewer, beef skewer and chickpea stew. Everything was very tasty. I'm pretty sure every plate that left our table was completely empty.

I usually take pictures of what I order to give readers a visual of the foods I'm describing, but we came here right after a long work shift and we were so hungry we forgot to take pictures of anything besides dessert. (My bad fellow Yelpers!)  

For dessert we had the caramelized banana, the almond bar, and the flan. The flan was some of the best I have ever had, the banana was delicious, and if you like caramel... the almond bar was yummy too!

All of the food was great, but what really maximized my experience here was our fabulous service. Like I said, we sat in the bar because it didn't look very busy... except what I didn't notice was that the bar wraps around and has tables on the other side as well. At one point the bartender, Luis, had an almost completely full bar and all the bar tables all by himself and we never once longed for anything. He was well versed on the menu, fast, friendly, and very attentive. At one point I accidentally spilled my drink (obviously my fault) and before I could even order another one he had already replaced it for me at no extra charge (greatly appreciated, but totally unnecessary)

I will definitely come back, and if you're looking for Tapas, definitely give this place a shot!

pics.caption: Caramelized Banana, Marcona Almond-Caramel Bar, and Natilla Flan

review.des: We ordered seafood paella, $17/serving. It tasted badly, smelling like a lot of preservatives in the mussels and squid. The rice is half cooked. I also ordered some tapas, they are just alright, kind of salty. The only tasty one is their seared Spanish sausages-txistorra. In total, I spent approximately $100. Expensive meal for two with horrible taste! Not recommended.

The food was ok, but not fabulous. The paella was marginal. The variety of tapas we ordered were fine. If I were in my home town, this would have been fine. But with all the choices in Chicago, I don't see any reason to go. If you do, be sure to download the app Lettuce Eats. You can earn points from your meal. They also own Joes. We used the app, the night before at Joes. The first time you visit one of the restaurants you get to "spin" to win on the app and we had our points tripled from Joes. This gave us $100 odd at Ba Ba Reba.

Food was great! Our buser was amazing our server Erika was horrible. Didn't ask how was our food and our drinks. She just dropped the check off and walked away. Told her to have a better day while she just stared at me. She was playing with her hair in the corner as well which is awesome. We tipped the busser personally because he did an amazing job.

So about 25 years ago Los Lobos posited "How Will the Wolf Survive?" Yeah, well if the Wolf is in Lincoln Park he will survive very nicely at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!

First, always call for a reservation...always! We Funksters called on a Monday afternoon around 4p and our choice was before 6 or after 8:30. Whatsup wit Dat?!? So we walked in at 5:50p to an EMPTY joint. Keep in mind the place is deceptively hugh. Escorted to a back-room table nicely tucked out of the way. Nothing around us but empty tables. When we departed, the establishment was wall-to-bar human people!

Brian our server was quick with an explanation of the Tapas (small plate) concept and off to the food races we went. For the next 60 minutes or so we sampled, in no particular order: brussel sprout salad; lamb kababs; roasted bacon wrapped dates; deviled eggs; stuffed mushrooms and pork belly paella X2 (an order size well suited for us three Funksters) all outstanding and all washed down with a pitcher of possibly the best house made Red Sangria we ever swilled!

In my typical Funkster close, would we return? Well if i can reach back to  Los Lobos and "How Will the Wolf Survive", one of my favorite tracks was "I got Loaded"... So yeah, pretty sure we'd return!

Our service was mediocre but acceptable.

I should give this place five stars, though, just for its Manchego Mashed Potatoes. Good God.

I'm not entirely certain that the tapas were all bona fide Spanish, no. (But that's OK.)

Try the bacon-wrapped dates.
Yum.

Absolutely amazed at what a great dinning experience I had this evening. I can honestly rave about this place for days.  Here's the simple breakdown.

Ambience : Noisy , crowded with vibrant sounds of laugher and chatter with tables closely seated. ( some tables are even communal with dividers)

Food: tapas style ( small plate portions ) with endless flavors and options to chose from. Lots  of vegetarian, cheese and meat options.

Here's some of my favorite, that I think personally are worth ordering:

SPICY POTATOES WITH ALIOLI: crispy with a slight hint of spice makes these dangerous addictive

SPINACH AND MACHEGO STUFFED MUSHROOMS:

CHICKEN EMPANADAS: warm, fresh and the chicken inside is perfectly seasoned

FRIED CALAMARI:

MEAT BALLS:

BACON WRAPPED DATES: Not sure who discovered this divine combination of sweet and salty combination. But the bacon is crisp to perfection.

Plates are shareable. Highly advice ordering multiple different stuff to try amongst your group because everything was amazing.

Plates range from as low as 3 dollars to as high as 13 depending on the item.

2 people should expect to pay between $50-100 depending on how many drinks/food is ordered.

pics.caption: Baked goat cheese and tomato sauce ( amazing )

review.des: Oh, my gosh! Our daughter and son-in-law treated us to brunch here for my birthday.  It was our first experience and w loved every bite and every minute. The staff is high energy and friendly.  The Tappas are beautifully presented and oh-so delicious. I hope we get to go again sometime. It was the best birthday brunch ever!

This place is a whole lot of fun to eat, drink and hang out with a large group. This is the type of place where the more people you have the merrier. The tapas are ideal for sharing and the menu has a little bit of everything. We came with a large group and was able to sample a bunch of dishes, all of which tasted great. I don't think there was a single dish that I didn't enjoy.

All of the food is was so delicious! We ordered about 7 tapas and they were all perfect! We got the goat cheese, iberico ham, steak with blue cheese, patatas bravas, croquetas, and i cant remember the last few, but I would recommend everything.

We shared a pitcher of traditional sangria and it was spot on authentic sangria. They have a couple different flavors which I will try another time.

Service was great. The tables have a stack of plates, so its easy to have fresh plates all the time. Our server was attentive and checked on us a fair amount of times.

I can't wait to go back and try some more tapas.

My favorite place to get lunch or dinner when I want to indulge. Their tapas are one of a kind. Staff is always friendly and helpful.

Tip: always get a reservation or you will wait for hours!

I'm a big fan of Spanish cuisine and overall I would say this place is a solid choice. The interior is quite interesting and the food was good. Service was solid as well. We got sangria which was delicious and a bunch of tapas. I think the only dish I didn't care for was the lamb skewer if I remember correctly. It was pretty dry. Otherwise everything was delicious. My biggest problem was this massive party sitting next to us that ordered platters of paella and didn't touch it lol. What a shame. It was honestly so disrespectful to the restaurant. What a bunch of schmucks. But anyways good food and old atmosphere! Would return.

MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO. Recently moved to LA and had to write a review since I miss Babareeba so much. The melon jamon dish that they serve in the summer is the best thing I've ever had. However, you can't go wrong here it will all be delicious! Make a reservation if you plan on eating in peak hours or you'll be waiting a while (it's worth it though :))

There's nothing wrong with Cafe Baba Reeba except Spanish Square on Belmont and Southport exists. Baba Rebaa's pintxos we're good, especially the Chorizo wrap dates (which were amazing) but nothing else stood out. I can feel the quality but the parts don't add to the sum, it's missing that extra notch, like they're trying to play it safe. Some extra salt and/or MSG might have done the job. The paella was generous with shrimp but that's it. I didn't see any other seafood. The bacon wrapped dates and the paella at Spanish Square are better.

had a really fun brunch here! I loooove tapas! the restaurant is in a great little location with lots of street parking around. we had a reservation, but probably would have been seated fairly quickly even without one. service was super friendly! the waitress had a lot of good suggestions as the menu looks so scrumptious, you'll want to order it all if you don't narrow it down! the basket of bread and olive oil on the table upon arrival was a nice touch. the almond nutella is verrrrry good as are the baked eggs! they have a make your own bloody mary bar which friends at the table enjoyed. I, on the other hand, stuck to the fresh squeezed juice which was quite tasty even though it's not made in house. definitely looking forward to visiting here again as there are ton of items I'd still like to try!
Cool place, nice to try different options and combinations . But size of the portions are definitely below average , so be ready to order 3-4 pieces for one or come for drink and conversation :)

Is there anything better than tapas and Sangria? The answer is no.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a staple in the Lincoln Park neighborhood and there is a reason why many guests have been over and over again.

I've only been for the lunch menu but it is fantastic.

My second visit to the Cafe was the best. Each course came out in perfect time so we always had something to share. Every bite was perfect too and they all went together really well.

The service was fantastic! The sangria is always amazing too!

I highly recommend going to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. Be sure to make a reservation in advance - they book up quick!
Great place to eat. Tapas are delicious. Everything was good. Highly recommend it. Must make a reservation unless you are ok waiting by the bar.

With over 3,000 reviews, there isn't much more for me to say that would be different from other reviews.

I've been a few times and I really enjoy this place. The sangrias are awesome - I am a white wine fan, but love the classic red just as much.

The service is great! Servers are quick to give recommendations of popular dishes. By being tapas style food, it's fun not to know what order your food will come out in. If you order paella, that will always be last because of how long it takes to cook.

I've had so many dishes here, but my favorites are:
Mushroom Soup
Spicy Potatoes
Burrata with Tomato Bread
Bacon Wrapped Dates
Seafood Paella

This is one of my go to places when I have guests from out of town come to visit.

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I love love love the small plates. I love the ambiance and overall experience of coming to Ba-Ba-Reeba. The restaurant feels huge so even if it's crowded and noisy, you can still enjoy your meal without feeling cramped by anyone.

They give you delicious free bread when you sit down. Their white peach and passionfruit and just ALL of the sangrias are amazing.

Some of my favorite small plates are the empanadas, the buratta, short rib, Brussels sprout salad, MUSHROOM SOUP IF ITS IN SEASON!!!!, and  beef skewer. Ugh. Amazing.

The desserts are also great and so tiny and cute. They also have good brunch!

Overall, such a great experience because you can try different things. I'm so in love!!!

Everybody knows that CBBR is a happening spot. I'm not sure if it's because it fosters the kind of camaraderie that is only forged when you share too-small amounts of delicious food, or the drinks. Seriously, though, you only have to show up most any night to see that there are a whole slew of people who had the same idea you did: eat good food with good friends, and have a great time.

Recommendations:
Patatas Bravas
Escargot, when available
Fried Chicken Thighs w/PiriPiri Sauce
Grilled Hanger Steak
Burrata
Marcona Almond dessert
Creme Brulee, when available
White Peach Sangria

pics.caption: Caramelized Banana w/Toasted Pistachios, Quince Syrup, and Vanilla Ice Cream

review.des: Decent spot for a group of people. I'd recommend getting a pitcher or two of sangria. The atmosphere is fun and inviting.

Patatas bravas. All day, everyday.

Also love the brunch pinxtos, tiny bites of a variety of breakfast foods.

This adorable Spanish tapas bar is a great local spot. You can go and enjoy brunch or dinner with all great small plates. Yes it's hard to get a table most days so show up early to put your name in. The back wrapped dates and sangrias are good enough to go now!
Definitely get the sangria and the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce is to die for!!! This is a great place to go with a group so that you can order different appetizers and share tapas style.

We hadn't been to Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba for maybe 20+ years.  Tonight, we met a friend there.  

We sat in the bar and shared a half-pitcher of Sangria before our friend arrive.  Good stuff.

Once our friend arrived, we began ordering Tapas.  We did 4 items the first round, then 3 items the second round and another 3 the third round.  

So good!

Our waiter was very pleasant and attentive to our needs.  We even did the Facebook check-in for 2 free desserts.

We'd return to Cafe Ba-Ba Reebas for more food and fun next time we're in the area.

I am absolutely in love with this place! It is always very very busy even early on a weeknight, so be sure to make a reservation. My recommendation would be first of all to order a pitcher of your favorite sangria flavor and sip on this while looking at the menu because this is going to take awhile. There are so many delicious options! My favorite thing to do is go with a smaller group of around 4 and order a variety. The last time my friends and I went we each went around and ordered one appetizer and kept ordering throughout the night until we were full! This was a great way to try a variety of items on the menu without filling up to fast. And in short, this is why it is a tapas restaurant. My favorite things to order are the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, Grilled Ibérico Pork, and  Rioja-Braised Short Rib. So much flavor in each bite! Can't wait to come back!

A group of 7, we ordered a whole bunch of food and were pleasantly surprised by how consistently good each dish was.

Standouts were:
- the grilled squid- one of the best I've ever eaten in my life (including those in Barcelona). It was cooked to utter, exact perfection.
- the lobster paella ($20/serving) - so flavourful and fragrant, and worth the wait
- sangrias- we had both the mango and passionfruit and polished both pitchers off quickly, everyone loved them
- short rib- juicy and packed with flavour

The appetiser platter was just 6 tiny pieces - not bad, but only suitable for a couple. It's hard to share and probably not worth the price.

Tip: a check in here gets each guest a free dessert tapas! Only found out later and I guess we missed out on 7 desserts, but we didn't have the space for them anyway!

Before you even get here, make a reservation as the restaurant is always super packed! It is also pretty loud, as this place is way bigger than it seems, so if you're looking for a nice quiet dinner this is not the place to go.

To start off with, I got the pinxto platter, and I was such a fan of the Bacalao Croquette and the Deviled Egg. For our tapas plates, as there was only two of us, we got 4-one from each of the sections. We got the spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms, moroccan spiced lamb kebabs, seared sea scallops, and the chicken and ham croquetas. I was a fan of all of them, especially the croquetas and scallops. The croquetas practically melted in your mouth, and the scallops were just the right consistency.

The only thing I will say is that they were sending our dishes out super fast at the beginning, and then we waited about 20 minutes for simply our scallops. It seemed like they weren't spacing the dishes out very well.
Overall, I think it lived up to the hype, and I will definitely be here again to try everything else on the menu

pics.caption: spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms, and lamb skewers

review.des:
This was famed to be vegetarians heaven. But I have not figured what's the fuss all about.

The vegetarian options are either cooked on same grill or too close by to the meat. I had the potato starters and it smelled so much of meat.

The food tastes okay.

Great food, good selection of tapas. A bit on the noisy and pricey side, but food quality and presentation does make this more worthwhile. Service usually excellent,  though some days server has gone MIA for 20 minutes

One of my favorite restaurants in the city! Tapas and sangria are amazing! This is a great place to take friends and family from out of town. My boyfriend and I like to watch football on the TVs at the bar sometimes when we need a little date night during football season. Also a good girl's night out place to kick back and enjoy with your lady friends.
Highly suggest this place! And get the paella, because it's well worth the wait!!

What a terrific spot! Came here to help a friend celebrate her business successes. This place seems like a small place on the outside, but it's plenty big inside. Nice crown...even on a Thursday night. The food is delicious and served tapas style so you can try a number of dishes without over eating (that much). Here is something on the menu for everyone to enjoy. The sangria is outta this world. Flavorful, light, smooth...and served in big glasses. Be careful tho, the alcohol in stuff creeps up on you!

I really liked the vibe of this place. Bloody Mary bar and World Cup going on makes it feel like a bar, but then some great tapas reminds you this is also a nice restaurant to take your parents.

The food is excellent and the portions are decent sized so that 2-4 per person and you're set. Some of the dishes don't really lend themselves to being shared easily. I wish they would indicate that on the menu somewhere unless they enjoy watching people struggle to split a poached egg as it explodes.

Their brunch is nice and fun. It's a lot bigger on the inside vs. what it looks like on the outside. The last time I was there the food did come out slowly. They seem to make it in batches so you're somewhat at the mercy of what other tables are having.

I'd recommend as a nice local spot to go to. Food is good quality and portioned appropriately.  Atmosphere is pleasant and you can have fun with a group of friends or even as a small family.

I'm addicted to this place! I love the atmosphere and their sangria is the best I've had at a restaurant. It is strong and delicious - not watered down wine with copious simple syrup (sadly the case for so many Spanish places). The garlic shrimp is my favorite, but I also love the bacon wrapped dates and the paella is also worth trying! One of my favorite spots to visit in Chicago!

I love this place!!!! Their bacon wrapped dates are the best out of everywhere I tried! I didn't even know I liked dates until I had theirs! Love the sangria. Employees are always very nice and quick to service. They're patio area has awesome chill vibes. Definitely recommend this place 10/10. Never been disappointed with them.

Small plates! Mmmmmmm
Lots of options for everyone!

Can get busy reservations would not be regretted.

I can't think of anything negative things to say about this place because it was just that great!  I have only been once but I can't wait to go back. The food was absolutely delicious and even on a busy Friday night the service was excellent. We ordered two pitchers of sangria (one mango and one classic red) and we were not disappointed. We came for a quick bite before a night out and only ordered a few of the menu items.I recommend the Moroccan spiced lamb kebab, garlic shrimp, fried calamari, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, and the sangria!
The ambiance is adorable and I love the string lights in the room we were in. Very cozy feeling. The room was bigger than I realized so don't be fooled by the outside.

Who doesn't love tapas. Amendment: who doesn't love tapas at a place that has 5 varieties of sangria. My sister and I were in the area, and it's her favorite restaurant. We didn't have a reservation, but we thought we'd try out luck. At 5:15 on a Saturday, we were seated no problem. We found our table and immediately were presented with a basket of rustic bread- crusty outside, soft inside. And that was just the bread, friends. First order of real business was ordering sangria. I'm not one for sweet drinks, so we went with the Cava variety. It was pretty good. Still a little sweet, but not bad. We ordered a whole pitcher for 2 people (ambitious, I know). It was a lot of carbonation considering how many glasses we ended up having, but tasty nonetheless.

An order of the Brussel sprout salad, albondigas, and chicken & ham croquettas later, we were feeling full. This is when we started to regret filing up on all the bread and sangria. We paused as I checked-in on Yelp. To our surprise, there was a check-in offer! And very serendipitously, it was for a free dessert tapa. We took that as our sign to return the dinner menu and take a look at the sweet offerings they had. We went with the butterscotch caramel custard, as referenced but our waiter as "the honey badger of desserts". Now, we had no clue what that meant. Maybe it was the sangria, maybe it was the mystery - but we went with it. It was pretty decent, but I'm not sure I'd go so far as "honey badger" good (still unclear what this actually means).

This place is a great group dining spot for tapas and sangria, and live music. The venue is pretty huge, well decorated, and the live music makes you feel like you're in Spain. I went here on an interview dinner on my journey to become a MD, and I think I may have enjoyed myself a little too much here (it was encouraged, and I got the job, don't worry).

The sangria is oh so tasty. Both red and white, very authentic flavors, and definitely not a mix of sprite and wine. Quite potent too, hence the enjoyment.

We had what seemed like almost the entire menu. Dishes that stood out include the garlic shrimp (I think I had an entire serving of this to myself), bacon wrapped dates, ham croquettes, paella, potatas bravas. Lots of savory tastes here (mmmm the meatballs) and some dishes are kind of heavy, but there was definitely enough food to go around. And did I mention the sangria?

Also happens to be a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant, which surprised me since I tend to think those places are giant steak houses... Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a neighborhood tapas place that is easy to get in and easy to enjoy.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was one of my all-time favorite in Chicago, but I was totally disappointed today.  They have a new kitchen staff, and everything was subpar.  Gambas were slightly undercooked so they were not firm in texture.  Pulpo in mole verde was not pretty.  Tortilla Espanola was cooked at too high of a temperature, so the texture was off.  Disappointment all around from a restaurant I thought I could count on for consistency.

This used to be great place to eat. I hadn't been there in about 3yrs,but always had a great memory of the place. I went last night without a reservation so we waited at the bar and noticed we could place are food order there as well. I was content to remain at the bar,but the wife complained about the hard seat,so I settled the bill and we were given a table.  The server was not happy and basically ignored us.
We had the seafood paella,  which I thought was overcooked, and the tapas were the same but fewer for the same price.

I love this place so much that I had to write an update for this restaurant!

My husband and I love bringing our friends to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for brunch! From their pitcher of sangria to their bacon covered dates, this place has something for everyone! Make sure to either come early (before 11AM) or make a reservation or else you might have to wait. Btw, this place is humongous! I've never really had to wait, but I would hate to be hangry while watching other people eat the amazing food here! Lol.

BEFORE you order drinks, place your order for the breakfast paella. It takes about 30-45 minutes to make and serves about 2-3 people. Trust me - you won't regret it! And you'll be so happy that you ordered it once you see it comes out. You might be full from the other dishes that you've ordered because it's the last dish that you will get, but it's an amazing for leftovers.

Cafe-Ba-Ba-Reeba is a spanish tapas restaurant. You should around around 2-3 dishes/person. I highly recommend ordering breakfast paella, bacon wrapped dates (comes with 6), potatoes braves, spanish tortilla (Warm potato and onion omelette), and citrus french toast. Skip the brunch pinxtos - it's not worth it. The menu will seem overwhelming but if you stick with the red colored items, you won't go wrong!

From the food to the service to the atmosphere, this restaurant is a wonderful place to bring your friends and family. I highly recommend it for any occasion! I can't wait to come back again.

P.S. Their flan is amazing!

Just went here for the first time after several years of friends recommending this place. I don't know what took us so long! This spot is fantastic! We had a wonderful server, Tim, who recommended some excellent drinks and tapas. Tim was also so personable and payed great attention to us, he made our experience very enjoyable. I highly recommend the buratta and Brussel sprouts for vegetarians. My husband had the squid and the chorizo wrapped dates and said they were excellent. I also tried the white wine flight and it was suburb. A nice variety. We tried several desserts and they were all delicious, but I have to say the butterscotch custard was our favorite. We only had drinks, tapas and desserts so we will have to come back to try the paella. Highly recommend this spot with it's fun vibe and all around beautiful service!

I've been coming to Cafe Babareeba since my junior high took my Spanish class here for a field trip. I love this place. It's truly a neighborhood gem. I love to take people here who have never been. They always love it.

You should definitely make reservations because now this place stays packed. You have to book days in advance because the reservations go fast. I brought my friend from out of town here. We didn't have reservations (because I tried 2 days in advance and they were booked). Come to find out, there were 2 wedding rehearsal dinners there. The wait was well over an hour, however, we were lucky enough to snag seats at the bar when a couple left. Since it was so crowded with people waiting for tables, we couldn't really enjoy our time there. We were crammed, getting bumped, and it was really loud.

I ALWAYS get the potatas bravas. However, over the years, the portion has gotten smaller. They're still tasty. My friend got the seared salmon in a romescu sauce. It was so good. The bacon wrapped date and ibérico chorizo pinxtos were perfect. The pinxto allows you to order by piece, which isn't bad if you're the only one who wants that particular dish. Smaller portion for a smaller price. I got the garlic shrimp...which is an always for me. They're always so good. We finished this off with a pitcher of peach sangria. It was yummy! Just too much ice. I wish we could've ordered a couple of more dishes but my friend didn't really understand the concept of tapas.

Overall, I will definitely continue to go to Cafe Babareeba. I love it here!!!

5 stars for being my own personal brunch dream come true. I am a die hard fan of brunch, paella, tapas and sangria so this place obviously is right up my alley.

Every single thing on the menu is excellent. Some tapas are bigger than other but you can always ask the server. For example, the sandwiches are much bigger than the tapas and Benedicts. The Pinxtos (one or two bites) are so clever, who doesn't face the classic dilemma of sweet or savory for brunch!? Well here, you can have it all! Including multiple sweet and savory. The paella definitely serves more than 2-3 as it claims. We had a party of 9 and didn't finish it (granted we all got one other thing plus some Pinxtos). We loved the seasonal sangria, Pomegranate and we downed it quick. Next we go the classic red sangria, and after ordering, we kind of regretted getting it for brunch, only because I think a lighter wine/sangria suits brunch better, but thats just all up to personal taste.

Personal top recommendations: White Wine, Rose or Sparkling Sangria of any type, Chicken Stick, Berry Waffles and Cubano!
Had the best date night here.  Great sangria and such good tapas.  Always fun to try a bunch of items.

Would recommend making reservations on any week day or weekend! Super yummy food, great staff, drinks also are AMAZING. Would totally recommend the sangria, salmon, and bacon wrapped dates. Went with a group of 4 on a busy Friday night and we all had a great time as well as indulged in great food. Pricing was fair as well as affordable. Will be back!

This places has the best appetizers!! I've only been here for drinks so I don't know how there dinner menu is, but really cool ambiance. The spicy potatoes wedges are yummy:)

The thing you really have to try if you are going to eat here is the Bacon Wrapped Dates, they are sweet, salty, and crunchy on the outside. Absolutely delicious!

Spanish tapas & sangria? Count me in. It was our first time here and I'm sure there will be plenty more visits in the future. Don't forget to make reservations ahead of time, especially if dining on the weekends. We were lucky enough to get last minute reservations on a Friday night. The place was already packed even before 6 p.m.

Right off the bat we got a pitcher of the white peach sangria. Had just the right amount of sweetness and was super refreshing. Probably could have drank the whole pitcher to myself it was THAT good.

For the tapas, we got a little too excited and ordered more food that our stomachs could handle. Between the two of us we ordered 6 plates and a dessert, which were:

- Chorizo wrapped dates (#1)
- Deviled egg (#5)
- Spicy potatoes & tomato aioli (#30)
- Citrus cured salmon (#40)
- Octopus (#43)
- Serrano ham, salchichon, & chorizo (#61)
- Caramelized banana

Very satisfied with all the items we ordered. Everything was delicious! Can't wait to come back and try more, especially the paella.

They also have happy hour at the bar Monday-Friday from 4 to 6 and Friday/Saturday 10 to midnight, which includes $16 pitchers of the classic sangria, $1 pintxos, and select tapas for less than $3.50.

*Don't forget to check in on Yelp to redeem a free dessert! Highly recommended the caramelized banana.

pics.caption: Octopus w/ shishito peppers, charred romescu, smoked fingerlings, & pearl onions

review.des: I've been coming to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for over 20 years. Time to right a review!  The service is consistently solid, friendly, phenomenal. Wait staff is always helpful to give suggestions. Bottom line:  get sangria, order the paella for the table, and order /share tapas to your hearts' and stomachs' content. This is a great to celebrate a birthday. Restaurant is loud but in a boisterous, party type of way.

Tapas(small plates) restaurant in Lincoln Park neighborhood. Don't t pass this spot up or you'll regret. We tried 15 plus different tapas and the only dud was the lamb tenderloin (over cooked). Highlights were the meatballs (great with the house bread to sop up sauce). Cheese plate is really good. The roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette, spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms were both winners. A surprise hit was the spicy potatoes with tomato aioli. Seared scallops and calamari were both cooked perfectly.

Always enjoy cafe babareeba. Definitely try the Brussels sprout salad. Great taste. Sangria's are good, paella is okay here. Love the vibe.

Try and come with a larger group and you will be able to share more of the small dishes.

Our server Joe was absolutely sensational! His recommendations were only topped by his sense of humor. The food was amazing the sangria was delicious. Nothing but good food and laughs with great people!

I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and an awesome ambiance.

Tapas and brunch- two of my favorites things. And a build your own Bloody Mary bar. Excellent set up all around.

We tried the eggs Benedict, shrimp and grits, potatoes and onion pancake, one of the waffles and Spanish rice. All of it was good- nonetheless thing mind blowing though. I like the idea of getting to try a lot of different things but some times it's a little weird. For example, sharing an eggs Benedict 4 ways is not easy.

I'd go back but it's really not what I typically want/crave when I'm going out for brunch.

Visited Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba while visiting Chicago. Amazing patatas bravas! Ordered seasonal sangria which was Mango Sangria and it turned out really nice. We kept repeating the same stuff. I wish they had one of their branches in Bay Area. The ambience is good for a birthday like celebration.

Perhaps it's because I have heard that the paella here is incredible and I hyped it up in my mind for months, but I was slightly disappointed.

We had four tapas: stuffed mushrooms, meatballs with sherry sauce, and a beef and a chicken empanada. The mushrooms were incredible. The other three dishes were mediocre.

We also got the seafood paella which was sadly not worth the hype. About 1/3 of the rice was so over cooked that I was worried I may crack a tooth on it, there was minimal amount of meat, and the entire dish seemed to be drenched in butter or oil. I've had delicious paella and this was not it. Also, I was a little disappointed that they don't leave the entire pan at the table, but rather dip out the portions onto your plate for you.

The best part of the meal were the two dessert tapas that the lovely waitress gave us on the house. One was a caramel nut bar and the other was a chocolate cake. The caramel one was to die for. I would consider going back just for that!

Everything was so amazing. They have 3 types of sangria on tap and I am picky about my sangria (almost always too sweet) but the red sangria was amazing. The service was phenomenal. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive.. I am allergic to dairy and he was very thorough with the kitchen to make sure What I ordered was dairy free or able to be made dairy free. We ordered off the happy hour menu and actual menu and everything we got was delicious. I highly suggest the empanadas, shrimp, calamari and stuffed olives. So disappointed that they are in Chicago and not in Boston so I could eat there all the time!

Three words: Bacon Wrapped Dates

Everything else was also good. I seriously enjoyed every plate

Let me start by saying Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has some good   Paella!! Like really really good! I was in Chicago and needed to find somewhere for my family and I to eat so what better place than to look on than ole faithful.. Yelp! I really enjoy tapas so I typed in tapas and Chicago and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba popped up. We were staying approximately 45 minutes away. Something told me to call and see if they were packed seeing all the reviews that had been posted, I could tell they were a popular spot. Good thing I did because the wait was 1.5 hours. However, they do call ahead seating. This was great and they put our name on the list. When we got there we walked in, checked in and a nice couple was leaving the first come tables in the bar. The girl walked over to us and asked us to follow her so we could have their table. How cool was that, no wait! The server we had was very nice and helpful on what to order.

BREAD - Ok. Honestly nothing special. It had a slight jalapeño taste by I didn't see any jalapeños so I'm not sure. It was typical bread that you get from any restaurant.

SPICY POTATOES WITH TOMATO ALIOLI - Very Good! These potatoes and Alioli had a great taste. The potatoes were just typical cut up chunks of potatoes and slightly seasoned with a little spices. The Alioli is what makes this dish. It is very good and adds the perfect flavors. An overall good dish!

ROASTED CHICKEN EMPANADA - Good. This empanada was pretty decent. It wasn't as good as other empanada places I have been to but it wasn't horrible. The shell was a little different than most we have tried. It was more of a flaky crust rather than a pie shell type of crust. The filling was good. It was seasoned and the chicken was nice and tender. It also came with a cream sauce that added another little pinch of flavor.

SPINACH & MANCHEGO-STUFFED MUSHROOMS - Meh! Honestly this dish was not anything special. It was mushrooms with sauce, spinach, a little cheese on top and bread crumbs. The flavors/ingredients didn't really go together or flow. It honestly just tasted like mushrooms and cream sauce. Nothing special and my husband who loves mushrooms wasn't even crazy about them. It honestly just lacked in flavor.

GRILLED OCTOPUS - Very Good! This dish consisted of grilled octopus, heirloom tomatoes, crispy chickepeas, roasted garlic, arugula, and garlic-chili vinaigrette. This dish was very good! I have had plenty of octopus from restaurants and this place is on the top list. The octopus was cooked perfect, nice and tender. It wasn't very chewy and had a good flavor. All of the side ingredients helped make the dish come together and added more depth of flavor.

PAELLA VALENCIANA (Pork Paella) - AWESOME! This dish was amaze balls!! I loved this dish! It consisted of confit pork shoulder, crispy pork belly, chorizo ibérico & chicharrónes. My husband and I usually don't eat a lot of
pork but for whatever reason we decided to try it. I'm so glad we did. It was packed full of flavor and all the meats were so tender and flavorful. All the ingredients were a nice balance of flavor. I didn't try the other paella dishes however I can definitely vouch for this one! TRY IT!

Overall, we had a really good experience at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and the food was good as well. I would definitely come back and recommend them for others to try.
Not really excited! Service is very high quality! But the special from chef .... disappointed!

So I came here for the first time this past weekend. I had called and made a reservation about two weeks in advance for a party of six and when we arrived, I was pleasantly surprised to see that the place looked so cozy. The ambient lighting really added to the atmosphere. My boyfriend and I came with his two brothers and their wife and fiance​. We had a nice triple date night. The food that we ordered was delicious, and we were also surprised by the bill​ since other places we have gone to have resulted in quite a larger bill- and this one was quite reasonable.

We ordered two sangria pitchers, but only three of us were drinking. I had always been iffy about sangria just because I was not able to find one that I really enjoyed, but I think I found a favorite here.

I know that my boyfriend and myself will be back for sure for date night.

Honestly don't understand the hype after multiple visits. Their tapas are ok, some better than others, but expensive and with bad service. First of all, the last time I was here, it too 2 hours to get our food (and it was not the right order even after they tried to get it). Management was nice enough to cover the missing dishes, but every time I come, it's slow. It's very loud and dark in the place, you have to scream at each other. The drinks are average and there's not a lot of them. The tapas... Some, like the baked goat cheese, are amazing and worth the wait. Others, like some of the iberico pork dishes or their empenadas, are overpriced and meh tasting. There are better and cheaper places for tapas, with better service and where you don't need to make reservations a week in advance.
Great food/tapas style food. Vegetarian friendly. Usually pretty packed. Great meet up spot with a bunch of friends or a bday celebration.

It wasn't for me! I don't quite understand the overwhelming popularity with this spot. I haven't explored a lot of the tapas experience in Chicago yet, but hopefully this isn't considered the best option. For folks from Miami or even New York -- don't bother with the wait. I think this place is a good bar spot to meet up with friends, but I would never recommend it for it's food. The albóndigas were very disappointing; the sauce and texture seemed totally off. I wasn't expecting authenticity here, but I would have hoped at least decent execution. Even el pan con tomate was a shame and that's pretty basic tapas.

pics.caption: Albóndigas (Spanish meatballs). If you ever see Spanish meatballs with cheese on top, don't order.

review.des:
Excellent brunch! It's definitely a good idea to get more than one tapas item off the menu, and add some sangria to the mix!

The bread is amazing to start off with. The brussel sprouts salad is also delicious and a great appetizer. I shared the veggie Benedict with a friend and loved this fish. Very flavorful, and the patatas bravas are tasty and spicy. I also had the iberco ham hash, which was pretty yummy as well.

Dessert tapas were great too. The flan was average, but it went well with the afogato, which is like coffee ice cream in a sherry float.

The service was slow on this busy Sunday morning, but we had a great time! I am always up for some good tapas!

Went here in a group of 5 for dinner a few nights ago. I was very impressed with the selection and the sangria was delicious! We were able to easily pick 10 options that the whole group would like without any repeats.

The goat cheese and red sauce was a table favorite, but out of the 10 plates we tried, I don't think there were any that fell short of expectations.

Service was acceptable. Nothing went wrong, our server was friendly, food came out quickly. They brought it out staggered so the table top wasn't too crowded.

Overall, I highly recommend it as a great place for tapas.

I went here because my friend had 50% off as an employee of Lettuce Entertain You. Totally worth it, for 50% off.

Delicious food (yummmmy seasonal pear sangria) and great service but totally overpriced as is typical with many places in that area of Lincoln Park. Go for a drink and a bite, but be prepared to drop some $$$ if you want to leave full!

Went here with my daughter during a visit to Chicago.  She lives there and had wanted to try this place out.  Knowing that I can eat spanish tapas as many of them are gluten free she recommended it and of course I accepted.  Hanging out with my daughter is always fun.  

The place is very nice with a cool vibe and decor. They sat us in the back and I was given a separate gluten free menu. Surprisingly is was considerably smaller than the regular menu, but I appreciated the effort to provide me with a menu specific to my needs.  I got the shrimp in garlic sauce - always get these as my baseline taste for any spanish place.  Also got the tortilla - another baseline.  My daughter got the octopus.

I paired it with a albariño white wine.

Bottom line is that the food is fine. The shrimp was good, even though the garlic was a little overpowering.  The tortilla was also good.  My daughter liked her octopus.  The wine was better than good.

I think that the place is fun and looks great for get together and groups.  The bar also looked to be hopping.  I would go there again, but the not necessarily for the food.  It was fine and really nothing negative to report, but the food was also nothing above and beyond where I would go out of my way just for the food.  

The place itself is great as a meeting place to hang out with friends and the staff was friendly.

This place was so delicious and great to try new foods. We ordered so many tapas and the seafood paella to top it. The paella needs to be ordered ahead of time so decide if you want it first. Since the tapas are small servings, it's easy to try new and different foods. The staff was very attentive and the place was nice to have an early dinner. I wish I could have gone during a show but I'm sure those are fun as well.

pics.caption: Calamari with a different yet delicious sauce

review.des: I went here for my son's wedding rehearsal dinner. The food  is very good, the service is excellent.

Table for 5, we ate much the menu.
Signature bloody Mary bar.
Tapas are sizable enough for a small meal. We shared 8.
I wish the food deliverer's would tell us the numbers.
Huge variety of sangria also.
Almost impossible to pick a favorite.

when you need to catch up
and a friend asks, when can i see ya?
the perfect answer pretty much is:
brunch at cafe ba-ba-reeba

located on halsted
in the heart of Lincoln P.
you'll want to make a rez
and try to get there early

because it's no secret
that cafe ba-ba-ree
is the best for spanish tapas
and if you can agree, say si!

settle in with sangria.
at least six kinds, you can choose:
cava, white peach, classic, 'del dia'
black raspberry, passion fruit

brunch menu: sat & sun
it's 9am to three.
their happy hour from 4pm to 6
deals from their menu daily
(...and they have gluten free)

we had 4 plates to share
our table in half shade-sunshine.
come in the summer and sit outdoors
their patio seating is divine

bocadillo sandwiches
ham hash w jamon iberico
so many pinxtos to choose from
even shrimp & grits with chorizo

my only worry with tapas
(which isn't serious at all)
is that I can eat forever and forever.
bite-sized plates intentionally small

get your free dessert with Yelp check-in
I chose the spanish affogato.
it was the perfect ending to our meal
the verdict: delicioso!

pics.caption: (L) citrus french toast w goat cheese butter; (R) spanish cubano bocadillo

review.des:
Favorite tapas restaurant! Never a disappointment. Tried almost all tapas from their menu. Last time we actually ordered sea food paella, it was very good! Sangria is one of my favorite drinks and at Cafe they do great job making it and have a good variety. Our server gave us great suggestion when it came to desert.
Only recommendation is to make sure you make reservations before you go in. The wait can be a pain in you know what
Love the fact that they have 4 seasons porch.
They offer brunch as well as lunch. Are children  friendly with kids menu. Also offer gluten free chooses!
Thumbs up!

pics.caption: Chocolate Truffle Cake and Butterscotch Custard desert. Black raspberry sangria and IPA

review.des: Burrata is absolutely fascinating. The spread on bread is tasty as well. Sprouts salad has great texture and we enjoy it a lot.
