THIS IS MY FAVORITE TAPAS BAR. Incredible small plates. Bacon wrapped dates? Why, yes please and thank you. Other worldly seasoned potatoes with spicy aioli? Don't mind if I do. Brussels sprout manchego salad?? SIGN ME UP. And you don't have to stop there. Delicious sangria that will really gave you *feeling* the summer air around you. Never been to a place where the red and white sangria were BOTH good. Service is always kind, excited and ready to help you navigate through any//all the choices on the menu to be sure you have the meal you deserve. If I were on death row, I would make Cafe Ba Ba my last meal.
This is one of my favorite restaurants.  A very non-assuming spot with authentic middle-eastern cuisine.  It's BYOB buy the way.  Try the Kebabs - amazing!
I'm so happy I started my tapa experience from here. I'm a Chinese and my friend has been telling me it's just like a Spanish version of dim sum. And it's true! I love the food and vibe here!

We celebrated mother's day here!!! The service was great as was the food! Love the Spanish touches the whole restaurant had it felt authentic! Recommendation make a reservation it's a very popular restaurant!

Meh... I was there for dinner on a Friday night. The restaurant was packed to the capacity but I don't know what the hype is about. We were seated right away which is a huge plus. We ordered a bunch of cold and hot tapas and seafood paella for an entree. The food was mediocre, nothing really stood out. We also got a half pitcher of red sangria which I swear had zero alcohol in it. It was boring, I was glad that we didn't order a whole pitcher of it. After sangria failed to impress we switched to wine which was server's recommendation but once again, it was bland and uninteresting. I checked this place out once and will not be back.

I came here with a group of 15 on a weekday night and this place handled us with efficiency and ease.

I will say before I begin my review to ensure you get a banquet room for a group, even on a weekday this place was busy and VERY loud. We were sitting in the second room and I had to yell for the person next to me to hear me. However, the service and food were very good quality. My favorite item was the bacon wrapped dates.

The food was okay, there was nothing I really loved- we were served family style so I was able to try quite a bit. The Brussels sprout salad was not one of the better ones I've had. I found the cheese overtly assertive. The goat cheese in tomato sauce was eh, the tomato sauce just tasted like something you'd get from a jar. The vegetables that came with the short rib were inedible, they were not remotely cooked through. The charcuterie plate and garlic shrimp were both good, not items that necessarily require a significant amount of finesse.

Though I enjoyed the service, they handled our group with aplomb, I really don't see myself coming here again because I get really frustrated when I leave a restaurant with a sore throat because the place is acoustically so loud. Plus the food was just okay, there's nothing that looking back I necessarily crave.

The bathroom was clean and I was able to park for free on a residential street a few blocks away.
This place is amazing!!! They have valet so you don't have to look for parking. Easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

What a great experience. Had an excellent dinner with family. Let's begin with the environment. The place is so lively. People just enjoying the food and company and it just seemed like everyone was at a family dinner. The service was great. Food came out in great timely succession.

The great thing about tapas is you get to try so many different plates. I was at dinner with 3 other people so I would recommend getting 2-3 tapas plates and a paella to share for the table.

Out of all the plates my favorites were: the stuffed mushrooms, the calamari and the chicken and chorizo skewers. The goat cheese in tomato sauce was also bomb.

Overall it was an excellent dinner, great experience, good food and good vibes. A definite comeback for me.

Best Tapas in the city! They offer a large menu and it never disappoints us. We particularly love the lamb skewer and grilled octopus. The seafood fried rice is a MUST-HAVE.

The restaurant gets super busy on Friday nights and weekends. It may take longer time to get the food.

My favorite brunch place in Chicago!! I try bringing all my out of town visitors here if I can! I love their menu, its fresh and unique! I like that it's a tapas, it's perfect to come here with a group of people and try out different things. I love their baked egg and cute French toast on a stick. Great mimosas and sangrias as well!

Is this a good restaurant? Yes, absolutely. Does it live up to the hype? Not quite. I came for brunch for restaurant week and was impressed by the variety on the menu, the insane bloody mary bar and the physical space. As a tapas restaurant, Ba Ba Reeba offers every little taste you could ever need for a weekend brunch... sweet, savory, spicy, you name it. SO, you know that huge internal debate you have when there's pancakes/waffles versus scrambled eggs and hash on the menu? Here, you can take both sides by ordering a bunch of their pinxtos (small bites) and sharing brunch tapas! The bloody bar, which costs $10, is well worth the price- you get your choice of booze (Grey Goose is the same price as Ketel One, HA!) and as many accoutrements as you can fit in your glass. Cocktail shrimp, olives, pickles, spices, hot sauce, celery, pearl onions, tomatoes, garlic, salami, and your choice of gazpacho or tomato juice. Basically, just stuff your glass with shrimp and call it a day! The food we ordered was tasty in general, but everything was too rich- the waffle-battered chicken stick was basically a greasy chicken sausage corn dog.The Ibérico ham hash was also too greasy, salty and overall heavy. My favorite dish was probably the citrus french toast, but even that was too much on its own (the goat cheese butter, while great in contrast to the honey-covered toast, was pretty overpowering). Even thought the food wasn't the best, the place is worth visiting for the experience. It's HUGE and really does have a Spanish courtyard vibe. The paella is even served traditionally like they do it in Spain (the waiter prepares your plate at your table, and you serve more from the skillet as you need it). Might be back, but I'll choose menu items more carefully next time!

I came here for restaurant week brunch and it was a great deal! The food was well portioned (we were able to get 2 Pinxtos and 2 tapas and 1 dessert for $22) and me and my friends walked out all very full and satisfied! Food was great, service was also very great. I don't know how much value brunch is on a regular day, but for restaurant week it was perfect! The butterscotch custard was incredible!

One of my favorite places in Chicago! Catching-up-with-friends, taking-out-of-town-relatives, sunday-brunch-on-the-patio, team dinners, double dates... I've been to Ba-Ba-Reeba so many times and always had great experiences. I love both the food and the vibe, and the price-to-food ratio is more than reasonable.

First off, get the SANGRIA. I typically prefer white sangrias but love the red one here. My bf and I once finished a pitcher between the two of us... what a great start of the night. The seasonal offerings are usually quite nice too; I particularly liked the apple cider one.

Tapas menu is pretty big. My constant favorites include the bacon wrapped dates (it's on the restaurant yelp profile picture... so get it), patatas bravas, baked goat cheese, short rib, scallops, and seafood paella. Totally brings me back to Spain, and even better than many tapas I sampled there.

They also have happy hour 4-6pm daily, with tapas at the original 1985 opening price ($1-$3) and reduced-price drinks. It's always a happy time.

Delicious dishes that may seem small at first but are quite filling. Definitely try the bacon wrapped dates and the flan if you're into flan that isn't just a sweet but has a nice dense texture. If you're travelling, the front desk allows you to keep luggage in their area. The place is decorated rusticly and is quite an appealing match with the surrounding condos and houses. Definitely worth the time and money as we were able to fill two stomachs for a little less than $30 before tip on a Sunday morning brunch.

I always take people from out of town here. They have reasonable priced pitchers of sangria. My favorite is the passion fruit, but a lot of people really like white peach too.

Favs:
Chicken & Ham Croquetas, bacon wrapped dates, Buttermilk-Fried Chicken Thighs, Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli, Grilled Ibérico Pork

-Chicken & ham croquetas are one of my favorite things here. Delicious and creamy and fried!
-They have bacon wrapped dates and also something in the Pintxos section called "Chorizo-Wrapped Medjool Date & Cheese". The bacon wrapped dates come with more dates and just leave out the cheese. The bacon wrapped dates plate tastes better and you get more!
-The chicken thighs are so yummy. The piri piri sauce tastes similar to buffalo sauce.
-The potatoes are simple but delicious. Not a must-order, but pretty good.
-The pork melts in your mouth! It's perfect.
-The butterscotch custard is one of the BEST desserts I've had in Chicago. It's a small portion so you don't even feel guilty afterwards.

Mehs: Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce, chicken empanada, Grilled Hanger Steak, the seafood paella!

-Goat cheese in tomato sauce is nothing special. It's yummy, but nothing special.
-Grilled hanger steak is kind of bland. It's cooked well, but it's lacking a bit in flavor.
-Chicken empanada is small and is nothing special.
-The seafood paella tastes like fried rice. It's too salty and kind of dry. The seafood flavor isn't incorporated into the paella like it's supposed to be, it feels like they made the rice separately and threw the seafood on top. There are a good number of clams though, so at least they didn't skimp.

Overall a fun place to go with big groups so you can try more items. Also a great place for (first) dates! Go without a reservation and you will be forced to hang out at the bar until your table is ready, not a bad thing if you're trying to get to know someone. I've recommended this place as a date spot to many friends.

I had such a great dining experience here with my girlfriend.  We sat at the bar because they had immediate seating.  We found a nice cozy table in the back and immediately our bartender came over to bring us menus.  He walked us through all his favorites on the menu and we ordered many of his favorites.
We had stuffed mushrooms, stuffed dates, piri piri fried chicken, the short rib, and garlic shrimp.  Every dish was delicious but I think the short rib and garlic shrimp are standouts.  The shrimp was so garlicy and the sauce was a perfect dip for the house bread.  The stuffed dates were an awesome sweet and salty unctuous umami bomb.  The short rib was so tender and fatty with beautiful potato purée and really tasty caramelized roasted root vegetables.  The mushrooms were tasty and satisfying, could use some crispness of panko for texture.
Our waiter brought us a complimentary chocolate tarte slice because it was our first visit.  Overall the brisk but super friendly service and the tasty dishes were really great.  Value wise they hit the sweet spot, every dish is fairly priced for the portion.  This is a perfect date spot as the tapas are ideal for two.  Do yourself a favor and take your significant other here.

I was a little skeptical about this place with their small plate serving that are shared family style. Once we did order our first round it was well worth it. We ordered a mix of things but the octopus dish stood out. It was not chewy at all but soft and tasty. It w not really well with the scallops also. I didn't get a chance to taste the white sangria as everyone at the table drank that first so I only was able to drink the red one. Red was good as a had more then half to my self.

Ba-ba-Reeba definition: being quick to deliver excitement

There aren't very many tapas restaurants where I come from (and it's not in the middle of nowhere or the country). Simply put - tapas are not good in my hometown. I had a bad experience where they just plopped some pre-made stuff onto tiny plates and called that tapas. Upon stepping into this dimly lit place in Lincoln Park called Ba-Ba-Reeba (with a lunch reservation this time, I've finally figured you Chicagoans out!), we were seated right away in a snug but romantic corner near the back.

Frantically flipping through both sides of the menu we didn't know what to order since what we wanted wasn't on their menu. The night before, we compiled a list of numbers we wanted to order ahead of time. We were given a lunch and brunch menu, but all the numbers we chose weren't on there. Where's #41 - anchovies and #43 - the fried green peppers?!?! Rest assured our awesome server, Tim said anything goes if it's online. Now why in the world would they hide these delectable dishes? I'm sorry if anchovies and hot peppers offend you. Maybe that's why those numbers are invisible during lunch/brunch hours.

The build your own bloody mary bar seemed interesting as you can put whatever skewer shit you want in there as the server gives you a shot a vodka. I saw a guy with like 6 skewers jammed in his cup! Where we were seated, I don't think I would've made it down the stairs, to the left, between all the tables, servers running around, just to get to the corner of the bar without falling after my BAC is probably above the legal limit in my state. I settled with the classic red sangria which wasn't too sweet, quite strong, and topped with fruit. It was tasty and I soon found out I felt buzzed, walking down a few steps to the women's bathroom which had 3 stalls, 1 sink, and I couldn't effing see anything in there let alone find the TP in the stall. The girls line was long when I came out. I'm assuming these girls had one too many drinks and needed to tinkle bad like me.

Drunkness aside. The food was FANTASTIC imho. Anchovies topped with an olive tapenade paired well with the complimentary bread and evoo. Toasty catalan tomato bread topped with arugula and Manchego cheese triangles was delicious. The meatballs with sherry tomato sauce was simply divine as I sopped up the sauce with bread. If you go, the charcuterie plate (plato de la casa) is a must if you're a cured meat lover. We also ordered a breakfast paella which took about 30 minutes and was served sizzling hot table side. Well worth the wait. The bomba rice was perfectly cooked and I loved the crispy rice bits. The bill for 2 was about $100 w/tips, but we dined like a king and queen.

Was Ba-ba Reeba quick to deliver excitement? I believe so, as I felt like a giddy kid in a candy store drooling, but in this case, over to-die-for sangria, tapas, and paella. This is redemption for having fake tapas in the past.

My first experience with Tapas in Chicago! The food was wonderful. We got about 6 plates for 2 people which was a little much, so had to take some home as leftovers. As a vegetarian, I did struggle a bit to find food I could eat but was still able to eat most of the dishes we got. Great food and sangria, will definitely come again.

This place is literally incredible. I had never been to a tapas restaurant before this and it was exceptional and such a fun experience. I loved getting to share the small plates and getting to try a little bit of everything. We had the stuffed mushrooms (which were AMAZING), the brussels sprout salad, olives, and split the veggie paella together because it was huge! You should order the paella early on because it takes about a half hour to prepare. Such a fun experience and a lively atmosphere. You can tell this restaurant is quite popular and for good reason. Everything was sooo tasty and very reasonably priced because if you get a good amount of small plates you can walk out of here very very full. I cannot wait to come back!! My waiter was so kind too & walked us through the entire menu because we had never been there before!

This is the real deal Spanish tapas. Rockin' Friday night without reservations 90 minute wait! We hawked a bar table and got lucky because the place was packed--and it's huge! Food is amazing. Be warned that veggie paella takes 40 minutes, minimum two people for that dish. Sangria was awesome. Get the olives for sure, and potato salad, and tortilla de patatas. Best meal in Chicago by far!!

Pretty good tapas restaurant in Lincoln Park.  Been here a few times with friends.  It's a tad overpriced for the amount of food you get, but the trick is to sit at the bar for their late night menu - which is a good deal.  The paella is good but takes some time to make, so order a few other things to hold you over.

The food is great and so affordable, but it's loud and dark and the seats are so uncomfortable that my friends and I kept having to stand. We'll definitely be back but more comfortable seating would make the experience way more enjoyable.

I haven't been to this tapas place in years and decided to stop by last week for dinner and the food was just as delicious as I previously remember.  I would definitely make reservations because this place is always packed.  I love the burrata, Brussel sprout salad, Spanish olives, the spicy patatoes with aioli (this is a fairly large dish), baked goat cheese, and paella.  Everything is tasty and every dish has a little something different to it.  The desserts are just as amazing as the food and I recommend the small chocolate dessert.  The service here is always pleasant and its become a staple for us.  Definitely recommend trying out!!!
A little dark inside, but totally got the mood thing going! The small plates they offer are so good! Must try!

I've been here twice for brunch and once for dinner! This place is great for groups or just a couple on a date. This place is actually quite large, but reservations are recommended. The two times I came here for brunch on weekends I did not have to wait more than 30 minutes. Service is always great and the price is reasonable!

Tapas I have ordered:
Spinach and Manchego Stuffed Mushrooms ($7.50): came with three mushrooms and were so delicious. Perfectly seasoned.

Fried Calamari ($9): a little bit pricey, but was large enough that I could not finish it alone.

Grilled Squid ($9): loved the grilled flavor, just a bit too oily.

Sausage-fried Paella Rice ($7.5): came with a poached egg on top. Loved it!

Spicy Potatoes ($6.5): fried to perfection. So crispy and delicious.

Rioja-braised Short Rib ($12): small portions, not too memorable.

This place also had a check-in offer so I got the chocolate truffle cake ($3.5) for free. Was a good portion and super rich and delicious! Would recommend this place to everyone!
Great tapas. Massive selection and all super tasty.  Home made bread is wonderful with the spicy oil too. Service was attentive and helpful

This place is just a Chicago staple. It's a great place for a date night or a night out with your girls. Every dish is sharable and delicious. Highly recommend the red sangria - might as well get a pitcher (or 2) ;) Also - I dream about their bacon wrapped dates. Trust me and get them!

I have been going here for 25 years.  One of the original tapas restaurants.  Food is always fresh and the service is always great.  From the patatas bravas, to the croquetas - everything is fresh and flavorful.  This is a long standing establishment and is located in Lincoln Park. Given its tenure and how they do tapas, which is very traditional - there is usually a very long wait.  Please go during a slight off hour if you are eager to eat; otherwise you can anticipate a long wait - but there is a bar inside the restaurant which will serve up your favorite sangria to keep you cool as you wait for your table.

I would go here again just to say I am going to a place called "cafe BA BA REEBA!!!!" It is a fairly big space with moody lighting. I went there for dinner and sangria on a Saturday. We got there at 9:30 and it was packed. My friend and I split a pitcher of passion fruit sangria. I loved it! My friend liked the blackberry sangria better. I got a salad and the bacon-wrapped dates. They were both delicious! I really liked the fact that if you checked in on yelp, you got a free dessert! I got the gala Apple empanada. Delish. It is a great place to go drinking with friends and splitting tapas. Would definitely come back some time.

I usualy find tapas places to be a liitle too expensive but this place is reasonably priced and overall fantastic. The potatoes, the cuban, the eggs benedict, the shrimp and grits,the sangeria: no other word but perfect.
The brunch is delicious but not other main entree such as shrimp bowl. That one is kind of small portion and not that worthy to pay $9 sth to have it.

Definitely one of our favorite brunch spots. We had reservations for Sunday, and it was pretty crowded so I recommend making reservations for a weekend.

We started with two sangrias and a pintxos platter. The platter has all 6 of their pintxos including deviled eggs, chicken sausages, and short stack of pancakes. The portions are decently sized to share for two people.

We then ordered the beef Benedict and sausage-fried paella rice and 3 sides (bacon-wrapped dates, chicken sausage, and spicy potatoes). Everything arrived in a timely manner and they tasted great. I really liked the bacon-wrapped and the sausage-fried paella rice. The Benedict was okay, but it wasn't as great as the other dishes.

I would definitely recommend this place for brunch and intend to go again.

Fives stars for the food and the service!  

Our server went out of his way to accomodate best friend's food allergies.  He even got the kitchen to make a beautifully prepared flank steak without the allergen-riddled sauce and best friend loved it.  He was back and forth several time to the kitchen to answer questions and clarify ingredients.  

I know they're famous for their sangria but it didn't do a heck of a lot for me (then again, I'm not a big sangria person).  Their smoky mezcal cocktail, however, (and I drank enough of them that I can't remember the proper name) was a thing of beauty.  Containing a list of unlikely ingredients, this magical beverage had a bevy of interesting, complex and complimentary flavors.  

The food was also fantastic.  I was dubious about the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce but GET IT.  It works so, so well.  So many wonderful bites and nibbles that I can't remember them all.  

The restaurant is also super cute and looks like a prime spot for day drinking.

I had reservations for Valentine's Day so I didn't have to worry about waiting to be seated. My reservation was for 9:30 pm and it didn't seem like anybody was there waiting to be seated. It was a full house, though.

I ordered six tapas total for two people.
1. Spicy potatoes
2. Baked goat cheese in tomato sauce
3. Moroccan chickpea stew
4. Moroccan spiced lamb
5. Fried chicken thighs
6. Citrus cured salmon

My boyfriend also ordered their Sangria special, which was pear sangria. Pretty tasty. The alcohol was a bit on the pricier side.  Anyways, food details. I enjoyed all the food but my two favorites were the spicy potatoes and the citrus cured salmon.
I was really looking forward to trying both the Moroccan chickpea stew and spiced lamb. The chickpea stew was delicious and reminded me of curry. However, it wasn't very warm.  The lamb was zesty, which I wasn't expecting - still tasty.
If you aren't a fan of spicy, the fried chicken won't be for you.  
The baked goat cheese was delicious as well.

One thing I wish was different about the dining experience here - all food come at the same time, please! Each of our vegetable based tapas came out one by one. After we finished one, another came out. But then all of our meat based tapas came out at the same time.

Went on a date here with my boyfriend a little while ago and had my first tapas restaurant! Great atmosphere, seemed like everyone else there were also on dates. It's the date spot! I love places that give you fresh bread and olive oil and this place had the bestest olive oil I've ever had. I ended up calling a few days later just to ask what kind they use, but didn't have much luck finding it in stores. Haven't been back since, but def want to!

Feels exactly like food from ! Husband didn't like it so much as he loves everything to be spicy!! The food from here is not spicy but flavorful!

We ordered delivery, but I think we will try the place next time!
Love Cafe BaBaReeba! The paella is my favorite, but the tapas are amazing as well. A great place to take friends visiting the city - warm atmosphere, great food, and pitchers of sangria.
I really felt like I was back in Spain again! Sangria was great and the food was amazing. Definitely much needed post-St Patty's day!

Cafe Ba-ba-ree-ba. More like ba-ba-ree-BAE.

Decided to drop by after an excursion in Lincoln Park. It's a dimly lit Spanish tapas restaurant and deemed Chicago classic. A highlight of the menu was the sangria, but seeing as my companion & I opted to brown bag a green apple flavored Jack Daniels for later, we sadly had to forego imbibing this thing that everyone swears is the elixir of life.

Ordered the sausage tapas that displays four different kinds--not a sausage fan (seen too many food docus) but the garlic sauce coupling absolutely killed it. I felt like Thor slamming this dish down. Enjoyed the goat cheese tomato blend & garlicy bread, but less so. I felt immoral eating the hangar steak with mushroom sauce.

Partial towards tapas, but hey this place beats the other ones I've tried.

pics.caption: What looks better the meal or this guy
Bread with tomato sauce & goat cheese, four sausages, hangar steak w mushroom sauce

review.des:
The tapas here are quite delicious and affordable. They are generally very rich in flavor and can be a bit heavy (especially potatas bravas or omelet)
The ambience is festive and usually pretty loud and it's best to make a reservation for weekend nights because the wait times can get up to 2-3 hours.
Overall, it is a great place for a fun and affordable night out

Would not recommend the paella though-- extremely extremely salty

Never get tires of this place and one of the places I go when I don't know where and what to eat. Before you know, you finish plates after plates of yummy food. I am a vegetarian but can find lots of things I can eat along with my carnivore family. A very lively place so not for a quiet date if that is what you are looking for.
This is somewhere you go with your family or friends and be happy.
This place is kids-friendly but could be scary as the outside seating area was "too dark" for my children when they were about 4.

We went with some friends for restaurant week and ordered every item on that tasting menu between the 4 of us! Everything was super tasty. The shrimp and grits were my favorite. Their Bloody Mary bar was awesome too because they had gazpacho as an option for your mixer! How cool is that?? This place is HUGE too! Our waiter was absolutely excellent. Overall a fantastic brunch experience.

First of all, our server, Erin N., was phenomenal. Extremely friendly and easy-going -- she made our tapas experience extremely pleasant. I give her extra props for dealing with our loud and scattered crew of 12.

SANGRIA:
Delicious, authentic. Not too sugary. We ordered a few of these.

TAPAS:

My favs out of the vegetarian options:

Moroccan stew was very flavorful. Spicy yet sweet from the yellow raisins. Unique.

The potato and onion omelette was delicious. Warm, fluffy, savory. The egg puffs it up, but wishing there was a little more flavor. It would be nice to have a jam pairing in addition to the aioli.

Stuffed Mushrooms were hearty and flavorful.
Goat Cheese in tomato sauce

Codfish croquette was delicious, as was the cheese with jam

Squid was well-cooked and buttery, but I wouldn't pair it with the arugula.

PAELLA:
We ended up trying the seafood, pork and chicken paellas. I personally thought it was slightly salty, but I'm not a huge paella expert though, so I wouldn't trust my review. Get slightly fewer servings than the # of people you have if you are trying to purchase other menu items.

DESSERT:

We tried every single dessert. Our favorites were the Butterscotch Custard, Caramelized Banana, Passion Fruit Sorbet, and the Marcona Almond-Caramel Bar.

OVERALL:
Really great for groups. Friendly staff. Fun & delicious food all around. Will definitely come back.

Great place but definitely a little over hyped. The environment is great for date nights, servers usually knows what they are talking about and very attentive. However, for the price, the plates are very small, delicious but small. This is not a great place where you want to show up hungry, if you do, just be ready for the bill.
You must try the spicy potato and the classic Sangria! Loved the atmosphere as much as the food!

I came here for my birthday with my bff on November 29. The food is great. The waiter thoroughly explained everything. There is ample metered street parking. The shrimp are wonderful, the mushrooms are excellent, just to name a couple.

Um yum! Can't believe I've lived in Chicago for 2.5 years and had never been here. We went for restaurant week and it was a great deal and we got to try a good variety. The bacon wrapped dates, baked goat cheese, and short rib were amazing! The menu even included a glass of sangria, can't beat that. Definitely want to come back and try more of the menu. Being that it's tapas, it's a place you can revisit and have a totally different experience!

Tapas restaurant in such a cute area. Our waitress Erin was Ah-Mazing! She recommended the white peach sangria which was delicious. The ambiance is super chill. Everything we ate was so flavorful and really large for tapas. To top off a perfect evening. She gave us a free dessert sampler for being first time customers! Such a wonderful meal!

pics.caption: Brussels Sprout Salad, Marcona Almonds, Manchego Cheese

review.des:
I went here for a big group dinner, and the drinks and food are delicious!
We had pitchers of the mango sangria, white, and red sangria and all were really good. The mango sangria was my favorite.
The actual food itself is awesome--some favorites were the paella, empanadas, shrimp, and meatballs.
It had a fun atmosphere as well. Overall a great dinner!

Love coming here with a group of friends! The sangrias are awesome. I personally love the passion fruit sangria. I have yet to try a dish here that I didn't love. It can get a little crazy and hectic on the weekends so just be prepared for that.

Had a great night here celebrating my anniversary with my wife. The food was exceptional with the highlights being the garlic shrimp and chorizo wrapped dates. Excellent service for the most part but some of our food took a while due to it being an incredibly busy night! Waiting was enjoyable though because the ambiance was great.
Great place to come with friends over lunch or dinner. We opted with sharing five plates for five people. Shared some sangria and would recommend the garlic shrimp!

Wonderful service and delicious food! My husband and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary and we were greeted with free champagne! What better to ask for. They're perfect is every manner .. a big thumbs up!!

I mean... who doesn't love tapas? What else can I say about this that everyone in the world hasn't raved about. Duhhh.... bacon wrapped dates, and sangria.

I feel like service isn't always consistent (servers get swamped and barely stop by your table) so I can't give 5 stars although it's almost there.

If you've never been, you need to go! And go hungry!

When we walked in there was an hour and a half wait for a table but we were lucky enough to find two seats at the bar. We got the pitcher of black raspberry sangria, which is more than enough for 2 but is really good. We had never dined there before and the bartender recommended 2-3 plates per person so we got the fried chicken, meatballs, spicy potatoes, and the beef tenderloin. Everything was amazing and would definitely order them all again and we could barely finish all of it. Service was great, food was delicious and I can't wait to go back and try everything else!

The service here is always top-notch, and you can't go wrong with their happy hour deal ($16 sangria pitchers, $1-3.50 tapas)! My favorite tapas were the bacon-wrapped dates (perfect combo of sweet and savory & nut-free too, unlike most places!!) and the croquetas (a classic).

I found the patatas bravas cut too large and too spicy. Also not the biggest fan of the meatballs or the slice of chorizo served with a pepper. I thought the red sangria could be fruitier too. Otherwise, a good go-to that's good for groups!

A great tapas place, excellent sangria, and cool beer choices! Go early or later, not in between, you'll have a heck of a wait! The bar is an option too. Lots of tvs to keep up with sports. The patatas bravas is a good (not great) choice. The pinxtos are a great small bite option for those dieting or too hungry to wait 30 minutes for paella.

pics.caption: My twice annual visit to this awesome tapas place!

review.des: Cheese bird was delicious.Not too impressed with the paella. Lacked flavor. The drinks were great and service was good....

Admittedly, I do not have a lot experience with Spanish tapas. I have been to two highly rated Spanish tapas on yelp now and have not been impressed. This is much better than Aventura in ann arbor, but overall the food was underwhelming. We ordered brussel sprout salad, patatas bravas, stuffed mushrooms, goat cheese, iberico pork, roast dates with bacon, paella so we had a pretty good variety of what they had to offer. The only thing I can say that was very good was the brussel sprout salad. Everything else to me was soso to marginally good. Service was also very poor. Waitress was non existant. The mexican workers did much more work than the wait staff. I wish I could give the tip to them rather than the waitress. Only positive thing I can say is that the meal wasn't that expensive for the amount of food we ordered.
Very nice tapas place, every sine dish is super delicious! Fried calamari and grilled octopus are must haves. Parking situation can be very frustrating during weekends though.

Ba-Ba is always a good time! You really can't go wrong when you come here, but my only suggestion would be the more, the merrier. If you go here by yourself, you limit how many fantastic dishes you can try! I'm not usually big on fruity drinks either, but their sangria is definitely the way to go! Stick to the original house red sangria for a nice treat; not too sweet and just the right amount of buzz to get you going to really elevate those tapas!

From my multiple visits I've pretty much had their entire menu, minus the paella.  I would say on average all the tapas are above average, but the stand outs are the patatas bravas, bacon wrapped dates, anchovies, and the garlic shrimp. This place definitely gets super busy so make sure either make a reservation or fend for yourself at the bar. Overall, a nice place to get social, taste some treats and relax!
All week happy hour 4-6pm! Yup inclusive Sat-Sun! $1-3.25 pintxos & $2.95 beer! Iberico chorizo w/ shishito,patatas bravas,meatballs & dates w/bacon authentic as it gets!

Great tapas and paella!  Pretty extensive gluten free menu & the server was very knowledgeable about allergies (even offered me gluten free bread).

Had the Rioja-Braised Short Rib, Seared Sea Scallops, Chicken paella, Chocolate Truffle Cake, and Butterscotch Custard.  I would definitely go back and would order any of those items again.
Liked the small plates and the spanish atmosphere. Great ambient. Various plates. Reasonable price

I was really looking forward to my dinner at Cafe ba ba Reba because there were so many other great reviews but I was honestly pretty disappointed. Nothing was terrible but it wasn't great either. The only dish I really loved of the night was the baked tomato and goat cheese and let's be honest it's pretty hard to screw up melted cheese. I had a very good glass of red wine as well. The other three dishes I got we're the spicy potatoes, the morrocan lamb meatballs and the grilled octopus. The spicy potatoes we're fine. The dipping sauce was very good but the potatoes themselves didn't really have a flavor it was all heat. The grilled octopus was fine. I've had better octopus and it was served at a weird temperature. It was also served on top of a chickpea puree that I don't think added anything to the dish.  Lastly the meatballs had a great flavor but were way too chewy. Overall I didnt hate anything but I certainly was not wowed. I've had much better tapas other places in the city.

The best tapas place in all of Chicago hands down. Always worth the wait, but would recommend reservations if going for dinner. Usually the wait does end up being shorter than projected.

Favorite thing on the menu is the paella (pork). If you go and do not get a serving or two of this you are truly missing out. The servings for the paella are large. There is a minimum of two servings when ordering the paella, but those two servings could feed three or four people. Especially if getting tapas in addition to the paella.

My favorite tapas item is the roasted potatoes, seriously they are to die for. The dipping sauce with them is out of this world.

Great date night place!

I love this place! I've been coming here for years with positive experiences, but most recently we had our wedding rehearsal dinner here and had an amazing experience. Not only was the staff team 100% professional, but the customer service that we received on the day of (and leading up to) our dinner was exceptional. Everything on our menu (calamari, shrimp, salmon, croquettes, potato salad, green salad) was cooked to perfection in terms of the flavor and the temperature. I could not provide a higher recommendation if you are looking for a yummy meal or planning an event.

My friend and I had a great time here! I finally was able to make a reservation at this place after being unsuccessful a few weeks before. We made reservations for 7:30pm on a Monday and I was surprised at how crowded this place was!

The sangria reminded me of the sangria I used to drink in Barcelona! All the tapas were really good too. I loved loved LOVED the bacon wrapped dates and the patatas brava were just the right level of spice. The one thing I wouldn't order again was the sea scallops. I just wasn't a big fan of the flavor and there were probably other things on the menu that I would have liked better. Our server was so fantastic too! She was on top of her stuff and just a great, enthusiastic waitress who really helped to make this experience top-notch. Overall had a great meal here, but would highly recommend a reservation before trying to come here!
I love this place. The food is so so amazing. Especially the bacon wrapped dates and calamari. We alway try new items and are never disappointed!

Love this place. Always consistent w food and service. Great spot for groups and a date! Love the goat cheese tomatoe sauce app, scallops, grilled calamari ,steak & wine! Love coming here w fam & friends and can't wait to come for brunch sometime soon!

One of my favorite tapas restaurants in the Chicago area. The potatoes with tomato aioli are outstanding, but the best thing in my opinion was the paella. The paella option with multiple forms of delicious pork is to die for. I would say it's a must when coming here. To top it all off, the flan was rich and dense, some of the best flan I have ever had. Disclaimer: it is a lot thicker, almost more of a dense custard, so if texture is not for you, maybe steer clear. All in all, it is a great restaurant, with a cool atmosphere.

P.S. would recommend making reservations as the places fills up very quickly, and the waits can be quite long.

Ba Ba Reeba is a great restaurant for a group because you can try more varieties of tapas that way! Make a reservation, because there will be a wait. There is a bar inside that is first come first served in case you do have to wait for a table. Some of my favorite menu items include the tortilla, bacon wrapped dates, brussel sprout salad, garlic shrimp (tip: order this then dip your bread in the sauce), patatas bravas, stuffed mushrooms... the list could go on. They bring out the food as it is ready, so you might feel overwhelmed with all of the delicious looking plates on your table if you're a slower eater. I usually order a few tapas at a time to pace the meal. They have a gluten free menu and our server was very accommodating in finding dairy and garlic-free options to meet the dietary restrictions of my group. The food takes me back to fond memories of my travels in Spain. If this restaurant isn't on your Chicago Bucket List, add it today!

Cafe BaBaReeba has been a staple for years for my friends and I. Whether you're going to split a pitcher and a tapa or two at the bar or going for a full blown meal inside, the food and drinks do not disappoint!

The spicy potatoes and the croquetas are my favorite dishes. Crispy potatoes with the right amount of spice, they are delicious! The croquetas are fried heaven with the yummiest sauces.

As someone who comes from Spanish decent, the paella isn't my favorite. But I've been spoiled by my Abuela's, so I'm biased :)

The atmosphere is fun and relaxed and you're guaranteed to have a fun time!

Helpful hint: make sure you make a reservation! The wait times can get pretty long and people tend to wait at the bar and fill it.

I had a good evening here for a special occasion. The service was good and efficient. Our server was very charming. My issue was with the food and atmosphere, which wasn't terrible, but was fairly boring with poorly executed elements of some dishes. Notably a weird peanut sauce that was not only not flavorful, but also had the unappetizing consistency of grainy paste. Another green sauce (the piri piri I believe) also paste-like and grainy, at least had a bit more flavor. Every other dish was predictable. Every combination felt like the obvious choice.

I am also not generally into enormous restaurants. I didn't choose this place, but the interior is so large, so many rooms, huge staff, no intimacy. And sure enough, a high school group walked out as we were coming in. I think as a general rule, I am never going to like a restaurant that caters to a high school sports team. That to me, indicates a blandness and lack of creativity that would appeal to a wide range of people. I want food to challenge me, as well as satiate. Also, having an out of use enormous bar in the back room looked tacky. It felt like we were shuffled into the utility closet. The bar should either be fully set up or maybe have a curtain over it to hide the empty counter top.

I was also bemused by what I received when I ordered a vodka on the rocks. I was presented with a cup filled to the brim with ice chips. It was absurd. So much ice for no apparent reason. Idk who trained the bar to do that. Maybe it's a Chicago thing, but it was way too much and looked ridiculous. Another indication that this place is feigning sophistication. I wonder about the quality of ingredients. It felt like a factory or mall restaurant, not unlike Applebees or something, which I suppose, is why they give out rewards cards like a common department store.

Our favorite tapas place in Chicago. Service was great with many recommendations and food did not disappoint.

The meatballs and croquetas were especially great.

The shirt rib was great the first time we came, but cold the second time around.

Was randomly poking around OpenTable on Friday and quite fortuitously, somebody had canceled their 7:30 pm reservation at this place.  No other reservations available until 10 pm, nearly 3000 reviews and 4 stars on yelp, reviews mentioning 45 minute to two hour waits, plus having been to Barcelona before with good memories of Spanish tapas - it was perfect.

This restaurant is has a very unassuming outward appearance but inside the place is huge, always packed and quite loud.  The parking across the street is free; the parking in front of the restaurant is usually available but is metered.  The food is great - especially the paella.  Order the seafood paella immediately when the waiter comes to the table - it takes 40 minutes for them to prepare it, so you want them cooking it while you decide on everything else.  We had four people and a 2-serving paella plus 7 tapas was too much for us.  6 tapas probably would've worked.

We had:
- Paella - Amazing, aromatic and delicious.
- Stuffed mushrooms - These were very good, really liked the melted manchego
- Catalan bread - Simple but quite authentic and typical of Spanish tapas
- Short rib - Didn't actually think much of this.  It's a meat and potatoes dish with nothing special.
- Empanada - Not Spanish but it tasted good.
- Octopus - This was probably my favorite dish of the night.  Loved the mix of flavors.
- Chicken and Ham Croquetas - These were cooked well, not over-fried.
- Potato and onion omelette - Somewhat overcooked, it was fine but not amazing.

Will be back.  If another reservation opens up.

This is our absolute favorite date night spot! My personal favorite is the calamari and he likes the short rib! You definitely need a reservation to get in as this place is always full. I recommend giving it a try, and the wait staff is very knowledgeable and always friendly.

I've been there several times. Every time I get a pleasant dining experience. I guess I've tried almost all the tapas on the menu, definitely all of the seafood ones. Their drinks are nice, as well. Service is attentive. I'll definitely be back!
Café Ba-Ba-Reba! A short visit into Spain  I tried the Spanish Cuban, deviled egg. Both are delicious with the authentic Spanish touch! #FoodPorn

So I've been here numerous times in he past and have always had great things to say. Last night was not a good experience for us. I am a Spanish teacher and have lived in Spain 4 times so know my Spanish food. I actually just returned from Galicia last week. That being said, I don't expect restaurants to be as great as Spain but cafe Ba Ba Reeba has always been how closest I can get.
The dates were delicious but here is what went wrong. The bread was stale and olives tasted bad. Not sure how you can mess up olives. The most disappointing was the paella. I have honestly never had such awful paella. If we didn't have plans and had t already waited the 40 minutes, I would have returned it. The rice was not cooked properly and was not edible. The seafood tasted so fishy, in a bad way,that it ruined the dish. There was absolutely no flavor of azafrán. So sad. I will still continue to visit here, as I love the environment and it's close to my house, but will never order the paella. Muy triste.

the POTATOES!! There is nothing better than these! They come with this spicy aioli sauce that I can't seem to stay away from.

The paella is good too. They have 3 (I believe) different kinds and they all taste amazing. Everything on the menu is great, and I'll continue to come to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for all my celebrations.

I came here for their happy hour upon so many recommendations from my friends, but honestly I was kind of disappointed in my experience both in terms of the service, the (error in) billing, and the portions (which I guess can't be helped).

I came to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba with a couple of friends. We got a pitcher of sangria which unfortunately I did not try (had some work to finish later that night! :( ) for our group, which serves around 6-7 drinks per $16 pitcher. I tried several of the tapas/pinxtos. Out of the pinxtos, I only got the chorizo with pepper: not bad, good flavor and texture. Out of the tapas, meatballs: only 2 per serving. tasty, but tiny portions and tasted like something you could probably make at home. Chicken/ham croquetas: DELICIOUS, great texture and the dipping sauce was great as well. Beef empanada: the flakiness of the crust was amazing. the empanada was a decent size as well. Overall, the portions are pretty small, but I guess that's to be expected for $1-$3.50 tapas. I left feeling a little less full than I expected I'd be.

The service was one of the lows of my experience here. Maybe it was because we were sitting near the back of the bar, but I'd still expect better service given that when we arrived, the place was relatively empty. We had to hail the bartender several times to get his attention to order more food, and often it felt like he was ignoring us. The wait times on our orders were decent, so no major complaints there. One of us checked in on yelp to claim the free dessert, and not the initial bill, but the bill that was handed to us to sign, had that dessert on the bill (charged to us). We noticed the bill discrepancy, and it was only after we asked our bartender that he changed this for us.

I came to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba having heard a lot of hype over this place, but my expectations were definitely not met. Maybe if the service had been better, I might have said otherwise?

I never really was a tapas fan.  But this place blew my mind.  Everything I tried (and I tried a lot) was amazing. The chicken empanadas was so good and the garlic sauce that came with it made it even better. The cherry sauce meatballs were delicious. The spicy potatoes with aioli sauce was so good. They had a bacon wrapped date which I never even thought that combo would ever go together tasted so so good. I can't wait to go back. This place has easily become my favorite place to eat.

pics.caption: Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce

review.des: Food is always so yummy! Fun place to eat and awesome sangria. Make reservations like a week in advance.

It was my first time to check out Cafe Ba-Ba-Reba. We came in early dinner on a weekday. I've tried tapas before with other restaurant. So here's my review.
Ambiance = 4 Stars
Servers = 3.75 Stars (somewhat attentive but doesn't look like happy to see us, still gave him 20% tip)
Food = 3.5 Stars
Price = 3.5 Stars
Cleanliness = 4 Stars

I would've rated it overall as 4 Stars but...
1. When my husband ordered his drink, the glass that was use to serve his alcohol has a visible crack on it. (I went to the bar and had it replace)
2. The water glass given to me has chip on the lid
3. When I checked in, I showed my server that I'm suppose to have a tapas desert but didn't serve it.

Will I be back? Maybe but I'll try some place first
Will I recommend? Maybe

I love ba Ba Reeba! All the food here is amazing. The seafood paella was great as well as the goat cheese and bread, meatballs, shrimp, and everything else we ordered. Super fun atmosphere would recommend!

Absolutely shocked this place does not have 5 stars. THE most delicious and satisfying meal I've had since moving to the area. I recommend making a reservation as this place fills up even though there are tons of tables. The tapas style food was absolutely incredible, with a variety of dishes and paella you surely will love. We also ordered a pitcher of the white, blackberry sangria, which was great for a hot summer day in Chicago. Will definitely be back.
One of our favorite restaurants in the city! The sangria pitchers and tapas are all amazing. Among our favorites are octopus, steak and blue cheese, and baked goat cheese with tomato sauce.

Brunch here is awesome! The concept of tapas may sound like it's not enough food but trust me, it's enough! They have a bloody mary bar that's very generous with it's toppings: bacon, cocktail onions, celery, hot peppers, hot sauce, carrots, pickles, olives, to name a few. Honestly, I take a bunch of bacon and eat it as a breakfast side when I order the bloodys.

Love this place so much! There are so many great tapas options to choose from. Perfect for sharing because the portions are small so you get to try a bunch of different things. The food was delicious and so was the sangria. Staff was friendly and attentive. I will definitely be returning soon!

First time here,nice and crowded 2 hour wait or bar service. Bar it was. Some of the dishes are ok,but it's so dark you have to damn near guess what your eating . Same thing for the menu. I won't return, just wasn't for me.

Came into Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! on a Sunday morning to sort of wind down a great long weekend in Chicago. This was on a long list of recommended brunch places our friends picked so we ended up choosing to come here and I'm very glad we did!

We got a table for six pretty easily around noon on Sunday. The layout of the restaurant is pretty fun and there are pretty deliberately sectioned off parts of the restaurant. We were ushered to the back right of the establishment. Just glancing at the menu I knew this was probably going to be a great brunch. That, and the fact that there is an "!" in the name of the restaurant makes me expect big things.

The menu was big. Like reallllly big. There were breakfast/brunch options on one side, and then more lunch/dinner options on the other. Lots of dishes to choose from. We split three pitchers of sangria between the six of us throughout the brunch and it was delicious. We got the regular house red and the white peach. They don't put way too much ice in their pitchers like you see at some places, for which everyone was thankful.

As for the food, you'd think with a menu so big, everything might be one note and taste the same. That's definitely what I was expecting going into it. That was not the case AT ALL. We probably sampled 12-14 dishes between the six of us and each dish was unique and had its own flavor.

Some standouts for me: The Pan Catalan, bacon mac and cheese, bacon wrapped dates, and the patatas bravas. All of these were incredibly tasty, and something I'd recommend you NEEDING to get while you're there. I thinkt the patatas bravas was my favorite. I've had them done a dozen different ways by different Spanish restaurants, but the sauce they put on them here really stuck out to me. It had a nice spicy kick but wasn't too much for people who aren't a huge fan of spice. Just really well done.

The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the shrimp and grits and the paella. The shrimp and grits were a little bland and the paella I thought was just sort of "Meh." I'm not a huge paella fan so take that with a grain of salt.

With all the dishes we had and the sangria, I'm pretty sure we all got out of there for less than $40 a person which was incredible considering we all had our fill of drink, and were stuffed to the brim with food. It's probably not the first place you think of when you hear "authentic Spanish cuisine" but it's pretty damn good. Only my second brunch in Chicago but I'd say if you're looking for some great food and sangria, this is your place.

pics.caption: Shrimp and grits. The only dish I was "meh" on

review.des:
Small plate places have a special place in my culinary heart.  Especially when the atmosphere and service are cranked to 11 like they are here.  Ordered multiple items throughout the evening and none of them disappointed, I hate chicken salad but their chicken curry salad made a believer out of me.

Deserts are very tiny, but just enough to leave you with a delightful taste reminder as you finish up.  Also Taylor Fladgate 20 year tawny on the menu was a big bonus for the last course.

Tapas. Kind of expensive tapas. THAT would be okay since the food was fairly good. We ended up trying most things on the menu. (Thank you corporate write-off!). Next time though...I'm bringing my magnifying glass to see the portion of my share. We were a party of 4 adults and a baby who were sat next to like a party of 12. Loud, drunken, rude, party of 12...so it was difficult for the server to hear us. That resulted in a couple of missed orders with our server. Thankfully, the server was nice enough...though sincerely...the party of 12 got all of the servers attentiveness. Please visit...when you don't wish to speak to one another...and are not that hungry...unless you have lots of money and time.

Great lunch...garlic shrimp satisfies my garlic requirement for 6 months - LOVE IT!   Potato salad is my favorite..so good.  Add the croquet and you've gotta awesome lunch.  

The screaming group of drunk women sucked but What ya gonna do.

Honestly perfect. Tiny bites of a bunch of things is exactly what you wanted and they're all delicious. It's always packed for a reason. They have like 5 sangrias on tap?! Yeah it's pretty magical. They also host amazing wine tasting events with some of the best party bites around and tons of wine at pretty reasonable prices. We go as often as possible.

We were excited to try this venerable Chicago institution.  It started great but it went downhill.  We were running a bit late but got lucky and scored a street parking close to the restaurant on a snowy cold night.  Even though it was Sunday night, it was hopping with not very many empty seats.  Tables are pretty close since they packed in so many, however, we got a nice table.

The server recommended peach sangria and it was delicious, a perfect start. (five stars so far)

Here is what we ate in the order they came out.

Mixed green salad:  plenty to share between two people with savory but touch too sweet dressing

Pintxos plate:  most were tasty but too creamy in general.  (now down to four stars)

Grilled octopus:  this was the star of the evening.  so tender and tasty, we practically licked the plate

Buttermilk fried chicken thighs:  delicious.  kind of like a fancy popcorn chicken with dressing

By this time we were both stuffed but wanted to try the desert.  But we waited, and waited and waited for our server.  Finally we got her attention and asked for our check.  (three stars)

It was a disappointing finish from such a promising start.  It is a fun place with some really tasty dishes but deteriorating service throughout the night really left us in a sully mood.

So much yes to this place! Great ambiance, great service, delicious  food! Our server was the nicest waitress ever! We pretty much had everything on the menu! Tapas was simply incredible! And we even fit desserts! Cava sangria is also a must! Great selection of wines!

Who doesn't love tapas? As maid-of-honor I wanted to plan a fun night and was looking for a pre-fix to anticipate costs. They have many levels of pre-fixes and I chose the cheapest one because by the time you add in the taxes and fees and gratuity. It ends up being about $50/pp. But then no one is fighting over the bill. It's all fair and equal. And with an added touch they make a personalized menu which is a nice touch. Since we didn't end up making any hard and fast plans for dinner it ended up being a 3 hour dinner. Lots of great food. Just a word to the wise, if you have a large party you need to start the planning at least two months in advance to get a desirable time.

I love this place! The paella are all delicious! I've had the pork shoulder one, the seafood one and the vegetarian. The only thing is that I wish they would serve it on the hot plate! The dates are also excellent as are the short ribs, sausages and spicy potatoes! I love the octopus because it's super tender.

Hands down my favorite place for tapas, kinda pricey but worth every penny. Food and drinks are excellent and the atmosphere is pretty chill. My favorites are the garlic shrimp, Rioja-braised short rib and the white peach sangria.
Brunch to die for.  The sampler platter, half savory and half sweet.  Sangrias add to the enjoyment

pics.caption: Excellent Brunch at a resumable price  Great tapas

review.des:
A friend of mine and I wanted to get out and try some place "different" so did some searching "Best Restaurants of Chicago" then realized...I get discounted parking in Lincoln Park, why not go there? So I searched "Best Restaurants of Lincoln Park" and found this place, I've heard of it, but never been there and it's been a long time since I had some good Tapas.  Thankfully I was able to make a reservation on Open Table for either 6:30 or 8pm, I took the 6:30 - the place was packed the entire time!
There is $13 valet for those looking to drive there and not look for parking by the way...
I'm not sure if it was loud in there or our speaker just spoke softly, but it was a little hard to hear him.  I ordered a few different things off the menu, my friend ordered the chicken paella for two and ate the entire thing.  We ordered a pitcher of the raspberry sangria...it was great!  And...free dessert with yelp check in!  
The best thing was, I was full...not food-coma full, but pleasantly full and with tip paid about $50 each, which isn't bad - I've paid much more dining at a good place in the city minus all that!
It was a great experience overall.  I already have a few things in mind for when we return.

pics.caption: Free dessert with Yelp check in

review.des: Visiting this place on a regular basis. Always good food, drinks and interior. Great set of tapas!

I really enjoy coming here, I think this has to be my favorite tapas restaurant and every time i come I always order the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce. I think I have had a chance to try almost all of the items they serve for dinner and can honestly say I have never been upset with what they offer. They also make a great sangria that will be gone before you know it. The interior is beautiful and broken up into smaller sections/rooms each having its own look and feel. They have valet service available but if you are okay spending a little time looking it won't be too difficult to find street parking. I have been here for brunch a couple times and they do a good Bloody Mary bar and it's all been good but honestly I would recommend going for dinner to really enjoy everything they have to offer.

Nice, popular Tapas bar with several happy hour choices including pitcher of sangria for $16. Great place for after work stopover.
BTW, if you "check in" here, you get a free happy hour dessert!  Can't go wrong!

It's hard to hate tapas and this place does them great. Everything we had was wonderful. The peri peri chicken is fantastic, the blue cheese fillet is incredible and bacon wrapped dates were on point. Also I try to have goat cheese and marinara everywhere that serves it and this was some of the best as the bread was fantastic.

pics.caption: So good I got it delivered the next day.

review.des: Come here often to just sit at the bar, drink sangria, and eat some tapas. Best is goat cheese and tomato, charcuterie, shrimp in oil, and the par Ataş braves are hot or miss (over cooked and burnt or undercooked, or just right)
The best Spanish meal I've ever had including the meals had in Barcelona. Every single one of the 9 plates was delicious but the paella and octopus were the highlight.

Came here with a large group on Sunday night (made reservations on OpenTable beforehand), and I'm glad we made a reservation because this place was poppin. We decided to all get tapas and paella to share, which allowed us to try many different things. I would recommend getting a pitcher of their sangria (we got the classic red, but all of them looked great!).

Here's all of the food we got to split between 4 people in order from best to worst:
1. Chorizo-wrapped mejdool dates and cheese ($2/piece) - the BEST thing we ordered, you definitely need to get one per person because you won't want to share yours!
2. Pork Paella ($12/per order, min. 2 orders) - yum yum yum so much PORK!
3. Burrata with tomato marmalade ($11)
4. Iberico chorizo with blistered shishito pepper ($2/piece)
5. Grilled octopus with harissa ($12)
6. Shrimp with garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes ($9)
7. Rioja-braised shortrib ($12) - still very tasty, but didn't taste new or exciting

Overall, the food was all good, not the best tapas I've ever had, but lots of great Spanish options and very delicious. The paella and the chorizo-wrapped dates are a MUST order.

PRO TIP: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free dessert tapa! I really liked the marcona almond caramel bar.
We have visited a few times and it's definitely worth it to go to the happy hour. Get the pitcher of sangria! I wasn't a fan of the paella but all the tapas we have tried we have enjoyed!

Great service, strong drinks, and fantastic food! We went early on a Friday night and got a pitcher of their classic red sangria. During happy hour it's $16, which is almost half of the normal price. The food was amazing! Loved it all. Definitely going back soon.
overrated, honestly. the food is interesting, mostly pretty tasty, but nothing special. you will drop a RIDICULOUS amount of money and still leave hungry.

Stopped by here because pizza pot pie was too long of a wait and we weren't disappointed!  Place is large so no wait at 300PM and we ordered the meat/cheese platter which my husband loved.  I had the garlic shrimp which was delicious and not enough.  The gazpacho was also a little heavy on olive oil and had a slightly bitter taste (likely from cucumbers).  The flan dessert was awesome tho and can't complain about sangria!  I'd recommend this tapas restaurant.

I don't think there's much I could say here that hasn't been said.
First: prepare for a wait- this place is always, always crazy busy. But it's great for a group, especially small celebrations, so it's worth it.
Bacon wrapped dates are worth the trip in from the burbs themselves, so please be sure to try those.
The sangria is obviously a go-to, and I have liked almost all the flavors I've tried.
My least favorite thing I've had here is the paella. I think I'll stick with the unique small plates from now on- this is the place to try something new because you're almost guaranteed to love it.

Probably one of my favorite restaurants in the entire city. I'm a fan of tapas and this place does not disappoint. The stuffed mushrooms and shrimp are favorites, but you can't go wrong with any of the small dishes.

The ambiance of the restaurant is cozy, yet upbeat and the service has always been above average. MUST try the sangria while you're there as well!

My first and only tapas experience in Chicago so far, and I absolutely love it. I brought my friend from out of town here this morning and she was impressed! I've only been here during weekend brunch time, it gets filled up quite quickly so I recommend making reservation by calling or via Open table (what I did, just the night before!). We got seated immediately. My friend and I ordered the paella rice with bacon, shrimp & grits, corn beef hash, and waffles with banana & Nutella! The food came out pretty quick and what CUTE portion!! It's definitely not huge, but shareable. I'm a big fan of the paella, it hit the spot both times. Everything else was just as flavorful, except for the grits, which we weren't too fond of. I couldn't pass the $10 make your own Bloody Mary bar and take advantage of the generous toppings! I would come back to this place over and over again, I just love the idea of (delicious) food being passed around and everyone could have at least a taste of everything.
Went out for sangria and tapas -- all was excellent. The patatas bravas were perfect, and I particularly loved the croquetas. The tortilla was a bit off, but still tasted good. Would recommend.

Delicious tapas (small dishes) to share and enjoy. If you're feeling adventurous and want to try various dishes, bring a group of people to eat a meal with. I recommend the bacon wrapped dates, spinach crepes, and their potatos. Delish

They're decent. The potatoes with the tomato aioli is my favorite. I get it every time. Cocktails are spot on, especially the sidecar and margarita.

Nothing here is terrible, but other than the aforementioned, nothing really stood out too much. However, if you're looking for tapas, it's one of the better places to eat at.

My boyfriend and I went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! while visiting Chicago for the July 4th holiday. We pigged out hard, and ordered nearly everything the chef recommended on the menu. We ordered the basic white wine sangria and it was a perfect pairing.

Things we ordered ranked:
1. Grilled Octopus
2. Burrata with Catalan Tomato Bread
3. Grilled Hanger Steak
4. Pintxos Platter
5. Citrus-Cured Salmon
6. Heirloom Tomato Salad
7. Grilled Ibérico Pork

The service was amazing. The second we would finish one plate, the next plate would be making its way to our table. For such a popular place, it was easy to get a reservation through OpenTable.

pics.caption: Burrata with Catalan Tomato Bread- a must!

review.des:
A+  A+  A+  A+   Is all I can say about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba.  Absolutely Outstanding!!  I have never in my life been to a tapas establishment where every single entree that came out was off the charts delicious and excellent in creativity and presentation.

When we walked up to this eatery it was packed inside.  There were people in front of us who said "This place is always packed", let me tell you, I can see why!!!  

I came to this place many years ago on a very lame blind date and although the date sucked to high hell the food was great then and it is still great now, true love doesn't die LOL!.  That being said on to the love/yum fest:  

#43 Octopus With Shishito peppers, charred romescu, smoker fingerlings and pearl onions=
I give this one an A+!!  And please forgive me for being so excited about this dish that I started stuffing my face before taking a photo of it.  But take my word, it was great.  There are so many amateur chefs out here who don't know how to cook Octopus but not here, it was done to perfection and the integration of all of the other ingredients makes this a master piece.

#51 Rioja-braised short rib, manchego mashed potatoes, roasted vegetable and rioja wine glaze = A+++  Meat so moist and full of flavor that it just melts in your mouth.  These chefs here have mad skills.  If you follow any of my other reviews you know of my constant complaints of some of these people out here who cook meat so poorly, where it is so dry and tough that it is like chewing on a leather bag or what I like to call "meat gum"!  Not here my friends, not here.  Everything at Cafe Ba-Ba is done to perfection.  They should open up a chef school and teach some of these other places how it's done.  And the glaze and the veggies on the plate were superb.

#63 Chicken and Ham Croquetas = A+++++   Another winner.

I think Cafe Ba Ba is the first establishment that I have ever given As out on every single dish, I guess that makes them the valedictorian of restaurants.

I should also add that the service was also good.   We sat at the bar and even though the bartender was super busy he still gave good service.  I was driving so he made me a
Virgin Sangria that was also, you guessed it, A+++.

And for food that is so good, I have to say that the prices here are really reasonable.

I wish every review I wrote could be this good, but unfortunately that can't all be, but I guess that is what makes it all the more special when it does happen.  Cafe Ba Ba Reeba deserves 100 stars.
Delicious tapas, probably the best I've had. We really liked the croquettes, empanada, octopus, patatas bravas. Cool environment and great service too.

I was very taken aback by just how massive this restaurant was, but that's an aside. It's Lincoln Park, so it's very commercialized, but you get that vibe from the website.

Anyways, the food was perfectly fine, but the price-per-portion ratio was high enough that you'd want the food to be exceptional, not just good. Nothing was remotely bad, but a lot of the food just didn't taste especially fresh and the flavors were a bit muted, which was disappointing for the price point. I probably wouldn't go again.

I have been to Cafe Ba Ba Reeba quite a few times. Half off wine in Tuesday's is absolutely amazing (especially in the city). The goat cheese app here is to die for. The sangria is also top notch. I love the Spanish tapas idea and all the selections are nothing short of fantastic.

This place brunches So Hard! And the service is spectacular! Thank you so much to Seba for influencing my table to get the breakfast paella. He also was very accommodating to my no dine on swine rule and made the switch to Chicken Sausage.  

Then the butterscotch custard was literally To Die For

pics.caption: This lil stack of pancake made @debkaltman's weekend

review.des: Our friends hosted a b'day party in the Granada Room and I was thoroughly impressed with the different courses of tapas brought in by the unflustered waiters....it was tightly packed for a crowd of 50 including kids but the service was top notch with the drinks and all! certainly see why we all keep coming back here!!

So we booked this for restaurant week since it's on the list and has been on our list of places to try for a while. We had a reservation for 8 and were there before but didn't get a table till 8:30 so I'm not sure how/if the reservations work. But that was the only bad part. We skipped the restaurant week menu and went rogue. The fried peppers were delicious and try spicy potatoes tapas were not too far behind. We went for empanadas and paella (yay rice!). The chicken empanada was flaky and melted in my mouth. The chicken paella had the rice just the right amount of paella sticky and was flavorful. I had the peach white wine sangria and and and they sent us two complimentary desserts -- I gobbled both of them down (chocolate and whipped cream and whatnot). Our server was friendly and helpful and I know I'm definitely returning. I just hope the wait to get a table is shorter.

This was my first time visit, and as soon as I entered the room, someone was there to greet you. They were very busy on a Wednesday night. We had a reservation so we didn't wait long but if you don't, the wait was an hour and a half. You can stay by the bar area until your table is available.

We ordered different tapas. I loved the beef empanada, grilled steak, and garlic shrimp. Some were very salty like the squid. I didn't realize that it takes a long time for the paella to come, which was unfortunate because by the time it was out, I was full. I ate a little bit of it, but I found it really salty. I added lemons to mine and it was palatable after that. The acidity from the lemons muted that saltiness of the dish.

it was my friend's birthday and the server was so sweet! There was a dessert sampler, and that was amazing. The flavors were rich and not overly sweet. We also had a white sangria, which I LOVED.

I would come back here again for the tapas but steer away from the paella. I would love to try other dishes since there's many options!

My all time FAVORITE place!! Best tapas ever. I marveled over the simplest of detail in their dishes that tasted amazing. They book up really fast though so make your reservation at least a few days ahead of time

One of my Chicago favorites. Been here many times, and every time is just as good as the last. Be sure to pleasure your taste buds with the stuffed dates. They're so freaking good. And for those of you who like alcohol, I mean I do, not sure about you. Their sangria is the bomb! Every single kind. Doesn't matter. They do it right. Normally I don't save room enough for desert here, but was able to this past weekend, and I am so grateful that I did! Be sure to come visit this place, you won't regret it.

Not absolutely floored with my experience. The baked goat cheese was the best part of my meal. The rest was very unmemorable. The atmosphere in here is nice. It's busy but service is still relatively quick and attentive. Make sure to get reservations. I'm not sure what the hype is about this place and it's pretty pricey. I hope that if I return, as I might, i have a better meal!

Stepped in on a bright sunny Saturday afternoon for late lunch. Perhaps 2pm was nearing the end of lunch's busiest hours, but waiting for window seats was reasonably quick without needing to make reservations.

As I'm a serious fan of bacon wrapped dates, my agenda going in was to order both their toxpintos chorizo medrool dates stuffed with cheese and a tapas order of bacon wrapped dates. Both were delicious and I would keep ordering them if my tight pants have enough give for them.

Their banana caramelized dessert is also a solid winner. First bite was full of crunchy pistachio bits mixed with warm browned banana. Get it please.

pics.caption: Caramelized banana with vanilla bean ices cream and crushed pistachios.
Caramelized banana with vanilla bean ices cream and crushed pistachios.

review.des: The food is good, but I have to say that the happy hour tapas are way too small. I'll come again cause I'm from Spain and it feels like home.
Tapas were portioned well and had flavor. Will try the others on another visit. Paella was reasonably priced but was a bit salty- ordered the pork confit for two.
Possibly the best tapas bars in Chicago! Amazing service and great ambience. Definitely try the shrimp with garlic, potato bravas, chickpea stew, lamb kebabs and the Spanish omlette..

One of my top places in the city.  Great for groups (helped me organize a surprise party!), girls' nights out, date night, celebrating any occasion... or really any time/just because.  I love their sangria and every plate that I have had is just mouth-watering.  I can't wait to go back.

We've gone to Happy Hour several times and the tapas and Sangria are always great!
I love the beef empanadas and meatballs!

I came here with a group of friends to celebrate our NCLEX success.  I'm not very adventurous when it comes to food but I enjoyed everything.  One of the girls in our group has a seafood allergy, and even though the server was very informative about what food would be contaminated, she was still very limited in items on the menu.  I would not recommend coming here if you have any sort of food allergy.  My favorite items were the sangria (duh) and the bacon wrapped figs.  They were like candy!

A cute tapas restaurant located in Lincoln Park. Love the surrounding neighborhood.

Tapas that I tried:
-devil eggs (5/5): one of the best deviled eggs I've had; love the crispy ham on top!
-chorizo with pepper: (3/5)
-potato and onion omelette: (2/5)  
-spicy potatoes with tomato aioli: MUST ORDER loved this even though i don't like potatos (5/5)
-wood oven veggies with pine nuts: (3/5)
-bacon dates with apple and vinaigrette: (4/5) i've had better bacon wrapped dates
-beef empanadas: GET THIS! love how puffy the pastry was and how decadent the beef filling was (5/5)

Order the deviled eggs, spicy potatoes, and beef empanada.
And of course, try one of their sangrias!

I ordered a pitcher of the classic red sangria, and it was a bit too much for 2 people. But the sangria was strong and good.

pics.caption: Beef empanadas, wood oven vegetables with pine nuts, spicy potatoes , and (gone) deviled eggs
Bacon rapped dates with apples, chorizo pepper, potato onion omelette, classic red sangria

review.des:
Came here on a Friday night. We sat at the bar and it took a bit for the bartender to notice us. We ordered the planxa apps which were delicious! The octopus was great. It was in a red sauce. My fiancé thought it was a bit soggy but I enjoyed it! Since we both checked in we got the free dessert- chocolate fudge and cheesecake. It was the perfect size.
