They also have happy hour after 10pm which was awesome!

The only reason why I rated this place 4 stars is because the bartender forgot about us and we had to chase him down.

I picto tapas bar by myself when I was visiting. It was very crowded on the workday night. I absolutely loved the food I got. It almost felt like the tapas I got in Barcelona. The food was not too spicy but flavorful. Some certain food can get similar and little bit boring for taste. You should check the menu and try to get diverse flavors. I love the atmosphere at night. - I wish it could get more space at the bar.

Been here a couple times mainly for the good vibes and the sangria + tapas combination (their pomogranate sangria is so refreshing!) Make sure to ask your servers about the portion for each dish, since sometimes 3-4 can be filling for one person, but sometimes 2 is enough. Their paella, short ribs, and spicy potatoes are my favorite dinner dishes, and most items from the brunch menus are delicious. Dessert-wise; the butterscotch custard probably stands out the most. The chocolate truffle cake is also good, but nothing special about it, and the pomegranate sorbet was waaay too sour. However, it's a great place to hang out and have good conversations over a wide variety of dishes and sangria (plus the good service) so I'll be back again!

Tips:
- Reservation is definitely recommended since Cafe Babareeba is almost always packed (yes, even on weekdays).  
- If you check in here on Yelp you also get one free dessert tapas per PERSON. So... the more people you bring, the more dessert tapas you get ;D

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in Chicago. I love it - I have been multiple times for events and dinners. Their sangria pitchers are amazing. My favorite tapas is their short ribs and mashed potatoes - I have even ordered this as take out separately. The ambiance is very cool. It is a fun place to go, great date night. Love it here.

Tapas isn't my favorite, but Ba-Ba-Reeba makes for a pretty consistently good time. I haven't eaten a lot of their seemingly tasty food, but I'd like to share a few little known treats. Let's not forget that when you say tapas to a suburbanite, the consistent responses are Ba-Ba-Reeba and Cafe Iberico.  

Firstly, come to the build your own bloody mary brunch on the weekends. Those who know me understand that I've had a rather fickle relationship with this much celebrated tomato based drink. Brunch, itself, is a meal that rather confounds me, but I've made my peace with the bloody after discovering the world of 'build your own.' Not arguing that the BYOBloody is the best in the city... it's simply a solid selection of side items such as kosher dill pickles, tasty bacon strips, olives and of course, celery. Zing Zang is the standard in bloody mixes, and they keep it pouring at Ba-Ba-Reeba.

The other interesting factoid about this well appointed spanish themed venue, is that they offer an unbeatable deal for New Years Day. If you show up in your pajamas on the first day of the year, they'll provide a gift card in the amount that you spent. My friends call it eating your bill. The only catch is make a reservation... and invest in some warm pajamas!

I have been coming to ba-ba-reeba for almost 10 years now. My order has varied slightly over the years but I always have 3 go to's: spicy potatoes (I could actually eat this aioli on everything), bacon wrapped dates (obviously), steak with blue cheese. Here's a secret: they have select  $3 tapas happy hour in the bar Monday-Thursday 4-6!
Best Paella in Chicago. Seriously a favorite place of ours to celebrate a special occasion, take visiting guests or just have a date night. You'll definitely need a reservation!

One of my favorite go-to restaurants in the city. Great for any size group, but make a reservation for more than 2-4. The bar/high tops are open seating, which is great for drinks, apps, or dinner. Gigantic menu of Spanish tapas. Great quality. Various types of sangria. Lively atmosphere.

A few years back, this was the spot we used to go to for fancy but fun group dinners. Now... they have happy hour! Even better! Great tapas specials plus sangria! This is my fav happy hour spot in Lincoln Park at the moment.

So good! Tapas are great to split between 2 guests. Both types of sangria here are VERY tasty. The octopus is very good. The mushrooms are very good. Honestly, it's all good. And, surprisingly doesn't break the bank.

My boyfriend and I got seated very quickly although I would recommend making a reservation if possible since it's a very popular place. We ordered a bunch of tapas and our favorite was Grilled Ibérico Pork with Red Chimichurri. That is definitely a MUST TRY if you're a chicken person. The chicken was very juicy and the sauce complimented it very nicely. I would also recommend try their sangria as that is always a very delicious option.
SO GOOD. We went here on a recommendation with a group of 6 for brunch and it was amazing. Can't wait to bring more friends here.

I've taken family in town here, first and second dates, and simply been here with friends. The staff is super friendly and the food is delicious! Great vegetarian option, strong drinks and always clean and tidy. The noise level is 4.5/5 very loud! The host stand is well-versed in large parties and reservations running late. Your entire party has to be present to be checked in, then you're grouped into another waiting area (near the bar!) to be seated once your table has been set and server is ready for you.

I would rate this restaurant 10 stars if I could. I f**kin jizzed in my jockey shorts at BA BA REEBA. Meatballs. Garlic potato salad. I have been there twice but I would love to go back there and bust a third NUT. When I bit into the burrata cheese on toast a little bit of burrata cheese came out of my dick as well. Great service. Scallops, bacon wrapped dates, hot cream coming out of my pants. EMPANADAS. Brussels sprout salad. 15 out of 10.
I always have such a fun time whenever I come here. Make sure to order some sangria. This place is great for groups and celebrations. I love the meatballs and the dates.

Another great meal! Went to Cafe baba reeba for brunch during restaurant week. I had never been for brunch so this was a new experience. Really enjoyed everything I got from the menu. The bacon Mac and cheese and the chicken and waffle dishes were the stand outs for me. As always the passion fruit sangria was delicious. The desserts were good but not as excellent as the rest of the meal

My boyfriend and I come here ALL the time. This is our favorite place to go to dinner ever. As a Christmas present I wanted to treat my parents and little brother to a weekend in Chicago and have dinner here.

I made a reservation weeks in advance and when we got there it was about an hour long wait. We didn't complain, but checked in every once in a while with the hostess to see if our table was ready.

It was finally ready and everyone absolutely LOVED everything! We got grilled octopus, spicy potatoes, goat cheese, green peppers, Spanish sausage and the seafood paella! Along with 3 pitchers of sangria and my dad had 2 beers. The manager, Jessica, came over to our table to apologize sincerely for the wait and was so sweet she even took care of the whole bill!! We were taken by surprise and so so so so incredibly appreciative of this kind gesture.

Thank you so much Jessica!! You didn't need to do all of that but we are extremely appreciative! Regardless we would come back, but that was the nicest thing I've ever experienced.

The experience I had here was pretty good. The tapas I'm used to are from hole-in-the-wall, very authentic flavored and strong Spanish-inspired plates. I understand tapas are supposed to be small, but the portions for the price were almost bite-sized.

We ordered the salmon, bacon-wrapped dates, chicken and ham croquetas, Jamón, chicken empanada, and the short rib. Everything was pretty average, all lacking flavor and spice. In no way would I say what we ordered was bad- the dates, short rib, and chicken empanada were above mediocre and enjoyable to eat. We also ordered the confit pork shoulder paella which was definitely worth the money. We followed the server's advice and fried an egg the next morning to put over the left over paella which was a great mid morning snack.

We also ordered two sangria pitchers which were both very good. I really liked that they added vodka to the sangria to give it that extra kick. The only advice I'd give regarding the pitchers would be to bump it up with some better fruit than apple. But I understand since their sangria is on tap that the fruit isn't soaking in the sangria to add flavor, it's merely there for garnish.

All in all I would return again, but I won't be going out of my way!

I know that this is the tapas "staple" for most, because it's in Lincoln Park. The space is great, and the service is awesome. Unfortunately, the food is disappointing.

The paella was a glob of greasy rice, with very little bit of the burnt part that makes a paella enjoyable. The empanadas are pretty good, I'll give em that.  The sangria is ok. The patatas bravas were a bit under-cooked as well.

I get it, most people wanna go to a safe franchise type place. I like the Lettuce group overall for their efficiency, but the food here is not good at all. There are many great tapas places in the city. Please, go try something new.

Came here for brunch and enjoyed it. Standard Spanish-American brunch fare. Food can be a bit heavy. Tables can accommodate large parties and you'll need a reservation as apparently it is a popular spot. Everything was good but not amazing. Atmosphere was fun.
Loved this place! Food was outstanding! Our server was very accommodating to make sure we were happy. Everything we ordered was great.

So it's been ages since I had dined here but I have to say the place is still packin them in a churnin out some tastee tapas. The space is larger that it appears from the outside so don't expect an intimate dining experience. Meter parking is an option but sometimes limited ...they do offer valet @$13. It gets packed but they do a great job accommodating the crowds and crankin out the food. Nice wine and beer selection and of course sangria. The tapas we sampled were all well prepared and fresh and although fairly typical defiantly prepared to order. The service was nice and knowledgeable and kept the ball rolling on a busy nite. So if your in the mood for some tapas this old standby is still working like a fine oiled machine. Oh and make sure to checkin to receive a free dessert.

The food, service and environment was good, but since I have mostly eaten Spanish food in Spain, some of the food seemed Americanized, and not necessarily worth the price.  The fried chicken with piri piri sauce tasted like boneless buffalo wings and the goat cheese with tomato sauce ended up seeming like a glorified French bread pizza in the end with garlic bread as the base.  But the octopus and patatas bravas and pinxtos tasted delicious.

Visited last night, and oh my are these tapas good!!

What we had (that I can remember):

- Short rib
- Lamb
- Steak with blue cheese
- Patatas bravas
- Deviled eggs
- Beef empanadas
- Southern fried chicken
- Pork paella

Everything was amazing! I especially loved the steak with blue cheese and the short rib was a major standout for the table. I tried a few different sangrias as well, and all were refreshing and wonderful. I preferred the peach over the berry sangria, however, both were extremely balanced flavors. I love that the sangria is on tap, too!

If you don't have a reservation, the wait can be daunting. Although there is seating in the bar area, it's somewhat minimal. Regardless of the crowd and horrendous wait (1.5 hours for a bar table!) I'm so glad we stuck it out. Deeeelish!

A wonderful place to celebrate a special event with a group, this was the perfect choice for our group of 12. The menu works well with great variety to satisfy all. It was helpful to have one person coordinate the orders. After a couple cheese plates as appetizers, we ordered many tapas to share, and 2 servings of 3 different Paello to share, and had plenty of food. Yes u can always order more! And the pitchers of sangria, loved all 3 varieties we tried (peach, mango, and one red).  Highly recommend, several of our group had been before and chose this for a grad celebration, and we'll certainly be back.

Ba Ba.. Best Tapas in Chicago! After living in Spain, I would say these was the best Tapas meal that I ever experienced. I am not the biggest fan of taps but how can you not love ordering and trying almost everything on the menu wish dishes coming to your table every 5 minutes. Combine the mass amounts of food with Sangria, and your result is a lot of happy customers on a Friday night! Dare me to say it but Cafe Ba Ba Reba might fall in my Top-10 list of favorite Chicago restaurants.

Located in Lincoln Park off oh Halsted Street for the last 35 years, Ba Ba Reeba paved the way for a popular row of restaurants, mainly all Lettuce Entertain You, on Halsted St in Lincoln Park. My very smart girlfriend knew that this would be a great restaurant for a larger group (8 of us) to sit at a round table and enjoy a lot of the Tapas. I previously mentioned that I wanted to go here but she said wait for a special occasion with a larger group. Of course she was spot on with this decision as we enjoyed her Birthday dinner @Ba Ba Reeba last night.

I know that I have already mentioned this a few times but it is fun to go to a Tapas restaurant with a large group because you get to enjoy so many dishes. I want to highlight A handful of my favorite dishes from the meal last night. I would definitely say the Patatas Bravas, Shrimp with garlic sauce was excellent, the Burrata was super soft and sweet, the short rib which was melt in your mouth good and the Brussel sprouts salad was stellar too!! I also really enjoyed the sangria as we got a pitcher of blackberry sangria. On top of excellent food, we dined at a round table next to the window facing Halsted white and enjoyed the beautiful night in Chicago. The service was also top notch as our Waiter was super quick and the Manager made this is a very special night too. I would only think that this restaurant does extremely well financially because of its size, speed of distributing dishes, quality of food, and maintaining and even improving their quality reputation over the last 35 years.

I will definitely be back to enjoy more Tapas at Ba Ba Reeba!

Always a fun place - and I love many of the tapas.  It can be busy, but I feel like you can often  find a place at the bar to eat if you have some patience...and the atmosphere is fun.  I enjoy brunch there too, especially in the summer at the outdoor patio.
Amazing tapas restaurant.  Reminds me a lot of the ones I visited in Barcelona.  A must if you are in the area!  Desserts not so much, but the rest of menu is amazing.
This place is great! The sangria goes well with the many choices of tapas they have. It's a great ambiance despite the tables being too close to one another. Such a great spot with delicious food!

Really great food, butalways so packed ! The food is exceptional though . The beef empanadas were amazing and the hanger steak Was cooked perfectly . Will for sure be back again , maybe avoiding their peak hours!

This is a really fun place for brunch just because there are so many tapas options that you can go with! At the same time, the menu can be quite overwhelming, again because of the number of options. My favorites were the citrus french toast, the short rib sliders, the serrano ham eggs benedicts, and the spinach and artichoke crepe. We got a ton of other tapas which were also fantastic but these were probably the ones I would definitely order again. A few of us also split a pitcher of the pear sangria which was a sweet sangria but it didn't really taste very much like pear unfortunately.

The best part is you get a free dessert tapas with each person who checks in on yelp! We ended up with a couple of desserts from the check ins including the caramelized banana, natilla flan (which has a really great saffron flavor), the almond caramel bar and the chocolate truffle cake. All were really yummy!

As usual with tapas, keep track of how much you're ordering because it can easily get out of hand with the amount and dollar signs!

It wasn't packed, but we got stuck in a far back room, that no one else was in...in the back corner of that room. It was super weird.

I think we ordered the wrong things, cuz I know everyone loves this place. We got a cheese board, which was super lack luster considering I have cheese boards often.

We both had a different sangria, which were good - fine, nothing to write home about.

We did enjoy the octopus plate so that was a plus.

I'd give it another try at some point but you clearly need to know what to order.

I've never been to a tapas/small plates restaurant before (gasp!), and this was definitely the place I wanted to give my tapas virginity to.

I came on a Tuesday with some friends, so getting in wasn't an issue. We split a pitcher of sangria which was amazing. I easily could've drank an entire pitcher by myself (one woman did. She was throwing up in the bathroom. Happens to the best of us). I would recommend the berry.

We got a variety of different plates-some of my favorites were the Brussels sprout salad, chicken with peri peri sauce and steak with mashed potatoes. My favorite was hands down the burrata: the bread was crispy and light, the spread, which was sweeter than I anticipated, complemented the fresh mozzarella perfectly. Its like biting into a little cheesy piece of Heaven. The chorizo dates, which are $2 for one, are worth a try as well. They were warm and amazing and I probably could've eaten 5 more.

I got the butterscotch dessert tapa, and it was rich and perfect. I tried the dessert ones my friends ordered and we passed around, and we all agreed the butterscotch was best.

I know there are a million more tapas restaurants to try, but I will definitely be back here soon!

This was my second visit and I was not really impressed. The food was pretty mediocre tasting and definitely overpriced. Most of the stuff they served could've been made at home without much effort. Will likely not return.

Ive been here a dozen times. I'm not kidding. I like the happy hour tapas. Everyday from 4 to 6. I love this place so much, I got mild food poisoning once from the paella but I'm still coming back. Just staying away from the paella...their happy hour use to be all night Monday but the staff does seem to be confused about that...its not as authentic as cafe ibercho but I prefer this place.

Lived in Chicago for 3 years and already been here at least 15 times. It's incredible! Fun atmosphere, great for dates or big groups (went for a bachelorette party and they easily accommodated 15 people at one table). The tapas are amazing and inexpensive ($5-10 on average per tapa, plan to get about 2 per person, served family style), cheaper during happy hour at the bar.

Must try the sangria (pitchers around $20 easily serve 4-6 people), patatas bravas, bacon wrapped dates, and empanadas. Brunch is also delicious.

I feel that the flavor was lacking in a lot of the dishes we tried.  The only thing I really enjoyed were the dates and the service is pretty great too.  I was trying not to compare it to another Spanish restaurant that I love, but the Spanish restaurant that I love won hands down.

I came here with 2 friends who love this place and come often. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated immediately. It was a Wed night at 730pm. They were pretty busy but seemed to have some free tables.

Drink. We started with white wine sangria.4/5.  Yum! Lots or oranges and lemons with the rinds so don't expect to really eat any of the fruit though.

Food. We got the appetizers sampler. 4/5. The deviled egg was surprisingly good and the bruschetta with Apple and sausage was decent.

Seafood paella. 5/5 A must have! Save room for this and don't order too many tapas! It's one of the best paellas I've ever had with lots of seafood and yummy crispy rice. They serve it to you straight from the skillet.

Sausage tapas. Okay. 3/5. Maybe not a fan of sausage but it wasn't anything special.

Bacon wrapped dates. 4/5. Very good. I was already expecting it to be quite amazing, given the Yelp reviews. Not disappointed. I would order again. There are about 6-7 to an order.

Dessert. 3/5. I ordered the caramelized bananas tapa. It was a nice small size - good for one person who just wants to finish off the meal with something sweet. However, it's pretty ordinary. The banana could have been warmer too. I would probably try a different dessert next time.

Overall, great service and food. I would go back if I'm in the Chicago area.

pics.caption: Check in to Facebook or Yelp and get a free dessert!

review.des:
Damnnnn dis place is goooooood dinner AND brunch. I've been here for brunch a few years back but this is the first time here for dinner. Me and the boo came here for V-day and we had to make a reservation! We ordered the Papas Bravas, Brussel Sprout Salad, the Grilled Hanger Steak w/ mushrooms, and the Calamari. My favvvv was the potatoes and the salad. The potatoes was the perfect amount of spicy and when it's dripping in that aoili sauce, mhmmmmm. I love. It was also crunchy and soft on the inside all at the same time. The brussel sprout salad was just like any other good af salad, it had cheese hidden here and there and it was a beautiful surprise in my mouth. It was a good dichotomy from the high cholesterol of the rest of the meal. I wouldn't get the calamari again honestly. It wasn't that special from other calamari I've tasted. It was just like meh. I'm not a meat kinda gal so I wasn't into the steak as much but the sauce and seasoning on the mushroom was BEAUTIFUL. I could eat an entire plate of just the mushrooms.  

We also got the White Peach Sangria but it was honestly just underwhelming. It really wasn't that strong and didn't have that much flavor. Between two, you can get 2 glasses out of a pitcher. I really won't get the sangria again but the price is honestly worth it for the amount of tipsy I got. ;)

I was really sad that we didn't get the paella. I was super looking forward to it but it was priced per serving and they required a minimum of 2 servings per table and me and the boo just wouldn't have been able to finish it. But definitely coming back with a larger group to try it!

Attended a Sunday brunch service. Food is small plates/tapas style, so comes out as ready. Everything was delicious and the whole table left very satisfied. The service was attentive and knowledgable and the cocktail list was  on point!

One of my favorite tapas places in the city! Great food, so many options and a fun place to come with friends to try many dishes. Overall I would say some dishes are not great, like none of the chicken dishes are very good and some of beef are over cooked / dry. The other downside is that it's really difficult to eat there on weekends - reservations at normal times are impossible and the waits are so long. But I guess that's not the fault of the restaurant. Overall would definitely recommend.
Amazing!! Spicy potatoes and calamari are a must. Also love the meatballs and chicken Piri piri. Am i missing anything? Oh yes... the SANGRIA! Can't wait to return.
Great gluten free options! I love everything I've ever tried here. They even make GF bread!!! Also has a cool atmosphere!

This place is SO FREAKING GOOD and SO FREAKING AFFORDABLE. Everything on the menu is to die - I have yet to have a single thing that didn't make me say "OHMGUDDDD" (that's a mouth full of food 'oh my god'). Their sangria is famous for a reason, their bacon wrapped dates are mouthwatering, and their fun desserts let you try everything just like their entrees! Great spot for a date, casual night out, group outing- legit anything. Can't wait to be back!

This is a great spot for most occasions! We showed up around 7:45 as walk ins and waited about 30-45 minutes for a table. We ordered the passion fruit sangria and snacked on some complimentary bread before deciding on the beef tenderloin with blue cheese, chicken empanada and spicy potatoes. I usually order these as well as a few more items, but yesterday we were really in the mood for some sangria! We had the truffle cake for dessert, which did not disappoint. Service was prompt and waters were always full. The spicy potatoes never came, but it was one of those "for the best" moments because we were already full. This is one of those places that I will always come back to!
Great spot for good tapas and the BREAD! A little pricey, but that's the world of tapas. Definitely plan ahead to dine here as it's usually a long wait if you don't have a reservation.

Cafe ba-ba hoo bah?  Baba wa bah?  Boobah sheebah? However unfortunate the restaurant name is, the food is utterly delicious - so don't let appearances fool you.

Came here for dinner on the Fourth, sun-dried, haggard, slightly disoriented, and with high expectations.  Although I'm utterly disdainful of the whole "tapas" fad in the U.S., the quality of the food here made up for it.  And for the course of one glorious mouth-watering meal, I forgot that I was in a bourgeois yuppie Spanish-style theme park.  

Had the beef skewer, the grilled octopus, croquetas, and patatas bravas.  Everything we ordered as a true delight.  The croquetas were certainly the highlight for me - perfectly fried rolls oozing with potatoes, ham, and cheese.  The beef was also excellently cooked and was complimented nicely by some horseradish.  The citrusy-sourness of the octopus was a little overpowering for my seafood tastes, but my partner enjoyed it, so perhaps it's just me.

Overall, quality food.  Will definitely be returning.
I visit Chicago frequently and some local friends took us here to eat. Happy that they chose this location for us to experience it. Great atmosphere, food, and drink.

I can't say enough good things about this place.  My wife and I tried it out when we were in town on a vacation.  The food was fantastic and the service was incredible.  We had the red sangria, the octopus, Brussels, chicken, lamb kebabs, and a few others... check it out!

Can someone help me to understand why this place is so popular? Despite it being terribly difficult to make a reservation ahead of time, calls to the place gave you the impression that the open-seating bar would be just as much of a challenge to get a table.
Interestingly enough, there were plenty of seats at the bar when we arrived on a Saturday night in July.
We scoped out what most of the guests were having around us and we concluded that it was mostly the traditional tapas dishes that were being consumed. We skipped the paella with it being just the two of us and wanted to go for dishes that we could get a greater variety. Unfortunately, nearly everything was super greasy and two dishes oddly has a mayo-sriracha based dip.
Moral of the story: don't believe the hype and spend your precious time and satisfy your appetite elsewhere.

I've been here for visits throughout the years and I'm pleased to say the food here is consistently delicious, appealing to the eye and a wonderful eventful time for you and a friend if you sit outside in the summer or come here alone. A friend of mine was dying to try this place so we ordered with confidence knowing every tapas would be tasty and shareable. We split an order of mushrooms and shrimp appetizers. Last week I took full advantage of their "happy hour" which occurs weekdays between 4pm till 6pm and you can choose from a wide array of $1 mini bites for one or their generous portions of tapas from about $2 or $3 so if you choose 4 tapas and don't order beverages expect to sample four satisfying tapas dishes for approximately $10. I had the spicy grilled potatoes, tiny omelette, dates with bacon and tomato bread with cheese do I picked well and even had leftovers for my pets to enjoy.  By the way this is a great place to enjoy a Sunday brunch with a good friend because if it's summer you can sit outside here, share some incredible tapas with a good friend and share a pitcher of sangria which is a specialty drink of theirs.

This is my 2nd favorite restaurant in Chicago.  (I'm still on the quest to find the 1st)
Love the atmosphere, the music, the service and the food.  
I've been coming here since they opened and have driven from the N.W. suburbs just to get food to take home.  
I don't mind waiting it out for a table on a Saturday night either.  I really like this place.
We had a wonderful private  dinner concert here and the food was excellent. The service and special requests we made were all handled quickly and we all had a great time!
They always have something new on the menu. The food is always great. This is a good place to go with a group, you can share and try different items however the cost can quickly add up.

Don't come here if you're starving otherwise you will have to order a ton of Tapas. I tried the grilled squid, beef skewer, blu cheese beef, calamari, garlic shrimp and the house blend of cured meats all delicious. Sangria is decent.

pics.caption: Cured meats, grilled squid and blu cheese beef
Flan, banana dessert and custard all great!

review.des:
No need for a long review - we keep going back for great food and service.  
Bartenders, Nico and Patrick, are fantastic.
We had ordered Potato Salad, Short Stack, Berry Waffle, Croquetas and Chicken Piri - all excellent.

Would highly recommend and looking forward to my next visit.

Had a Lettuce Entertain You gift card. Decided to use it by coming here for happy hour. Ordered a pitcher of sangria and a few tapas dishes. The sangria tasted watered down. Honestly we make better sangria at home. The tapas dishes were generic and mediocre. While they weren't bad, nothing really stood out. Most items were very greasy and over salted. Service was decent. Food came out super fast. Don't get why so many people come here. Personally, I would not come back here again.

The restaurant was very busy when I arrived, which was a good sign. I came with a group of 8; we made a reservation beforehand. Some of our selections included the burrata, baked goat cheese, spicy potatoes, Rioja-braised short rib, chicken and ham croquetas, and the paella valenciana. My favorite were the spicy potatoes and the short rib, and I was not as impressed by the baked goat cheese and the paella. I generally prefer lighter food options, and all of the dishes that we ended up ordering were pretty dense and savory, so it was a bit overwhelming by the end, but that may have just been based on what we ordered. One of our party had a seafood allergy so we didn't get to try the seafood offerings on the menu. We also ordered the sangria; the white wine sangria was one of the best sangrias I've had, although people in the group who prefer red wine enjoyed the red wine sangria as well.

Great food. Everything is delicious.
The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the service. Our waitress took away our sangria pitcher before we had finished it. A bus boy took away our basket of bread even though it was still full and we were still sitting there munching on it.
Everyone there seems to be in a rush. Like, stop taking away our food and drink please. That's what we came here for. Don't take that away from me.

Every time I come to Ba ba Reeba I am never disappointed! I always make a reservation, but they have always been able to seat us 15 min early, which is great. The food here is AMAZING, you can come here 20 times and get different things each time. Everything tastes gourmet and I haven't found a dish I don't like here. Sangria is top notch- the pitcher is a great deal! Close to the L stop and there's usually street parking available.

Great food and drinks! Great Ambience. Very friendly. We went there with a couple of friends on a week day and it was a great experience.
Overall time and money well spent.
Never  disappointed this everytime i am here this place is the best. Amazing food. Wonderfil service. They have always made sure everything is perfect.
Always a great spot to take people if they are from out of town! Soooo many awesome options and the price is right!

Have come for both brunch and dinner. Service and food at both have been phenomenal and, luckily, on the less expensive side compared to other similar restaurants in the area. Suggest making reservations when possible!

I wasn't expecting much of this place, but Café Ba-Ba Reeba knocked me off my feet! Out of all the restaurants we ate at during our 4 days in Chicago, this restaurant came out in 2nd place!

Our party of 4 arrived 5 minutes after the restaurant opened. We were seated towards on the left which looked almost like a covered patio. Beautiful brick walls with red chairs to accent. Our server was great in assisting us. After a few recommendations and selecting what we thought sounded good...

Full sized breakfast paella, patatas bravas, eggs benedict, nutella banana waffles, hash, flan, and a slice of chocolate cake (free dessert with Yelp check-in). You really can't go wrong ordering anything off the menu!

Great service, excellent food, nice atmosphere.

Just a bit confused about the overall brunch concept. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba claims to be Spanish tapas but I'm not sure if anything they offer is truly Spanish (except for the paella?), the overall meal felt like something you would get at TGIFriday's or Applebees - everything felt like food from a chain restaurant.

- Deviled egg: interesting but way too much mustard. Pass.
- Waffle battered chicken stick with maple syrup: this was good but not Spanish at all... chicken sausage and waffle batter and maple syrup.
- Citrus french toast stick: I didn't notice any citrus flavors. Thick french toast with powdered sugar and maple syrup. Decent I guess, but not Spanish, and overall something you would expect at a chain restaurant..
- Burrata with catalan tomato bread: this was good, I'd recommend.
- Citrus cured salmon: soooooooo much citrus and so many capers that the delicate smoked salmon taste was completely outnumbered. Pass.
- Buttermilk-fried Chicken Thighs, Piri-piri Sauce & Shaved Vegetable Salad: basically buffalo sauce and fried chicken. Definitely not Spanish and not that great either. TGIFridays vibe.

Overall I left confused and my stomach left confused too.

Love this place! Great tapas and sangria. It's a really fun atmosphere for every occasion. Especially nice in the summertime when the patio is open.

Usually busy so I recommend making reservations--unless you're a party of 2 in which case you may be able to luck out at the bar.

The selection of tapas is as robust as it is rich - you will leave here with a food coma if you do it right.  The ambiance is loud and vibrant, just what you would expect from a place serving Spanish food.  Major points because the roof opens up at night in the summer.  Each patron is encouraged to order ~2 tapas so the table has a chance to share and taste everything.  I highly recommend the brussels sprout salad, the spicy potatoes, and the burrata.  My only complaint is that our food came out in small waves with no perceived order and our waitress was snippy/unhelpful when we inquired about the rest of the dishes.

Not sure how I haven't already reviewed this spot -- it's such a go-to in my happy hour book!

Their happy hour is fantastic if you like sangria. And we're talking real sangria without the soda and juice filler that you get at so many places. A pitcher during happy hour is around $16 and perfect for 3-4 people if you each want a glass, or for 2 people if you're feeling a bit more adventurous :)

Their tapas are also great, but mildly pricey for what you get -- if options were $0.50 to $1 cheaper per item, this would easily be a 5-star place.

Servers are all really nice, but when it gets crowded can be a bit slow, so just make sure you know what you want to order when your waiter comes so you don't have to flag someone down later.

The water in the men's room is the coldest water I've ever washed my hands with. It was somehow just at freezing level, but the yet the pipes weren't frozen. It affected my dining experience- when I returned to my seat to eat, my hands were too numb to properly grasp the food, and I struggled to eat.

We've been here twice, and both times we really enjoyed ourselves. We lived nearby at one point and noticed that sometimes this place is dead, and other times it is packed full even though there is a ton of seating. The tapas we had were tasty and reasonably price. The second visit was probably better than the first because we listened to our waiter's recommendations which served us well. I have friends who think it's over priced and overhyped, but I did not feel that way at all. I've travelled extensively in Spain and nothing can compare with fresh seafood tapas in Barcelona or Jamon Iberico platters in Madrid, but this does a pretty good job for what it is and where it is, and for how much we ate and drank, it didn't break the bank. Probably not a place we will take out of town visitors who want to experience the best of Chicago, but it's a fun spot to get some tasty bites and a drink on a Friday night.

We rolled in late on a Sunday (before President's Day) with about 20 minutes left until the kitchen closed. We were starving and trying hard to find a place we could quick eat before they closed. Trying to be good patrons (and attempting for servers not to hate us for coming in so late), we ordered as soon as we sat down: Burrata (#23), shrimp w garlic (#44), short rib (#51), and bacon wrapped dates (#67).

The burrata is alright - I'm a fan of savory burrata, and the bitter tomato paste was a little on the sweet side for me. Still delicious.
The shrimp was my favorite...spicy, but manageable. A perfect in-between for Clark and my tastes.
Short rib is tried and true - tender and delicious. I'm always sad at the fact that it's a "small" plate.
Bacon wrapped dates are exactly as they sound, and the vinegar and apples they sit in really add a perfect bite to them.

This was perfect for the two of us to fill up but not be stuffed. It was a quick and expensive dinner, but we definitely ate well! We love coming here and will absolutely be back more and more!
Awesome tapas! So much wonderful food, will have to say the bacon wrapped dates were my favorite! Tasted so much - nothing was left!

This is one of the top tapas places in Chicago, the only reason I bumped it down a star is because I went to iberico first. Between the two Iberico is personally my more favorite of the two. I still recommend trying this place as they have some pretty solid dishes.

I've been coming here for 11 years! I love it- great for date nights, meeting up with friends and I even had my baby shower here. Weekends get exceptionally busy and plan to wait a bit even if you have a reservation but the food is wonderful and consistent.
Amazing all the tine, solid place for great food. Happy hour is a really good deal if you can get there at 4 for a spot at the bar!

Went here for my birthday my beautiful niece and her awesome hubby took the family for some outstanding tapas. Since they have been here before (and we will try just about anything), we let them order. We had pitchers of white sangria and I'm happy to have been able to walk out of there with one foot in front of the other. One tapas was better than the last some of the mouth watering dishes in order of my favorites and it was really hard to place these in order were Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Roasted Chicken Empanada, Beef Tenderloin & Blue Cheese, Garlic Shrimp so good (they give you bread for the table that is really crusty and good also perfect to soop up the garlic oil from the shrimp), we place two orders of the Fried Green Peppers & Coarse Salt some were a little spicy but mostly they were mild. and the Meatballs
with sherry tomato sauce. I know we ordered more but this is what I remember the most. The tapas were a generous portion, hot and incredibly delicious. We had my darling little great nephew along with us - this joint is genius - they try and seat all the tables with children in an enclosed room so the other diners are not disturbed. But my nephew was an angel because he likes to eat and enjoyed the different foods placed in front of him. Great spot, excellent service, awesome food. Thankful for family.
I come here all the time and the food is fantastic. I highly recommend the Burrata.
Love this place!!! Amazing food, great service, and reasonable price. Best tapas l've had in Chicago. Must try it!

The tapas were delicious! My favorite was the chorizo-wrapped medjool date and cheese. We ordered many different items off the menu. It was plenty for a meal. Also enjoyed the pitcher of sangria on happy hour. It was a deal! Don't forego the dessert tapas. They were also excellent!

Honestly, Chicago restaurants have really opened my eyes to what good food truly is.

This small-from-the-outside, but huge-on-the-inside establishment is a fantastic place to try out tons of different Spanish dishes, including their famous paella. I don't remember all of the dishes we got, but some standouts included the grilled hanger steak, the SPICY POTATOES (ridiculously good and cheap!), and of course, the paella.

While the place is pretty packed and loud (I wouldn't suggest this place for an intimate date or anything), it's a great place for a group of friends to hang out and get some great food at good prices. I can't say that the service was exceptional, as the waiter constantly spilled water on our table while refilling our glasses, but it certainly didn't detract from the experience.

Overall, a very nice cafe that I would definitely recommend to people visiting Chicago that want a less upscale, but just as delicious option.

My boyfriend and my favorite brunch spot. We normally spend $60 here: 2x $10 bloody Mary's, we normally split 4 tapas. We just started using our LettuceEats app to get cash promotions and love it! They're amazing for dinner as well. Love the passion sangria! We always post up at the bar for brunch so no waiting in line!

Met a friend here for dinner while I was in town.  First of all, it's much bigger than it looks from the outside.  Inside has a dark, funky atmosphere.  Service was good, and the food was delicious.  We shared a whole bunch of things, and every one of them was very well executed.  I'm a fan of tapas in general, and would definitely recommend this place.

This is my favorite Tapas restaurant. The food is always delicious, the atmosphere splendid, the service is prompt and servers are always polite and attentive, and their house red is my favorite sangria. What's not to like?

Food is really good.  All small portions except the paella its huge and very authentic.
The variety of vodka sangria pitchers is delicious. The plates are tiny but food is very filling.make a reservation ahead of time.  Decor is good. Music is loud and enclosed patio get hot in the winter with heaters shooting vapor at you.  
Food comes out pretty quick.

Always a fun tapas environment. They have a good variety of dishes and blazing fast service. I have been with a variety of different people and they always love it.

Great sangria and a fun evening out.

Awesome! Paella for many!!! Bacon wrapped dates were great. Group of 10 sat in good location  and great service! Free desert for check in on Yelp!!! Would come again. Was full leaving we enjoyed everything
Great tapas and drinks  Only down side is that they can only split the bill 6 ways and we had a party of 15 so we couldn't just throw our credit cards in the pile and have it split equally.

Went this wknd. Hipster theme. Food was ok, nothing special to come back to. I got the dates wrapped in bacon, spicy fries, shrimps. The sangria was however quite delicious. The reason I'm giving a one star is the terrible service. The woman who served us asked if we've done tapas before I said yes and when our shrimp order didn't come out w the rest of the food. I asked her how long it would take, bc I was curious. And the she proceeded to lecture me on what tapas were. I was trying to be nice about it since I had a guest w me. But it was really insulting. And her tone was awful. To make matters worse, if you check in for the first time at yelp you get a free desert. After our meal, I told our waitress and made sure she saw the free dessert on my app/phone, since I didn't know how it was supposed to worked. She held my phone. HELD IT! Clearly saw it. Later she told me she didn't see it, trying to infer that I was lying. I had to click back in the app to prove it to her again. What the heck? I just showed it to her. Even my guest was surprised at how awful the service was.

Terrible, terrible service. I go out to eat to enjoy my meal and get a friendly service. Instead I was insulted and made to feel like a liar.

I advice anyone considering to come here not to bother. There are other places in Chicago with better service & even better food.

But if you're looking for a place that makes you feel like a second class citizen. Go here.

Looking for a better place? Try Beatrix at W Fulton Market. Really awesome food and the service was unlike anything I've experience before. Our friendly waitress knew it was my first time and walked us through the menu, answered all our questions. She was genuine and sweet.  And even, even gave a rainbow toast on the house. First impressions mean everything, ever since then I've come back multiple times. You can't go wrong w Beatrix.

I live in the neighborhood and there are so many good restaurants but this one may be my favorite. There are probably 30 items on the menu and I've had probably 20 of them. Every single item is so good! You can't go wrong! The classic red sangria is a must. Always the Brussel salad- other favorites are the meatballs, the steak with blue cheese, the spicy potatoes, and well everything. Love the Carmel and the Banana desserts a lot too. The service is also great. They once gave us a free dessert platter with every dessert on the menu only because we had to wait longer than they told us initially. Love this place!

You will simply will not find a better Tapas place in the city or burbs, I've had nearly everything on their menu and have been a proud patron for over 20 years. Good luck and compare this to something else, there's a reason you need to make reservations in advance. They aren't a secret!
Excellent food, service, and Sangria. The latter offered in 3 sizes and colors. Five stars.

Sorry Chicago-ans.. if this is your version of a top tapas restaurant... I'm not sure what else there is to say.

If Ba-Ba-Reeba were located in a small town, I'd rate it higher (3 stars)... but it's located in one of the largest cities in the US, so the quality, flavor and freshness should be compared with places like Boqueria (Flatiron) and Olea (Ft. Greene) in NYC. Or even Spain? I've only lived in Andalucia (Southern Spain) and I think the comparison is similar to Chinese food in the US (babareeba) vs. Chinese food in China...

The Bloody Mary bar should be avoided at all costs. Even their "spicy" mix is just a tad spicy at best. Plus, the choices are overwhelming... your drink will just taste like tomato juice with random spices in it.

The food was just off. I felt like I was at a commercialized chain restaurant eating processed food (The Cheesecake Factory was the first place that came to mind).

1) Patatas Bravas: They put a coating on the patatas (paprika?), which make them taste funky. I appreciate that they don't want to serve up traditional patatas, but this iteration tasted starchy, processed and strange.

2) Brussel sprout salad: This was admittedly the best dish from what I tried. However, the ratio of cheese and dressing to sprouts was off... So I felt inundated with the fixings, I could barely taste the sprouts.

3) Octopus: Check out my picture, does that look appetizing? It was overly oily and rubbery. My cousin had never tried octopus and I convinced him (Since I savor the octopus at Taverna Kyclades in Astoria, Queens and even Boqueria). Our server said "it's everyone's favorite..." (This dish reaffirmed why I left Chicago after living there for 3 years).

4) NOW for the worst part of the meal... DESSERT. I received a free dessert through Yelp and our server recommended the marcona-almond caramel bar. It's basically a glorified snickers bar, but worse... So we looked on Yelp and saw that folks reallllly liked the butterscotch custard. So for sh*ts and giggles we ordered that too... #fail. It tasted like overly sweetened condensed milk with flavoring.

Silver lining? I got to hang with my cousin, who I haven't seen in a few years... so I did enjoy the company, thus the 2 star rating.

I came for brunch on a Saturday. My friend and I shared four tapas and the portions were a bit too much for two girls, should be just fine for two guys. The dishes were all good. The ambience was just so so and it's a little too loud. Worth trying!

Great evening - would highly recommend spicy tomato with goat cheese tapas, garlic shrimp, chorizo wrapped dates, burrata, Brussels sprout salad - we also had the classic red sangria and all thought it was delicious! We had the lamb, hangar steak and a chimichurri pork that all were a lot more well done than our preference and would probably not get the next time we go! Waitress was amazing and overall experience was delightful - cannot wait to visit again!

What a fantastic tapas place in Chicago.

The restaurant space is huge and there is a wide variety of seating options, ranging from big group tables illuminated by skylights in the front to the dimmer, date-night candlelit areas further back.  Our server was extremely friendly and helpful; no complaints whatsoever.  

Since it was our first time here, we decided to go with the more popular items, which were helpfully highlighted in red on the menu.  We ended up ordering at least one thing from every category, and they were all delicious.  Thankfully, the food also came with enough time in between each dish to enjoy each one properly.

Burrata (vegetables & cheese): very creamy cheese which contrasted nicely with the fresh sweetness of the roasted corn, tomatoes, and other vegetables.

Rioja-braised shortrib w/ mashed potatoes and vegetables (beef & lamb): the shortrib was tender and flavorful, and mashed potatoes were satisfying (as they always are).  However, the vegetables were somewhat overcooked and a bit soggy due to the red wine sauce.

Seared sea scallops (seafood): normally I'm not a big fan of scallops due to their somewhat fatty taste, but the citrus and the leeks helped to balance out the flavor and provide a nice bite.  Not quite sure it's worth $13 though.

But the highlight of the meal came in the form of the bacon wrapped dates (under the label chicken & pork, for some reason).  Oh my gosh, they were so good!  Sweet, salty, and rich, hitting all the reward systems that are a part of human taste.  No regrets.

Total cost: $42 w/out tax or tip.  This was enough food for two people, so I ended up paying around $26-27.  Not very cheap, but given this is a popular restaurant in the middle of Chicago, it's to be expected.  

I would definitely recommend coming here for a delicious experience.

Went in based on the great reviews. Was let down - the octopus dish was too greasy, hash-browns too salty, the cheese platter had a yellow cheese that on one side was dried up. The paella dish for 2-3 was going to take 1 hour to cook so we didn't get to order it. The only good thing was the bread.

I know what true Spanish & mediterranean food is like, this is below average! I'm astonished that people are giving it 5 stars - too bad there isn't another similar restaurant in town to set the standards higher (except Avec, but is not strictly a tapas place).

Came here with a group of people for dinner while I was in Chicago. There was about a 20-30 minute wait for about 8 of us. It was pretty crowded for a Tuesday night. The staff was also super friendly. When we got seated, we decided to share a bunch of tapas and everything was super delish! It's a bit on the pricy side as is most tapas bars. We got a couple pitchers of the red sangria which was alright (considering I don't usually like sangrias). We also ordered some potatoes (yum), brussels sprouts, mushrooms, beef tenderloin (yum), grilled hanger steak (yum), braised short ribs, shrimp, meatballs (a big hit), grilled pork with chimichurri (cause you know I LOVE chimichurri) and some other awesome things from the menu. Everything was really good! I'd love to try their paella next time. This place is definitely a must-try if you're visiting Chicago (like I was).

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a tapas restaurant in LP. I came here once for Sunday brunch, and continue to come back. Its a place where food is meant to be shared and they accommodate large parties exceptionally well. I celebrated a birthday here last week, and CBBR accommodated our party of 8 and didn't hesitate to split the check 8 ways. My only complaint is that if you order pitchers of sangria, they don't replenish water. My friend and I had to ask for a water refill.

I like how they space out the tapas, and their initial recommendation to order 1-2 tapas per person. This provided enough food for everyone to share.

At my most recent dinner experience, we ordered the following:

chorizo-wrapped medjool dates and cheese-a popular tapa that reminded me of Avec's prosciutto-wrapped dates.

spicy potatoes with tomato aioli-one of my favorite tapas here and at Mercat a la Planxa. I prefer M a la P's patatas bravas over the spicy potatoes at CBBR, but for the price point, CBBR hits the spot.

grilled octopus-this was one of my favorites tapas at CBBR and I would order this again. Don't be afraid to try octopus. It's not fishy tasting at all!

scallop empanada-flaky crust, generous scallop filling.

buttermilk-fried chicken thighs-Mmm. Not what you'd expect if you're a Nando's fan. This is a marriage of fried chicken doused in peri peri sauce.

grilled hanger steak-sliced for sharing, moist and succulent meat.

seafood paella with squid and squid ink-Our entire party's favorite dish, this is a special that should be made into a regular offering. Instead of rice, this dish contained vermicelli noodles, with a generous seafood portion. Highly recommend ordering this before its no longer offered!

This place broke my heart into pieces.  My wife took me here after she had been here for a work outing because she thought I'd like it.  This place was completely amazing and knocked my socks off.  First, paella is one of my favorite dishes.  They made some of the most delicious paella I had ever had.  We ordered so many dishes from here I couldn't name them all, but the short rib, bacon wrapped dates, calamari frito, chicken paella were huge stand outs.  The cocktails and sangrias were delicious and addictive.  I don't like sangria, at all, but I loved theirs.  The service and atmosphere was spot on.  I loved this place so much I recommended it to so many friends and family members, anytime someone said they were looking for tapas this was the place to go.  They were consistent and delicious and I put them in my rotation immediately.

Fast forward a few years and I hadn't been in a while and recently went with my wife.  We were looking forward to it because we both loved this place.  We got there and ordered some of everything, our old favorites and some new stuff.  We got all of the pintxos, not impressed at all.  They changed the recipe for a lot of their dishes in the 4 months since we'd been there last.  Some of the hot food was cold.  The food that should be cold was luke warm like it had been sitting out.  Our waiter came by so infrequently that we decided to order everything all at once because there was not telling when he would come back.  Our drink orders were messed up, we got food that we didn't order and we didn't get food that we did order, all the way through dessert.  We ordered three desserts and only got one thing that we ordered.  The seafood paella was so bland I wanted to cry.  The socarrat on the bottom of the pan was non-existent.  It felt like meeting an ex-lover that you longed for only to find that while your love for her grew she only grew disdain.  I couldn't rationalize the complete change.  I started feeling bad, wondering if people I recommended this place to had the same experience as me.  If anyone came here under my recommendation and had this happen to them I apologize.  What made it worse was that it was my wife's birthday, smh, so you know I had to make up for it.

One of my favorite places in the city. Excellent food and many choices to keep everyone happy. The wine is good, the sangria is really good. I've only been for brunch once and I'd go back for sure. I would definitely make a reservation if possible as it's always packed. Otherwise you end up waiting or trying snag a bar seat. We can go here without getting the beef skewer with horseradish cream. It's my favorite thing on the menu.
The passion fruit sangria is to die for!! My favorites are the octopus and patatas! Definitely recommend. Everyone is friendly too.

Deeeeeelicious!!! Everything is absolutely amazing and we can't even pick a favorite. Sangrias are always go-to, but the mojitos are fresh as can be!!! All the tapas had so much flavor, more than any other place we've been of the same sort. Hot and fresh, even with the place packed!!! Service is also so great even though they have so many people to take care of! Ham and cheese croquetas a must, as well as the spicy potatoes, beef and mashed potatoes, garlic shrimp.... Always a great time!

My six person last minute brunch reservation is eternally grateful that you had a table available. I assume it's because this is not a typical brunch spot and I hope it stays that way.
Shared a pitcher of the mango sangria and pretty much every one of the chef recommended plates but, when we saw the table next to us get the paella we immediately regretted not trying it. The food was slightly overpriced for what we got but that is the way with tapas it seems. Every plate was well thought out and executed. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable so, no complaints there.
My friends and I will be back!

Love this fun neighborhood spot. Great for sangria or tapas. Nice place to get together with friends. I've brought many guests here and they always enjoy the ambiance, drinks, service and food. Definitely recommend!

This is my ALL TIME FAVORITE restaurant. The sangria is so delicious as well as the food. It does however get pretty busy in the evening times so be sure to make a reservation or else you will wait a while.  I don't mind waiting because it is always worth it. When you go order the spicy potatoes those little things are amazing and spicy.

We had the best dinning experience here tonight. We sat outside, weather was great, and Jose was the greatest waiter that I ever had. He was great at recommendations and answering questions. Such a great evening.
Everytime I come here I leave satisfied. All of their food is delicious! Brunch or dinner, I recommend

I went here for a date and it was amazing. I pass by this place on my commute all the time, but it wasnt until i went for dinner that i saw why its always busy. Expect a decent wait time, but its sooo worth it. I had the brisket with mashed potatoes and one of their rices with pork belly, pork skin, etc. OMFG it was amazing. The rice is definitely for 2 peopel at least. I had it for a few days afterwards with tortillas and siracha. Great food, great drinks, great scenery. The staff is always tryna make sure you are cared for. I would highly recommend.
It's always very hit or miss with this place. This last time was a miss. It has the feel of a corporate restaurant.

Use the lettuce entertain you app for points and reservations. Also would suggest calling if they don't have the opening you want on the app and they were flexible for me. Came for brunch and It was great- ordered the two Benedict's, the side of homemade sausage, and a deviled egg. It was tasty and I loved the vibe overall. I like the tapas for brunch concept and I look forward to coming back for dinner.
Sangria is amazing, apps are amazing, great environment and service. Love this place, have gone on numerous special occasions

Used to be THE  place for tapas in Chicago but it's star has faded. Still part of LEYE so held to high standards, but is no longer unique and no longer all that good, candidly. It's a pale comparison to a real version either anywhere throughout Spain or even NYC.
In fact, there used to be several middling to upper-middling Spanish / tapas restaurants in Chicago, and I think we're down to far fewer than before. Emilio's is still the best of a diminished pack.
Sad, really, but I think the emergence of "small plate" restaurants co-opted the idea of a tapas bar, and it's our loss that the Spanish component of that equation couldn't keep demand high enough to make it competitive.
A nice enough place. Loved the more authentic feel it had years ago, but food is still worth a trip if you want a great array of tapas choices

Good tapas joint but there are better throughout the city and suburbs. With that said, Cafe Babareeba has been at this location for more than 35 years so they're doing something right. Still a good place with a great location and consistent food.

Came as a group of 6 for brunch, ordered:
*pitcher of sangria, and one virgin sangria
*seafood paella
*bacon wrapped dates
*burrata with tomato sauce
*seared scallops
*short ribs

Everything was good and especially liked the sangrias!  Love to come back again.

It's so good it's actually sinful. Who knew just a bowl of olives could make someone so happy? Seriously a must when in Chicago, the food and service is too good to experience through review trolling. Just go.

Great restaurant! With a fantastic i'm ambience!

Told some work colleagues that I might be going here for dinner and to my surprise a lot of people had been there before. Nothing but good things can be said about the food, service and the drink specials.

I'm excited to say that everything that my colleagues said was truthful! This is a Great establishment and will be definitely coming here again.

id write a story 5 pages long if I needed to tell you about how amazing the food and all the staff members are for this place..

honestly just amazing and also the bartenders make you feel so at home when you eat in the lounge.

I love this place

We had couple of tapas and they were all really delicious, it's a very crowded place so I highly recommend a reservation. The only thing that really bothered me is that the host at the front table was so rude and impolite, she was behaving like we are there to get free food. I had a reservation for 3 and when I talked to her she was kinda yelling at me and then very rude way told me we have no table for you now go sit at the bar till I call you!!! I definitely liked the place but I think the host who makes the first impression of a restaurant should be a nicer well behaved person.

It was my first time to try the place and I liked it a lot! Loved the bacon-wrapped dates. The Paella Valenciana was very well done and that peach sangria is just dazzling. Do not leave without trying it! One can never have too much sangria. The service is very helpful and accommodating. So fun & perfect for a girls night out. Plus, incredible value!

Hands down my favorite restaurant! I love the tapa style and we ordered all the popular dishes on the menu! The burrata, octopus and paella were awesome and we loved the white sangria we well. The paella was very rich and creamy, and the seafood tasted really fresh with a natural sweetness. Pork belly was very crispy and rich, and the potatoes were out of this world! Would definitely recommend if you are looking for Spanish food and family style dining!

While Visiting Chicago a group of us stopped here last night to have dinner and enjoy some tapas and drinks. Superb! Asides from the amazing atmosphere and wonderful service, We had the seafood paella, the seared octopus, batatas bravas , calamari and pitchers of sangria all night. Wow! Everything was amazing! Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Tapas! Five star review for sure

I see why this restaurant has such a long and rich history in Chicago, because it is truly outstanding. My friend and I came for brunch recently, and really loved our experience here. Making reservations was easy since they are on Open Table, and I was able to snag us a table the day before our Saturday brunch. During brunch you have the options of choosing between the brunch items, or the dinner items on the other side of the menu. The fact that there are so many options is dangerous, because everything sounds delicious. I decided to focus on items from the brunch menu, because I know I'll come another time to try the dinner items.

Our waitress was very attentive and answered our questions about the menu well. My friend and I both didn't order any cocktails, since we both were more in need of caffeine, but I hear their sangria is amazing.  To eat I ordered the citrus french toast  stick, deviled egg, and baked eggs.

Citrus french toast stick: It had a light citrus taste, and the flavor was not overpowering . The outer texture was crispy, and the inner part was soft. I almost wish I had ordered two instead of one, because it was my second favorite item from my visit.

Deviled egg: It was good and had a little bit of a kick to it.

Baked Eggs: I am head over hills and in love with their baked eggs. The eggs are covered in cheese,  a tangy sauce and are  perfectly baked.  The tomato bread is seriously some of the best bread I've ever had, and it paired perfectly with the baked eggs. If you enjoy eggs, tomatoes, and cheese, then this dish is for you.

The price point is excellent for the quality of the food here. My whole bill before tip was a little over $12, which wasn't bad at all.

pics.caption: Baked egg and tomato bread for brunch

review.des:
Love, love, love this place! Best tapas around:)

The sangria is delicious, great variety in the food, and the atmosphere is casual. Date night, out with friends...order several plates to share and dig in! I highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates

I drag every person who visits Chicago here and it's always a win.

I came here with a large group on a Thursday night, and this place was packed. There's a cute courtyard with outdoor seating near the front of the restaurant in addition to the large dining space inside. We started off with a couple of pitchers of the classic red sangria which was delicious and not overly sweet.

The best way to do tapas is gathering a bunch of hungry people together and basically ordering one (or four) items from each of the categories - veggies/cheeses, seafood, chicken/pork, beef/lamb. Some of the standouts for me were roast dates with bacon and burrata with bread and tomato marmalade. I'm a big fan of sweet/salty, and the flavors of both those dishes were richly complex. I also really liked the brussels sprouts salad, mixed greens salad, grilled squid, and the ham/chorizo plate. I could have done without the fried calamari or garlic potato salad, but I think other people liked it. We ended the meal with the caramelized banana and chocolate cake which were both SO good.

I'm giving this place four, not five stars because some of the dishes came out a little cold, and the fried calamari was on the soggy side. The atmosphere was also pretty loud and crazy for a weeknight dinner, but I guess that is to be expected at a tapas place. The food and people made for a fun night, and I will definitely be back!
Love this place. The tapas are consistent, the ambiance is pretty high energy but still comfortable and the service is good. This is my go-to restaurant when I'm craving tapas and sangria.

Very fun place to go with a group! Food is great and it's easy to accommodate meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Definitely recommend getting a pitcher of sangria for the table. Hoping to go for brunch in the future!

This place has grown on me each time I seem to come back. The food has always been good here and I've always enjoyed their paella and sangria options, but note that you can easily surpass $30/person price point making it a $$$ experience rather than $$ as listed.

On our last visit here, we did the rioja-braised short rib, summer melon salad, buttermilk fried chicken with piri piri sauce, seared Spanish sausages, grilled octopus with potatoes and olives, & porky paella (pork shoulder pork belly, chorizo, & chicharrones). Overall a solid meal. If there were items I could live without, it would be the seared sausages and the buttermilk fried chicken. Sausages were good but nothing that really stood out for me and the buttermilk fried chicken was tasty but kind of out of place in my opinion for a Spanish tapas bar. My favorite was probably the braised short rib due to how tender and flavorful the meat was. The melon salad I really enjoyed the serranos and the smoked vinaigrette they used. The grilled octopus was good, but some of the pieces of octopus were had a bit too much char in my opinion. And lastly, for the pork paella... be ready for a mouthful of pork flavors and textures. Really good, but after a few bites I was definitely overwhelmed and needed to balance it out with other bites from the other dishes. On a final note, their classic sangria is my go to and goes great with any of the food here.

'Til next time, cheers!

Our group of 4 had a reservation on Sunday morning for brunch, and we were seated right on time. My husband and I love brunch and have tried many of the Chicago favorites, but this is our new favorite! There are so many options to choose from, and the tapas style brunch is wonderful for those who are wanting to try a little bit of everything. Everyone in our group was thrilled with our selections. We ordered slightly too much food, but I would recommend 7-8 dishes for a group of 4. The Nutella and banana waffles were my favorite item that we tried.
Absolutely delicious! Insanely crowded on a snowy Friday night, so reservations are probably a good idea. Chorizo wrapped dates and the classic red sangria... if only we lived closer
This is a great place to eat if you want a lot of food for what you pay for. I've had generally positive experiences here. Great for vegetarians!
Great place! Had my husbands 30th surprise party here. Everything I ordered was amazing and the waiter was so gracious with the large bunch of us. Will definitely return!

Absolutely delicious.

Even though I am a cautious eater (read:picky), the menu was so large and diverse that it was easy to find items that were enjoyable for everyone. We tried so many things that it is hard to remember, but I will say this- YES TO PAELLA!!!! We had two different paellas and they were both wonderful and crispy on the bottom and just yum.

My only gripes were that the floor was SUPER slippery and our server seemed to hold some sort of grudge against me. Like he would fill everyone else's waters but not mine even though I was sitting the closest to him. No big deal, though, I had sangria.
Favorite tapas in the city. Brunch & dinner menus are both amazing. Good with friends or a date night!
Server had me sign up for the Lettuce Entertain You rewards app, did not give me rewards.

This place is a great spot for a casual outing with friends or for a date. They have a great selection of drinks and tapas, and what's best is that the menu has certain popular items highlighted for you in case you're indecisive. We tried the hangar steak, the stuffed mushrooms, and the burrata, along with the caramelized bananas for dessert. I had a classic red sangria, which was great/decently strong. I recommend you get all of these! Very delicious, a great atmosphere and friendly service.

It does get packed but we came on a Sunday at around 4 and were seated right away. The neighborhood is also nice to walk around in general after a meal.

pics.caption: Caramelized Banana from Cafe Ba Ba Reeba!

review.des:
Finally had the chance to eat at this well known tapas restaurant! Ordered a pitcher of white Sangria (garnished with apples) to accompany our meal, and it was great! Very refreshing, not too sweet, and the apples were amazing.

For three of us we ordered:
-Burrata with Catalan Tomato Bread
-Spicy Potatoes
-2 orders of Bacon Wrapped Dates
-Rioja Braised Short Rib

Without a doubt get the bacon wrapped dates, they're to die for. Short Rib and burrata were very good but not amazing. Spicy potatoes were also excellent. It was the perfect amount of food and came to about $30 a piece after tax and tip- which was well worth it and we were all full! We sat out on the covered patio which was awesome, and I was surprised how full it got on a Wednesday evening! Excited to go back and try more menu items!!

So oooo Spanish. God damn this place has a long wait. Prepare to get drunk next door as you wait for your table.

Order sangria

Octopus was good too.

Yeah it is tapas, nuff said.

Love this place.  They always have great food, and the prices are super reasonable.  Their brunch tapas are also very good, but their traditional Spanish tapas are still the best.  Also have great Sangria and wine.

Also have done private events here, and the prices were more reasonable than most other places.

I am so impressed with their happy hour specials. From 4-6pm every day in the bar area they have tapas and drink specials. We ordered one or two of everything on the happy hour tapas and everything was delicious. My favorites were the bacon wrapped dates, the garlic potato salad, and the patatas bravas. We also ordered a pitcher of delicious sangria. Our server was attentive and quick. With how much food we ordered and our drinks, we were shocked with how cheap our bill was. I can't decide if for the small sizes of the tapas if it would be worth it to pay full non happy hour prices...
Love this place! Always busy, always good. Can't wait to go back soon for more good eats and good drinks!

What a cute place! Ideal place for girls day/night out. I went for brunch but ended up ordering just the lunch menu items. I thought the menu was small for a tapas joint, maybe it wasn't the full menu.

We ordered:
Passion fruit sangria (Delicious, you can't taste the alcohol at all!)
-Grilled Octopus (Octopus is not as soft as other tapas dishes I've had but the flavor of the grilled/charred octopus is pretty good)
-Goat cheese dip (The bread it comes with was too hard but the dip is tasty. It's better with the bread that they give you at the beginning of your meal.)
-Brussel spout salad (This was good but nothing special.)
-Seafood paella (I asked our server to cook the paella a little longer and it was good.)
Caramelized banana (I always order this dessert at tapas restaurants and like it every time.)
Chocolate truffle cake (Not my favorite..)

I would return to try other dishes, maybe for dinner to see the full menu. The paella was not on the menu I had so I'm assuming that there is a fuller menu. The dessert portions were small and presentation wasn't as good but it tasted good.

When the paella came out, I asked the person who brought out the food not to mix the food yet so that I can take a photo. He waited for me to take a photo but said "I'm very busy". That wasn't nice...

One of my favorite tapas restaurants ever. The menu is expansive, the sangria is delicious, and the food is very flavorful and consistent. The menu is a bit dated, but if it's not broken, don't fix it I guess. The best time to come here is actually happy hour, when all the best menu items are half off-- including their famous sangria.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. They have the best tapas!  Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba's atmosphere is dark and romantic with soft lighting. Service has always been superb.  Sangria is fantastic.  Must try patatas braves, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, garlic shrimp, and garlic potato salad.  Enough gluten-free options to satisfy the mother-in-law as well. I visit every time I return to Chicago. LOVE IT!
This place is the bomb. Worth it if you're in this neighborhood. They have about 20 delicious tapas to choose from and a great wine selection to accompany. Beautiful dark and Mediterranean ambiance.

We were there on a Friday night. Very busy. We called to be on their waitlist and then showed up and then they texted us when our table was ready. Very easy. I am gluten and dairy free and our waiter (maximiella) was awesome about knowing the food. We got a ton and everything was great. And everyone was happy. And for a super busy place, it wasn't as loud as I was expecting. And the service was actually very fast and really great.
Items sampled:
chorizo wrapped dates (gooey, hot and always good)
salmon with confit fennel (so good)
deviled egg (1 tiny 1/2 egg. good. Nothing special)
patatas bravas (got a kick, very good. lots of food)
brussel sprout salad (raw. Very good and light.)
garlic shrimp (not kidding with the garlic)
chicken and chorizo skewer (1 skewer, small, good)
hanger steak (very unique flavor and cooked perfectly).
The desserts sounded great, but we were full!

We tried quite a few items from the menu and sadly nothing really stood out. Probably won't be back anytime soon.  

-Grilled squid (ok)
-Spicy chili oil shrimp (meh just oily)
-Seafood paella (way too salty and the seafood was over cooked)
-Lamb loin (ok, not gamey)
-Steak with chimichurri (just ok)
- Goat cheese in tomato sauce (good)

Bill with tax and tip for 3 ppl and two drinks was ~$145.

Oh Cafe Ba Ba Reeba... if only I could bring you home with me. I've loved this place since my sister took me 10 years ago when she lived in Chicago, and I have to say my heart broke a little when I found out there is one in Las Vegas the week after visiting. Seriously, this place is so good it may be the answer to world peace.

I've never had a single dish that is bad and this trip was no different. Definitely try to more traditional tapas - tortilla espanola, croquetas, patatas bravas, pulpo... it's making my mouth water just to think about it! My husband and I also shared 1/2 pitcher of the pomegranate sangria that was a feature and it was phenomenal. 1/2 pitcher was about 3 glasses each as they are short glasses. A couple glasses of sangria and some tortilla and you'll feel as though you've been transported to a bar in Puerto del Sol.

The space is surprisingly big but I would still highly recommend a reservation to avoid an hours long wait. Even though I would totally hours to eat here. I can't wait for our next Chicago visit and next Ba Ba Reeba experience!

Simply delicious! Had a early dinner here this evening with a few friends. Ordered a pitcher of their classic sangria, good stuff, and stiff. Got some yummy bread and olive oil to snack on while we decided ..

We went all out and ordered a bit of everything.. Chorizo wrapped dates were to die for, the lamb, pork shoulder and beef empanadas were my favorite.
