Food came out quickly, the servers were very attentive .. They cleaned up quickly and made sure we had everything we needed, fresh plates, water.. Etc. good music. Good atmosphere. Will definitely return!
Fabulous!  Everything was good and the price was very reasonable. Hope to find a place like this in Seattle.

Date night was a success here! We went in early on a Saturday night@5! Got seated right away and pleasantly served. Our service was timely and our meal was excellent. I was surprised when the influx of patrons went from no one at 5pm to a full house by 6pm and the quality of our service did not change. Our waitress and the bus staff cleaned our plates rapidly and filled our water cups regularly. Our evening was perfection.  We will be back with friends!
This place is great for a date night where you want to try many dishes. The portions are small but just enough of everything.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba made for a really nice Sunday brunch.  The venue is very nice, with lots of natural light.  We ordered several tapas and the Citrus French Toast, the Braised Short Rib, and the Fried Chicken.  They were all great, but our favorite was the seafood paella.

Are you kidding me? This is one of my favourite restaurants in the city of Chicago. Talk about tapas...everything I've gotten here has been orgasmically delicious. It is pricey, but my friends and I save up and go every few months. A check-in will get you a free tapas desert! I love the Chicken piri piri and also the sangria is to die for. The wait is usually 2 hours on a weekend, but we just hop over to Marquee bar and Cafe Baabs texts us when our table is ready. Good system! Less busy on weekdays, usually no wait before 7PM.

Where do I even begin?  Everyone always asks me what my favorite restaurant is in the city, and almost always I say, "I don't know, I have so many!", but now I can give a definitive answer and tell the whole world that Café Ba-ba-reeba is one of my all-time favorites.  This restaurant totally hits it out the ballpark, and I would reccomend it to anyone and everyone.  Café Ba-ba-reeba is equivalent to the eight wonder of the world - can you tell that I love it here?

Like I said - where do I begin?  I suppose I can just start off by listing all the tapas thar we ordered, so here we go:
1. Potatoes and aioli
2. Spicy meatballs in sherry sauce
3. Beef empanada
4. Ham and chicken croquetas
5. Melted goat cheese in tomato sauce
6. Octopus with smoked potatoes

Although I could just lean back, relax and tell you that each of these were phenomenal, let me just give you a brief description of each tapa we ordered. The potatoes and aioli are simple, but amazing; the aioli is finger-lickin good (quite literally).  The meatballs are juicy, and the sauce they are in is wonderfully flavorful.  The beef empanada was like a meat filled croissant - it was awesome.  The croquetas were amazing - that's all.  The melted goat cheese in tomato sauce came with garlic bread and the flavor mixed perfectly together - this was one of the best deals as well.  And finally, the octopus tasted like they fetched it straight from the sea; it had all the salinity your heart could desire, not to mention it was chewy but tender in the most perfect way.  Biased as I may sound, all of these tapas are a "must-get".  Yes, there's so many others to choose from but these were freaking amazing.  

But hey, guess what?  The empanada, meatballs, croquetas and potatoes are all $3 or less during happy hour which is 4pm-6pm, Monday-Friday.  That way you can try more of their tapas for a little less money.  You can only take advantage of these happy hour deals if you sit in the bar area, but why not?  You still get the same great atmosphere and service when sitting in the bar so take advantage why don't ya?  

Now, I'm not done - oh no, not even close.  My fiancé and I got the seafood paella after all those tapas.  I had high expectations for the paella since my fiancé has said it's the best he's had, and I was anything but disappointed.  The paella exceeded my expectations, and I can say it is now my favorite paella as well.  The saffron is very distinct, but not overwheleming, and the seafood was cooked perfectly.  I had some left-over and it still tasted just as good the following day.  That's impressive.  I don't usually have a burning desire to go back to the same restaurant twice, but I'd go here 10x over to indulge in this paella.  

And after the paella, we had dessert - not one, but four to be precise (we pigged out just a little).  We had the black raspberry sorbet, caramelized bananas, natilla flan and the butterscotch mousse.  Don't even ask what my favorite one was there - they satisfied the sweet tooth like no other dessert ever has.  I'd say that you definitely should try the butterscotch mousse and the caramelized bananas...if you really have to choose.  Each dessert is only $3 and they're small so you should choose to get more than just one.

And finally (as if that wasn't enough, right?) We got a pitcher of sangria that lasted throughout the entire course of our meal.  That pitcher is huge, and it's not filled to the brim with ice so you truly are getting a whole lotta sangria.  We got the red sangria which is only $17 for a pitcher during happy hour - hell yeah!  The sangria was awesome, maybe a little too awesome since I walked outta that place a little tipsy.  We also got some Spanish beer that was on draft and it was also very good...and yes, I was double-fisting it for a bit there.

The atmosphere and the service made this dining experience even better.  The waiters and bussers were extremely attentive and always came through picking up our dirty plates.  We definitely didn't feel ignored, even though we weren't sitting in the main dining area.  In fact, it was kind of nice because it felt like private dining be for all the dinner crowd came.

Ultimately, we left in some pain because of all that we ate, but can say that we came, we saw and we conquered.

pics.caption: With everything we ordered the bill came to a reasonable price

review.des: This place is one of the best in the city for Tapas style food. The Cafe offers a wide variety of dishes for everyone's pallet. They have wine flights, decent beers on tap, and great deals on sangria pitchers. If you don't want to sit at a table, the place also has an extensive bar with TVs. While the place is pretty big, you will likely want to get a reservation as this place is pretty popular. If you are lucky, you may be able to snag one of the 2 tables that are located outside. Bring your friends and you won't be disappointed.

Met my daughter here for dinner.  Traffic from Rosemont was horrible but once we started trying the yummy tapas selections, I forgot about the commute.  We'll rate our selections!  1-bacon wrapped dates, 2-beef tenderloin and blue cheese, 3-chicken thighs, 4-goat cheese in tomato sauce w/garlic bread.  Dessert coming now...gotta go!

Tapas are very delicious, especially those red marked popular items. The atmosphere is more designed for couples we guess. Romantic and a bit dark. Makes you relax. I went this place with group of friends. It's always a good idea to dinning with friends so that you could order more tapas and share various different things. We ordered garlic shrimp for twice since we all like it very much. There are 6 pieces come in one order. The spicy potato definitely caught my stomach. I am not such a potato fan but I ate a LOT of spicy potato. It's just fried great! The hanger steak is also good. We tried the rib, it was super soft and delicious. Paella is OK since we all agree the one we ordered is too salty. Overall I would recommend you to check this place out.
Like any Melman restaurant, the food is consistent and pretty good, but not great. The atmosphere is quite festive and sitting at the bar is fun. It's very noisy.

This is one of my friends most favorite go-to spots when she comes to Chicago so of course with her raving reviews I had to come see it for myself. The restaurant is huge! Lots of space, a bar area for waiting and grabbing drinks and tvs to watch the game

MUST GET THE SANGRIA PITCHER. sweet and light just how i like it.

The food was a little on the salty side for me but the flavors were really good. I recommend the paella! We have 8 people and ordered 6 servings but it was wayy too much as its a large platter.Portions werent too small but a good size for a tapa.

Parking is hard since its street parking and you have to pay meters on the street.

Amazing food, great variety, delicious sangria, and romantic atmosphere.  This place is great for a date night with your SO or dinner with a group of friends!  I recommend trying a little of everything and also asking the waiter/waitress for their recommendations.  The goat cheese with tomato sauce is one of my faves- simple yet so delicious!

Not worth waiting 2.5 hours if you don't have a reservation... If by chance you happen to eat here, great, but not worth it in my opinion...
3 stars is for:
1. Not sweet red Sangria, which is hard to find these days for some weird reason
2. Tender octopus
3. Tender short ribs

If the review was based on paella, it would have gotten 1 star... The paella was subpar (we got their recommended pork paella), and they took away the paella pan...who does that!  That's the best part about paella! The way the rice crisps on the bottom of the pan & keeps the paella warm as it sits on your table... Instead the server brought the paella in the pan, but divided it up in portions & served it in regular tapas plates...fail!
The deviled egg was not worth it for $2.5 for a half an egg that was way over cooked & the filling was meh :(

Overall, I don't understand how this place got almost 3k reviews at 4 stars... Def a tourist attraction.

I have been here several times and feel that I am qualified to write this review. The sangrias are great and strong so be careful not to keep knocking them back. Definitely order the patatas bravas as they are the most all-around-good menu item, enjoyed by everyone at the table. Everything else varies. I've had some good and not so good; although most of it seemed to be a difference in taste buds.
I would also recommend the fried chicken with piri piri sauce. The service is good but last time I went it was incredibly slow. The waitress was just chatting on the side while I waited for my bill. It seemed almost impossible to get her attention.
Anyway, they have an extensive menu with lots to choose from!

This place has great food and a great ambiance. Good for dates or large parties/gatherings. Saw a couple of bridal showers/bachelorette dinners.

Would recommend about 2-3 dishes per person. We tried the following:

*Garlic Shrimp
*Meatballs
*Buttermilk Chicken
*Hangar Steak
*Bacon Wrapped Dates
*Caramelized Banana (free with yelp check-in)

Favorite was definitely the meatballs and the bacon wrapped dates. The hangar steak was also very good - smaller portions than the other tapas, but very tender meat and went great with the chimmichurri sauce.

The caramelized banana we got as dessert was good and came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, but it was nothing special.

My friends and I came to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for restaurant week at first, but then was attracted by their variety of tapas. So we ordered 4 tapas and 2 serving of seafood paella. Everything is delicious, and the service was also excellent!
It gets crowded easily in weekends, therefore making reservation is highly recommended. But I think the food is also worth the waiting time~~~
Amazing tapas , the best sangrias and a very nice vibe . Be sure to make reservations ahead of time as this place is very popular! Enjoy

Don't forget to check in on your Yelp app to receive a free dessert! :) you're welcome!

The vibe here is very chill, I love it. It's a great place to work (there's free wifi) when they're less busy but when it's packed, it gets very loud and the wait can be very long! As per usual at a tapas bar, the portions are pretty small here and it can be very easy to rack up a big bill, so don't come in too hungry if you're not prepared to pay with your wallet!

Rioja-Braised Short Rib - fell right off when I cut it, very tender and flavorful

Shrimp with garlic, olive oil - this was a little too much for me, the shrimp were practically drowned in olive oil, taking away from my appreciation of the shrimp itself!

Chocolate cake - delicious!

I would like to come back and try their paella! Next time I'm ordering the sangria as well!

Haven't been here in years and am in town for work and decided to head back. I love tapas and this place is perfect for it! Usually order 3 plates for each person at your table for sharing. We ordered the passion fruit sangria- very good and they use real fruit. For plates- goat cheese with tomato, Brussel sprout salad, beef empanada, bacon wrapped dates, spicy potatoes, and garlic shrimp. Everything was so good especially the dates and the empanada. Also by checking in you get a free desert- caramelized bananas were so good!! Would go back again- cool atmosphere and great service!

We had some friends visiting from New York City, so naturally we had to choose a place that would impress.... And Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was it. Brunch is fantastic, but I LOVE their dinners. Truly one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

I like the way they designed their menus with favorite items and/or chef recommendations highlighted in red. Because they do change the menu pretty frequently, it's nice to automatically know some of the newbies you should try.

Some things you should absolutely order:
-a pitcher of sangria. We shared it among 4 people and we each got two full glasses and then some. The pitcher costs $26, while a single glass costs $7. Huge savings, and well worth sharing among a small crowd.
-on the pinxtos menu, the date stuffed with cheese wrapped with chorizo is to die for. Embarrassingly enough, I always order 2-3 just for myself. They have something similar on the full size menu, but it's not identical, and these are sooooo fantastic that I don't even chance it. Get more than one. It's all of the flavors you would never expect to work that just do.
-spicy potatoes. They aren't over powering, and contain just the right amount of kick... And that chipotle mayo sauce is delicious!
-beef tenderloin with blue cheese = perfection. It's cooked medium rare and has a slightly salty taste from the cheese. Mmm, mmm, good!
-goat cheese with tomato sauce. It's super creamy and warm, and when placed on top of the garlic bread, it melts.

Some other menu items we thought were tasty (though not at the same 5+ star level as the above list):
-ham and cheese croquettes. They came four to an order and were jam packed with flavor. Although they look like mozzarella sticks, the cheese isn't melty, it's more cream-based.
-hanger steak. It was cooked medium rare and came with roasted potatoes and harissa sauce (which we all thought was similar to sofrito, but I'm not sure if it was the color or the flavor that led us to believe that!).
-octopus! It was many of our first times trying octopus, but it exceeded our expectations. Ever so slightly chewy, but great pop of flavor.

Tips:
-Check-in on Yelp and you get a free dessert. Surprisingly, because we all checked in, they let us all get a free dessert. It was NOT one per table. We tried four different ones and passed them around the table in true tapas fashion. They were about 5 bites a piece and hit the spot! My personal favorite was the rich chocolate cake!

The food was for the most part wonderful! Only issue was undercooked chicken on chicken kabobs-very very pink. However, the service was terrible. Our waiter was extremely slow and then rude and defensive when we would ask for something. We waited 35 minutes between when we had clearly stopped eating and plates were cleaned before we got a chance to ask for our check. The atmosphere of the place was very fun, it's loud, but a great place to go to hangout and try small dishes. Just don't go when you have to be somewhere afterwards for the pace is just unbelievably slow.

Five star for Management!
Thank you for taking care of us after our Paella was never made!  

My family has been coming here for since it opened and I was a kid. We came back  to celebrate my Mom's 81st birthday.

5 stars:
-Mushrooms with mancheko? Cheese.
-Beef medium rare with garlic mashed potatoes (special of the day)
-octopus sauté in garlic with greens
I want to eat these again just writing about it.
Cooked just right and flavor was delish!

3stars for Chicken Paella: it was salty, rice overcooked, and tasted burnt. I don't think I would order again.

3 stars for kids penne pasta with red sauce. Flavor was ok, edible. It  came with mini vegetables that were gritty so no one ate.
Beware of the bread that sits out uncovered in the racks and at service station: Bad cross contamination ?! !! Have to say, was not happy about the busser who serves cuts and serves bread with the same dirty hands he just wiped tables and cleared dishes with.  We didn't realize this until there were more tables. Although, He was very efficient and attentive.

Loved the $3 dessert menu:
Best:
-Butterscotch pudding
-hazelnut bar
-flan
-chocolate cake with vanilla (very rich)
Pass on cheesecake, minimal flavor, not memorable.

This place was my first tapas experience and it was amazing! Certainly set the bar high for tapas. The service is super friendly and the servers helpful since there are so many options. The ambiance is so energetic and friendly. You feed off the energy of everyone else which is always fun. This is a great place to come with a group but there are definitely different areas and feels with different parts of the restaurant. In the summer, they have a patio which is always fun to sit out on! The best part of Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba of course is the food. The plates are small - tapas sized- but all filling and delicious. The bacon wrapped dates are a must-try, a unique combo bursting with flavor. They also serve paella which is so cool to see them stir and serve. Be aware the paella is huge! So definitely more filling than the other small plates. Sangria is a must-try here as well, perfectly mixed and fruity! Great and fun dining experience that won't break the bank!

Very underwhelming for all the reviews we saw. My boyfriend and I ordered grilled squid  (way too salty), beef tenderloin with blue cheese (beef was dried and tough), Brussel sprouts salad (too much cheese, made the dressing too creamy and the beef empanada, which was delightful. The desserts were below par as well. We ordered caramelized banana and the flan, it just didn't have a lot originality.  The good part was that we got the desserts for free as a part of checking in via yelp. Overall, not very good food and was a disappointment given all the rave reviews.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong things?
I take my picky eaters here and show them that eating out can be yummy with their foodie friends. No one is left behind here. There is always something.

The service was fabulous and the food was pretty good. It wasn't the best Spanish food I've ever had, but my boyfriend and I were very content (and full) at the end of our meal. I definitely recommend coming with a group of people so that you can try as many dishes as possible!

pics.caption: Octopus with Shishito Peppers, Charred Romescu, Smoked Fingerlings & Pearl Onions - $12

review.des:
Went out to dine in tonight. Haven't been back in two years and it was way below par.
The lamb was overlooked, veggies burned, octopus was tough. Sangrias are watered down and with a ton of ice. $85 bill for four small plates and a pitcher of sangria was not worth it. There are much better, authentic tapas restaurants in Chicago. This place sucks.

Great Sangria, lovely bread. The tapas need to be a little more fresh, whole, and something green would be great. The food was overly prepared.  For example, in the the tortilla espanola, there were cubed potatoes.  I don't understand why. But, I will end with. . . they make their own bread and it is good.
What can't I say? Ahhhhhhhh! This is THE BEST PLACE everrrrrrrrrrrr. Try all of the tapas and all of the sangria flavors. You just won't go weong. It's definitely a great time here.

I've been wanting to come here for a long time and we finally made it out on Wednesday for happy hour at the bar. They had $3 tapas so we got to try a ton of different things. My favorite was the bacon wrapped dates. It was a combination of sweet and savory but really bold flavored! We also had the ham croquet, chicken empanada, meatballs, and the mushroom toast thingy. They were all small flavorful bites. My bf also had the grilled octopus but was disappointed that it was a bit too salty. We also order the pork paella. It came out really hot and well seasoned.  Overall, ton of food!

Since we were there, we absolutely had to try the sangria! We had a pitcher of the white peach one, and it was one of the best sangrias I have tried. I also wanted to try another one and the bartender was nice enough to give me samples of them all. So my second favorite was the black raspberry followed by the passion fruit. The plain red was my bfs favorite, it really has that red wine flavor! And the sangria of the day was mango which was a little too sweet for me. I would definitely come back here for just drinks and small bites at the bar.

pics.caption: The bacon wrapped dates and the octopus tapas

review.des:
Came here on a Monday night and it was the best thing because of the $5 cocktails!! which we didn't know about before coming here (bonus :D). Everything on the menu is around $6-$8 and I recommend 2 dishes per person. We ordered spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, rioja-braised short rib, and galician empanada of bay scallops all were pretty amazing. The tab came to about $20 per person (super cheap for tapas) :)

I would definitely come back and try everything if I can!!!

pics.caption: blood orange margarita & spicy potatoes with tomato alioli yumm!

review.des: Fun environment and surprisingly large restaurant, have been here a few times always busy but not overwhelming. Definitely recommend reservations on weekends as the wait can be lengthy, but if you are just a couple, there are two bars which you can typically slide right into and eat at the bar. The tapas are very filling(which isn't always the case with tapas) and priced reasonably, I always plan on getting the paella but end up too full from tapas!  and I'm always a fan of a place that offers wine flights- the sangria is amazing too! Also close to other bars if you do have a wait!

Ba-ba-ba-barbara ann...wait, I mean, Reeba! I LOVE THIS PLACE!

My party of 5 came here for dinner around 6 PM and the wait for a table was about 45 minutes so we decided to just grab a table at the bar area. The tables at the bar area is first come, first serve and they still offer the entire menu of the restaurant. Shortly after we ordered our food, I got a text saying our table was ready on the restaurant side but we decided not to move.

We ordered a bunch of food and it all came out very quickly besides the paella, which the waiter did warn us that it would take about 30-40 minutes to cook.

We also got the peach sangria 1/2 pitcher to split between 4 people and that was more than enough. It was so yummy and not too strong at all.

Citrus Salmon: It was a spread of salmon with citrusy round thing and you eat it with the bread that's provided. It was interesting and I love salmon so it was a new twist to it.

Pork Skewer: DELICIOUS, I wished we had more of it. Juicy and very flavorful. It came it two skewers with about 3 cubes of meat on the skewer so it was just enough for each of us.

Scallop Empanada: My friends and I loved this dish! The filling of the empanada just melts in your mouth.

Sea Scallops: I personally thought this was a bit too bland for my liking.

Octopus: LOVED this dish. I thought the octopus was grilled just perfectly and it was deliciously seasoned, not too overpowering in taste.

Short Ribs: This piece of meat was just heaven, it melts in your mouth and oh so succulent. The mashed potatoes that came with it was one of the best I've ever had!

Paella: the paella came out right on time, shortly after we finished all the tapas and had a few minutes to digest the food a bit. It is a minimum of two orders and it was just enough to split between five people. I likd the paella but I was a bit full towards the end so I didn't enjoy it as much as I could have.

DESSERTS: Yelp had a super awesome offer of a free dessert w/ check in so we got 3 orders: Flan, apple empanada, and the banana one; our favorite ranked as Banana, apple empanada, flan. But TBH, they were alll very yummy!

The total bill for the seven orders and sangria came out to roughly $27 a person after tax and tip, which is reasonable (considering we got free desserts!!). It is better to eat with a bigger group so you can try a bit of everything.

PRO:
+free parking across the street, if you're lucky
+they will text you when your table is ready
+bar area is first come, first serve so snatch an open table if you see one
+great service, great food, yummy drinks!
+FREE desserts w/ Yelp check in and they don't limit the amount of free desserts/table so get everyone at your table to check in!!
Always a great time. Love the food. Great sangria. Really enjoy the new outdoor tables.

Loved Cafe Ba ba reeba so much I returned the same day during Happy Hour with 3 of my girlfriends. The beef empanadas are a MUST try and $16 for a pitcher of Sangria is just too good to skip. I will surely be back.
PS - I wish they offer authentic Valencia Horchata ;)
The best place for a group to split some plates and still get full. So much fun. This place is a riot. Try the sangria pitchers. 5/5

Came here while still underage unfortunately so didn't get to try out their sangria BUT still had a terrific time. Met my family there, and the servers were very patient with us taking our time to catch up before looking at the menus. The food was absolutely delicious and very well proportioned for us!! Even though they have a two serving minimum of their paella, it was very worth getting the extra food and having some leftovers for the next day. Definitely need to come back here sometime soon!

I've been here several times and it never disappoints. A few must-have menu items:

Dinner Menu:
-patatas bravas (the aioli has a little kick and is delicious!)
-bacon-wrapped dates (no explanation needed)
-goat cheese baked in tomato sauce
-fried green peppers (trust me on this)
-shrimp
-scallops
-white peach sangria

Brunch menu:
Pintxos:
-short stack of pancakes (the cutest, tastiest stack you'll ever eat)
-waffle-battered chicken stick

I don't recall my other brunch selections, and I'm sad to say I've never had any of the paella selections, but that's definitely on my list. Make a reservation, they're always busy--and for good reason!

Wow, all I can say is wow.. wow, wow, wow. Every time I eat here I'm blown away. Service is super friendly and FAST. If you time your orders properly you could have a never ending flow of tapas, and I ain't mad at that. Bacon wrapped dates are one of my favorites and some of the best I've ever had. I could honestly eat one of everything on the menu,  beer selection could be better but their cocktails make up for that, their mezcal mule is A-1. Make a reservation to avoid waiting since it's usually pretty busy, it's a massive space but tables fill up fast.

I love this place for tapas. Great sangria (and other drinks!) with an extensive food menu with a wide variety of items you may or may not have ever tried.

Cost is certainly decent and the atmosphere is great - not too loud, but not too quiet & serious though either. Festive without going overboard. All around good place.

Recently took my friends from out of town & they loved it! "Perfect" was the word they used :)

This bustling tapas restaurant is larger than it looks from the outside, and is consistently busy.

The menu has a reasonably broad selection of tapas and also paella. There is also a substantial wine and sangria list, and a separate cocktail menu.

I particularly enjoyed the house smoked salmon.

Bacon wrapped dates were nice and crisp on the outside without being mushy on the inside.

Buttermilk chicken thighs seemed mis-named, and were more like chicken tenders with a wing sauce on them.

Beef skewers were tender and nicely charred on the outside, although the horseradish sauce could have used more kick.

The empanadas had a delightfully flakey pastry.

Service was friendly and attentive. Dishes are delivered by runners, and come out as they are ready, so don't order everything at once or you will be inundated in food!
Best tapas! Will definitely be back!! Sangria is great too! We had calamari, shrimp, stuffed mushrooms, pork and beef, & the spicy potatoes.  Every tapas was excellent! Delicious! Glad we came!

I've been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba a few times over the years, but it's fitting to review it now because it wasn't until recently that I noticed how sizable the space was. I've always sat towards the front of the restaurant and didn't pay that much attention...the tables are still small as heck though. Good thing that the servers are typically quick to pick up used plates because there's not a lot of room to place the various tapas that you will undoubtedly order.

As for the tapas itself, I can't think of a single one I've tried thus far that I didn't either like or love. What falls into my love category?

1. Baked goat cheese
2. Pretty much anything with chorizo in it
3. Last but certainly not least, the bacon wrapped dates. I don't even eat bacon, but I will if it's wrapped around those dates!

I went for weekend brunch and you get to order from both the brunch menu and the regular one. Highly appreciated.

Price is reasonable but keep in mind, because these are small plates, and depending on the size of your party, it may take you quite a few to get satiated. In other words, don't be surprised if your bill falls into the $30-40 range. The one cost-effective tip I'll give you: if you have a party of 2-3, split a sangria pitcher, instead of going glass by glass. I split a pitcher of red with another person and felt like I got a whole lot of sangria out of that thing...definitely my money's worth.

Ba-ba-reeba is consistent and I've yet to have an awful experience. Great place to celebrate a birthday, introduce out of town friends/family to tapas, or have a date.

Good food, adequate service, Bohemian dive bar vibe.

We were mostly vegetarian and ordered mostly vegetarian dishes. Mushroom and goat cheese dishes were excellent; the Moroccan chickpea stew and brussels sprouts salad were a little too sweet but otherwise tasty. They have a good deal for wine flights, which I enjoyed (even if one of the glasses arrived wet, i.e., freshly washed but not dried). I wish there were more green things on the menu, but this is a chronic problem with the tapas I have experienced. Desserts were mediocre.

Our server was extremely conscientious and polite, but other employees who checked in on us forgot to bring us more water, a second glass of wine, and a serving spoon.

The women's bathroom was a little gross.

The place is crowded, loud, and feels a little skeevy to me, but it's solid all around.
Really good food/menu options(loved the bacon wrapped dates).  Cute interior and friendly staff.  Great place for a quiet dinner with friends or a date night
So good! Haven't had anything I didn't like here. Highly recommend for almost any occasion, it won't disappoint!

The food is good, and the service is very friendly and upbeat. It's a very loud environment, and definitely an energetic and busy environment.

The portions are average for tapas, and I would definitely recommend getting the seafood paella.

I loved the variety in flavors and textures I got out of a single meal. I wanted to try everything on the menu! Ended up ordering a few pinchos plates, brussel sprouts salad, sirloin with Blue Cheese and the bacon wrapped dates. Everything was amazing, I highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates, try it out as a dessert!

An excellent place to take visitors for a fun time, good buzz, and full stomach - all without breaking the bank!

First of all, sign up for their texting service- about once a month, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba issues a special free food item. You can log on to their website and sign up directly there (right panel).

Secondly, there's almost always a Yelp checkin special - also for free food. There used to be a foursquare one, but foursquare..is no more.

Third, if you're going during a popular time..PUT IN A RESERVATION. You and your guests will thank you.

Now...before you order any food. Get some sangria in ya! It's tapas for goodness sakes! They normally have a seasonal, but I love sticking to the traditional red - Not overwhelmingly sweet and shared among a few friends, a decent value.

I've been here more times than I can count. Without writing an essay for you, my recommendations:
- brussel sprouts salad, marcona almonds, manchego cheese ($6)
- spicy potatoes with tomato alioli (patata bravas) ($6)
- rioja-braised short rib, manchego mashed potatoes, roasted seasonal vegetables & rioja wine glaze ($12)
- grilled hanger steak with charred green chili chimichurri & fingerling potatoes ($10)
- grilled octopus with green harissa, smoked potatoes & olives ($12)
- buttermillk-fried chicken thighs, piri-piri sauce & shaved vegetable salad ($7)

Now keep in mind, these are tapas so the portions are far from big. Normally when I go with a big group I get a few servings of the Paella to make sure we're all full. I normally go with the seafood paella with shrimp, monkfish, clams & green beans ($17 per serving)

PS: They also have a happy hour. Last I checked, it was $16 pitchers of sangria, and select tapas at 1985 prices. M-F 4-6. Go get'em.

Whenever I'm visiting my hometown, Chicago, I have a specific craving... Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. It may be because I LOVE appetizers and duh, a tapas restaurant is perfect for "endless-appetizers-for-dinner" BUT this place has good food! It may be one of the most popular items, but the goat cheese in tomato sauce I could eat all day long. My last visit my friend and I tried the lamb kebab... it was a very small serving but delicious nonetheless. Bacon-wrapped dates, the complimentary bread & oil, pumpkin soup, calamari, patatas bravas, I could go on... And I must to mention the desserts! They are perfect-sized RICH desserts. I've tried them all and I love them all equally.

Really really good food. I seriously loved everything I ate. Most memorable items: bacon wrapped dates,  buttermilk chicken thighs, burrata with heirloom tomatoes. I got the red classic sangria and I normally hate sangria but this was delicious. I would say if they lowered their prices by 2.5% it would get a 5 Star rating.

Three years ago, I studied abroad in Madrid and I can't seem to shake off my love of Spanish cuisine. When a friend suggested Cafe Ba ba reeba, I was immediately sold. He promised it tasted authentic and I couldn't wait to try!

It did not disappoint!! We ordered the croquetas, buratta, garlic potato salad and paella con pollo y verduras. I have absolutely no complaints. It was all so good! The croquetas came with a blend of ham and chicken. They were crispy and delicious! I especially loved the garlic potato salad. It was a simple dish that was packed with garlicky flavor! (tip: you might not want to order this if you're on a first date).

The paella was perfect! I'm usually picky about whether or not the flavors are right or the rice is quality but this was everything and more. A server brings out the paella in a large pan and mixes it at your table. The portions are then served out and they are huge! You have to order a minimum of two servings but if you're getting tapas as well, the two servings could easily feed more than two people! So delicious!

Oh and how could I forget about the drinks! We ordered half a pitcher of white sangria between the two of us and it was the perfect refreshing addition to our meal.

Make sure to check in on yelp to get a free dessert. I was obsessed with the caramel custard. It had the perfect creamy consistency and completely satiated my sweet tooth!

pics.caption: Chicken and vegetable paella. Minimum order is two servings. This is one!
garlic potato salad. So good but so garlicky

review.des:
Made a day-of reservation for 9:30 on a Saturday. I was a little apprehensive about eating so late because that's not my usual style, but I think eating late and embracing the Spanish/European habit of eating late made the experience all the better.

This was my first time here and I was amazed by the sheer size of the restaurant. There are so many different rooms that all have their own atmosphere. My friend and I were seated in one of the back rooms, so it was quiet and made for a really pleasant and private dining experience.

Our waitress was really nice and attentive, and gave good recommendations. We ordered a half pitcher of the Classic Red sangria. It was delicious, and red wine is not usually my favorite. We really debated between the Classic Red and the seasonal special, which was white with mango. Next time.

This is definitely a menu you have to approach with a plan. Because we were only two people, we wanted to maximize our plates, so we ordered one plate from each category:

32. Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce.
42. Grilled squid with olive oil & garlic.
51. Short rib with mashed potatoes.
58. Meatballs with sherry tomato sauce.

They were all AMAZING. I wouldn't change what we ordered and I would order them again -- but first I would try everything else on the menu. I was seriously impressed.

The meatballs came out first and they were the perfect start. When we finished the meatballs, we dipped the table bread in the sauce -- YUM! The squid, short rib, and goat cheese came out pretty quickly after that.

The goat cheese was so fresh and creamy and the tomato sauce complemented the cheese very well. With the garlic bread that comes with the plate, these 3 make the perfect bite. Amazingly fresh and vibrant flavors.

The squid was wonderful. I'm not used to having grilled squid and it was so refreshing to actually taste the flavor of the squid and not fried breading. The sauce was really light and made this dish a great choice for something lighter, especially compared to the short rib.

The short rib was definitely the heaviest of the dishes and wasn't my favorite. The short rib had a great flavor but the mashed potatoes were kind of bland and eh (IMHO). The veggies that came with also weren't mind-blowing. I'd like to try the other meat choices.

We also got a free dessert for being first-timers (so I got to save my check-in dessert for later!!!). After the richness of the meal, I probably should've opted for a lighter dessert choice, but I couldn't resist the chocolate truffle cake. It was deeeeelicious. Definitely super rich and maybe not the best choice after such a rich meal, but it was amazing. I would for sure order this again.

Overall, an amazing dining experience. I want to come here for brunch now, too, to see what they have to offer.

Great brunch with room for large groups if you get a reservation. We ordered small plates to share, and it was extremely affordable while we were able to get stuffed. Our favorite dishes were bacon Mac, short rib bocadillo, and citrus French toast. Have a fun Bloody Mary bar to top off your brunch. I am excited for next time to try the breakfast paella.
Semi pricey tapas, my dessert was delicious. Didn't get any paella but regretted it later. Large restaurant with a mixed crowd of families and younger people.

pics.caption: Marcona almond caramel bar with butter crust

review.des:
Reservation for Monday were easy for 6 people. They sat us right away even though the entire party wasn't present.

They had half-off cocktail specials (the Barca Blues was my favorite). This was my 1st visit but I have tried their food before as my office catered from here for special events. The food was all pretty good.

We had the...
- Serrano wrapped date from the pinxtos menu
- batatas bravas (can't go wrong)
- the super tender short rib
- octopus (Mmm), and
- the ever indulgent garlicky shrimp.
- the only dish that was sub par was the pork shoulder with apples and chestnuts...it was an odd flavor compared to the rest of the dishes.
- For dessert, we girls shared a salted caramel butterscotch custard and the glazed bananas.

The service was attentive and aimed to please. Overall, this is a great place for pretty much any occasion or non-occasion. I can see how this place can get busy. The space is big with nice décor and great food and service.

I stumbled upon this place when I first moved to Chicago and since then have dined here at least once every few months. With Chicago being such a big city, I try not to dine at restaurants more than one time. Cafe ba-ba-Reeba has a phenomenal atmosphere for both date nights or an evening out with your girlfriends. The bacon wrapped dates are out of this world and the classic red sangria is a must. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba can be anything from a place to grab a drink and a quick bite to a full blown friendsgiving event.

After living in the city for seven years this place is still in my top five favorite restaurants. Yes its trendy, popular, crowded and over run by Lululemon/Kate Spade types but its still So Freaking Amazing.

My recommendation to anyone visiting for the first time is try the specials (off menu/verbal specials) and drink sangria by the pitcher. On my last visit to Baba Reeba my girlfriend and I got a cute table near the kitchen and went to town ordering. We each got one dish just for ourselves, she had the hanger steak and gave it a 10/10 and I had the raw tuna with jalapenos and it was also diving 10/10.

To share we had a half pitcher of both the passion fruit and peach sangria, we both feel that the passion fruit is a more fruit forward  sangria and better pairs with the menu. In addition we split the burrata, spicy potatoes, bacon wrapped dates, and pan seared peppers. Every bite of every dish surpassed expectation.

Its easy to over order here so i would suggest buying 2-2.5 plates per person. Cafe BaBa Reeba is great for groups, dates, brunch, dinner, families and even buyout parties.
We really enjoy the bite-size portions and it allows you to experience so many different flavors!  The ambiance it so fun too!

Great dinner in a fun and lively restaurant. The yelp reviews were what brought us here and the atmosphere and menu kept us at our table. Sangria, chorizo, chicken, olives, shrimp, meatballs, bread...all of it and more were great!

Hit or miss for me. I wouldn't call the tapas authentic at all but more catered to an American crowd. There are some good dishes and several meh dishes. Brunch was nicer than expected - get the cuban/pork sandwich.

Yum.  i was out for a walk on a hot day, and I stopped in here.  Had a glass of rose and some garlic potato salad at the bar.  Nice service. Good wine.  And delicious potato salad.  I did not sample the dinner offerings, but I bet they are good.  A bit noisy but that's not a bad thing.

It's time for Spanish food. We came here for lunch today. Great ambiance. We tried all pintxos. Quantity is very small. It's only one bite of all. Spicy potatoes were extremely spicy as the name gives. Garlic shrimp is the one must try item which I really loved.
Finally seasonal sangria is so good. Especially ask for seasonal one, otherwise you would get classic sangria. I had sangria with pomegranates and red wine.
Over all food is very delicious.

I've been here a few time and this place is always busy. The food is served tapas style. It's very good but a little over priced in my opinion. Get the potatoes with the spicy mayo sauce. I'm not sure what they're called. The red sangria is my favorite too. A great place to take your family from out of town.

Came here for my 21st birthday brunch and was wowed by the service. Our waiter gave us a sample of all the sangrias before we committed to a 1/2 pitcher of the passion fruit. Here's what we ordered:

1. sausage-fried paella rice
2. grilled squid
3. garlic shrimp
4. buttermilk fried chicken thighs
5. bacon mac'n cheese

The chicken and shrimp were really amazing. The breakfast paella tends to take around 45 minutes to cook so we didn't order it this time, but I'd love to come back with a big group of friends

Love love love this place!  Reminds me of being in Barcelona and sampling all kinds of tapas. Have not tried the paella yet but it looks good. I've over enjoyed the Sangria a few time and would return just for that. Favorites include the chicken, octopus, bacon wrapped dates, calamari and garlic shrimp!  It's easy to over order and over eat here!  Loud and lively

Sad news: my friend got food poisoning from there. Was either the garlic shrimp, wrapped dates, or the meatballs. She was sick for 3-4 days.

After telling other friends about her experience, they all seemed to have known someone who's also had food poisoning from there.

such a bummer cause my experiences have been good, but im not willing to risk it.
Great food, great atmosphere, great service! And the sangria is pretty amazing too! Go hungry because there are so many options here!

It brought be back in Spain.

We were just in the area and was looking for a place to eat before we head to our summer event that evening.

I checked my yelp and boom - found this place.

My cousin and I wanted to try all of it. We ordered at least one or more in every section of veggies, seafood, beef.. I enjoyed the salad and the grilled quid with asparagus. We also had the tuna with melon slices (that was different) but good.

Everything was delicious except the calamari - I've had better.

The different flavors of Sangria was just a treat! We had a pitcher of mango.

The server's knowledge and atmosphere was a great addition to the experience.

Tapas galore!!! I love the food here. A fave is the deviled egg...yum. It's got so many dishes and they are incredibly tasty. Tapas are always good when you want to try different types of dishes.

It's a huge, busy, loud space that's dimly lit for the most part. Prices are decent and the cocktails are good!

Make reservations ahead of time!
Amazing Sangria, loved the atmosphere and food was delicious. Never though mashed potatoes could be what I tasted. Seafood Paella was great. No complains
I love this place!!! This is perfect for brunch. Go with a bunch of people and try as many things as possible!! Definitely get a pitcher of sangria too!

My friend who lives in Chicago loves this place, mainly because it's still stylish and cute inside but it's not in the all time busy downtown area (about 10-15 min drive from there). Located in Lincoln Park community, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! was super busy on a Friday evening, with different ages crowd. The wait for a table was 1.5 hours, but luckily you can order off the main menu at the bar as well. We were there around 8 pm and were barely able to snag the last 2 seats at the bar. This place offers a variety of Spanish tapas. If you order a paella, make sure you specify for how many people. It was two of us and they must have assumed we ordered paella for two and boy was it A LOT of it! My favorite part of the evening was the passion fruit sangria - it was DELISH! Very easy to drink too hahaha
The cafe offers valet parking, as well as plenty of Ubers driving around.

I would go back!

We've been here twice for tapas!  The service is good, sangria options are great!  I like that they have Open Table as well.  Everything is fresh and yummy- great sharing portions for a group of people.

We had the salad, octopus, steak and chicken thigh from the recommended dishes. To me, the meat were all over cooked, don't have the chewy texture it should have. The chocolate cake is surprisingly good though. The chocolate is really smooth and melted in your mouth.

I had wanted to go here for so many years and finally got the chance. It exceeded the hype!

First - we're talking tapas, so it's great to go alone, but even better to take some friends. I was there with a group of four and it was just perfect.

Before we even really started, they brought out some delicious and chewy bread and got a round of drinks to the table quickly. The olive oil on the table was pretty good. I might have liked some dried herbs to toss in with it, but it was all good.

Then, we started ordering food, food, and more food.

We opened with the burrata tomato bread. Yumz! The bread is toasted, there's a little zip to the sauce and it was total yum. Three pieces. The cheese served with it was great with this, but I reserved it to have with the table bread or tasted on its own, because it was just that good.

The heirloom tomato salad came out next and did not disappoint. There were portions/wedges of several colored tomatoes set upon some green goddess dressing that was great. There was thinly sliced cucumber that I thought to be a bit over salted, but it did balance well with the other parts that didn't have the same treatment and worked well in the same bite. Small toasted pieces of ricotta cheese also found on the plate made it even more awesome.

Somewhere along the way, the spicy potatoes showed up. YUM! They were moist, but toasted on the outside with a zingy outer coating. And I never really got into what the sauce/moosh was that came with it, but you put the two together and you really lose any sense of caring about anything, because they are that amazing together. Get the spicy potatoes!!!!!

We did the short rib, garlic shrimp - which were great - but, two others stood out. The melon and serrano ham was insane! I never would have paired the two, but took a leap. Tasty and thinly sliced melon draped a pile of thin-sliced ham. You just go to town on it and it's all good. The other one I loved most was the peri-peri chicken. I'm sure the chef would filet me for saying it, but think - chicken nuggets in an awesome peri-peri pepper sauce. The result? AMAZING! I could have just eaten that and loved the place.

A later portion of chorizo-wrapped dates was ordered and they were great! The sweet and the savory nicely prepared on toothpicks to top us off.

Service was extraordinary. Super friendly, helpful, and good with suggestions. The dining space is fun and top-notch with outdoor seating available on those more pleasant days.

Can't wait to go back!!!

Lively, upbeat atmosphere. Service was okay as was the food. A friend and I tried about 8 items off the menu plus dessert. I sent the meatballs back because they did not taste as described on the menu. Everything else was fine. A good place to go with friends so you can try each other's menu choices.

came here for a Monday dinner with my boyfriend,  he'd been here before but I had never been. We ordered plenty of tapas and all were delicious!

I really want to thank our two servers for the night Eduardo and katlyn (sorry if I misspelled your names). My boyfriend and I had no clue who was training, I had even suggested maybe they always have two servers. They both were very helpful and everything they recommended I loved ( keep in mind I'm not the most picky person but still).

My boyfriend and I were really impressed with the service, as well as them letting us know about the specials on Mondays! 1/2 off cocktails! There's really no words to describe how great they made our night that night ! Thank you again, keep up the great work! :)

pics.caption: Yummy drink that was recommend to me :)

review.des:
Yummmm tapas and sangria. Never been a better combination!

I've been here a few times, both with small parties and large groups. The restaurant is great for both options - huge space, but has more intimate seating as well.

Things I love: spicy potatoes (crispy potatoes with this amazing tomato-based sauce), bacon-wrapped dates (duh), goat cheese baked in tomato sauce (the most succulent goat cheese atop a ridiculously good tomato sauce, served with bread), buttermilk fried chicken thighs.

Service could be better, taking a star off for that. But all in all, delicious food and the rotating seasonal sangrias are always fabulous!

Great experience. I was celebrating my birthday & had a great time.

We made a reservation at 11am for Sunday Brunch. Once we arrived we were right away seated in a packed restaurant. The ambience was perfect!

It was our first time going to Cafe Baba-Re-Ba. The waiter explained the menu and our food came out really fast.

We ordered:
-Waffle-battered chicken sticks - (do not recommend. It was like a corn dog)
-Mac N' Cheese - (AMAZING)
-Buttermilk Waffle with marcona almond nutella and bananas - (Pretty dry & not sure if that was nutella)
-Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli - (AMAZING)
-Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce - (AMAZING)
-Shrimp With garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes - (Really good)
-Beef Skewer Horseradish Cream & Red Onions - (Really good)
-Chicken Skewer - (The chicken was kind of dry)

Asides from the waffle battered chicken sticks & waffles, I definitely want to come back for the spicy potatoes & goat cheese.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has become a go-to spot for me over the past year and a half! Delicious food, nice atmosphere, and the place is huge so I can always get a reservation. I recommend for both dinner and brunch. Get the classic red sangria and stick to tapas-- the paella is fine but not my favorite. They also have good happy hour deals and a DePaul discount.

Great food, atmosphere and service! We went for brunch. I'm a vegetarian but still felt overwhelmed by the options. We used Yelp for a free dessert which was great! Make reservations as the restaurant does get crowded however it is a large restaurant. Get the sangria for sure!! We did street parking although I believe they also had valet. Definitely go with a group of people since it's tapas style! Portions are larger than what I was expecting.

This was an awesome experience. We came here for my father's birthday and it was great. Everything we tried was delicious. My sister is vegan and a few of us are vegetarian and there were plenty of options. They were very accommodating and we received our food really quickly. We even brought our own cake and they cut it and served it to us. The atmosphere was great. It wasn't too loud or too crowded. Music was lovely. I highly recommend. My only issue was that our waitress would disappear for extended periods of time, especially towards the end of our meal, and it made our leave awkward and far more lengthy than it needed to be. I'm sure she just got busy. Overall, it was a really good and fun meal for us.
Absolutely love the Brussels sprout salad and sangria!!! Ribs and steaks are awesome as well.

Delicious brunch on the weekends.  Very busy place so try to make reservations, but there are enough tables you just might get a walk-in spot or you can just sit at the bar (and get full food service).

Citrus french toast best item we had, nice thick toast with a great goat cheese and honey spread.  It also came with some maple syrup but didn't need it.  The meatballs were delicious, and the sauce was great on the free bread.  Paella is large and takes time, but seems to be worth it if you know that's something you like.  Skip the papas bravas, looks tasty but the seasoning and the aioli are both bland.

And if you have a sweet tooth I recommend visiting Annette's Italian Ice a few blocks west (by the Armitage CTA stop)

pics.caption: Papas bravas and what's left of citrus french toast

review.des: AMAZING! I would eat every meal here if I could. The plates are the perfect size and 3 plates were plenty for the 2 of us. The sangria is good but not strong at all in my opinion-drink to taste not to get drunk kind of beverage. I recommend the Brussels sprout salad, the salmon (omg that sauce!) and of course the short rib. Can't wait to return and try more dishes

I came here for brunch. It had everything you like for breakfast just small plates so you can have it all!!! Very busy place so I don't recommend coming here with a big crowed unless you have reservations.

Great place for tapas(small plates) and good drinks and service. The Q's shared: Goat cheese baked in a delicious tomato sauce and toasted garlic bread, & beef empanada, & a special of the day "duck",  & garlic shrimp - which was to die for. All delicious along with their delicious homemade bread, great drinks and lively atmosphere made for a great dinner. They also have many sangria to choose from and a variety of paella.

Mrs. Q says: Yes, it is handicap accessible if you eat in the bar area. A note of caution, depending on your disability there are two steps to get to the bathrooms irregardless of where you are seated.

Ok, hit this place when I lived in Chicago several times but have been living on west coast the last 15 years. Came back to visit and craved some tapas and came here. Oh my, it was as good as I remember. Iberico pork, lamb, shrimp, bacon wrapped dates, paella and a tray of 4 desserts. Phenomenal!  Love it and friends who tried it for first time agreed. Good times and loved being back in Lincoln Park.

Love Tapas! The place looks small from the outside, but its huge once you get in.  We came here for Restaurant week, but the R week menu was pretty lame so we just ordered off the regular menu. It was Sunday brunch, and there was a Bloody Mary bar which was pretty cool. The bacon wrapped dates were my fave, followed by the patatas bravas, that orange chipotle mayo is to die for. The jamon eggs benedict was surprisingly good. I would pass on the hanger steak it had a weird after taste. We finished the meal off with some French toast with jam and goat cheese, not too sweet and a great savory dessert. Overall great tapas, great brunch!

pics.caption: French toast with grapefruit jelly n goat cheese

review.des: Excellent place to share tapas with friends. We each got a free dessert for checking in on Yelp! The casual ambiance, upbeat music, superb wait-staff, and dim lighting make it an excellent location for a date or a girls' night out. Make a reservation to expedite the wait and enjoy the bacon-wrapped dates!

This is going to be one of those places that you cannot avoid going to if you live in Chicago. I really think this place is a solid 3.5, but rounding up, because I think rounding down is just mean.

I think this is a solid option if you need to go somewhere with a large group of people. There aren't that many tapas-style restaurants in Chicago, and this is usually one that is generally a crowd pleaser.

The Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Brussel Sprouts, and Goat Cheese are my favorites on the menu. The menu is GIANT though, so I think you will be hard-pressed to find something you won't like. Especially if you go for brunch, because you can order off both the brunch and dinner menu.

This restaurant is certainly not a destination in my mind, but it does the trick if you need to go somewhere with a lot of people, and you might have some picky eaters in the crowd.

The Paella is absolutely a pass though. I've tried it multiple times, and never liked it.

They also have certain days that only happen a couple times a year, where if you come in wearing pajamas, they give each person at your table a $25 gift card. Look out for those, because those days are pretty clutch.

It's not only the amazing food and drinks that deserve 5 stars, but the atmosphere, service, and genuine hospitality that did it for me and the reason I will absolutely be going back.

A group of 5 friends and I wanted to get together and catch up so a reservation was made for 8:30 Tuesday evening. When we arrived it was quite busy and the woman at the front explained that there were no tables available at the moment but we would be seated shortly. Totally fine, so we stood near the bar and were immediately offered drinks or anything else while we waited. We had no issue waiting but about 15 minutes after our reservation time, the host was very apologetic and let us know they had not forgotten about us but were waiting one some tables, who had already paid, to leave. We understood, and her sincere apologies and acknowledgement of us was great service in my opinion. She let us know as soon as the table was being prepared for us and said they would take good care of us!

After a pitcher of the fantastic berry sangria and many shared plates we were very satisfied with the food and overall experience. And finally the icing on the cake, our server brought out about 7 or 8 of the small desserts for us on the house as well as removing the sangria and a couple of the tapas from our bill to make up for our delay in seating. That was honestly the best customer service and superb recovery I've ever received, they actually care about the customers! So pleased with everything, I will definitely be returning very soon.
Scallops were oddly disappointing. Short run was decent, the mashed potatoes were very yummy.

I had an early-ish dinner here with my fiance last Thursday, and we had a great meal. We were able to be seated right away arriving around 5:30. We chose the chorizo-wrapped date and the laughing bird shrimp for a bite-sized pinxto ($2/ea.) Hubs enjoyed his date; my shrimp was good, but I wasn't prepared for the actual strip of chewy white fat adorning the top of the skewer, which I removed and didn't eat. When they said "topped with fat" I guess I assumed it was drizzled with a little grease or something; I personally don't eat solid pieces of fat like that.

We shared the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, which was really delicious ($8), and had a plate of soy-orange duck wings which were the special that evening and should go on the permanent menu, they were so tender and tasty. We attempted to order 1/2 a pitcher of the blood orange sangria (also a special for the evening) but apparently the server heard "HAVE a pitcher of sangria," and brought us a full one, which we didn't figure out til we looked at the bill. I thought it was a little generous for a half, but didn't ask! Oh well. Guess someone's gonna have to drink all that extra sangria. Shucks!

We also ordered 2 portions (the minimum order) of the seafood paella with shrimp, scallops, and monkfish. I could only find a single piece of monkfish in the entire pan, but there were a more reasonable number of shrimp and scallops. The paella takes about 30 minutes to cook to order, so they ask you to be prepared that it will take a little longer than the tapas orders. Though we were stuffed by this point, my Yelp check-in earned us a free dessert tapa, so we chose the caramelized banana with vanilla ice cream and pistachios, the perfect sweet but not too heavy ending to our delicious meal. We ended up spending about $85 for the meal, which earned us 1 point per $1 for the Lettuce Entertain You group's frequent diner reward program - there are so many affiliated restaurants, it's a great program to enroll in! We would definitely eat at Ba-Ba-Reeba again for the delicious food!

I went here for lunch with my best friend who was in town visiting from central Illinois. She's not a big city fan, so I wanted to take her somewhere fun! Atmosphere is always great at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, and this day wasn't an exception, though the food came out cold (the stuffed mushrooms were literally ice cubes), and the bathrooms did not have any toilet paper in them. Myself and other women waiting in line to use the bathroom had to use paper towels, since we had no other option, nor was the bathroom attended to at all. Not the first time the bathrooms here were a bit dirty, to be honest. The staff also just seem like they're over-it (again, not the first time I've experienced this). It honestly stinks to write this review, as we had my friend's bachelorette dinner here, and I've come here many times and have enjoyed it. It just seems like the place went down hill a bit. I'd love to come back again to some hot food, happy staff and maybe some well-kept bathrooms.

Super fun place. Sangria- yes please! Try them all. We had- stuffed mushrooms, olives, potato salad, egg& potato pancake and veggie paella. Happy. Full. Great service . Great vibe. Great food. Excellent night ! Do it! We will be back. : )
P:S: we walked right in at 6:00 on a Thursday night, sat at the bar for our first sangria, and were seated by 7:00.  If it's a weekend or later at night, obviously make a reservation.

Every single dish was fantastic - really EVERY DISH!! Some of the highlights were the stuffed mushrooms, hanger steak, beef skewer, buttermilk chicken thighs, and the bacon wrapped dates. For dessert, we had the butterscotch custard, chocolate truffle cake, and the seasonal sorbet (prickly pear). The desserts are perfectly sized - so you can order several! I almost forgot to mention the sangria - abundant choices of red, white and different fruit flavors. Our server Linsey M was great - very friendly and helpful with our menu questions. Love the intimate atmosphere of the restaurant. We look forward to returning and trying even more items from the extensive menu.

Got bad service, I walk in to pick up food and nobody greeting or ask. I tried to tell somone that I come to pick up food. Somone walked to me, " I'm a manager, could you waiting far away. I'll tell you when it's done" The food was sitting there waiting to be packed, after manager packed the food still siting there without telling me like 10 minutes. Was waiting for food like 20 minutes.. Well, street parking isn't safe, that is why people want to pick up fast and leave.. don't want to try this place !!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba never fails me. I've been a multitude of times, and always give it as a recommendation to those visiting Chicago. It's a tapas place, so diners are meant to share a bunch of small plates around the table. Everything I've tried has been delicious, but in particular I would suggest:
- Roast dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette
- Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce
- Brussels sprout salad (which is actually quite large)
- Red wine sangria
I love that their menu is so extensive, with lots of options for vegetarians and pescatarians. Also, if you check in on Yelp you get a free dessert tapa!

The service is always good, and very attentive. This restaurant is popular though! So expect it to always be busy and a little loud. Many people come here for special occasions because they can accommodate larger groups and the atmosphere is lively. You can make a reservation ahead of time on Opentable, or try your luck just walking in. Either way, make sure to check out this awesome eatery!
Best mojito, amazing chicken empanadas and stuffed mushrooms. We also loved the heirloom salad and desserts. Made a reservation for Sunday night and got in with no hassle. My new go to Tapas place!

Best food we had in Chicago! We went in pretty irritated because we had a reservation and there was still over a twenty minute wait despite being on time, but the food and the service more than made up for it. The Paella Valenciana which has confit pork shoulder, crispy pork belly, chorizo ibérico & chicharrónes was unbelievable! Pricey, but worth it for a special night out! Peach sangria was great, and I could eat the brussels sprout salad with candied marcona almonds and manchego cheese for the rest of my life and die happy. Beef Tenderloin & Blue Cheese served with housemade chips was also really good.

THE BEST SPANISH TAPAS IN THE WORLD (never been to Spain so I'm not an expert but take my word for it). Came here with friends (get a reservation the line can be long) and were seated in about 10 minutes. The sangria is on tap here and is amazing and honestly everything on the menu is 10/10. The bacon wrapped dates will definitely be a part of my last meal on earth. Obviously you have to get the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce and bread. The paella is also spot on and the portion is huge so definitely keep that in mind if you're ordering tapas as well. One of my favorite places in Chicago and the prices are very reasonable.

We had a blast tonight! Our good friend visiting from Japan,  wanted to try something new and we decided to take her to one of our favorite restaurants, Cafe baba reeba! And she really enjoyed it! Moreover, there was no waiting this time for our seats and the service was excellent as always. This place is still one of my favorite places to have tapas. I definitely would eat here again and I definitely would recommend them to my friends and family.

I LOVED their tapas, although I've had tapas in several other restaurants and they serve a bigger food portion for about the same price as Ba-Ba-Reeba! The sangria is also really good, they have many flavors to choose from.

Loove this restaurant! It's truly a wonderful dining experience from the moment you walk in.  The atmosphere is what you would find in a Spanish restaurant and the service is superb.

The tapas are tasty and flavorful.  Each dish has a unique taste and the restaurant is fast to bring them out.  

Sangria is to die for and they always have various flavors to suit many palates.

Overall if you're looking for a great tapas in Chicago, you have to checkout Babareeba.

New Years Day we stroll in after a depressing movie and everyone is wearing pajamas! (Apparently there is some kind of promotion going on where you get a deal for showing up in PJ's).  When I lived in Seattle people just did that because it was Tuesday - but that's another story.

The atmosphere put our party of four quickly back into happy mode. We were seated promptly (without reservations). One of our group wasn't happy with our table (high traffic area) and they accomodated us graciously.

I love tapas! Because instead of ordering one entree you get to try and share many small dishes with your party. New Year's Day - they were all well done. My favorites were the baked goat cheese with tomato sauce and toasted garlic bread, the brussle sprouts salad with manchego and toasted almond (omg), the shrimp in garlic, pepper flake and olive oil... It was a great way to spend 3 hours. Good wine selection by the glass.  I don't normally like sangria because it's too sweet, but I tasted everybody's red and it was deelish!  Our server Matt was phenomenal and I can't wait to go back again soon!

This place was great! I made a reservation the day of - just myself and my friend. The beef empanada was fantastic and probably our favorite. We didn't really know what to order or how much and our waiter was awesome at helping us navigate the menu! Definitely would return, also seems like a great place for a big group!

My all time favorite tapas place in Chicago.

I love the outdoor seating in the summer and the coziness in the winter. The servers are friendly and always have suggestions if you're stumped on what to get.

My favorite tapas are...  
The patatas bravas are delicious! The aioli that is served with the potatoes is very tasty.

The bacon wrapped dates so delicious! I wish there we're more on the plate.

The beef short ribs with mashed potatoes are so good but come in such a small portion it can't be shared. Well, maybe others can share them.

The champiñones (stuffed mushrooms) are stuffed with manchengo cheese and overall deliciousness in a mini cup.

The goat cheese is devine; a perfect mixture of tartness and sweetness.

The croquetas and the empanadas are served with two delicious aiolis. We usually try the cheese and chicken varieties.  

The sangria tho.... It's so good. If they have the mango sangria get it. While the red and white sangria are great staples the specialty sangria are executed perfectly.

Dessert: all of them! But really, that butterscotch shot is so creamy and delicious I want some right now.

Love this place so much I had my wedding shower here.

I've been here twice now and the food has been delicious both times.

My favorite dishes are:
Braised Shortrib
Goat Cheese in Tomato
Bacon wrapped Dates

I'm sure there are many more delicious tapas but these stood out. Great sangria as well!
Great service and great food! Johnny was a great server and very accommodating and had great recommendations.

Good food just such small portions... i get that it's tapas but expensive and small portion just makes me think of taste plates at fancy restaurant and not a place that's kind of aiming for a homey feel to it
Fabulous! Had a wonderful evening here - the staff went above and beyond and the food was absolutely amazing!

Great spot for Spanish-style tapas right around the Armitage area. We ordered a number of dishes (it's all small sharing plates with many options) but the croquetas and the short rib dish stood out to us. Also, great sangria. Would recommend!

My girlfriend and I came here after having gone to Barcelona, Spain and trying many paellas there. This place was fantastic with so many delicious options and things to try. Recommend the seafood paella (they serve the paellas at all times of the day btw, you just have to ask) and the Patatas Bravas! Will definitely eat here again!

This is one of my go-to's in Chicago. I've come here multiple times with a group of girlfriends, and Baba never seems to disappoint. Their tapas are delicious and the ambiance is light and fun. I always start with a pitcher of the sangria(all of the flavors are good!) and a mini pinxtos plate. I love that you can get a mini sample of many things at once!

I was very impressed by Ba-Ba-Reeba! I'm not sure what was better - the pitchers of sangria, the excellent staff service or the food.

With an 8pm reservation we were seated by 815 and had some sangria while we waited. Our server (whose name escapes me but was a delight) was extremely knowledgeable and made wonderful suggestions.

We had baked goat cheese, short ribs, olives, spicy chorizo and chicken skewers, stuffed mushrooms and the almond desert.  For the size of the tapas I was impressed - it was honestly a lot of food for just two people and we couldn't finish everything.

The exterior of this restaurant is deceiving, because this place is huge. While it may be large, latin and loud, this is a fantastic late night/date spot still maintains a great level of intimacy.

Would absolutely go back.
This place usually gets a visit when I am in Chicago and it always delivers solid food and a good time.  I crave the sangria as soon as I walk in the door

For $20, you can enjoy dinner of 2 selections that can be complimentary or a complete dish in itself.  Effort in balance and value for $$.  ALL dishes were prepared well and seasoned.  Common menu.

DEVILED EGG ($2) -- One gulp.  One egg.  Painfully addictive and delicious.  Firm.

GOAT CHEESE IN TOMATO  ($8) -- shareable by 2-4...unless you love goat cheese that much.

FRIED GREEN PEPPERS ($6) -- a good complimentary side dish.  There is a Japanese version of this at Goat you know who.  *wink* I finally got lucky with one green hot pepper.  The red pepper is both sweet and hot.

SHORT RIB ($12) -- a complete meal.  Girl portion.  Good.  Nothing exemplary.  Filling. Content.

PORK BELLY & PORK LOIN ($8) -- skip it.  Pork belly was good and moist.  Pork loin did have flavor but was too dry for my taste.

SANGRIA -- very clean taste where the booze can still creep up on you.  Taste like water.  :-)

COAT CHECK -- complimentary.  Yay!  There are still some things for free.  A part of excellent service.

VENUE -- dark and romantic.  Space is tight but somehow I didn't mine it.  Unusual.  High table and short chair that is comfortable for 6'2" but weird for shorties.  The lighting...everyone looks fantabulous.

SERVICE -- Great!  No time for chumminess but you are ever neglected or forgotten.  They automatically brown bag for you.  All staff says 'thank you' when you leave.  And, you can't sneak out the brown box without a brown bag.

How I wish I can order Paella for one.  I look forward to enjoying and sampling the rest of the dishes.  Brunch Lunch and Dinner.

pics.caption: Grilled Pork Belly and Pork Loin

review.des: So I wanted to take my boyfriend out on his birthday. I called to make a reservation and I specifically told them that it was his birthday. I was excited because usually when it's a birthday you get a candle or something. I even went and spoke to my waiter during dinner to make sure that he received something on the desert that I paid for so that my boyfriend could feel special on his day. He said he knew and we went on with the night. Finally after dinner I had to ask for a desert menu as my waiter didn't even offer one. When we got our desert it was a tiny little thing and the waiter didn't even acknowledge the fact that it was my boyfriend's birthday! I was very disappointed! AFTER confirming twice that it was his birthday and getting confirmation they still whatevered my request! Definitely not going back there for any special occasion!

This place is by far my favorite Lettuce Entertain You restaurant in the area (and there are so many!)

Brussels sprout salad, meatballs, paella, mushrooms, cauliflower specials, you name it! It's all so tasty.

I've always had excellent service too.. I'm so happy you can make a reservation online because this place is always packed!

I hope to be coming back here for years to come!

One of my favorite Chicago restaurants! It can be tricky to get a table here because of how great it is but if you are reading this and are in Chicago, head on over.

This is a great place to go with a group where you can split multiple tapas. To start, I recommend a pitcher of sangria (about 6 glasses!)

Food recommendations:
Chorizo wrapped dates- This is just a serving for 1 person which is why it is only $2
Brussel sprout salad- Nice flavors and refreshing paired with the heavier entered and tapas
Spicy potatoes- Good portion size for sharing
Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce- #1 seller! So good and they give a crispy bread to dip
Chicken and ham croquettes

The empanadas are so good. The meat inside tastes like it comes from a slow cooker. Yummy

The paellas are good but big so require a bigger group of people!

The banana dessert is also great!

Make sure to make a reservation as this place is always busy!

Have always loved this place but had a frustrating experience trying to pick up a to go order the other day.  I called the restaurant several times and they kept transferring me somewhere else to place the to go order but the phone kept ringing and nobody would pick up.  I hung up and called back twice and try to tell the person who initially answered that nobody was answering at where ever they were transferring me to, but they kept transferring me.  Getting very frustrated, I was went there and ordered in person.  The place was not busy, but the bartender was running around serving people in the entire bar, running food, Cleaning tables, etc and it took forever to get his attention.  When I finally got his attention, I waited 30 min to get two Brussels sprout salads which isn't event a hot dish.  Pretty frustrating experience overall, but we love baba reeba and will probably be back

If you love Tapas you must go! I also just discovered they have an amazing Happy Hour Sunday-Thursday 4-6. It's always busy on the weekends I would highly suggest a reservation or you will have to wait. The Sangria, potatas bravas, tortilla espanola are a must!!
