I was at Cafe Baba Reeba last week on a date.  Liked it so much I'm back for brunch.  Loved the brunch specials thanks to our server Patrick for his recommendations.  He was very knowledgeable and provided us with great service.  With that saying I told the manager how Patrick made our brunch experience an enjoyable one.  Food was made to perfection.  Portions were enough for my friend and I.  And the build your own Bloody Mary!!! Oh my that was fun how we can be creative by adding all the garnishes they provided.  Thanks again  but I just wish you can be in the west burbs :(

Best place for that special event. I had 3 events here in a few months. They do a great job. Best service and great sangria.  If you want to go for dinner get reservations because they book fast. Try the potatoes. They are the best

I love the Spanish food here! We had the seafood paella and a handful of tapas and every single thing was great. We also had the passion fruit sangria and it was light and refreshing. Classic red sangria was a little strong but it was still great!

One of my and my friend's favorite restaurants in Chicago. Ba Ba Reeba never disappoints! Perfect for any meal or any occasion - I've hosted and attended multiple parties and showers there and it just never gets old! This place is the best crowd pleaser.
Great place! Food was delicious and perfect portions for the price. Spicy potatoes, buttermilk fried chicken, and stuffed mushrooms were our favorites! Make a reservation because it gets pretty busy!
The Spanish Cubano sandwich was amazing! The atmosphere was laid back and fun. They have an awesome bloody mary bar too!

Came back and was unfortunately quite underwhelmed this time around.

Scallop empanadas: Again, the standout of the night. A rich, flaky puff pastry with a delicious scallop filling.

Short ribs: Tender and loved the flavors; however, I wasn't a fan of the side of mashed potatoes, which seemed suspiciously like they came from powder rather than real potatoes.

Pomegranate salad: Solidly executed but lacked any special flavor or combination of flavors that would have made it worth writing home about.

Pork belly and loin skewer: The weakest dish of the night. I'm pretty certain the skewer came with only loin cuts, which were extremely tough and dry. The sauce that came on the side alleviated the dryness, but I really would've preferred to see a sauce that was made for the dish than what seemed to be a generic dollop of mayonnaise-type sauce that was also used for the scallop empanadas.

Seared scallop: I found this rather salty, although I thoroughly enjoyed the sweetness and acidity that the grapefruit brought to the dish. However, I definitely thought that the dish was not worth its price.

Flan: Interesting combination of honey and what seems to be cinnamon, but definitely erred on the sweeter side.

Service this time around was extremely slow, and I was rather disappointed that I didn't find any more tapas that I loved aside from the ones I discovered last time. Given the variable quality of food, it might be a while before I venture back here.

Huge fan of Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! I really like the paella and all the tapas are really great. I'd say the only downside is that I think the tapas are over priced but still really good. Side note: passionfruit sangria is soo good. I usually ask for ice on the side because it can get watered down! Also the braised short rib - so goood!
Nice decor. Each room was different. We had some really good dishes too. The portions were good for a tapas place. The spinach & goat cheese crepes and the breakfast paella were both solid dishes.

We came on a Sunday afternoon and informed that there are only bar seats left (1hr+ wait for table seats). We sat on 2 bar seats for 10+ minutes and no one served us. Some waiters passed by but they chose to ignore us.

My favorite place for brunch in the city! I've been here at least 10 times and each time is just as wonderful as the last. Their brunch menu is amazing. Not only do you get the full dinner menu, but all of the brunch options as well. I always have to get the potatoes and bacon wrapped dates, but every dish is excellent. The bloody marry bar is an added bonus to the great food!
Delicious tapas - especially octopus dish. Paella was good but could have been better. Potatoes omelette was delicious.

I have been coming to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for years. You can always count on this place for a good meal and good service. Whether it's a girls night out, date night, or a very large group dinner, I've never had a bad meal here. I always order the same classic tapas: patatas bravas, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, bacon-wrapped dates, etc. and then I usually like to order some seafood tapas such as Gambas al Ajillo or scallops and maybe throw in a few specials. And you can't forget the sangria! Great food. Great service. Great ambiance.
Food and service were great!! I think the only thing I had an issue with was the small tables. We had a party of 4 and were very crammed in the small tables. Other than that, food was great!

Really fun place to come. I've been here probably three or four times now. The dinner tapas, dessert tapas, and the sangria are delicious. I'm vegetarian and had plenty of options! Wait staff was friendly and lively too.

Great place for brunch! I got the Mango Sangria half pitcher and split it with one person. DELICIOUS. As my meal I got the sampler and it was filling with 6 different items. I also got to taste test some items around the table - including the bacon mac and cheese. It was all superb. On top of that, the service was great and so were the prices.

Great good and drinks, but our waitress for the pajama brunch was pretty awful. We've been attending this brunch for YEARS, and always with a large party. They've always had no trouble splitting our check and keeping our order straight (we always let them know ahead of time) but this time she not only refused to do it (not mentioning that the policy about separate checks had changed when we told her before ordering we wanted separate checks), but she was very rude when we asked her about it after the check came. She kept insisting she had to talk to her manager (who we never saw) and acted super put out. I was very disappointed because we come here every New Year's Day as well as every Easter and now I'm thinking our families may have to find new traditions.

The food: 4/5. I've tried a variety of different things over several visits, octopus, croquettes, patatas bravas, garlic shrimp and goat cheese spread are some of my favorites. The menu is fairly extensive, so it can accommodate all kinds of taste.

The service: 4/5. The service is fast and friendly, but not good with giving recommendations.

Overall: 4/5. A casual spot to drink sangria and try all kinds of small plates.

pics.caption: Chicken and ham croquestas - my favorite thing on the menu

review.des: This is one of the best spots in chicago! Food, service and overall experience is phenomenal. Highly recommend if you like small plates.

pics.caption: The white peach sangria is the best! It's a must every time I come.

review.des: Amazing gluten free menu(among other offerings!)!! My husband and I have been going to Café Ba Ba Reeba for years and always love it! We have a few favorites like the bacon wrapped dates, Brussel sprout salad, and always delicious sangria.  We also held our rehearsal dinner there for our wedding and were beyond pleased with the process and product. Now we go back every year for our anniversary, but there's no need for a special occasion to visit this place. I'm always surprised at how little we spend for the amount of food and drinks we order. Ba-ba-Reeba is the best!

Super busy Friday, but was able to sit in the bar area. The service was great and the food was excellent. The bartender made excellent sangria. The only complaint is the bread was very cold. I assume because we were in the bar area, but it would have been nice to have warm bread. That's all....

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a favorite of my wife's and we try to go whenever we're visiting Chicago.  That being said, it's probably been nearly 4 years since we were here last.  The restaurant has definitely stood the test of time.  

The Goat Cheese, Patatas Bravas and bacon wrapped dates are a consistent hit and the Deviled Egg pintxos, though new to us, were a great addition, too.

I had the Jack, Mike and Ginger and my wife went with a classic margarita, both were quite tasty.  

We aren't often in Chicago these days, but I'm sure we will keep visiting Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba whenever we're in town.

I stopped in to grab a quick bloody and was blown away by the sports bar vibe this tapas spot had! The bartender, Ryan, and was beyond awesome and instantly makes you feel like a regular. The menu was amazing. The people at the bar next to us came from Michigan just to eat here again. I'm definitely coming back hungry and thirsty for a bears game SOON!!

Hi Joe!

pics.caption: I stopped in to grab a quick bloody and was blown away by the sports bar vibe this tapas spot had!

review.des: We went to cafe ba ba reeba while visiting Chicago and someone recommended it to us. All we can say is wow!! This place does get very busy so I would suggest going early. We were able to find a seat at the bar and our bartender was phenomenal. We started with the chorizo date and oh my gosh this was so good. We also got a deviled egg to start. Next we got potatoes with tomato aioli and these were also so good. We then ordered octopus and #61 on the menu. We loved the octopus but were disappointed with #61, it was more of a charcuterie board which we weren't expecting and it took a very long time for it to come out even though nothing was cooked on it. Overall this place is absolutely amazing, we wish there was one back home for us to go to.

Came here on a Saturday for brunch for restaurant week, but we decided to order off the regular menu instead. I mean it's a tapas place so options are a must!

We ordered 6 items between two people, which was just a tad too much food for us. I enjoy leftovers though, so I was perfectly fine with bringing home an assortment of goodies that I could snack on later.

1. Sausage fried paella rice with poached egg (off the brunch menu, everything else we ordered was from the dinner menu): This was good but not really a paella. I mean it was honestly a glorified fried rice at best. Don't get me wrong, it was freaking delicious and there was nothing left over from this, but when I order paella, I look for that metal skillet and a crust of rice. This definitely did not have that.

2. Spicy tomatoes with tomato aioli: This was my boyfriends favorite dish. The tomatoes were bomb. Aioli was more bomb. Just bombs all around.

3. Spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms: Good but pretty average. You get 4 decently sized mushroom. I don't even really like mushrooms so in hindsight, not too sure why I ordered that.

4. Seared sea scallops with leaks, torched oranges, and jamon serrano: Soooo yummy! This was the most expensive thing we ordered, but it was worth it! You get 4 scallops but they were perfectly balanced with that buttery scallop texture cut with the citrus from the oranges. [insert 2 thumbs up emojis]

5. Rioja braised short rib: Okay this was probably one of my favorite things. The meat was sooooo tender and just ugh tres magnifique! The sauce was good, the mashed potatoes were very buttery (maybe a little too buttery?) but meat and potatoes is just such a classic dish. It's hard to go wrong with something like that.

6. Grilled skewer of marinated pork belly and pork loin: I remember this being good, but I guess it wasn't as memorable as the other ones..

Overall, enjoyed a fantastic lunch! Excited to try other dishes next time :)

Service was great but food was so-so. Tried spicy potato, buttermilk chicken, grilled octopus and specialty. Spicy potato was ok, everything else was too sour and/or too greasy. Sangria was pretty good though.
Amazing tapas & service! Highly recommend! The bacon wrapped dates are incredible - short rib melts in your mouth - so many great options! Desserts are delicious too - I loved the caramelized banana!

My boyfriend and I wanted to stay in Lincoln Park for dinner it had been over a year since I went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba so we decided to go back. I like tapas and it was pretty good the first time (but try sharing tapas with someone that hates all vegetables... ugh limited choices)

Anyway, our waiter was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. We let him know about all my allergies right away (gluten, nuts, shellfish ... yes my life sucks) and he immediately offered me gluten free bread, gave me the gluten free menu, and let the kitchen know about all of my allergies. It is SO nice when restaurants are this accommodating to allergies.  

We started with a pitcher of red sangria, which was delicious and a really good deal. You get nearly 4 glasses each out of that and for a good price. Normally gluten free bread is not the greatest and it really makes me miss regular bread, this was actually pretty good! Especially with the olive oil they provide on the table.

For tapas, we ordered:
1) serrano ham, salchichon, chorizo & manchego platter - really good, the ham is definitely the best and it even tasted good with my gluten free bread
2) spicy potatoes with tomato alioli - way too good... probably could have eaten the whole thing myself
3) seared salmon, dill crema, roasted squash & caramelized lemon - delicious

We also got the chicken paella, which was amazing. That's saying a lot since the last time I had paella was in Spain, so they really did a good job. Obviously we had leftovers because it was huge, so we got to enjoy it the next night too.

I really like the ambiance of the restaurant because you can dress up in a long dress or wear jeans and either way you fit in. I will definitely come back to this restaurant! (especially in the summer when the front windows are open)

pics.caption: seared salmon, dill crema, roasted squash & caramelized lemon - yum!
spicy potatoes with tomato alioli - patatas bravas

review.des:
Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is a fun and affordable spot to go with a group for dinner. This past Saturday my fiance and I grabbed dinner there with another couple and had a really enjoyable evening sharing small plates and drinking the Blood Orange Sangria that was on special.

While the food didn't wow me there's no doubt that there were some good dishes including the Burrata, Spinach & Manchego Stuffed Mushrooms, and Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Aioli.

Service was a bit spottier than I would've liked. We had a good twenty minute period where we were planning to order more that we spent waiting for the waitress.

While I know this review is no rave I cannot stress how affordable this spot is and what a great spot it is for a group dinner.

I had my heart set on dining her after seeing it was a tapas and reviewing the menu.  After reaching out via social media, I was pleasantly surprised that they were super accommodating for our out of town, large, rowdy group celebrating 3 birthdays. We had the intense pleasure of dining here on a busy, crowded Saturday evening and it was everything and more that we expected.  The waitress was busy, no nonsense and efficient.  Each course came out separately, letting us taste, savor and discuss each dish.  And every one of them, from the pork tenderloin carpaccio to the blistered shishito and chorizo was mouth watering and fantastic.  

The sangria was delicious, the desserts were over the top and we paid a very reasonable price for the amount of food and sangria we consumed.

I'm not sure what a Ba-Ba-Reeba is, but Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! offers some of the better tapas options that I've had in the Chicagoland area. The highlights were the potatoes with tomato aioli, seafood paella, and the short ribs.

Book early! We called in to put our names on the list an hour in advance and still had to wait 45 minutes to get seated. The dimly lit and smokey atmosphere probably would offer an intimate experience if I hadn't come to the restaurant with my goofy friends. A couple huge slabs of meat hung from the ceiling near the bar area, making things feel somehow more authentic.

Once we put in our orders, the food came out surprisingly fast and well timed. We got our peach sangria first and though it didn't taste too boozy, it offered a solid sugary supplement to the free bread. The short ribs came out right away and WOW was it tender. It came out in one slab of meat and melted to the cut of my BUTTER KNIFE. That's when you know... The dish was pretty amazing and probably my favorite of the night.

The potatoes with tomato aioli came out after, followed by the chorizo wrapped dates and the duck special. Everything was well seasoned and delicious. The paella came out last, and although it would have gone well with the other dishes, it was a solid finisher to fill us up.

We were stuffed but because we checked in on yelp, we all got free dessert! That was an awesome deal - go Yelp. We shared the butterscotch custard, flan, pumpkin empanadas, and the glazed bananas. The pumpkin empanadas were kind of whack because they were salty, but everything else was tasty.

I left in a food coma, which is why I had to wait until today to leave my review. I'd come back.

This is hands down my #1 go-to spot. Definitely get the seasonal sangria, brussel sprout salad, burrata, and bacon wrapped dates.  Sometimes you can hit this place when it's super busy, but if you're okay with a bar seat you can usually slide on in if you keep an eye out.  Haven't found another spot that's nice, yet not pretentious, and the vibe feels relaxed but you feel like you're treating yourself like this spot.

Shrug. Sat at bar with friend, ordered scallops (pretty decent), shrimp (kinda small/medium-ish/sad) and spicy potatoes (best of the three...as in they are potatoes).  Food in general was acceptable; nothing that blew my socks off.  Same can be said about service but with less enthusiasm.

Came here on a Friday for a 5:30 reservation. The place is huge but I would def recommend making one as it was pretty crowded.

We tried the fried chicken, the scallops, the flank steak, marinated and spicy potatoes and they all hit the spot, although I could've done without the spicy potatoes. They were just okay but everything else was fantastic.

Will def be back!
I mean what could I possibly say that everyone else hasn't already said. This place is wonderful!

My second time at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and I enjoyed it just as much as the first. A quick note, my first visit was during a second date after many other ventures (including beverages), and I returned this week with that same person for an early Valentine's Day. We both had Lettuce Entertain You gift cards and even after all of the delicious food we consumed, we had money to spare! The value in the product here is so incredible. Every dish is served with perfect timing, as tapas should be, and in a beautiful order that creates a want for more. Gabriel was our server this time around and he gave us a wonderful experience. He was just attentive enough but never bothersome and treated us to a little something extra at the end of our dining. I would 100% recommend Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba to anyone looking for awesome food and a great ambiance. Don't get turned off by the lack of reservation times, there's always room for more :)

Had Brunch here a long 8 months ago.  I just wanted to post that it is a delightful place.

The food was extraordinary and we'll with the price.

Service was lousy, but it was a long brunch with friends, so we didn't give much care.  Just because keep in mind that is big and appears a little understaffed for the popularity.

Pretty good place! Went here on a Friday night for my 4 year anniversary. Good service! Good food!

Had a pitcher of the sangria which was also yummy.

Only 4 stars because we were cramped (our 2 person table was literally an inch away from the table next to us and we could hear their whole convo).

So much yes! Went during happy hour but would have been happy at full prices. Roasted dates, empanadas, meatballs, blue cheese tenderloins and chocolate truffle cake all winners. Can't say enough good things about this place!

Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is one of my absolute FAVORITE restaurants in Chicago. The ambiance is incredible, service is amazing and the food is always delicious. I definitely recommend trying their Sangria. Make sure to make reservations as they are normally pretty busy.

First of all, I have been coming here for tapas for the last 7 years. This is the only place I come for tapas and a couple of weeks ago my family and I had dinner there on a Monday evening to celebrate my birthday. The food was excellent but our server was horrible.  I was so embarrassed.  The place was not too busy. He came to our table when we were seated and causally asked if we were ready and my sister put in the seafood paella since it takes a while to serve. We got our sangria but he never smiled. He was arrogant and not warm. He kept coming to our table to put in our order. Very pushy and he seemed very irritated. Then we put in our desserts and my sister requested a surprise candle on the flan she ordered for me. He just brought it out and left it on the table and walked away. When my family was ready to pay he came picked up the payment came back and said thank you and that was it. We spent almost $400.00 that night. I mean what kind of service is this??? Sloppy and inattentive. Management should look into this and retrain their wait staff.  I've been in the hospitality business for 3 decades. Unfortunately I won't be coming back here with family and friends. Was not impressed at all. I will be searching for a new tapas place. Chicago has a wide variety of restaurants. Just very lousy service here too bad.

I ate here with a class during high school, and the tapas that we ordered were delicious. I especially enjoyed the Spanish tortilla. During the trip, we viewed a flamenco dancer perform which was very fun. This would be a great venue for a party. I really hope to return soon and try other things on the menu!

Delicious! Absolutely love this place. I can't count how many times I've been here, but every time makes me want to come back for more! The tapas are outstanding! I love the short rib plate the best. It come with potatoes and the meat just melts in your mouth.

The sangria is also a reason you should visit! There are several different flavors you can try, but I stick with the classic red sangria. The bacon wrapped dates are a must try too. I really enjoy the goat cheese marinara plate as well. The garlic bread that comes with it is oh so yummy!

I'm looking forward to going back again and again. If you haven't been here, what are you waiting for... go!
Quarentinos and BabaReeba are a close tie. I prefer this location because of the atmosphere, scenery and a more extended aray of foods. Their desserts are awesome and their service is great.

I live in the neighborhood and Ba-Ba-Reeba was always a reliable place for a quick good meal. However, my last visit was so bad I felt compelled to write this review. I came for brunch on A Sunday. We ordered several tapas some of which came out quickly while others took over a half hour. The last dish came out 45 minutes after ordering and we were no longer hungry. When we reminded the waitress that we had ordered the dish, she rudely told us she was aware. She made us feel like she was doing us a huge favor every time she came by to check on us and getting the bill seemed like a huge inconvenience. It was not the service I'm used to with Lettuce Entertain You restaurants. Needless to say, I'm on a Ba-Ba-Reeba break.

Love this place for a large group! We order tons of the delicious small plates and enjoy sharing and drinking for several hours. It's a great time and we never feel rushed. Atmosphere is fun and lighthearted.
This place is ok. Very touristy. There are plenty of better options for tapas in the city.

Only been for brunch-- but would definitely recommend.  It was great they had a lot of smaller options, so you can share and try different things with the people you are with.  Bloody mary bar was excellent, and the sangria is amazing.

What's not to love? Tapas! Great service! Great food, I love the scallops but I'm a scallops kinda girl you know? Couple two tree scallops make everything gorgeous!  I like to go here win big parties of people and have a great time they have excellent sangria and deserts omg so good.

An authentic Spanish tapas restaurant tucked away on Halsted in Lincoln Park. Can't find a single thing I did not love about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. As a Spaniard - and Spanish food lover - I loved Ba-Ba-Reeba's take on tapas. Some authentic and some with a fun twist. All delicious.

This is one of my favorite spots in Chicago! I've been here so many times for brunch and dinner. It works well with groups as well as two people. Their goat cheese dip is amazing. Sangria is always great. I also like their empanadas, Brussels sprout salad, and meatballs.

Good food, good drinks, just not my cup of tea. Facility is great, staff is kind and knowledgeable. The food is tapas so share with lots of friends and be ready to eat a ton. Definitely a good group spot!
Amazing food and fun atmosphere. Make a reservation, it's always busy. Great sangria selection and the garlic shrimp is amazing!

First time to this place in our daughters recommendation and we were so glad we went!! Tappas menu was great and the food was even better!! The bread they bring out was soooooo good with olive oil on he table already! Full bar menu and we split a bottle of Cava rose sparkling it was so cold and yummy!! Make a reservation and give this restaurant a go!!
Food is always great and so the service ! Everything on the menu taste great . I would take one star off since it's always loud and crowded
This place is amazing! Every time I come to Chicago this is the one restaurant I make sure to hit up! The spicy garlic shrimp is my absolute favorite. Make sure to stock up on bread!!!!
My favorite restaurant!!! Loves: goat cheese,  stuffed mushrooms,  croquettes, and bacon wrapped dates

Every time I decide to visit the Windy City I decide to visit somewhere new, since there's so many great places to eat! Then again when you waste your dinner at some place mediocre, it's not that fun.

We were seated promptly and was served fresh bread. We ordered 2 pitchers of sangria the peach and passion fruit white sangria. Very sweet but nothing too remarkable.

Our server was sweet and recommended anything in red is popular. Therefore we ordered about 7 different dishes.

The short rib and beef dish was the only thing we liked! Out of 7 dishes

Paella- not worth the price and not amazing
Calamari- very soft and not chewy but nothing remarkable
4 other bread and cheese dishes that were not even pallet savory!

All in all this place has over 2k reviews and it's worth a 3 stars at most. Would I come back no, am I glad I went sure...

Would not recommend!

Love it here! Prices are reasonable. We always share a lot of different tapas and get drinks and we don't end up spending too much money. The stuffed mushrooms, the goat cheese and the chickpea stew are all amazing!! Order something that looks interesting and just try it out, you won't be disappointed!

Came here for a friend reunion after months of not seeing each other and am soooooooo glad we did. Hours of catching up and greasy foot and TOP NOTCH red sangria. Get the house sangria, bacon wrapped dates, and stuffed mushrooms. To die for.
I love coming here for my birthday with  big group. So many yummy options and I'm never disappointed. The sangria is clutch!

Heard a lot of hype from Café Ba-Ba-Ree-ba but never really had an occasion to go here until yesterday, and was very pleasantly surprised after the experience. Not only because of the flavors and presentation of the food, but also because we surprisingly didn't break the budget doing it, spending around $20 per person(I was fully expecting to spend twice as much). First thing to note is that this place is gigantic. It has like 5 different rooms, two semi-floors, walls of bread and bundles of ham swinging from the ceiling. They really do try to capture the dim but bustling atmosphere of a restaurant in Barcelona, and in my opinion they do so fairly successfully. Ordered 7 tapas between 3 people, including the warm potato and onion omelette, spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, beef empanada, chicken and ham croquetas, buttermilk-fried chicken thighs, seared Spanish sausages, and skewered chicken + chorizo sausage. All the dishes were good, though my personal favorites were the potato dishes, the croquets, and the skewered Spanish sausages. The beef empanada was also good though for a single $6 empanada I would probably wait for happy hour. Speaking of which, they have a solid happy hour here, where their dishes are priced as they were when they first opened 30 years ago, meaning you essentially get 50% off a lot of their favorites(patatas bravas, empanadas, roast dates, chicken & ham croquetas, pintxos, etc.) along with $16 pitchers of Sangria. It's every day from 4pm-6pm, along with Friday sand Saturdays from 10pm-midnight as well, and you can definitely get full off of $10-15 or so if you come by around this time.

All in all tapas are never cheap, though with the right orders, along with plenty of complimentary bread and olive oil, you can actually get fairly full without breaking the bank. We averaged around $12/person on just food, and with drinks it just brought it a little higher, which is not bad at all. Also, they knew it was our first time there, so they even brought us out a trio of desserts, on the house, which was a great way to end the meal and start off the night. For that and their happy hour, they are definitely warrant another half star(4.5/5)
This is probably my favorite Spanish tapas restaurant. There's a large variety and the plates are decently sized. Definitely recommend trying the white peach sangria and the paella.

One word for this place: AMAZING. Tapas all around - we loved the potatoes the best, kale salad not so much. Great to bring family that's in town because of the warm, friendly atmosphere. Just keep in mind, the desserts are also smaller portions, so harder to share ;)

Food was excellent. We particularly liked the small bites which allowed us to sample a lot more. The flavors were complex and delicious. Dessert was fantastic. We ordered 3 desserts for the two of us and that was just the right amount to allow another delicious tasting.
Delicious food, fun atmosphere, great wine/sangria and awesome customer service. Great happy hour deals too. Definitely make a reservation in advance
Good for breakfast or dinner. They have a small outdoor area and a large dining room. Great for parties of all sizes.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is in Lincoln Park in a cute little pocket area that reminds me of Toronto and heading out to the little micro communities for foodie exploration.

My co-workers know this restaurant and they know it well. There was no problem getting a great seat (by the window). In the summer the roof comes off and exposes a massive outdoor seating area. In the winter, the roof keeps the restaurant warm and cozy.

The food and drinks come fast and furious and the evening was a huge blur of tapas and sangrias and conversation. The food was good but got lost in the background of conversation. The fish and mollusk dishes were my favourite. Most can be made gluten free.

One of our favorite spots, lots of changes
In mgmt, menu, food and few drinks... Some dishes have changed and even flavor but still enjoy it as well as the atmosphere. Summer time is busy so make reservation!!

My last experience was so good but the server today ruined it. Last time was my first time dining here, and everything was perfect (the food and excellent server)! I was soooo looking forward to coming back so I recommended this place to my friends for one of us's farewell dinner since she was leaving town.

Okay, checking on us is good. But coming and asking too frequently whether we need anything else/ whether we're gonna order some more is a little uncomfortable. To me, experience is the second important thing (of course, the first thing is food) when I evaluate a restaurant but it was bad today. It felt like she wanted us to either order more or eat quickly and just leave. Yeah, more people started to come in for dinner but it wasn't that busy like last time when I came during the weekend. There were still empty tables. Also, when we got out receipt I wrote down my LettuceEats number on the receipt but it seemed like she didn't add it so I asked her and she said she'll add it later. I checked and it's not added.

The supposedly warm/hot tapas dishes we ordered were generally quite cold when it came out. Seems like it was sitting there for a while before it was served to us.  Also, I told my friend that grilled octopus tapas they have here is so soft but what we actually had today was hard to chew. Since I had a really great time last time, I was really disappointed. I felt sorry to my friends for recommending. Before today I always recommended this place when people asked me some good places to dine but I don't think I will anymore. Well, they might have a good experience like when I first came, but I'm afraid they'll have a bad experience like i had today so I don't want to take that risk.

pics.caption: Skewer. Octopus/loved it when i had it last time but it was hard to chew today. Stuffed mushrooms-good when warm. desert tapas-chocolate.

review.des: This place is lit!!! Came here for happy hour on a Wednesday night and it was poppin'. The happy hour special is only at the bar so probably go in groups of 2 or 3. We got a pitcher of the red sangria for $16 (6-7 big cups) and bacon wrapped dates, spicy potatoes, and the beef empanadas with the happy hour special. We also ordered the short rib and fried chicken from the regular menu, as recommended by our waiter/bartender. All of the tapas were REALLY GOOD and pretty filling for two people. I would definitely get all of them again but my personal favorite was the bacon wrapped dates. The combination of sweet and savory and the different textures just work so well together. Our waiter/bartender was really nice and even changed the channel on the bar TV when we asked. The only thing that wasn't great was that he never gave us our complimentary bread even though we asked for it twice!! Still love this place though, it's well-priced and delicious so I'll definitely be coming again.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago by far. Best Tapas choice by far. Great prices.

First of all, I love the atmosphere. There are bar seats that you can pick up without a reservation but I do recommend that you make a reservation if you want to eat here.

It's a great place to hang out with friends/have a reunion/get some light drinks and appetizers/date night with dim lighting/everything you would want.

To get:

- Paella (Chorizo one is my favorite)
- Sangria (Mango and classic are great and not very strong but delicious)
- Bacon wrapped dates (Perfect!)
- Goat cheese and tomato dip
- Mash potatoes and pork shoulder
- Scallops
- Brussels sprouts salad
- Can't wait to try more!

To eat for free:

- I love their free bread in the beginning dipped with olive oil...maybe I was just hungry but I ate like 5 in a row.
Service is awesome and food is even better ! We had a great time! Every single thing we ordered from wine to tapas to dessert was delicious. Would most definitely go back.

Kind of pricey for what they offer. The food was delicious and the drinks were tasty and strong! The waiter was timely and service was okay. Nothing bad, nothing great. Average. Would have been 4 stars if it wasn't so pricey. Be careful! Their prices seem good but it's actually just mini-servings.

My sister decided to host my bridal shower at a private room at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba last weekend, and I cannot stop raving about it!

We were seated in the larger backroom, which comfortably fit about 28 people, including the two staff members. My sister picked the middle package (paella, salmon and bread, bacon wrapped dates, eggs benedict, french toast) and it was ALL delicious. The guests (and myself!) could not stop raving about how good it was, and the service was phenomenal. We did a drink package for two hours, and the servers were very prompt with filling the drinks that no one even noticed when the bar service ended.

Again, the staff made the event so easy! With all the commotion of picture taking and gift opening, I ended up accidentally knocking over a pitcher (whoops..) and the servers immediately cleaned it up...without making me feel bad/disrupting the event.

Overall, I would absolutely recommend Cafe Ba Ba Reeba's private event space for a bridal shower. It was a wonderful day I won't soon forget :)

Not from Chicago, but got recommended to come to this place! First we ordered black raspberry sangria, delicious!!! Not too sweet and also not loaded with liquor. We ordered the heirloom tomato salad, meat charcuterie and chicken empanadas. The heirloom salad sounds a lot more fancy than what it was. It was 3 huge pieces of lettuce with 2 big pieces of tomato and then some green dressing. The cucumbers and onions in it looked old and dried out (9 dollars). The charcuterie was terrible. The only good thing we're the side cup of olives. The meats had funky flavors, the bruschetta was on hard stale bread and not appetizing. The cheese was not good and only came with 3 tiny thin slices. (20 dollars!!!). The chicken empanada only came with one, it was the better of the three. (6.50). Overall, I was not happy with my experience. If the sangria was bad, this place would have gotten 1 star.

I can't say enough about this place!  I was tasked with planning a dinner for a large group staying in Chicago for a few days, and found this place through Yelp and other sources.  I was in touch with the restaurant about 2 weeks before our trip to Chicago.  They responded to my reservation request within hours, then assisted me with reserving a table even though I adjusted the number of guests and the time of the reservation in the next couple of days.  

On the day of our dinner, we definitely misjudged the time it would take to get to the restaurant and ended up about 20 minutes late.  I called from the cab to let them know we were on our way, and again, they were super accommodating and friendly.

On to the meal - they have three different sangria recipes, plus a sangria of the day.  We ordered the sangria of the day - which was mango - and it was delicious!  And a good value for the cost.  

But the food...OMG!  I don't think we had a single item that we didn't love!  Shrimp, pork, lamb, olives, shredded brussels sprouts, chorizo, jamon iberico, and I could go on and on!  A couple on the other side of the table ordered the paella, and thankfully sent a sample to our side of the table, and it was delicious as well!  There wasn't a single menu item that we didn't love, and we actually re-ordered a few of the items because they were so delicious!!  

We ordered five different desserts to pass around the table - they are all on the smaller side, in line with tapas-style dining, and we had fun taking a bite and passing each one along around the table.  

Our server, Allison, was amazing and very accommodating for a large group.  She explained the restaurant policies regarding bill splitting up front and allowed us to split the table in two to make it easier to settle up when the meal was over.  

The restaurant itself is cute and classy with the perfect ambience.  Food arrives quickly thanks to a crew of friendly food runners.  

I received endless compliments from our group of 15 for a job well done in selecting such a great restaurant for our group.  I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone that would care to listen to me, and I would definitely return should I be lucky enough to travel to Chicago again in the future!!

pics.caption: Mango Sangria!  Lab dinner!!  My favorite part of ABAI!!

review.des: Great place for tapas and sangria! I have always had outstanding service here and have loved everything I have tried! The paella is good, but I generally prefer to stick to the tapas. My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, brussels sprouts salad, ham croquettes, and the garlic shrimp. So delicious!

The most delicious tapas place in Chicago! My boyfriend and I had the most delicious food and sangria here. The plates were small and decadent, the olive order lasted the entire meal and the sangria was absolutely incredible. The entire experience was one I would recommend vehemently and I only regret not reviewing my meal sooner as well as taking photos to post. The employees were extremely professional and very quick to help and offer suggestions. This is my new favorite restaurant and I gush to my friends about it. I can't wait to come back and get the lamb and olives and sangria again!
Hands down my favorite tapas restaurant in the city. Food is excellent, service is great, and the atmosphere is fun. This place never disappoints!

Yummy yummy tapas. The make your own Bloody Mary bar is awesome, albeit overwhelming with options (not a bad thing!). I love taking friends from out of town here for brunch. It's a bit on the pricy side but totally worth it, great interior ambience as well. And friendly wait staff. Would recommend.

Best tapas in Chicago.
On par with San Francisco standards.
Amazing brunch if you haven't tried it.

The food at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was honestly amazing. There are so many great restaurants in the city that it's hard to keep returning to the same one but I'll be back again and again. I visited during a Wednesday evening and took advantage of their happy hour special. Although, the happy hour menu has limited options on it, they are all a hit. Meatballs, amazing. Chicken and ham croquettes, so good! Even the bacon wrapped date, which I expected not to like was tasty. I will say, I think the food significantly surpassed the service. Someone else described it as "somewhat attentive but doesn't look like happy to see us" and I understand why they would say that. I almost felt like we were bothering him by sitting in his section and placing an order. However, the food was so good I could honestly not care less about the server's demeanor.
So good here! Really good tapas and customer service. Everything in the menu is delicious and as long as you order something that sounds appetizing to you, you will enjoy it!

I'm from Arizona and My friend and I stopped in for a quick bite to eat before the Blackhawks game and the food was phenomenal! 10/10 I would recommend this place to all non Chicago natives and people who have never tried it! It's well worth it.

I went here for a celebration for a co workers engagement. The staff was very friendly and the 4 of us split the small plates, I was so full off the little that we ordered but I couldn't stop eating! The wine and food was flowing, and the spicy potatoes are to die for. I can't wait to go back! I highly recommend getting a reservation in.
Damn that butterscotch custard............ also the stuffed mushrooms were unreal and hanger steak made the vegetarianism break real worth it ya ya
I lived in southern Spain for 3 years...the food reminded me of Spain.  Everyting tasted exactly how it shoild. Definitely recommend to anyone wanting to experience Spanish food!

Yum!!  I enjoyed dinner here with a large group for dinner. We pretty much ordered at least 1 of everything on the menu and it was all delicious. The sangria was also a hit!!  I would recommend this place if you are nearby, just be sure to make a reservation as it can get busy come evening hours.

Perhaps this place is a bit hyped up. Was super excited to go here on date night, once we found out the wait for too long we ended up going to a different Tapas restaurant. But one lazy Sunday afternoon we decided to swing by to see if they have any outdoor seating. We got lucky (they only have 2 tables outside btw). After being challenged with awful attitude on the phone, and in person by a rude hostess we gave it a shot.

Sangrias were great I must say. Every other tapas was so underwhelming it was just sad. A pitcher of Sangria couldn't make food better....Potatoes were served to us within a minute or two, obviously not prepared fresh. They looked/tasted like they were laying under a hot lamp for a few hours. Bread and mushroom tapas were so unoriginal, they didn't even try...i will include photos, do your own judgement.

I expected much more from a place that was so hyped up, but to my disappointment they turned authentic Spanish restaurant to all american brunch place with bloody mary bar. No creative attention to detail and lack of presentation. Isn't what tapas are all about ?

Don't expect much if your coming here to get an authentic feel and try one of a kind dishes.

Try Emilios instead, where you can get 100% top notch service and incredible authentic vibe.
My favorite tapas place in the city. I highly recommend the calamari, the potato bites, and any of the sangria options. I've tried to pick a favorite sangria, but trust me, they are all delicious!!

Love love love these tapas!! The paella is my favorite!! The sangria is so good too!! They waxed their floors recently.. it was soo slippery! Surprised I didn't fall or others walking to the table or bathroom.

I rarely go to restaurants more than once... I would come back here every day! Tapas is the BEST way to do it. Most authentic Spanish tapas I've ever had (and I can say that because I've lived in Spain)! Drooling just thinking about the food. Highly recommend! Ordered a total of 8 tapas for 3 of us and was perfect amount of food. We started with 5 and ordered a few more because we couldn't get enough food. Atmosphere is loud, but it's very enjoyable. The food comes out faster than any place I've ever been! Sangria pitcher is a great deal as well. I'd recommend making a reservation because I did, but we still waited about 8 minutes. There was a group that did not and I over heard they were waiting for a while. Lettuce entertain you restaurant, so there are added benefits to spending money here. Price was pretty moderate.
We tried all the sangria sand they were delicious. My favorite tapas was by far the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce.

I attended a Bridal Shower here at 11am last Sun morning.  The place was still fairly empty with guests scattered about in all different areas of the restaurant for breakfast/brunch/sangria.  I love the building itself.  There are all these different seating areas and hallways, brick and dark and intimate.  Nice outdoor dining area also.

The waitstaff was AMAZING.  We had two servers.  One guy welcomed me into the private dining room and was so pleasant and accommodating.  Sangria, coffee and Orange Juice were served.  Both servers were efficient and attentive all through our party from 11-2.  Really great and refreshing.

Small plates were served.  Starting with argula salad and bacon wrapped figs.  Chicken and sausage skewers and spicy potatoes with the most amazing aioli accompaniments.  Garlic toast with goat cheese in marinara and stuffed mushrooms.  All very tasty and light since you get a very tiny plate of your own to dine from.   I enjoyed it very much.  

I will be back.

An awesome place for a date or for a big group outing. The menu has a lot to offer and there's always something new to try! The bacon wrapped dates are amazing. A few of my favorites are the spicy potatoes, scallop empanadas, calamari, ham croquettes, and buttermilk fried chicken. You really cannot go wrong here. The sangria is amazing too.

pics.caption: Brunch - Cubano sandwich and home fries

review.des:
Let's get one thing straight from the get-go.  Pan con tomate means Bread with tomato.  It doesn't mean bread with tomato, arugula manchego, anchovies, iberico or whatever other Spanish ingredient you can think to put on top of it.  It means bread with tomato.  The success of such a dish depends on having high quality super ripe tomatoes, combined with bread that has been toasted after being brushed with a scant amount of olive oil and just lightly rubbed with a bit of garlic.  When you have pan con tomate on the menu and you bring out this abomination that has all this extra bull s*** on it you embarrass yourself.  This is not Spanish food.  I wanted what I ordered, and what the menu said it was.  Simple refreshing bread with tomato.   The kind that is so good that you marvel at how something so simple can be so tasty can be so elegant and delicious.

Furthermore,  I don't understand how the Patatas Bravas at Tall Boy Taco which is owned by the same company and also happens to be a Mexican Joint rather than a Spanish one can be so much better than the ones here.  The decision the coat them in paprika prior to frying and then do so in such a way to burn the paprika takes away from all the positive notes you can get from the tasty aoili.

While we're on the subject of burnt food, let's talk about my croquetas, which upon arriving at the table I thought looked a little dark.  But before tasting them I gave them the benefit of the doubt and assumed that it was overcooked which it was.  How obviously burnt food makes it past the line cook, expediter, and runner to the table, shows a pretty blatant lack of care and concern when it comes to the quality of the food.  It's not like I couldn't have waited on a refire, there was plenty of food at the table already and the only reason I didn't send it back is because I was already food.

The two saving graces for this meal were the Sangria was good and that i was near full when I decided to eat here.  Absent those two things it wouldn't have even been worth coming here.  It is such a shame because the space is charming and it being a Lettuce restaurant carries a bit of weight with me.  They just fell really short.

It's everything I want from a restaurant. My new go to, I wish I would have found you sooner. Food was fast and delicious. Service was amazing, the lighting and decor were PERFECT. Passion fruit sangria =dangerously delicious. My favorite dishes were the garlic shrimp and the garlic potato salad. I almost don't want to write a review so I can keep this restaurant all to myself.

Amazing tapas, great ambiance, wonderful service. The salmon tapa is one of my favorite and comes with a guacamole on the side that is incredible! We also had the shrimp with garlic, the grilled octopus, and the Spanish egg and potato tortilla. 4-6 small plates is more than enough to share with 2 people.

Happened to be there on a Monday and all cocktails ate half off!

Great service, good food. Favorites were the filet with blue cheese, salmon, and garlic shrimp. Cheese and charcuterie plate were very good. Favorite desserts were the chocolate truffle and the cheese cake.

What a great time and awesome food. Portion smalls duh its tapas but keep in mind the bill racks up fast. Well worth it and would defiantly go back again. Service is fast and quick. Try to get a seat in the outdoor area.

We've been here a handful of times for date night. I love their tapas! The chorizo wrapped dates are seriously to die for as was the short rib. The sangria has been hit or miss but I'm there for the food :) The service has always been good and our experience pleasant. I would definitely recommend this place!
The bacon wrapped dates and red sangria are to die for. Portions are small even for tapas

Very good tapas menu and excellent Sangria!  I really like the white Sangria and the bacon-wrapped dates.  The Paella is also good.

Restaurant Week menu was no better than the regular prices when we went, which is my only downgrade on the rating.

Phenomenal. That's it. That's all I have to say.

Oh. And get the butterscotch dessert.

My boyfriend and I returned for Sunday brunch and were very pleased with our experience here. The specialty mango sangria was incredibly tasty. We split some veggie-friendly dishes such as the potato omelet, the eggs benedict, and the stuffed mushrooms. Though my boyfriend isn't vegetarian, he thoroughly enjoyed these dishes alongside me. Jane was our server and was very attentive and friendly. We're happy we gave this place a second chance and will likely return.

The food and sangria are both delicious. It is nice because you can try lots of different foods for a reasonable price. They have a large menu that caters to people of all tastes. The server even brought out a sample of the sangria to make sure we liked it before deciding on a pitcher.

Very fun atmosphere and decor I always like eating somewhere the feels like I'm outside.

The food is great, fun and inventive.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I love it so much I went for my birthday this year. We actually just got back from Spain and the food here was just as good. I also love the amount of vegetarian options. Highly recommend:

Red house sangria (obviously!)
Tortilla Espanola
Patatas Bravas
Burrata with Bread and Tomato Marmalade
Fried green peppers with course black salt

The two times I went the service was excellent and the food even better. Highly recommend!!

Definitely come here. Very authentic Spanish food. I felt like I was back in Barcelona. The sangria is a must. Strong, flavorful, fruity. We ordered the originally and I'd recommend it!

Food we ordered:
Potatoes bravas: too spicy for our liking. Actually I couldn't even eat it it was so spicy. We told our waiter and he took it off the bill which was very nice of him.

Chorizo wrapped dates: good but you can go without

Stuffed mushrooms: must!! Best stuffed mushrooms I've had. Amazing crisp on top and juicy inside.

Brussels sprouts salad. loved this salad. Great flavor. Crunchy and fresh.

Don't forget check in on Yelp for free dessert

Delicious!! First, make sure you try the brunch. The sausage rice was one of the best dishes I have had at any time of day anywhere and it was actually a pretty decent size (though shareable would be a stretch). The chicken and waffles on a stick was also very tasty. The croquetas have a unique taste but were also good and you get four so you can share. Most items are between $2 and $8 so getting a wide variety together for a table can be done for a decent price. There are over 100 items to choose from though and so many things will look good so be careful. My only caution would be that most dishes were only shareable if you wanted a very literal taste of something. Though some dishes gave more bang for the buck like the bacon Mac and cheese and the the house plate of meat and cheese. See what I mean about trying everything...

Would be 5 stars if our service would've been better.

Love the idea of breakfast/brunch tapas and these did not disappoint! We tried the eggs Benedict, spinach & artichoke crepe and spicy potatoes and were perfectly satisfied.

Didn't have drinks, but the build your own Bloody Mary bar looked good from what we saw at other tables and the sangrias on the menu also sounded really yummy.

Atmosphere wasn't anything to write home (or Yelp) about, but that may be because we were seated in the back of the restaurant a bit removed from the main action.
Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I call it "Ol' dependable" because I can always count on great food and service. I always bring out of town guests here.

Go for happy hour and feel liberated as you order every tapa on the menu, a pitcher of sangria, and still not be frightened by the bill. Fantastic patatas bravas, tortilla, chorizo and peppers, croquettes, garlic and tomato bread (a ton of it) and sangria. Fun, very group friendly environment and great service.

Food is great, especially pork paella!
My tips for you is: Order paella (min. 2 orders, choose from chicken, pork or seafood; you can mix n match) before you even sit down, cause the wait was 40 mins!

Chorizo wrapped date is good, worth trying, one per person will be good enough cause it's a bit on the sweet side.

Grilled octopus .. Hmmm, I saw lots of compliments here so I ordered it. But mine was over-cooked, and tasted blend. I don't recommend it.

Red Sangria is a must!

Good food but a bit pricey for my taste. I very much enjoyed the ambience. Nice music, and rustic decor. I ordered the pintxos platter, shrimp with garlic, buttermilk-fried chicken thighs, and seared sea scallop. All of it was good, but the best thing I tasted was the buttermilk-fried chicken thighs. BEST FRIED CHICKEN I HAVE EVER TRIED.
Needn't say anymore. My favorite Spanish restaurant in Chicago. Love every tapas I've tried. The best paella.

pics.caption: Forget the name. It's dates rolled by bacon, good tastes.

review.des: All of the food was delicious!  My friends and I ordered 2-3 tapas each and then got the paella to split and it was more than enough food. Everything was so good. The sangria was great too. Great service too, our waitress Katherine was so helpful explaining the menu and being patient with our party. She made our experience great!

Not sure why this place has 4 stars. It's such a mediocre place. It was my second time and last time here. The sangria's here are weak and the food is soooo bland. Nothing special about it. I don't recommend it.
My favorite tapas restaurant in Chicago very good, super crowded all the time though. So many good choices and a vast array of selections you can't go wrong no matter what you choose.

Back in the mid to late 2000s, I used to come here and spend a lot of money on not a lot of food (although delicious).  Fast forward almost 10 years, and nothing has changed.  The plates are so small and light, you need to handle them with delicate hands.  If you've got the shakes, your food will go flying off your plate.  You've been warned!

Go to Cafe Iberico for larger portions closer to what "tapas" sizes are like in Spain.  Dishes are a notch below Ba Ba Reeba's regarding authenticity and taste, but you will get more value!  Or try Black Bull, although it's a smaller restaurant with a slightly more avant garde take on common Spanish dishes.

Tapas for brunch is a great breakaway from the traditional, and it's a very fun and group-friendly choice! I've only been for brunch and the wait isn't bad. On a Saturday, it meant around 45 minutes, and that's plenty of time to get a head start on their sangrias on tap. Brunch comes with its own tapas menu, though you can order from the standard menu. Prices are reasonable for the tapas size and quantity. Flavors are fantastic and varied. There were only a few items I wouldn't get again, like the baby shrimps and grits.

pics.caption: Tiny shrimps/grits and baked eggs for breakfast

review.des:
Tapas. So many options. So much sangria. Very authentic. Waitstaff sometimes forgets about you. Plan to be patient and keep eating and drinking. Worth it.

Recommended: garlic potato salad, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, grilled octopus and shrimp with garlic.

Fun place for small plates. Good tasting food.

My only complaint was that I felt very rushed by our waitress to finish our food quickly and leave. They are efficient but I wanted a little more time to enjoy my food considering how much I was paying. The service was like an assembly line, not an inviting restaurant.
The best for big groups/parties. Had a family get together of ALL ages and everyone was so pleased with the food as well as the drinks. I recommend getting the sangria! Also vegetarian friendly

One of the best restaurants I've been to in my lifetime! The bacon wrapped dates, calamari, short rib, charcuterie board, and burrata were amazing! Redeemed free desserts also! Would definitely come back again !

We started at the bar while we waited fro our 12 top to be ready, and enjoyed excellent service and impeccable mixology.  

Seated we enjoyed an endless flow of delicious sangria (8 different flavors, but I liked the regular red the best)

the plates were all excellent, and just the right portions to share and pass around. the pallella finished the meal off properly several hours later.

If you like tapas, Ba-Ba-Reeba is no joke.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is one of my favorite places in Chicago! The vibe is awesome and they are really great with special food diets! They even have a really good gluten free bread (important with their spreadable and soupy tapas items)! My favorite item on the menu is the broccoli manchego salad - it has a wonderful crunch and a ton of manchego!

This place is a gem!

Great food, great drinks. I highly recommend getting dessert from here (the butterscotch pudding is to die for). Great place for date night or happyhour

Great ambiance/atmosphere and the service was impeccable! I especially appreciated how attentive the staff were, immediately removing plates when we were finished. Our waitress was incredibly helpful with offering up suggestions and explaining the tapas concept. Bread was given to us upon arrival and I don't know anyone who doesn't love a little freebie to begin a meal! The food came out rather quickly despite the large crowd on a Friday night. We ordered several small plates of food and two of our favorites were the short rib and the beef empanada. It was a bit expensive but a nice little treat!

I visited for the first time during happy hour with coworkers. We called ahead as we were a group of about 15. When we got there the host, who was very curt, directed us to sit only at the bar and high top tables.  I don't know if this is because happy hour is at the bar, but this was not a good first impression. Once seated, our waiter also was what I would describe as friendly. I was already over this place but then I had the food. I highly recommend the spicy potatoes. They are soo good! The beef empanadas and red sangria aren't bad either. And maybe best of all, we spent almost no money! Overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again, but if I was in the area, I'd happily pop in. And I'd recommend it to others.

I have no idea what all of the fuss is about this place.  The tapas was OK.  I have had much better.  Our waiter was great.  He was friendly and very good about making recommendations.  If you are a Spanish tapas fan you can do better.
Not great food. Appetizers are good, entrees were pretty boring. Mainly, the place is big, crowded, and NOISY. Has more the feel of a sports bar than a restaurant.

I have been a patron of Ba Ba Reeba for years so I was ecstatic to learn that they held events when I was planning my rehearsal dinner. I worked with multiple staff members throughout the 10 month process who were all attentive and quick to answer all emails and calls. I was able to customize the entire menu and drink options. My 32 guests had an incredible time and everyone is still raving about it. I highly recommend their rooms for your small gatherings such as showers, rehearsals, and even weddings. Thank you to the Ba Ba Reeba and Lettuce Entertain You team!

Great restaurant, I love the tapas style of serving. You are able to try many dishes during the same sitting. I've been here a few times and always end up grabbing a bite or two off my friends small plates as well.
It can get quite busy and loud at times, but that's expected with any popular restaurant in the city.

First time I ate here I gave a 4 for service. Since then, this has become my favorite restaurant. I love the tapas concept - trying new things and having conversations over the food. Never disappoints. Among my favorite dishes are the bacon-wrapped dates, the croquetas, and the roasted vegetables. Don't leave without ordering sangria!
I had never had tapas before. This place has set the bar pretty high for me. Everything here was fantastic! Drinks are excellent too! Get the white sangria. It tastes like summer to me.

I've been coming here for years and I went there Saturday night around 9pm and we were seated right away.  But once we got to our table we had to replace one of the cups of water because it was dirty.  When we went to grab the plates we noticed that there was food stuck on the inside of the plate and there were food crumbs on four more plates.  The waitress had to just replace the whole stack of plates.  When it came to getting our food we didn't receive any bread until we asked for it and when the food came the bacon on the bacon wrapped dates were burnt.  Lastly, for dessert we ordered the caramelized banana which we've had before and it was supposed to be a banana with a caramelized crust with sugar which they brulee the top what we got was a raw banana with some caramel sauce on top.

I went here for my birthday this past weekend and the food was good however the drinks were horrible. My party ordered a mojito, the smoke & spice, gin & tonic and a sangria. We also order the seafood paella and the pork paella. I would not say they were the best I have ever had but they were decent. Space is definitely an issue here, I was with a party of 7 and we had to constantly move our chairs around because the waiters kept bumping the back of our chairs or the back of our heads. I don't think anyone from the party would suggest this place to friends or be back.

Ohmigosh.. I LOVED this place, and this place will be a "must stop" spot for many future trips to Chicago. Unassuming from the outside and totally awesome inside. I have no idea how big this place is, but it's much bigger than it looks from the outside.

While visiting a friend, he made a reservation at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. I read through the Yelp reviews before our dinner so I see what people recommended for dinner. All of the reviews looked amazing, so I relied on my friend and his expert option to help guide the menu for the evening. Our choices in my order of  tasty goodness:

-Beef Tenderloin with Blue Cheese. Really.. can you go wrong with blue cheese?
-Bacon wrapped dates. I easily could have eaten the entire plate
-Seared bay scallops - they could have used a bit more of a sear on them, but I still devoured my share and could have eaten more
-Splcy Potatoes - the heat sneaks up on you, which is wonderful. I'll be attempting to make these at home

We also got the White Sangria. The first glass was excellent, but after time, it became a little too sweet for me. Thankfully the server was spot on when it came to refilling my water, keeping me hydrated and allowed me to finish the sangria; because, let's face it, you can't waste sangria.

Definitely make a reservation if you're coming.. there was quite the crowd hanging out waiting for a table.

Huge huge huge tapas fan and was not disappointed by Cafe Babareeba. Went here for a work dinner with bunch 10 other people. The staples like the wrapped dates and the meatballs were on point, but the hangar steak and the goat cheese tomato garlic bread REALLY stole the show. Ordered the paella as well, but I was not a fan.

Be sure to order the sangria -- it cannot be missed.

A big thank you to Manager, Jack! He made my first time visit at Cafe-Ba-Ba-Reeba! memorable! I was tired and had not eaten all day. When I arrived on Friday evening, I was told by the hostess that there was a 2 hour wait for a dining table or I could sit in the bar that was extremely crowded (I was not prepared for that long of a wait).

Jack found out about my situation and was extremely accommodating; he found a table for me within 10 minutes. The wait staff was very knowledgeable about the menu. The food and Sangria were excellent! I will definitely be back again. Thank you Jack!

For the higher price point and all the great reviews on here, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba didn't quite meet my expectations. The tapas were good - especially the chorizo-wrapped date & cheese and the beef tenderloin. The chicken paella we ordered was super salty (not sure if it is usually that way or just an off night). The service was really great though. I'd recommend making reservations ahead of time if you plan on bringing a larger group.

This review is long overdue.

I hosted my husband's 40th surprise birthday party here back in March ~ had a private room.
Where do I begin!? I suppose with the menu.

Below is the menu for the party:

Cold Tapas:

*Serrano ham, salchichon, chorizo & manchego cheese
*Spanish caesar salad

Hot Tapas:
*Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce
*Spicy potatoes with tomato alioli
*Shrimp with garlic, olive oil & red pepper flakes
*Skewered chicken & chorizo sausage
*Meatballs in sherry tomato sauce
*Wood-oven roasted market vegetables
*Rioja short ribs & manchego mashed potatoe

Desserts:
*Marcona almond tart
*Chocolate truffle
*Seasonal flan

Sangria, beer & wine package

Everything was on point and delicious, a hit with my guests.
Thank you Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba ~ Michelle in Special Events and employees assigned to the party for being so accommodating! I definitely will return.

By far one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  Delicious food, Great friendly staff who allow their guests to experience a meal without being to pushy for the next tapas round order. We love coming here and Cafe B truly has a special place in our hearts, in fact we got engaged here!
Always a 10/10 for overall experience

I've been coming here for years and this was the first time where I've honestly felt no need to come back to eat. The sangra is great and our waitress was a dear. When our food (over cooked dates that were thrown on our table) we spoke to the team and they were kind enough to understand the situation. The service here has gone down hill in the last year or so and the tapas are hit or miss.
The patatas bravas are decent, but if you're looking to eat a good meal I'd suggest going elsewhere. The sangria is fine, so if you're looking to just drink it isn't a bad spot for 30 minutes. Probably won't be coming back.

Tapas, galore!! I needed 30 minutes to try and choose what I wanted to order and even then had a hard time narrowing it down. We had a party of 6 with each person ordering 2-3 dishes so a TON of food. I got to try most of it and everything (besides the empanada I ordered- blah) I tasted was absolutely delicious and unlike any other food I have ever had. I especially loved the deviled eggs, stuffed mushrooms and garlic shrimp. Loved the diversity and uniqueness of  this place.

We sat on the very cute patio and our service sucked. It took TWO hours for lunch and we just wanted to get out of there so bad by the time we were finished but our waitress wasn't going to let that happen. She had the personality of a wet mop and couldn't manage to get any of our checks right.The manager stood by the computer for about 20 minutes trying to help her ( she still got it wrong when she brought the checks out) and neither one of them approached our table to apologize or explain the confusion. She couldn't even muster up a "sorry it took so long, have a nice day" by the end of it all. NOTHING. Very poor service and management.

I still wanted to give 4 stars for everything else aside from service and would definitely give it another shot and hope for a better overall experience.

A member of our party was restricted to a gluten-free diet. They provided gluten-free bread (which was actually tasty) and the gluten-free menu was extensive.

The server went beyond the specialized menu to explain which items the table ordered could be consumed and why certain items weren't gluten-free due to cross-contamination (i.e. the burrata could be eaten, but isn't included on the gluten-free menu because it comes with toast and the patatas bravas aren't gluten-free because they're cooked in the fryer with breaded foods).

They were very accommodating and the food was excellent, as always!

Definitely the place to be for tapas and paella! Everything here is delicious but my favorite thing is the olives and paella. They have definitely imported the best olives and perfected the art of paella. Also, don't forget to add their delicious sangrias to complete your Spanish fiesta.
I came here several times . Best tapas in town with good service. Make reservation early! Since it's super popular, sometimes you have to wait a little bit for seats. But totally worth it.

Talk about a well oiled machine.  Never seen tapas fly out of a kitchen so fast even on a Saturday night.  Everything was delicious at a good price.  Great place for a girls night out, first date, or double date.  Just watch your step near the pass...saw a lady bite it.

The first thing you will notice when you walk in, is the beautiful ambience. About2 tapas er Erson would be sufficient. Mind you, it takes 35-40 min for the paella so order in advance.

We order the spicy potatoes, Moroccan lamb and the salmon. Everything was very good and exquisite!

Came here for my birthday yesterday and it was beyond perfect. Cafe baba Reba is one of my favorite restaurants so it was obviously a no brainier to take my family here. I worked with Michelle from the event staff to get everything planned. A big thank you to Michelle. She helped me customized a menu of all my favorite things. Hands down my most favorite lettuce entertain you restaurant. Our waiter was great! The management was great! The front hostess not so great (but everything can't be perfect) the menu appealed to everyone bc I included a little bit of everything with the help of Michelle. The food was absolutely delicious, the sangrias were amaze balls (red and mango). I couldn't of hoped for a more perfect birthday dinner.

Came here to celebrate two birthdays and it was great. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. I would recommend a reservation if having dinner. Between the two times we were there we had everything on the menu and about 90% of the menu items I loved. Highly recommend

I researched ahead of time for "best restaurants for families," and to their credit, Reeba's "healthy" kids menu, and kids play kit was great. The red wine flight was great, three smaller glasses of wine for $16, was perfect for my wife and I (we each got a flight). Food was good, not great. The goat cheese dish was glorified marinara sauce and garlic bread, pass on that. The hangar steak, melon and purity-piri dishes were very good. The best dish of the night was the bananas foster dish. Perfectly sized, and very, very tasty. Overall, very positive experience, and it was nice to get out of downtown Chicago.

The pork paella was so good. I can't wait to eat my leftovers for lunch tomorrow! The meatballs and beef empanada were amazing too. Those 3 orders were a perfect amount of food for 2 people. Most definitely coming back to try other tapas dishes. Yummy!

Delicious tapas! Absolutely love so many dishes on the menu!

The Sangria is excellent. (My favorite is the classic Red Sangria) Always enjoy the Bacon-Wrapped Dates, Baked Goat Cheese, Beef Tenderloin & Blue Cheese,  Meatballs, Spicy Potatoes, and Seafood Paella.  Must try the desserts as well!

Perfect for any occasion.  Always a great experience.

First time here and the experience was perfect. We had a reservation, which enabled us to have a table really fast, otherwise you can queue for hours here.

Everything we had was delicious, here's the list.
A couple Pintxos to start: Chorizo-wrapped medjool date and cheese, and the Deviled egg.
Then Tapas: Spinach & manchego-stuffed mushrooms (a pure wonder), Meatballs, Roasted chicken empanada, Chicken & ham croquetas (better than in Spain, said my friend),
And finally three extraordinary deserts: caramelized banana (that was fantastic), butterscotch custard and the marcona almond-caramel bar.
I recommend them all. The meatballs were not as exceptional as everything else, but still delicious. Also had an Estrella Damn, a Spanish beer, which tasted fine, Finally, taste their olive oil with bread.

And service was really good. Looking forward to coming back!

I've been coming here for many years, and I have yet to order something off the menu that I don't like. This was the first tapas bar I ever tried, and they still have my favorite sangria. A couple pointers:

1. Their bacon wrapped dates are the bomb. Get them. Trust me, just get them.

2. Great sangria, you really can't go wrong with any flavor but try their cava sangria or white peach sangria to mix it up.

3. Try the pintxos platter to get a little bite of everything for a reasonable price - 6 tapas for 11$

4. Spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, beef skewer with horseradish cream and red onions, serrano ham and garlic potato salad are some of our favorites.

I have been returning here for 5 years now, it is a tapas staple with consistently good food and service.

pics.caption: The pintxos platter: chorizo wrapped medjool date & cheese, shrimp, tuna toast (now mushroom toast) deviled egg, fried croquette

review.des:
Let me say for the record... I adore Spain and tapas!!!! I wanted a romantic dinner and my husband delivered! We arrived and had a glass of sangria. I'm a light weight and my man loves ales. Lol. The sangria was excellent. Ok, two glasses are my limit.  Alright three but I'm stopping there.

Onto the food: we had the following:
- roasted dates with bacon and apple vinagaigrette
- citrus-cured salmon, cucumber, creama, and toast
- Rioja-braised short ribs with manchego mashed potatoes
- wood-roasted peppers, eggplant & tomatoes
- chocolate truffle cake
- caramelized banana with crushed pistachio

The food is amazing. Tapas are small dishes that are meant to be shared. Usually, you should order 2 - 3 dishes per person. Each dish can be between $6-12 depending upon what it is. Things can add up pretty quickly but the food is so worth it.

Our waitress, Marilyn was exceptionally nice. She understood when ordering, we would appreciate it if only two dishes came out and not all at once. She timed it so there was a heavy dish paired up with a lighter dish. Our dishes complimented each other in taste and they didn't fight against each other. The only time we were stumped was when it came time for desserts. I opted for a chocolate truffle cake. It comes with kuluha and a dollop of whipped cream. I can hear my waist line popping. So worth it. I'll run on the treadmill for an extra hour. Yes, it's that incredible.

Thanks to everyone who made it a memorable night. Special thanks goes to my husband who used Yelp to find this place. He knows I love tapas.

pics.caption: Chocolate truffle cake with a dollop of whip cream

review.des: Favorite restaurant in Chicago! Perfect for date nights or a girls night out. Not too expensive and the food and drinks are to die for. Pitchers of red sangria, orders of spicy potatoes, meatballs, goat cheese bread, and the shrimp is what a perfect night entails! You. Must. Go. Here.

Went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for the first time on a Tuesday night. I was with a group of 9 so thank goodness they take reservations! Despite being a rainy Tuesday night the restaurant was packed at around 8 pm, and this is a really huge space too!

The hostess was nice enough to show me to my friends' table. Apparently they had just moved the whole group because the room they were in started leaking/flooding due to the torrential downpour. More on that later...

My group downed several pitchers of their sangria (red and peach) throughout dinner. Both were good! We ordered a ton of food. Pardon my ignorance on the names because I was not in charge of ordering.
