We had burrata with green sauce and corn, cheesy bread with a red sauce, huge potatoes with an orange sauce, sausage plates, beef short rib and two plates of the pork paella. Everything was outstanding! Each tapa is good to share among 3-4 people (assuming you're going to order multiple) and the paellas are huge servings. I literally couldn't get enough of just about every dish. They will also bring you as much free bread as you can possibly eat.

What really added the finishing touch was our waitress brought out a complimentary platter with 5 of their desserts to make up for the moving rooms/flooding incident. The butterscotch one was really tasty.The manager came and checked on us and apologized at the end of the meal as well. Awesome environment with high class service and absolutely delicious food! Can't believe it took me two years in the city to make my first visit here. I'll definitely be back!!

Great food and great service!  You can't go wrong with anything you order.  We had seafood paella, tried all the pinxtos (amazing!), braised short ribs, spicy potatoes, goat cheese and washed it down with sangria.  I'm getting hungry again, so need to go back!

This is a good place to get a great appetizer and sangria! My wife and I come here occassionally for dinner.  The seafood paella is great.  My wife enjoys the spinach stuffed mushrooms. The staff is friendly and can't beat the convenient location from our home.

We stumbled upon this place on Yelp while visiting on business from NY and it completely lived up to the reviews. The food was amazing and the service was awesome ! I recommend siting on the patio but it gets a bit chilly. We had a bunch of tapas and then the vegetable paella which was great but HUGE.

There are SO many vegetarian options which was excellent for me as well as amazing seafood options for my coworker.

Definitely   worth checking this place out!
Perfect place for a great brunch with a big group of people. I always order the mac & cheese with bacon and the short rib sliders. Also, the sangria is phenomenal.

Everything on the menu tastes unbelievably delicious. One of the best restaurants I've ever been to and the service is always incredible!! This is the only restaurant in the US where I've found tapas that are just as delicious as the ones in Spain. Definitely recommend the patatas bravas (spicy potatoes) here. The sangria is also always amazing and there's usually a seasonal flavor. This is one of the only restaurants in Chicago where I've been more than once and always look forward to coming back.

I loved this place!  We have only had the opportunity to hit two Spanish style tapas places in Chi-town, so this review is based on my experience at these places, as well as my recent ones in Spain.

Everything that we had here was pretty darn good.  The service was excellent as well.  I can recommend the following: Deviled egg, Chorizo wrapped medjool date, Catalan bread, Patatas bravas, sea salted green peppers, calamari, Tortilla espanola,  
Shrimp with garlic olive oil, Roast dates with bacon and apple, the Albondigas, Skewered chicken and chorizo sausage and red sangria. We were skeptical about how good (or bad) this place would be after a failed tapas experience on Friday night somewhere else.  We were more than delighted here!

I would highly recommend this place!
Favorite restaurant in Chicago hands down. Every dish is amazing. I'm not even sure how that's possible!

Great place for tapas and the prices are extremely affordable. The food is super tasty. I recommend the lamb and the short rib they both were super tender and cocked to perfection. The stuffed mushrooms with spinach and manchego are crispy and they melt in your mouth. I also recommend the goat cheese in tomato sauce creamy and very tasty. Overall, the food was excellent and the service was great. If you want to try an affordable tapas place come check this place

Yum, love this place. The best Spanish food on the northern side of Chicago (the best on the southern side is Mercat a la Planxa oh yeah oh yeah). It's a great place to come with friends and the food is super solid. You'll have a great time - definitely recommended.

Normally I have a fabulous experience at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba, but this past time I was a let down due to our server. I went for my birthday celebrations because it is my favorite place to eat and I NORMALLY get a really great server. To say I was let down is an understatement. We had a young man with a buzzed haircut who acted as though he didn't have time for anyone and I saw him roll his eyes both at our table and other tables around us. When we sat down he didn't welcome us or ask if we had dined at their restaurant before. He  didn't take our menus, I had to ASK for the specials for the day, barely checked in, never refilled our water and was overall a jerk. I get it- you hate your job, but you also have a job so be thankful and treat your customers who are just trying to have a fun evening out with respect.

Definitely taking a break from going here if that is how I am going to be treated.
Great service and amazing menu! So many options to choose from and a very attentive wait staff that was able to answer all my questions. I recommend this place to all of my friend visiting Chicago!!

They stuck us in a dark, cold corner in the back of the restaurant "because the front isn't open right now."  When we all commented on how cold it was, the hostess offered to "turn the heat on."  ON??  You didn't even have the heat ON??  The high that day was 34 DEGREES, LADY.

Dishes were overpriced and generally unmemorable.  The goat cheese in tomato sauce that everyone raves about?  Well, if you've ever had warm goat cheese on a pizza, it's exactly like that (except without the crust, and for quadruple the price per volume).  Pitchers of sangria were at least 60% ice by volume.  One star for the bread and olive oil, although really, give us enough for the whole table.  They finally got the memo on that after the third time we asked.

This is by far my favorite tapas place.  My favorite restaurant in general.

Cafe Ba Ba Reeba has an AMAZING menu. The spicy potatoes and chicken and ham croquetas leave me speechless!! Never go without having them along with half the rest of the menu.
I'm not much of a drinker but their white peach sangria is absolutely delicious and smooth. A great drink to accompany such excellent food. Get the pitcher!! It's worth it.

Service here is always great. Not one complaint to date and I go here often. I recommend this place to almost everyone I know. I love it!

It's definitely a party place with all the noise and so many people around, but great for a date as well. My favorite is the patio, though. The prices are decent and the food is pretty great. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I just wish they took reservations because they're always crowded. That's a good sign, though.

We went here for an early dinner after visiting Warby Parker. It was really busy for late afternoon meal, but we did get seated and did not have to wait. We did not have reservations, so I was glad we ended upon getting a table.

We ordered a combination of different tapas which included: galacian empanada of bay scallops, chicken & ham croquetas, and the rioja braised short rib. They were all excellent. The service was great as well. The server was very attentive. We weren't starving otherwise, we would have also ordered the Paella for dinner. We did order a few deserts though as we were not completely full yet.

The deserts were as good as the tapas and were delicious. I don't think you can go wrong with whatever one you end up choosing. Everything we ordered was really excellent. I would definitely come back here when in the Lincoln Park area.
One of the best brunch!! Great portion, good for small and big party! And don't have to wait a long line. Like it!

Food: truly delicious, I don't even care if it's not authentic. It's good.
Service: very very good.
Price: pretty reasonable. Good food, the good service, and the upscale neighborhood

Fun place to go. Loud and social Thurs-Sat nights. Definitely good for a date night!

The food was really good but they didn't seat us until 35 minutes past our 10:00pm reservation. Then they bus boy was cleaning the table (blowing out candles, taking napkins, threw us dirty looks etc...) as we were winding down our meal and signing the check. I understand you want to leave but you still had guests in the restaurant, that was downright rude!

I wasn't super disappointed in this place, but I wasn't really thrilled either. Some of the small plates just seem kinda overpriced. The grilled hanger steak plate honestly tasted a bit strange. The chef's artisanal cheese selection came with bread that was really hard and chewy. Overall, not really impressive. But, the manchego stuffed mushrooms were a winner for me. They were absolutely delicious. the buttermilk fried chicken was pretty good as well. I would be willing to come back, I just wish the quality was a bit better for the price you pay.

Although this restaurant gets a high grade, i do not think it deserves it. First, the taste is just okay. I tried another Spanish restaurant in downtown before, actually that one is better than this and is less crowded. Also be carefully about the tip reference they give you!!!! I split my check with my friend but the tip reference was calculated on our whole order. We all gave the number on the reference without doubting the number!!! It was so disappointing to dinner there and I felt I was cheated. I would never go there again!!

Umm. This is tapas heaven.

If my stomach could live up to the challenge, I would totally order everything and eat it all but it can't and that makes me utterly depressed.

I walked in one evening with a friend and was kind of digging pretty much everything about the place.

We ordered the brussels sprout salad, spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, garlic potato salad, the short run with manchego mashed potatoes, citrus cured salmon, grilled iberico pork shoulder, and the paella valenciana. I also got the mango sangria which I loved since it didn't have a strong wine taste to it.

We loved both the potato tapas because well, starches are freaking delicious- loved the crispness of the spicy potatoes. The short rib was cooked beautifully tender and the paella had plenty of meat in it.

Service was excellent as well. Our waiter came by plenty of times to check up on us. They also served up the paella which was different for me.

I plan to return when I'm back in Chicago. Mmmmm

pics.caption: Brussels sprout salad and potato salad
Paella valenciana, spicy potatoes, grilled iberico pork shoulder

review.des:
Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is my go-to for birthdays and group dinners. There's a lot of fun energy, but it's not too loud or out of hand. Tapas are great for groups because you get to taste lots of dishes, but it also makes splitting the bill so easy, not to mention that Ba-Ba-Reeba is very reasonably priced. On top of that, the food is AMAZING.

Some of my favorite dishes are; the spicy potatoes, the goat cheese, the bacon wrapped dates, paella, and the pork shoulder. You can't forget a big pitcher of sangria and absolutely must finish with the butterscotch pudding -- it's out of this world!

I never would have thought of Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba as a brunch destination, but I only needed three words to be convinced -- Bloody Mary Bar!

pics.caption: after my trip to the bloody mary bar at brunch

review.des: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! catered for our wedding reception. The food was so delicious that the guests are still talking about it, and the staff was very professional, personable, helpful and prompt. But what truly stood out was Alison, who was the event planner. She went above and beyond to provide any special request we had, and was always quick to respond to all our questions. We truly appreciate all of her efforts in making our vision for the wedding become reality.

We went here on a Sunday evening as part of a group of eight (one of our party made reservations - not sure if you can only do this only for large groups but if you can make them,I would recommend this as it was crowded on a Sunday at 7:30). We enjoyed a large assortment of tapas and all were excellent (patatas Brava, squid, Brussel sprouts salad were just a few). The paella is excellent and a larger portion than the tapas. The sangria (four varieties) is refreshing although the alcohol content seemed low - not a bad thing. The desserts (we tried two- the chocolate cake and the marcona almond caramel bar) were the perfect size to end our meal on a sweet note. Only complaint is that the noise level is a bit high so it made it challenging to converse with our group.

My fave tapas place in the city! My recommendations: bacon-wrapped dates, spinach & manchego-stuffed mushrooms,  and the burrata with Catalan tomato bread! As for drinks, the peach sangria is a must (pitcher size ofcourse!)

Between 6 adults and 3 kids we spent over $250. For this price point I expect a restaurant to nail every (not just some) dish. What they were good at... Chocolate truffle cake, saffron flan and vegetable paella. Also enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates. Their plating and presentations were gorgeous. Where they failed... Shrimp skewers were charred and tasted charred, a different shrimp dish tasted really fishy, steak tapas were under seasoned, fried calamari was extremely over done, the mango sangria lacked flavor. The waitstaff was attentive and did a good job clearing our table, but they did clear some tapas that we were still working on.

(Says in Spanish accent): Get your tapas on at Ba-Ba-Rrrreeba!

I made a reservation for my best friend and I to come here in celebration of her birthday. Neither of us had been here before, but we'd heard good things about it. We came on a Monday night, and expected it to be pretty empty. We were quite wrong! You'd never know that is was a Monday night here. There were lots of people there and the place was kicking! We got a table in the back area. The décor of the entire place was GORGEOUS. There was art on the walls, dim lighting, candles in Mason jars - everything was just so perfect!

Our server was super helpful and explained the menu to us. We ordered the deviled egg tapa and patatas bravas to start with. They were both great! To drink, we both had the sangria. It was not super strong..it was more sweet (but that's how I like it!). For our entrée, we ordered the Paella with pork. We were surprised at how fast it was done. The menu said 45 minutes, but we're almost certain it was a shorter wait than that. It was super filling and delicious. Lots of great flavors and smells came from the Paella!

For dessert, we ordered the chocolate truffle cake and the Butterscotch Caramel Custard. The desserts might have been my favorite part of the evening. DO NOT leave here without getting dessert! The portions of the desserts were very small, and that surprised us at first. Once we tasted each one, we knew why they were small. The desserts were SO amazingly sweet and rich, we could only handle a little bit of them! I think that's why the portions come smaller. The custard was just phenomenal with the caramel and the cake literally tasted like (and had the consistency of) chocolate fudge. Heck, I'll go as far to say that this place is worth a trip just for the dessert alone! Yes, it was THAT good. Our server packed up our leftovers (we had paella leftovers - we ate all the desserts!) and gave us our bill. For everything that we had there and the excellent service we received, it was a very reasonable price - $80 for tapas, the entrée, 2 sangrias/person, plus dessert!

I will most DEFINITELY be coming back here soon!

pics.caption: Smorgasbord of desserts--all delicious but the Butterscotch Custard is my favorite!

review.des:
This place is perfect for dinner out with friends. I have been here for birthdays, work, family, and girls night out dinners. Always a hit.

First off the ambiance is great. It's trendy and a lively, maybe a little too loud for grandma. You can get dressed up or show up in jeans and a comfy old T-shirt and fit in just fine.

The menu is small plates and is best shared.  The staff is great at making suggestions both about specific dishes and the number you need for the size of your group.

Definitely get the bacon-wrapped dates. Huge hit, even for people who aren't sure they like dates. The paella is good for groups but I'd skip it if it's just two people because there are other things I like more. Obviously get a pitcher of sangria.

This place is popular so definitely make a reservation. I have come here without one and sat at the bar, but I called ahead of time.

I used to be a regular here when I lived in the neighborhood. It's been about a decade since I've dined here. Yeah I still like it, but maybe more for nostalgia. The quality of the food seems to have lost something I've the years. By no means is it bad, but I remember something a bit more special.

I loved the idea of making your own Bloody Mary at the bar. Everything is setup for you at the bar. They bring you a glass of vodka on ice and the rest is up to you. Tapas for brunch is not something I'm accustomed to having because I love breakfast and I don't like to share my food. I tend to be a picky eater. But this place changed my mind about it because I enjoyed everything we ordered. Food is great and the patio side of the restaurant is nice. I believe the roof of the patio opens, but it was not nice enough that day to see it I guess.

I came this past Halloween for the first time, because on past trips to Chicago this place was always packed with a wait time of over an hour. This time I came on a Thursday and made sure to make a reservation! It was pretty busy so it's understandable that our server didn't come around as often as we wanted her to when we kept adding orders...

I wish I came with a bigger group so I could have tried more things on the menu, but 6 tapas for 4 people was plenty for us already. I was pretty obsessed with their roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette (so juicy and flavorful...did not even know I could like dates), meatballs with sherry tomato sauce (I love meatballs, and don't think sherry tomatoes are anything special, but whatever they did with this combo made it so delicious), and spicy potatoes with tomato alioli (just all kinds of amazing, definitely fancier than your regular home fries lol). The other things didn't wow me just because of my personal preferences (not crazy about blue cheese, goat cheese, or seafood). Feast your eyes on these pics from our meal:

pics.caption: Grilled salmon, basil-arugula pesto, charred tomatoes

review.des:
¡Caramba! Glad we chose Cafe Ba-Ba-Ree-Ba! for brunch today while in the city.

While it looks deceptively small from the outside, you'll find that the space goes back...and back...and back some more, and then to the side into another big dining room. In a city where it can be hard to find a seat for brunch, they welcomed us with open arms at prime brunch time: no wait, yay!

This is a tapas place, so as long as you don't mind sharing you can choose a bunch of things and have a taste of each. It works well with two diners; not quite sure how it goes for tables of eight (such as the noisy one that arrived halfway through our meal.)

At brunch time you can choose from the Brunch or Lunch menus, but there so many tempting things among the Brunch options that we just held fast. As two people with inquisitive appetites, we ordered bits of this and that and it was pretty uniformly great.

In (roughly) order of fave to least fave:

- Let me start by mentioning the bread at the beginning of the meal: crusty, toasted and served with butter and marmalade. Starting the meal with this assured good things in the future...but don't fill up too much because there's more to come!!

- Citrus French Toast with Goat cheese butter and honey. This was a wonderful amalgam of flavors: sweet citrus against the tang of the goat cheese, all smoothed over with a drizzle of honey. Delicious!!

- Bacon-wrapped dates. This is a tapas classic, and it's not hard to see why. These tiny morsels combine the best qualities of smoky and sweet.

- My dining partner got the mini Cubano, which he adored; I had a bit of the meat, but pork just isn't my favorite thing.

- Waffle-battered Chicken Stick. This is seemingly a chicken sausage stick; some sort of sausage at least was encased by the sweet batter. Sounded like it was going to be a version of chicken and waffles; ended up being more of a Spanish corn dog.

- The traditional Spanish rice dish paella was spicy with chorizo and studded with veggies. I avoided the poached egg, so he got to enjoy its combo of fluffy white and oozing yolk himself.

- Spinach and artichoke crepe. This was spinach-heavy but also filled with mushrooms and cheese. Yum.

- Bacon mac and cheese. Thin but delicious cheesy sauce, with strips of crisp bacon on top. Tasty though paled compared to other things.

- Surprisingly, the thing I liked least was a dish I usually love: shrimp and grits. Their spin used chorizo-flavored polenta in place of the grits (I should mention that this menu is loaded with chorizo in general, so if you don't care for sausage your options are somewhat limited.) The shrimp were what is described as "Spanish baby ghost shrimp," which turned out to be half-inch-long minnow-looking things. The tiny pinpoint black eyes on each is clearly visible, which disturbed me somewhat. Tasted okay, but would not order again.

Daniel, our server, was friendly, explained things well, and checked up on us so we could order more. Also a shout-out to the tireless bussers who whisked away the tiny used plates with speed and refilled water frequently but unobtrusively.

The restaurant is moody with dark wood, but the bathrooms were weird: industrial stainless steel with almost no light in the stalls!

Overall though, this was a thoroughly enjoyable meal. ¡Arriba! Let's go again!

Great food and much less crazy crowded than other tapas places.   I like their sangria pitchers (good prices too).  I wouldn't call this 100% authentic Spanish tapas, but the food is all very well prepared and serves a variety of tastes.

This place is our absolute favorite Spanish tapas restaurant hands down!!! We live way out in the burbs but every time we're in the area, we always make a stop here. My faves are the baked goat cheese, the dates, plato de la casa, EVERYTHING!! is delish!!

I love this place! The food and drinks are great!!

It is reasonably priced but make sure that you make a reservation - this place is busy all the time.
The paella is to die for, and the tapas were all amazing. On a Friday it was very loud, crowded, and disorderly, but still a good night.

Lame. Food is average at best. We ordered several plates and all were ok, but just that. Service is slow, everything took time, even the beverages. On top of these, the place smells all the time. We got out with our clothes and hair smelling. Bad experience overall, I can't recommend this place.

My wife and I ate at Ba Ba Reeba before attending a concert at "The Riv" (aka stinky shit hole).  We have eaten at BABAReeba before, but we were really rushed and I wasn't addicted to Yelp at the time, so this is my first review...

We ate at like 4 PM, so the place was empty.  We sat by the windows in the bar and it was cold as hell.  The server was the bartender and he was kinda meh, and was gone for significant swatches of time.  So whatever, it was between shifts so I figured we would get B- service, no big deal.

We ordered several items from the tapas menu.  They were all great.  I would rate Baba as my third favorite tapas resaurants behind Meson Sabika (#1) and Bien Trucha (#2).  

We had a pleasant experience and it was the beginning of a great weekend!

Got one of the "pinxos" which actually means tapas in Euskara (Basque language) - so don't BS me with your marketing lol --- got the Iberico chorizo one...lackluster and they really put an American spin on tapas and chisel you, it was literally a toothpick with a slice of chorizo...unbelievable

-Then we got the spicy potatoes - those were good for potatoes
-The beef short rip - pretty good I guess
-The fried calamari - yeaaaah, nothing special there
-And the famous chicken thighs - give me a f'ing break, it was like grocery store frozen chicken that you serve to your unhealthy kids because you're too tired to cook after work
-....oh an for dessert we had the chocolate truffle cake --- tapas size!?!? Get outta here!

And the service....the epitome of an American experience. Rushing you out of the restaurant. Literally every 7-10 minutes was, "Is everything alright?" and when we weren't even done she was pushing the dessert, we were taking our time talking, kept coming back, like 3-4 times to ask if we were ready. I almost asked her if she wanted us to leave. It's like, please let us enjoy our company with each other and talk after a long day, I'll call you when I'm ready, please go away! *sigh*...so it goes...but I won't be going back. Tapas in the USA is a gimmick!

Definitely the best tapas place I have been to in Chicago. The sangria on tap is always fresh. The wait is usually around 2 hours, but you can generally find a spot at a high top table or the bar and avoid the long lines.

Hosted our engagement party here a couple months ago and it was a great experience! Alison, the event coordinator, was great to work with. The food was fantastic, the drinks were flowing and the decor/lighting at the restaurant was great for a dinner-time event! Our party had a decent number of vegetarians and everyone left full, happy and grabbed leftovers. Definitely coming back for dinner again soon!

Overrated - but good dessert.

The food came out incredibly fast, all at once and on top of that it was all cold.

The octopus was overlooked, probably the worst I have had in the city.

I will say the atmosphere is great especially on the patio area when you walk in to the left.

And the desert was great!

Came for happy hour and loved it! Bar seating can get tight but the atmosphere is lively an fun so we didn't mind waiting.
Jug of sangria + bites of perfectly layered tapas + good conversation = great evening! We'll be back.
Very lovely cafe with amazing Spanish tapas! I especially love the yogurt served here. It is different from normal yogurt and more like cream and not too sweet.
Always on the hunt for tapas where ever I go. Traveling to Chicago and heard about the spot from locals. Delicious, great atmosphere and very attentive staff. Grab some chorizo!
Food are tasty but a bit oily. We got octopus, calamari, bacon and dates, steak, spicy potato. Dimly lit nice interior.

I had heard great things about this place and happened to end up there for dinner during happy hour on my first visit. The happy hour menu was an incredible deal - each small plate was only $2-3 and we got a pitcher of sangria for $16. All of the tapas were great with the bacon wrapped dates, ham and chicken croquettes, meatballs, and beef empanada most notable. They also have pretty decent bread and olive oil at the table as well which is a nice touch.

To top it all off, every staff member we interacted with was extremely nice and added to the enjoyment of the meal. Definitely recommended.

As LEYE restaurants go... meh.  It wasn't bad. But it wasn't what I've come to expect from that brand either.

In fact, they brought us one wrong dish, a misunderstanding, but since our server didn't come by for at least 10 minutes, we just ate the wrong one at that point.

We had paella, which was alright (we had seafood one)...  The manchego mushrooms were ok, but not special. Our friends liked the short rib a lot. We ordered about 16 things and most were just not noteworthy.

The best dishes we had? Octopus, burrata, and nope, those were the best two  I'm in no hurry to go back. I don't discourage people, especially if they're tapas (or sangria) fans --  but if you're just looking for something that lives up to the hype for a special event? This isn't it..

Yum! Went here for an anniversary dinner with my wife and loved the variety and subtle gorgeous flavors of the offerings. Once of those places that you walk into and can tell just by the smell that it's outstanding.

Go here! Reservations are highly recommended, quite possibly required since we couldn't get a table for 2 days on Opentable. Once in however, we were in awe of all the well plated dishes. I still crave the food we explored. It was worth the trip outside the loop to enjoy a laid back eclectic vibe. It was a bit noisy but this seemed to be a popular place for group eating. There were 2 parties going on around us.. so much fun!
Excellent food and atmosphere. Went to celebrate my birthday and had a fantastic time!

After a long time away, I came back to Ba-Ba-Reeba recently and remembered how much I loved it.  This place has an amazing array of tapas and the bacon-wrapped dates are basically the best thing you can put in your mouth.

In fact, I was about to ratchet my review up to five stars but...

The place is always packed, which means reservations are a must, especially on weekends.  And that means your food can be strangely slow arriving to your table.  The patatas bravas (spicy potatoes) are out of this world... but why were they the last thing served?  They're the kind of thing you want as a side item, not as a dessert.

Also, we showed up on a night when they were offering boar.  It was crazy delicious.  But... the waitress failed to notify us that those two small slices of boar cost $18.  WHAT?  That's more than double most of their normal dishes.  And I could've gotten an entire large pizza for that amount.  We wouldn't have ordered it if we'd known.

Yes, Ba-Ba-Reeba has amazing and tasty delights.  But there are enough drawbacks to make it the kind of place you only visit twice a year, tops.

Love Ba Ba Reeba so much, it's one of the few places I'll go to over and over.  

Great ambiance for various settings. Good for both group outings and dates.  This place is also a great option for vegetarians and pescetarians.  I definitely recommend the patatas bravas, the tortilla espanola, the citrus cured salmon, the peppers, and stuffed mushrooms.

I'm not a sangria fan but every time I've gone the people I was with liked it.

Definitely make a reservation if you can, we waited 2 hours.

Tapas galore! Café Ba-Ba-Reeba is as fun as the name sounds; with its festive Spanish décor, flamenco music, and flavorful foods. I went here for a much needed girls' night the other weekend and it was a great experience. We got a pitcher of red sangria (naturally) and thoroughly enjoyed it. I also tried a taster of the pear sangria which would be perfect as a refreshing summer drink.

For food, I think few tapas places rival Café Ba-Ba-Reeba in terms of the variety. At other tapas places I feel like there is too much of an emphasis on heavy meat and cheese laden dishes but not so at Café Ba-Ba-Reeba. There are tapas for everyone, whether you're vegetarian, dairy free, gluten free, etc, you will be able to find something on their menu. That being said, we tried a bit of everything: spicy potatoes, short rib, sautéed vegetables, smoked salmon, and more. My favorite by far was the smoke salmon- it was so light and bursting with flavor. Our server was great and very helpful when making menu suggestions. She explained that the menu at Café Ba-Ba-Reeba changes often, but the smoked salmon always stays on, and now I know why!

I would highly recommend Café Ba-Ba-Reeba as a restaurant to go to for pretty much any occasion; you'll enjoy the food and the friendly atmosphere as well.
Food is really delicious but the prices are too high. I left feeling still hungry but not wanting to drop more $ here.
Another successful let us entertain you restaurant. It is great. Huge restaurant full of people.Like the sangria.
Thoroughly enjoyable brunch. We got a bit of everything and it was quite affordable. I thought tortilla española and the short rib bocadillos were fantastic.
Was visiting Chicago and went here on the recommendation of a local. Impeccable service and delicious food, loved the sangria. Great environment for a date or just a night out with friends.

This place is definitely one of my favorites, I have not had a bad dish at this restaurant. The meats have always been juicy and tender and nothing has ever been dried out or over/under cooked.

I came here for my 3rd time over the weekend. We had a half pitcher of their blackberry raspberry sangria and their seasonal blood orange sangria. Both were a great combination of fruity and just a little tart. We had the flank steak, spicy potatoes, beef tenderloin & blue cheese, and my favorite the chicken paella. *Note - order the paella first because it takes awhile!* We also had some desserts which were perfect small plates (what else would it be?) so we got to try a few and they did not disappoint.

Great atmosphere, quiet and romantic!

As a side note - make sure you make reservations a little in advance. This place packs up FAST and I usually make mine about 2 weeks out for a Saturday night.

It is amazing how a brief phone call with the" Manager on Duty" at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba changed 7 years of wonderful meals and experiences at Cafe BA-BA-REEBA to such strong dislike that I will never again go to this restaurant.

I called on Jan 11 to cancel a reservation for January 27 (made on Jan 1) and was told my credit card was already charged and there were no cancellations permitted, End of story- no cancellations!

How can a restaurant charge me 16 days before I eat the meal? I was never told there were no cancellations permitted and i called to cancel more than 2 weeks before the date of the reservation,

Pros: very reasonably priced tapas, great choices, great sangria, very large space and great atmosphere.

Cons: it's a popular spot so the wait time can be over an hour during busy periods. However, there's a bar you can grab a drink at while waiting.

I went to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! with a fun group of 14 people.  But I can't rate a restaurant based on the fact that my family is pretty darn awesome.  Sorry, CBBR.

Our waiter was friendly and patient with our large group.  But one there are a few things I've learned from doing tapas with large groups:  Someone needs to take charge of the group, or everyone needs to chose 1-2 dishes, AND there mustn't be any picky eaters in the group.  CBBR is good for groups, even large groups, but without some guidelines and willingness to try different foods, there will be chaos.

I'll detail what we ate and drank, but here's a spoiler alert:  I think CBBR is just okay, and I'm not likely to return.

The Passion Fruit Sangria was good, but the Raspberry Sangria was pretty bad.  Once you mix vodka into wine, I don't think you can really call it sangria anymore.  I would've liked the fruit flavor to come from a fruit puree, or a schnapps/liquor before a flavored vodka.

The complimentary bread and olive oil was a great way to satisfy our grumbling tummies as we waited for food.  If you are ordering paella, understand that it takes about 45 minutes and you must order it right away!

But should you?  Eh, the paella was okay, and I've had better.  We had the seafood as well as the pork paella.  Both had great flavor, but the meat portion was skimpy, resulting in very disappointing dishes.

My favorite tapa of the evening was the Cured Salmon.  Salmon, capers, cream, and pickled cucumbers - yum!  I also really liked the spicy potatoes.

The bacon wrapped dates and baked goat cheese were also very good, but these are pretty much like "Tapas 101," and I can't act like those two dishes make CBBR stand apart from any other tapas restaurant.

The stuffed mushrooms were bland, flavorless, and hardly what I'd call "stuffed."  The octopus was horrible - it was burnt.  I spit it into a napkin!

The desserts are so cute and perfect for only $3 - you get a few bites without overstuffing yourself.  I had the dark chocolate crema which was like a thick pudding.

The set-up of the restaurant could be better.  Parking in the area isn't impossible.  We arrived shortly after 4:30 on a Saturday and got a spot on Halsted ($2/hour with a 3 hr max).  Otherwise, valet is available for $13.

Inside the restaurant, tables are too close together, probably so they can pack 'em in whenever possible.  The chairs were uncomfortable - I don't think I've EVER said that about a restaurant.  There was nowhere to put my purse, and since it is winter and the floors were wet and muddy, I didn't want to put my purse on the floor.  I tried to stick my purse between two chairs in a dry spot, but the waiter kicked my purse every time he came to the table.

I'd recommend reservations.  By the time we left around 7:00 p.m., it was a full house.  It is a little bit noisy in here, but I was able to hear my dining companions up to 3-4 seats down the table without shouting.  

Each couple ended up spending about $35/person after several paellas, tapas, and sangria.  I can't say I was impressed.

I have dined in at Ba-Ba-Reeba several times, and I would say in general dining in is a 3.5 stars experience--it is loud and service is sometimes inattentive, but it is fine overall.

However, I just ordered delivery for the first time and was very disappointed. I live less than a mile away, but the food arrived cold and the scallops were way overcooked. Not palatable. I ended up making myself a salad from stuff I had in the refrigerator, which I could have done without spending almost $40 on Grubhub.

Go in person or order elsewhere.

Came here because of the raving reviews. However the food was lackluster.

We ordered the octopus, but it came out burnt. The service was good in that the server came out with another plate right away, but the second plate was still semi-burnt. We also tried the seafood paella. It was good, but not the best I've had. The rice was soft and crunch at the same time, but I wish we had more seafood and more flavoring.

Tip: check in and get the free dessert. The banana dessert was definitely the highlight of the meal.

Overall good service and good dessert, but the food overall was uninspiring.

pics.caption: The banana dessert was absolute delicious - definitely the highlight of the meal.
Seafood paella - could be more flavorful.

review.des:
A sanctuary of scrumptious Spanish small plates! We had a great time here catching up with friends while trying lots of new dishes, and some drinks as well. Given the atmosphere (and great wine selection), this is also a good destination for a romantic date.

My first tip is to hold back on the bread basket and wait for the tapas to roll in - you'll find plenty of dishes with sauces to sop up. Save the bread for that.

We started with the pinxtos platter, which is basically six different 'bites' and a good way to satisfy different tastes at the table (though you may all end up fighting over your favorite). We also ended up ordering about two tapas per person and skipping the paella since we wanted more flavor than 'filler' and I was quite happy with that decision.  Just the perfect amount of food.

Hits: the stuffed mushrooms were incredible (and the creamy, cheesy, garlicky sauce is one of the best reasons to hold onto your bread bits). We also all LOVED the scallops a la plancha and - surprisingly - the Brussels sprout salad (even the guys scarfed that one up).

No misses at all, but I'd recommend against what I think was called the market greens salad - mostly because it wasn't 'special' - you could totally make that at home or get it anywhere.

Service was friendly, fast and knowledgeable. Our server recommended the Juan Gil red wine for me and I absolutely fell in love with it. The hostesses were also very helpful, and speaking of that - get a reservation or call-ahead!  The waitlist is often two hours long, but you can get your name in early; they start making their list at 6pm.

One of my favorite Tapas restaurants.

Everything is wonderful on their menu. If you are looking to try something different:
Garlic potatoes and brussel sprout salad are the BOMB!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago; definitely the best Tapas. The food is excellent and service has always been consistent during my many visits. Getting a reservation on the weekend is often difficult, and the noise level can be a little out of hand at times but the food is definitely worth it.

Recommendations: Sangria (the specials are often the best), Pintxos Platter (gives you a little taste of everything... definitely a good choice if you've never been), spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, **beef tenderloin and blue cheese, grilled squid with olive oil and garlic.

Selection alone makes this worth a try, of the 6 pintxos and 5 dinner tapas and 5 dessert tapas, I can honestly say I enjoyed them all. My favorite was probably the short rib. We ordered all of the above for two people and it was really too much. They suggest 2-3 per person and I agree. Be prepared for a leisurely meal, I liked that they didn't bring all the tapas at one time, but it did make the dining experience long. I thought the staff was great, really quick to clear plates making room for more. Had a good cocktail selection and a reasonable beer list. Would like to come back next time I'm in town.

I've been wanting to go here for a while but it's a bit out of the way (purple line to red line to brown line) so it wasn't until yesterday that I finally made it out with a friend (and fellow food fanatic).

Ordered:

- 2 servings of paella valenciana (basically paella with a shitload of pork): don't eat this if you're dieting, don't like meat, or are scared of grease. It was delicious and flavors were extremely rich and fatty, but it was literally swimming in grease and there was complete meat overload. Best paella I've had taste-wise, but left me feeling extremely thirsty and a bit guilty afterwards.

- chilled seafood salad with shrimp, scallops, and calamari: Yum! I love seafood and I love citrus, so this was a great dish for me. Came with a decently generous portion of seafood, and the citrus marinade was great as well.

- shrimp with garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes: pretty good. Flavors were solid but nothing extraordinary (tasted kinda like shrimp with butter and garlic).

- Fried calamari: Typical calamari.

- mini caramel almond tart: absolutely heavenly. Extremely thick, caramel-y goodness. Not for those who can't handle really sweet things.

Meal comes with free bread, and I was able to avoid stuffing myself with bread. BUT I did try a couple bites and it had a subtle, tangy flavor that I really liked. Friend also ordered the peach sangria. Tried a sip and it was good - didn't taste overwhelmingly of alcohol. She also ordered the caramelized banana for dessert and it was great as well.

Biggest complaint is the pricing. Spent almost $40 per person, and although the food was good, I wouldn't say it was worth that price.

Tip: check in for a free dessert tapa!

Babareeba is my favorite Tapas restaurant. The food here is always consistently delicious and the staff is awesome.

My first experience with Baba was in 2000. Wow! So long ago and I've been coming back ever since. I've tried some of the other popular Chicago Tapas restaurants such as Emilio's and Iberico and they don't compare in terms of taste, ambiance or even service. Not to mention that Babareeba has an awesome happy hour every day that is a steal.

I'll surely be back.

One of the better Tapas restaurants I have visited in Chicago.
Spacious inside but always good to make reservations in advance. Service was quick, dishes were being served within 5-10 mins of us ordering them. The red dishes on the menu denote the popular items, paella typically takes 35-45 mins so we didn't bother ordering any.

Started with the Iberico chorizo with shishito peppers and the plate of jamon iberico, the jamon was good but wouldn't order the chorizo dish again.
The Artisanal cheese plate and Meat plate with Serrano ham, salchichon and chorizo were really good.
Meat balls were flavorful and the tomato sauce went well with some crusty house bread.
The Short ribs and Shrimp with garlic dishes were decent too.
Would definitely make another trip back to try some other dishes.

The tapas were excellent! My first time at this location and I will be back. The wait was really long but the server next to the bar greeted us and sat us at the bar tables. The bartender that served us was excellent. He was very knowledgable of the menu and gave great choices . The food came out very quickly to my surprise and was delicious, fresh, and hot. Great place to dine on a date, casual dining, and just hanging out.

Tapas + sangria = PERFECTION. This is the perfect place to go with your girlfriends. You can't really go wrong with any of the tapas but you should definitely order the spicy potatoes! They also have a happy hour everyday at the bar during a specific time with $3 select tapas (they have a pretty decent selection for happy hour including 5-6 different tapas I believe). AND THE SANGRIA!! You must order the sangria (whatever special they have at the time). Beautiful ambiance with string lights as well
Excellent! Joe is great, will guide you to ordering and having a great time! Food very good.

My wife and I goto Cafe Ba Ba Reeba for the seafood piyah!  This is a tapas style restaurant, with a cool mellow vibe. The sangria is a must, the wait is a bit much though, even if you make a reservation be prepared for a wait. Overall good spot for a date
I thought it was a little pricey for what you got...

Wow. This was a great recommendation and I am glad I tried it! It's a tapas place with delicious small plates with enough on it to share. Everything we ordered was amazing. The place was packed with the brunch crowd.

We went ahead and ordered couple of dishes from their brunch menu and some from their dinner menu. We ordered their home-baked french toast that came with blueberries and baked apple slices, and an order of their eggs Benedict with cubed hash from the brunch menu, and then the shrimp served in garlic, olive oil, their highly-raved meatballs, and finally ending it with beef tenderloin with blue cheese plated with chips. Everything came out in a timely manner and one after the other and every single one of the dishes was perfectly seasoned and cooked. I was tempted to try their Bloody Mary because they have a Bloody Mary bar, but I wasn't brave enough to create my own. Maybe next time I'll give it a shot.

All in all, it was great start to a year, and the service started and ended with a smile and politeness.

This place is incredible. Always great service, great food, great sangria. I recommend the potatoes with spicy aioli, the short rib, and butterscotch custard for dessert. John was the best sever I ever had here - very attentive and walked us through the menu. If you can, make a reservation because it gets busy even on the weeknights.

I remember going here for a 7th grade spanish field trip. 8 years later, my taste buds never forgot the taste of the delicious food at Cafe Ba Ba Reeba!!

I couldn't wait to try this place out again. I have been raving about it to all my friends whenever they ask me if I know any good Tapas places. This place is always at the top of my list.

RECOMMENDATIONS:
-Patatas Bravas: has a slight kick to it, and comes with a very tasty sauce which complements the potatoes.)
-THE CHORIZO WRAPPED DATE AND CHEESE: Seriously. Get this. It is part of the pintxos platter, but honestly just order 3 of these babies (2 per plate) and taste buds will thank you and you will thank me.

Other things I tried:
Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce: So I saw many people on here recommending this so I gave it a shot. Unfortunately, it didn't make my list of must-haves. It sort of reminded me of garlic bread dipped in Ragu spaghetti sauce, with a hint of goat cheese.

Grilled Hanger Steak:
Maybe it was just me getting full, or maybe after eating the potatoes it made this dish taste a bit bland but these were just OK. It came drizzled with a green sauce and a side of chopped potatoes, which were delightful.

Buttermilk Fried Chicken thighs:
The crunch on these oh my. The outside of the chicken was perfect. Just the right consistency. Think buffalo wild wings but with more crunch. It was good, and it also came with a piri piri sauce but it didn't really taste like anything.

Overall, still my fav place to visit. If you check in to yelp you get a free dessert, who doesn't love free?!

The Brunch Tapas menu here is literally the best. I live out in the suburbs and getting brunch at this restaurant is worth the trip. I first went with a group and ordered the peach sangria, the hash, and the Nutella waffles. I was not disappointed. My cocktail was crowned with delicious chunks of fruit, including apples, which I let sit in the cocktail and absorb it for a delicious after cocktail treat. I definitely recommend ordering at least a half pitcher especially if one in your party orders it as well. The buttermilk waffle with marcona almond Nutella and bananas is deep wonderfully balanced and not too sweet. A great dish if you're craving the sweeter side of breakfast. If you're craving the savory side of breakfast I loved the ham hash with vegetables, potatoes and poached egg, it was perfectly seasoned and a great way to start off my meal. 10/10 brunch recommendation. I went back a second time and ordered the same thing. I can't say enough good things about this place. If I had one complaint it would be that the place can get loud if you are seated near large groups.

pics.caption: peach sangria-loaded with fruit and harmonically balanced. Order it and be amazed.
Ham Hash with vegetables, potatoes and a poached egg-a flavor explosion
Buttermilk Waffles with Marcona Almond Nutella and Bananas-delicious if you're craving something light and sweet

review.des:
Yay! Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeeeeeba! I love this place! Some of my favorite items include: the patatas bravas, chicken empanadas, chicken and ham croquettes, braised short rib, and the garlic shrimp. I love the red Sangria as well, one pitcher is good enough for 2 to get a nice buzz on.

I would say this place is great but it is not OMG AMAZING or worth the crazy hype that it gets. It's definitely a fun spot to go with a group of friends because they actually take reservations. It does give off that chain restaurant vibe but it is balanced out with the good food and drinks they offer.

I will be back soon! Love you ba-ba!
I have been to this restaurant a few times. they have great tapas and dishes to share. The only down side about this restaurant is it is very over crowded and the service can be slow.

This place is phenomenal. However,  it is an absolute must that you get reservations before going. The last time we went we did not make reservations, and we ended up waiting an hour and forty five minutes for a table (but that should tell you it's worth it).

The black raspberry sangria is absolutely delicious. The atmosphere is very fun and lively. I love the interior lighting, and although it can get very loud, the candlelit tables and awesome music make the experience enjoyable.

The food is excellent. We have attempted to try as much as possible, and would order about 3 to 4 tapas a person. This would always leave me completely stuffed. Do not skip dessert! The desserts are just as good as the tapas, if not better.

The rundown:

Definites:
- Spicy potatoes with tomato aioli. I can't get enough of this one. My favorite dish.
- Beef tenderloin and blue cheese. Very tasty.
- Chicken and ham croquetas. These almost taste like street food or something from a fair. Very, very good but also a bit heavy.
- Dark chocolate crema with orange marmalade. This dessert is fantastic, but it is only a few bites.
- Butterscotch custard with salted caramel sauce. WOW. This one is delicious. So, so good.

Skip:
-Manchego stuffed mushrooms. Very bland and generic, almost like they come frozen. I've had way better.
-Meatballs with sherry sauce. These were good, but there are much better items on the menu that are way more interesting. I would say this is a "safe" item that everyone will like, but won't be blown away by.

If you are visiting Chicago or already live here, you can't miss Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. I can't wait to go again.

pics.caption: Fried green peppers and coarse black salt.

review.des:
Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is one of my favorite (if not my absolute favorite) restaurants in Chicago! I recommend making a reservation to ensure you get a table, as this place gets packed during peak hours and on weekends. I'm a fan of tapas, and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has some seriously good tapas. I highly recommend the bacon-wrapped dates, the sherry-tomato meatballs, and the garlic-red pepper shrimp! The candle-lit setting with its chatty ambiance and delicious smells from the kitchen make for a fun evening. We love the sangria options, and the sangria-of-the-day is neat since it's always something unique (desert pear, mango, blood orange, etc.). We've never had a server without a smile, and we've never left hungry. They also have a great Happy Hour at both bars from 4p-6p on weekdays and 10p-12a on Friday & Saturday that offers 1/2 price sangria and very, very discounted tapas dishes!

TIP: Join Lettuce Eats! It's a rewards/loyalty program that lets you earn points at Lettuce Eats establishments (including Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba) and gives you $ off your bill once you earn enough points, for your birthday, and for your anniversary!

This is one of my favorite places in the city! Although it's usually packed and you may have to wait over an hour without a reservation, it is definitely worth it. I have been here so many times that I have gotten a chance to try almost everything on the menu, and I have yet to find something I don't like. Their sangrias are also fantastic. The atmosphere is very relaxing and the staff is very nice and attentive. This is my go-to spot for any important dinners or celebrations. Can't wait to go back!
The best restaurant in Chicago. The service is always fantastic and they are great for groups and privatizing rooms.
Sangria and stuffed mushrooms are to die for!!! Service is great and mashed potatoes were amazing

I'm not usually a fan of tapas but this restaurant changed my mind. Thank goodness for opentable.com reservations esp on a Saturday night. We came at 630 PM and they were packed so we waited at the bar for our 730 PM reservation.  Red sangria kept us company and the bar tender even gave us a sample of the sangria del dia.

Right at 730 PM we got a text that our table was ready and the food just kept coming right after we ordered.

Patatas bravas are hot and crispy on the outside but tender on the inside, aioli is perfect (not spicy for my taste.). Goat cheese in tomato sauce is served with buttered toast. Complimentary bread is sliced fresh with a soft inside and crisp crust. Pan con tomate is crisp bread with the perfect amount of tomato but could've used more garlic in my opinion. Shrimp (gambas al ajillo) in olive oil and garlic with red pepper flakes was my favorite. Dip your bread in it!  Seafood paella was just ok but nice that they sub chicken for monkfish. Rioja short rib was delish. Would NOT rec tortilla espanola, although it came out piping hot it was like a round hash brown that was soggy? Calamari was usual.

Butterscotch custard was perfect with caramel sauce, a perfect sweet and salty.

Ambiance was def lively and celebratory (lots of bday celebrations).

Daniel is the BEST waiter ever!

Took my now girlfriend to here for first date.
She loved the food, and so did I.
We held hands for the first time after the meal.
Thanks ba-ba-ree-ba.
We've now been dating for almost 2 years.
We still talk about this place.

Brought my four daughters here for a pre-holiday dinner. Just as in my prior visits here - food is amazing!! Service is fabulous!!! And the pitchers of sangria were delish! Such a fun place to come to with a group to try an array of interesting flavors and tastes! This place is always solid!

I am a fan of tapas, and it being both Easter and my cousin's birthday, I thought it would be fun, so I decided on Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba for our family brunch.

We had a reservation and were seated promptly in the back room (where I worried that we may be neglected), but it was no problem. Our waiter and the bus boys were very attentive, and the pace was good. The only thing we had to ask for constantly was water, because the glasses were so small and a few people in our party were only having water. For larger parties where this is the case, leaving a pitcher of water on the table would be best. (Or at least larger glasses!)

My husband and my mom enjoyed the bloody mary bar ($10 for just one trip), while I tried the special sangria which was blood orange and just OK. ($8).

We enjoyed: the spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms (yummy!), brussel sprout salad (both crunchy and flavorful), beef tenderloin and blue cheese (a definite hit!!), chicken skewer, shrimp in olive oil and garlic, beef benedict, and the seared sea scallops. My daughter loved the chicken empanada, and I was the only one at the table who liked the potato and onion omelet. Of the above listed, the beef tenderloin was definitely a family favorite. We ordered two of those ($11 each), and they were cooked perfectly with the right amount of pink, juicy and tender. My husband is a former chef so he can be hard to please, but he was impressed by the presentation and the demi glazes and other sauces that accompanied the dishes. Most everything was flavorful and appealing to the pallet.

Missing the mark were the scallop empanada (the scallops were buried in all the bread, while the seared scallops were much better), and the grilled flank steak, which was tough. The fingerling potatoes that came with it were good, although that was $9 wasted for such a small, disappointing dish. My cousin also ordered the citrus cured salmon, and was disappointed because it was flattened and thin like paper. Thinner than even smoked salmon usually is, and I think he was expecting a filet, even if it was a tapas-sized one. Yet for our first try, this was not bad.

My husband ordered the veal special and while he was skeptical, it was very tender and cooked to perfection. Our only concern was that it was $17. That's pricey for a small tapas portion!

There was another group seated behind us, and one of the servers gave us their deviled egg by mistake. We ate it before we realized, and we actually would have ordered more if we weren't so overwhelmed by everything else that we had. It was good!

I liked the dessert menu and the fact that those are all $3 each. We got one free dessert for checking in on Yelp, and we ordered another one to sing Happy Birthday to my cousin. We ended up getting that one taken off the bill as well, which was nice. I wanted to try one of their coffees, but decided to wait until next time.

We thoroughly enjoyed our visit, and I'm only deducting one star for a few dishes and some of the priciness. Since it's all tapas, people are going to order a lot anyway, so prices for each item should be reasonable. Our bill was $190 before tip for 5 of us. Now that we know what we like, future trips can be planned a bit better. I see a date night with hubby in our future.

After being in Barcelona, I was happy to check out all my favorite tapas here. It's never going to be exactly the same, but it was pretty close! And delicious! Potatoes bravas, deviled eggs, croquettes, tomato bread...yum! Oh, and don't forget the pitcher of sangria!

Nice place to come for a quick bite after work.

Food is ok. Drinks are ok. I am not too crazy about their food but it's to bad.

prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly.

this is a place to come every now and then when in the neighborhood.

I've been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba a handful of times now and I always leave happy. It's one of the few tapas places that actually serves Spanish tapas. Seems the whole food industry is moving towards small plates but not serving Spanish tapas - just charging more for less food.

Pretty much every time I go to CBBR, I start with the same two dishes. Dates wrapped in bacon and tomato sauce with goat cheese. Yes, I admit, both dishes are incredibly simple, but both are delicious and staples of tapas food. The dates and bacon are heavenly. The goat cheese and tomato sauce is fine, not the best, but i think it's just one of those you have to try.

Then I'll move onto some of the meat dishes. There are plenty and I've tried a great many, but I'll mention a couple. Specifically the rioja-braised short rib, skewered chicken and chorizo, and any of the squid. The skewered chicken and chorizo is especially good because that chorizo as absolutely top notch and it's only in a couple dishes.

This most recent time we also tried the Paella. Wow, definitely getting it again. Order it the moment you sit down because it'll take a while to come out, but man, it's absolutely superb. I'm allergic to shellfish so we got the one with roasted pork, sausage, and pork belly. So much delicious flavor, cooked perfectly.

Wow.  Just.  Wow.  

I've been coming here for years and every time the menu changes it just keeps getting better and better - not many restaurants can say this.

I'll admit - the only thing on the menu that I'm not a huge fan of is the paella but it's still good!  The sangria is the absolute best in Chicago.  The patatas bravas are just heavenly.   Everything from the goat cheese to the bacon wrapped dates are always made fresh and taste amazing every time I come here!     Great vegetarian options as well.   The servers are always very professional and attentive - and personable!

This place has a very unique vibe and they do it well.   Always packed, but this only adds to the very cool atmosphere here.  Make reservations in advance, though!  The music is very cool and the area is very beautiful.  

I bring friends here all the time and they become obsessed with this place.  The day this places closes will be a very sad day indeed for Chicago.
The bacon wrapped dates were delicious. & the sangria was GREAT. everything we had was great.

This restaurant is one of our favorite spots in town. You can can come for a casual bite, spend a small amount and walk away satisfied OR you could come for an extravagant meal, spend a bit more and walk away brimming, fat and happy! We can for an extra special night and took the extravagant route! ;)
We started with the half pitcher of the classic sangria for $17. It was the perfect amount for us...and so delicious! If you are a sangria fan, you have to try it here!
We ordered six tapas and loved each and everyone. From the veggies and appetizer section we had the Brussel sprout salad and the spicy potatoes. I preferred the Brussel sprout salad because it was so finely chopped, lightly drizzled with oil and enhanced with sweet almonds. My partner preferred the spicy potatoes with the spicy tomato aioli. It was a perfect split for the two of us, but we enjoyed both! From the beef section we ordered the short rib and we ordered the fried calamari from the seafood section. The short rib was decadent, flavorful and heavenly tender. I could have eaten five of them, they were so good. The fried calamari were also good, but the mixture of the red Fresca salsa and cream sauce was the highlight of the dish! From the pork menu we ordered the assortment of cured pork meats and olives as well as the dates wrapped in bacon. The cured meats were a great starter and way to try some of the restaurants house cured meats. The dates, however, were my favorite dish. Paired with a sweet vinaigrette and apples, it was simply to die for!
We ended the evening with the $3 dessert a.) because they are only $3 and b.) because Yelp checkin provides a free dessert tapa! Perfect! We both got the chocolate truffle which was amazing! However, it was sooo sweet that I had to give half of it to my partner. But he loved it!
We walked away with all of that food for a decent price. The servers were great, the ambience was warm/inviting and the service was quick. All this to say, we can't wait for the next excuse to return!

I am in love with this place.  This was one of my first tapas experiences and it was great.  All the sangria is excellent as I split all of the flavors with my date.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  Some of the best things- the baked goat cheese, the spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, the beef empanada and the beef skewer.  I wish I could have tried everything but you know, money.  This is the perfect place to have a fun night out with friends or a date as well.

Cute and interesting tapas bar with great food and drinks. It seems to be a very popular place with almost all the tables and bar full. Service was a little slow but it was also busy. Overall quite pricey for what you get.

Amazingly delicious food! I always get the spicy potatoes, bacon wrapped dates, meatballs, and shrimp. The sangria is delicious too! Any one you choose won't let you down. The wait staff if so attentive, not just the waiters. I've been there countless times and I'm never let down.

This review is for their catering / party event coordinating. I went to their website and registered for someone to call me to schedule an event for a corporate Christmas party. This was two weeks ago and till this day no one has contacted me. I left both a landline number and a cell phone number.

Whoever is in charge of their events planning is not doing their job. So if you're looking to plan an event and go to their website to register for someone to call you, no one will. That was my experience.

As far as the food it is pretty good. Again this rating and review is for their event coordinator and not for in dining.

This place is sooo good! It's a little expensive but everything is so delicious. The spicy potatoes (not sure what they were called) were soooo good. The dessert were amazing! We got 4 desserts and everything was awesome. Overall awesome experience. I will note that it's extremely busy in there and the tables are pretty close together.

I can't say enough about this place. I've had dinner here twice with friends and will be coming back again & again. The staff is friendly and attentive, the sangria is amazing, the menu is broad and diverse and the food is consistently incredible. It's a great casual atmosphere and surprisingly affordable (our group of four had several small plates and a pitcher of mango sangria for just over $100).

Also, I could eat those bacon-wrapped dates until I pass out.

I came here on a Thursday night with an old friend of mine. The average wait was fourth five minutes to an hour but the bar seating was immediate. The only difference from what I saw was that the bar area lacked natural light. However, it had a really nice date ambience with the candles and dim lighting. We of course sat at the bar tables.

We started off with the white peach sangria which was amazing. Not too sweet and perfect for a hot night. A half pitcher was enough for the two of us. We ordered six dishes. The deviled eggs(5/5), calamari (3/5), cooked salmon with dill (2/5), beef empanadas(5/5), the steak with chimichurri (3/5), and the spicy potatoes (3/5). My favorites were the deviled eggs and the empanadas hands down! The rest were delicious but I'd probably order something else my next time around to try something new.  

The service was a little slow and you had to get the waiters attention at times. But it wasn't enough to put a damper on the night.

Overall, I'd definitely hit this place up again for tapas and delicious sangria!

Popped in here for a great dinner the other night, I heard that it has been here forever.

Delicious food, and sangria's with solid service.

W O W. Having the option to order two to four little plates, not having to choose one thing on a menu filled with mouth watering selections, where have you been my whole life? The service was great, the mango sangria light and refreshing, the food was delicious. Thank you for the memorable night!

Came here for a Sunday night dinner based on the strength of the restaurant's Yelp reviews. Was surprisingly underwhelmed by the food, restaurant, and service.

Food: This is a classic tapas place - nothing new, nothing different. Very solid menu but it lacks inventive dishes. To boot, I don't think the flavors or ingredients were that good. The paella was extremely salty, the sauteed shrimp tasted like frozen shrimp from Trader Joes, and the brussel sprouts were a snooze.

Restaurant: The space is huge. I read that CBBR is romantic and intimate - I couldn't disagree more. Feels like you're in a cave packed with other diners

Service: Mixed bag. Our waitress and the seating hostess were very nice, but the busboys were the complete opposite. Dropped baskets of bread on our table, never refilled our water glasses, unhelpful when asked if he could help us track down our waitress.

SO SO SO SO SO SO GOOD!
Would definitely recommend.
the menu was explained to us and we loved everything we tried (you NEED to try the bacon-wrapped dates).
We went for a dinner date and had a great time.

I love Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! The food is great (brunch AND dinner); the service is fantastic; the ambiance is neat, and the sangria is perfect. Not a lot more you can ask for in a restaurant! It's a blast to go here with a group of friends, because you can try a lot of food and share pitchers of the different kinds of perfect sangria.

Menu highlights:
- bacon wrapped dates
- Goat cheese and tomato sauce
- Spicy potatoes with aloili
- Grilled octopus
- Scallops
- Sea food paella (One of my low moments from 2015 was leaving my leftover container of this on the table.)

I've been coming here for over 10 years now, even through different ownership, this place has been able to withstand the test of time. The ambiance is cozy, comfortable and chatty - a great place to go on a date or simply to grab a bite with friends. After coming here for so many years there's a standard list of things I always order: Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli, Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce,  Roast Dates with Bacon & Apple Vinaigrette, and Chicken & Ham Croquetas. The rest are always fun to try!

P.S. If this place could bring back the creme brulee from years ago that'd be great.

Excellent!! Our service was friendly and efficient. The food was so good and moderately priced. We tried the spicy potatoes (awesome), the fried green peppers (weird, but tasty), the Brussels sprout salad (best salad I've ever had), and the tomato bread(my personal favorite!). We will return again!!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba (CBR) is one of our go to restaurants when we want to eat Tapas. We were celebrating my son's birthday last Saturday and made reservations online thru Open Table. This restaurant gets SUPER busy, even at 5:30 pm, so be sure you make reservations. Parking is permit only in the neighborhood and there is no garage. CBR does have a valet service for $13. Totally worth it, Lincoln Park is super busy on the weekend and it's very hard to find street parking.
We began our evening with cocktails; they offer many flavors of Sangria. I usually order 1/2 a pitcher of red wine Sangrias. You get about 3 full glasses from 1/2 a pitcher. It's more economical than individual glasses. CBR also offers full pitchers. My sons ordered a margarita and a mojito. We discovered that many places offer a mojito but there is an art to actually making a good mojito, CBR fell short on this mojito. Not mixed correctly. Margarita was fine.
Tapas is a great way to try several dishes with your companions. Tapas are appetizer sized portions of Spanish dishes and arrive at your table in no special order. We usually start off with 2 per person, keep a menu handy and order more as the night progresses. We've been to CBR a few times and have tried pretty much everything on the menu and have been happy with taste, quality and quantity. If you order the paella, allow some extra time for it's preparation.
Our waiter, busboy and servers were very efficient, even thought the restaurant was packed! They never forgot about us and were quick to refill our water glasses, clear dishes and bring new dishes to our table.
When making the reservation on Open Table I did note that we would be celebrating my son's 22nd Birthday but, no complimentary dessert was offered to him :(.
Note: The noise level does get loud due to the high ceilings, kinda hard to hear your diner companions sometimes.

pics.caption: I say "YES" to a pitcher a Red Wine Sangria!
Sorry this tapas is all mine! Generous slice of smoked salmon with lots of capers.

review.des:
This is by far one of the best tapas places in Chicago! Located in the vibrant Lincoln Park area, it is only a short walk from the CTA brown line. Although parking can be hard to come by depending on how busy the time of the day is, you might get lucky scoring street parking on one of the side streets.
The prices and portions of Café BabaReeba's foods are quite good. Note that it is a tapas place and hence most items are small portions and are meant for sharing. Please be sure to come with a few friends so that you can make the most of your experience by trying a bunch of different items without breaking bank. And given the wide variety of food offered here, it is well worth trying a handful of different items.
These items are probably my go-to, all time favorites:-
Chorizo-Wrapped Medjool Date & Cheese  Perfect combo with the date bringing the sweetness and chorizo bringing the bold richness.
Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli  MY FAVORITE!!! So, so good!!
Spinach & Manchego-Stuffed Mushrooms  Light but delicious veggie item.
Grilled Hanger Steak  I got mine medium rare and it was done just perfect! So juicy and tasty.
Seared Lamb Loin  Seared to perfection. Meat was super tender.
Seared Sea Scallops  This was excellent! Perfectly seared but soft and juicy on the inside.
Grilled Octopus  Typical but delicious.
Skewered Chicken & Chorizo Sausage  A good filler as the meat helps curb your appetite especially if you're there to try a bunch of stuff but not stuff yourself.
This is truly an amazing option for tapas (and note that their sangrias are pretty freaking awesome too) - I can't wait for my next visit =)

I really enjoy this wonderful Sevilla style restaurant. It's got the whole package: delicious food, great sangria, terrific service and very nice Spanish ambiance. Haven't found a tapas I didn't like here as all of the dishes are carefully prepared and high quality. Try the patatas bravas, croquettas, tortilla (it's like an omelette), and dates wrapped in bacon...oh, just try them all, they're all good.
Check in on Yelp and get a free small desert. The butterscotch pudding with a salted caramel sauce I had was delicious!

Hands down, one of my favorite place in the city! There's not much to say that hasn't already been said: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is amazing and there's plenty on the menu for everyone.  As many of other people have already said, the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce is incredible and I get it every single time.  The stuffed mushrooms are also to die for. I usually get one or two of the seafood options, and have have never been disappointed.  One word of caution: the spicy scale can vary quite a bit...some things labeled as spicy don't have much heat, while other will leaving you pounding your sangria down too fast. (Side note: get the sangria...all the sangria!)

While the ambiance is wonderful (especially the sun room) this place works much better for groups than for dates. Whenever I go with just 1-2 other people the bill is always pretty steep but it's never bad when there's a big group. I had my birthday here this past year, and the service was wonderful, even when it came to taking a bunch of different credit cards. Call to make reservations on open table at least a few days before hand for weekdays, and give even more notice on the weekends.

Fun place for a lively night out. The tapas are very good. I particularly like the tortilla española and patatas brava. Pulpo good as well. Delicious sangria. Outdoor patio is charming. Indoors had energetic vibrant feel. Great place for a group. Fair prices.

A friend of mine has been trying to get me to go here for years, but it wasn't till I got a Lettuce Entertain You gift card that I took the plunge. The hubby, some friends and I decided to go check it out. Half a block away we could already smell the amazing food. We started with a pitcher of peach sangria. Lovely!

One friend got the grilled squid with olive and garlic. I'm not a fan of arugula or tons of garlic, but this dish was perfectly balanced! So yummy. The shrimp skewers and cheese plate were good, though I didn't care for the guava cube or the orange marmalade.

However the absolute BEST thing we had was the shrimp paella. I'd heard of paella, but had never had it. We ordered the smaller portion to split 4 ways, and it was FANTABULOUS! I'm talking lick the plate clean and think about ordering some more...

The server was excellent, keeping tabs on us, but not hovering too much. Also, because there was a Yelp coupon, I got a free butterscotch pudding which was frankly the best I've ever had.

The ONLY problem with Tapas is that its so good and you are having such a good time that is is really easy to rack up a big bill. I will TOTALLY be back again. I had no idea what I was missing.

The wait on a weekend night is loooonng, but well worth it.

We arrived around 7pm on a Saturday night and were told 45 minutes. No big, we hung out by the bar and had a couple of tasty cocktails. By the time our table was ready, I was nice and happy.

Robust, intriguing menu with all kinds of tapas AND a gluten free version! We got:

-Scallops
-Beef kabob
-Chicken curry salad
-Burrata salad
-Short rib w/ mashed potato
-Chocolate flourless cake

Everything was excellent, but my favs were the chicken curry salad and the short rib (and the cake, obvs).

Server was attentive and knowledgeable, complimentary basket o' bread was warm and delicious, and the lighting made everyone look hotter.

Will definitely return!

pics.caption: Burrata, chicken curry salad (best in the Midwest), beef kabob

review.des:
I had a friend in town and he has never been to a tapas restaurant and we were in the area so we found a seat at the bar at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba.  We were served quickly and received all of our small plates as they were ready from the kitchen.  Every plate we received was delicoius - some portions larger than others.  The bartender who was serving us gave us some tips on which items were larger than others!  

I would highly suggest giving this place a try whether its for a girls night out or a romantic date night.
Have always enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates (of course) and red or white sangria. Can't go wrong with eating here, always a great choice.

Thank you Cafe Ba-Ba Reeba for helping my friends and I to host a wonderful baby shower brunch! Michelle Gil was an absolute pleasure to work with during the planning process and couldn't have made things easier. Her excellent, timely communication was very much appreciated.
