Even though we didn't have a huge group, we still received extra special care and attention. Tabitha did an amazing job taking care of our party the day of the shower. I had never been to Ba-Ba Reeba for brunch before and will definitely be back again. All of the brunch tapas options were delicious. If you are looking for a great place to host a party, look no further. Thank you!

I really do love this place, I've been so many times. It is a cute spot, tons of seating with smaller, more intimate rooms. Great sangria, so many flavor options. Bacon wrapped dates, the goat cheese and tomato sauce, curried chicken salad and the ham and cheese croquettess are my favs. That chicken salad is seriously awesome. Plus with Lettuce Entertain you, you always know you will have a great experience. My family also hosted my baby shower here! It was so nice. We had our own private room with exposed brick walls and tons of space. The service was excellent! Always find myself coming back again and again:)

The food is amazing. The service was good. And the prices aren't bad! I went here for my 25th birthday dinner and was very happy when I left. I would recommend making a reservation a week or so in advance to guarantee a table.

If you come here and don't get the bacon wrapped dates, you're doing it wrong.  Seriously, this place tops my list of Chicago tapas spots--it's THAT good.

I've been here on several occasions, in different sized groups, and have never been disappointed.  The service is amazing, and each time the server has made helpful recommendations on dishes to try, amount of food that will be enough, etc.  My favorite dishes include the beef tips, garlic potato salad, paella, and of course, the bacon wrapped dates.  The desserts are adorable little nibbles, just enough to satisfy the sweet tooth after a savory meal.  

The ambiance is boisterous and fun, very lively and entertaining.  The people watching is fantastic, and you won't be disappointed in the fast-paced, exciting operation that Ba-Ba-Reeba boasts.  

This is the perfect date night place, but obviously, since it's tapas, it's amazing for group outings and parties.

I think I've been here and ordered bacon wrapped dates more than any other dish from any restaurant in Chicago. Their sangria is amazing too. I order a pitcher of sangria every time and I don't even like alcohol. I honestly have never eaten a dish I didn't like here though. Besides the dates I definitely recommend the platter, the spicy potatoes, and the calamari.

One warning though: there's always a wait, even on weekday nights. Be prepared to sit at the bar or fight for a high top table if you're hungry.

This place was recommended by a friend and we enjoyed our meal and the experience very much.  The style is Spanish Tapas, and the choices are seemingly endless.  With so many options, we were thankful for a server and a manager who made awesome recommendations.  We started with an appetizer sampler, the highlights being the variety and freshness.  Next up goat cheese in tomato sauce with insanely good croutonish slices of bread.  The cheese was smooth and the sauce was flavorful and hot.  A great blend of textures and elements.  We finished our main meal with the Rioja-Braised Short Rib.  It is served over Manchego mashed potatoes with baby root vegetables & rioja wine glaze.  Some of the best mashed potatoes I've ever had in that dish, and the short rib was tender and juicy.  We finished with a small dessert, the macona almond caramel bar.  2-3 bites of bliss.

I've been here twice - once a while back for a friend's birthday and once recently for dinner before heading to the movies and loved it both times! My friend said a friend of hers isn't a fan of Ba-Ba-Reeba because the tapas aren't authentic, but I say screw authenticity when the food is just so darn tasty! It's a really long wait to get a table without a reservation on the weekend, so I recommend making one in advance or sitting at the bar if your party is small.

DRINKS
Their sangria is so fruity and delicious! I've had their white peach one and the passion fruit and while both were good, I would recommend the white peach. Each glass comes with a ton of fruit and the sangria is super refreshing and not too sweet.

FOOD
My favorite dishes were their seafood ones, specifically the shrimp with garlic, olive oil, and red pepper flakes and the seared sea scallops with leeks, torched oranges, and jamon serrano. The sauce that the shrimp comes in is SO DELICIOUS. Be sure to ask for extra bread, so you can soak up every last drop! The scallops were equally just as delicious and I loved the surprising addition of the torched oranges with all the other components. However, I was really disappointed with the grilled flank steak dish, which was a little dry and tough. Will be sticking to their seafood dishes, which I thought were much better.

DESSERT
If you check in on Yelp, you get a free dessert tapa per person! My friend and I shared the mini ice cream sandwiches and the butterscotch custard and it was the perfect way to end the meal. Each dish was small as expected, but very satisfying. My favorite was the ice cream sandwiches because they had housemade pumpkin ice cream in the middle, which made the little fall-loving girl in me squeal with delight!

Overall, Ba-Ba-Reeba is a great place for small or big groups if you're looking for a fun atmosphere with delicious drinks and many dishes to share! I've also heard that their brunch is bomb, so will also be checking that out in the near future.

We went for restaurant week and had a great time! The sangria is plentiful, creative, and tasty. My favorite thing we tried was the seafood paella-- it's exactly what paella should be: crispy rice, bold flavors, and plenty of shrimp, scallops, and fish. We'll be back!!
delicious! avoided this spot due to popularity and highly regret it.

BRUNCH! I have been here for both brunch and dinner and both experiences were great.

Brunch is one of the best in the city. There are so many breakfast tapas to choose from, as well as the regular menu too.

They have a make your own Bloody Mary bar, which is a meal within itself. They will bring you a glass of your preferred vodka and you go up to the bar and can make it however you like. There is bacon, shrimp, olives, etc.
They also make dank sangria.

The tapas are also exquisite. I would highly recommend the spinach & manchengo stuffed mushrooms and the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce. For brunch, the deviled egg and potato & egg bite are AMAZING!

The tapas are not as small as one would think, so I definitely had a lot to bring home. Also, can be pricey!

I have visited Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba many times!  A great place for a group, a date or just with a friend.  The Paella is awesome and I order it every time along with the Spinach with manchego stuffed mushrooms, beef tenderloin with blue cheese.  Mmmmm
I can also not resist the Sangria.  It is delicious!  Can't wait to go back! :-)

This place was good and my friend was excited to find another fun place in her neighborhood she hadn't been. I know there are many people that hate them, but I am a huge fan of small plates. You get to try a bunch of different food. We tried a bunch of different plates to share which is the way to go. The bacon wrapped dates were a standout. There are so many choices though. If I lived in Chicago I'd have to go back to try different things.

Tip: You can get a free dessert if you check-in with the yelp app which we did.

Love the spicy potato and beef skewer. Spicy potato has a flavor of hummus and chili, for which my friend refer to as Chinese spicy source "Lao Gan Ma".

Nice environment and good neighborhood

I came here for brunch on Sunday (and maybe that was my mistake), but I didn't think the food was that spectacular.  The service was okay, but they were kind of slow and not very friendly or engaging.  We had the sausage-fried paella rice with poached egg, iberico ham hash, beef tenderloin eggs benedict, and grilled octopus.  Nothing special to write home about.

This was my second trip to this wonderful place! We went on valentines night and obviously they were running 30mins behind for people who already had appointments. That caused for a lot of impatient couples, but we were fine! After 30mins we were seated and this wonderful server came to take our orders.

We started off with the bacon wrapped dates, spicy potatoes, goat cheese and short ribs and put in the order for the pork paella. All the tapas were delicious! The short ribs melted in our mouths! When the paella came, it looked a bit burnt but we decided not to say anything. As soon as we started eating, we could definitely taste the burnt rice that were super crunchy and the meats were bitter. I'm not the type of person to send the food back but it was my boyfriend's first time trying tapas and I wasn't gonna let him have this paella! It was already 11:00pm and when the server came we explained the situation. He looked at the paella and was very accommodating on taking it back and offered to whip up another serving. We were already tired and opted for two different tapas - seared spanish sausage and beef skewers. Sausages were on point, but the beef skewer was also very burnt and tasted bitter.

We ate it nonetheless and got the caramelized banana for desert (yay yelp checkin!) The service got slow at the end but it could be due to having too many people? Not sure. But despite the fact we had some delicious tapas and my bf's a fan now so we'll be definitely exploring some different tapas places :)

pics.caption: Goat cheese, short ribs and potatoes!

review.des: love, love, love this place! we visited Spain and I realized how close the food is at Baba Reeba to the actual Spanish tapas. Love their peach sangria!
Loved the open Bloody Mary bar and the food was really good.  The service was fast..and the staff is very friendly

Yum, yum, yum!!

Food comes out fast. Gets really busy on the weekends, so make sure you have a reservation. It's a fun place to take out of town guests.

bacon-wrapped dates. sangria.
I really don't  have to say more than that. Just go there. It's FIVE STARS good.
Happy hour is such a deal. Good food and service. Bacon wrapped dates are to die for.

Absolutely love the food here. It's great for a night out with your friends or on a date!

I have to stay the pitcher drinks are pretty great too.

I'll be for sure coming back

There are many great reasons on their menu, why they are jammed packed every weekend of the year. I love the atmosphere as well as the food and drinks. Its worth coming here for the hearty Spanish style bread alone. Crusty dense and soft inside transport me back to the Iberian peninsula. I could live on this bread. This place and Eatly are neck and neck for best bread in the city. Their imported wood burning oven from Spain in the hands of the cooks here is priceless. Therefore, don't just have the tapas, enjoy some of the perfectly cooked items out of the oven. You won't regret it (for example the tender fall off the bone lamb).  Hands down this place is very worth the splurge!

Cafe Ba-ba-reeba is a crowd pleaser hot spot, great for large groups! The Spanish tapas and flavorful sangrias made for a perfect girls night out/birthday dinner. We did have some issues with reservations and having to wait for a table to clear out for our party of 10 on a Thursday night, but the staff was apologetic and gave us a free bottle of sangria.

Our waiter was helpful in suggesting how many dishes to order and how much sangria. We got three bottles of sangria and I was a HUGE fan of the blood orange and blackberry - all about the fruit ones! As for the food, we all ordered a couple of dishes and we're just blown away by how tasty everything was. Garlic shrimp, spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms, scallops and spicy potatoes were my top favorites.

We showed the waiter our Yelp checkin for the free dessert tapa and because it was my roommate's birthday, he actually brought out a whole platter of all the desserts with a candle and a sweet message. So perfect!! The desserts were to die for - esp the pumpkin ice cream sandwich and butterscotch custard. Man, oh man!

Overall, a fun tapas restaurant with delicious food and lively ambiance. I'll definitely be back again for sangria and to try the paella!

pics.caption: Shrimp with garlic, olive oil and red pepper - decadent!
Chicken with eggplant, eggplant, arugula and couscous... Pass next time for the other, more exciting dishes on the menu

review.des: Really enjoyed a romantic dinner for two at Ba-Ba-Reeba. Between the two of us we ordered about ten plates, all of which were great. We especially loved both of the stuffed date dishes (yes, we got stuffed dates twice) and the sangrias. Perfect place for a date, dinner with friends, or if you want to try a little bit of everything.
have been coming to this place for more than 10 times. My go to.place if I don't want to make dinner. Every dish is so good. some are even better than I had I'm Spain.

While I don't dine at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba more than a few times a year, it certainly gets 5 stars from me. The restaurant is very loud with high energy, so keep that in mind! Their sangria is a must, and I recommend a pitcher if you're with more than 2 people. It's ALWAYS busy, so you should make a reservation.

THE FOOD PORTIONS ARE TOO SMALL!!!

I hate when I get dragged here when I visit Chicago. So hungry....

Overall: Fantastic tapas, atmosphere, and service. Perfect for a date, large group, or just after-hour drinks and snacks. Ba-Ba-Reeba is a great spot to try.

The good: Fantastic tasting tapas, with a huge list to choose from. The paella was amazing as well. Left very full. For tapas, it was good on price. Nothing crazy expensive, nothing crazy cheap. Service was fast and friendly, got seated early. Atmosphere was romantic yet casual.

The bad: Not very much...the waiting room was smaller, and the bar was full. Not a huge dessert menu.

Atmosphere: 9/10
Service: 10/10
Food: 10/10

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is an excellent tapas bar and Lincoln Park standard bearer for over 30 years. I've been a number of times in my years living in Chicago, for both weekend brunch and dinner. I was in for dinner again last night and am very happy to report they still certainly know what they are doing.

The sangria menu is extensive - and they were featuring a white pear as the special of the day. Seeing as we like red wine - we went with the Classic red. Unfortunately of the 6 or so sangrias on the menu, 5 of them are white... that's probably the only complaint I can find about this place.

On the menu there's a ton to pick from - the baked goat cheese in sauce, buttermilk chicken, dates, and beef with blue cheese are some of my favorites. The paella is also good, granted I've only tried the seafood one - but they're a bit more of a commitment (30 min wait, minimum two serving order per table). Also, I tried the calamari on the most recent visit and was kind of disappointed, it wasn't bad by any means but it wasn't anything special. In the seafood section - either of the scallop empanada or the garlic, red pepper, oil shrimp are very good.

Here's some of the things I had during my recent trip to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba:

1. Passion Fruit Sangria was nice, fruity, refreshing. Everything a sangria should be.

2. Roast Dates with Bacon and Apple Vinaigrette. Still my favorite dish here. Vinaigrette is not overpowering at all. Delicious!

3. Fried potatoes had a nice kick to it. It could have been a little more crispy or fried. But the tomato aioli paired nicely with it.

4. Rioja-Braised Short Ribs - Pretty tender but pretty bland. Could have done without this dish.

5. Deviled Egg Pintxos - Incredibly salty.

6. Paella Valenciana was a tad too 'al dente' for me. It's unfortunate that if you're here on a date and want to try this, you must get a minimum of 2 servings. Two servings is enough for about 4-5 people, and with all those tapas to order, well you do the math. I was so stuffed I never wanted to eat again.

7. Butterscotch - My usual go-to-dessert from here, which is topped with salted caramel (hella salty, bleh) and a dollop of whipped cream. The butterscotch itself was pretty delicious.

Overall, this experience fell very short of the previous times I visited. Maybe it was an off night but it was enough to de-throne them from my 'Favorite Restaurants in Chicago' list. Bummer.
1/2 price Sangria pitchers on Mondays AND $2 spicy potatoes for happy hour. I'm absolutely game for a Tuesday morning hangover when it involves that combination, just saying. :)

When it comes to food adventures, I love to be accompanied by those whom are openly affectionate. By that, I'm referencing to cartwheels and giggles that extend from the lungs to as far down as one's tippy toes. Needless to say, a half pitcher of white peach sangria added to that effect. #lightweight

The highlights of our dinner were the roasted dates with bacon in apple vinaigrette, fried calamari with tomato sauce and ailoli, and meatballs with sherry tomato sauce. If you haven't yet, you should really hop onto the "bandwagon" and order not one but all three of these.  

The other dishes, chicken and ham croquette and seafood paella, were also very likable. We ordered two servings of the paella. The rice didn't seem to be 100% cooked. A few pieces of rice here and there were a bit difficult, but they were very generous with the shrimp and scallop.

Our waiter was certainly a charmer. He complemented our desserts, butterscotch custard and dark chocolate crema, while also adding a third one, the chocolate truffle cake, to his tab. La-la-la-lovely! Each bite was a sugary, wicked blow to the taste buds. Very, very rich! My favorite goes to the butterscotch custard!  

Reservations are recommended. Our trio had it for a Sunday evening at 6:30pm. There was no wait or hassle. The restaurant décor and dangling lights were dimmed but casual, intimate yet welcoming. Café Ba-Ba-Reeba is definitely a keeper!

pics.caption: Butterscotch custard, dark chocolate crema, and chocolate truffle cake

review.des: Had Karl for a server this evening and he was great. He helped us choose some dishes and all were great suggestions. Enjoyed the good as well as the service and ambiance.

I came here on a Saturday afternoon for brunch with my family.
We made reservations through open table on Yelp so there was no wait time and
the restaurant was not crowded at all (there were many empty tables)

Environment:
-It was right after thanksgiving but they already put many christmas decorations up and it was cozy and warm (4/5)

Service:
- The waitress was very informative and friendly (5/5)

Food:
- Rioja-Braised Short Rib, Manchego Mashed Potatoes, Charred Spring Onions & Rioja Wine Glaze (3/5)
- Grilled Octopus With Fresno Chili Vinaigrette, Fiery Tomato Sauce, Watercress & Pippara Peppers (2.5/5)
- Shrimp With Garlic, Olive Oil, Red Pepper Flakes (5/5)
- Scallop Empanada (2/5)
- Devil's egg ( 2/5)
- Waffle with caramel and banana (3.5/5)
- mac & cheese with bacon (3/5)
- salad ( 4/5)
- bite size chicken sausage waffle (3/5)
- peach sangria (3/5)
- complimentary toast with orange peel jam and butter (4/5)

This place was just okay for me and if I visit Chicago again I would want to try other tapas places before coming back here.

This is a tapas style place so you get to try a lot of things.. and we did try a lot of things.. and everything is sooo delicious. The absolute best dish on the menu is the braised short ribs. I would not share this dish with anyone ;).

You can make your own bloody mary's which is perfect for a weekend brunch/lunch. Do not miss this place!

This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Chicago! BaBa is good for both dinner and brunch (great value for brunch, incidentally), and it has a great selection of tapas and sangrias. I can't wait until my next visit.

We came here on a Sunday for brunch around 11 am. The restaurant was larger than I had expected and there were plenty of empty tables, but these began filling up as we were leaving around noon. Despite its size, it's still quite cozy and has great ambiance.

I can't speak to the authenticity of the food, but we were definitely impressed, particularly by the sausage-fried paella rice. Still reminiscing about the perfectly charred sausage bits. The poached egg on top makes it acceptable for breakfast, and when mixed in, makes the rice so creamy! We also ordered the pinxtos platter which was gorgeously presented on a wooden paddle, and the buttermilk waffle with marcona almond, nutella and bananas. You can definitely taste the salt in their french toast and waffles, but the sweet syrup balances it out nicely.

My boyfriend tried their Bloody Mary bar which was a lot of fun! You get to choose from a glass of vodka/bourbon/gin/tequila and add your own juice and add-ins. They have everything from your classic celery stick to bacon strips to cocktail shrimp on skewers. Would recommend if you like Bloody Marys.

In the middle of our meal, we ordered the buttermilk-fried chicken thighs from their limited dinner menu. This took a few extra minutes to come out compared to the rest of our dishes (which were brought to our table within 10 minutes of ordering). The chicken was good with a tangy sauce that made for a nice contrast, but nothing spectacular. Our waitress apologized several times for the delay, and also brought us complimentary desserts (pear sorbet and caramelized banana). Ended our meal on a sweet note. Needless to say, impressive service!

I love that you get to try a variety of food without breaking the bank. Everything is very reasonably priced and some of the portions are quite substantial. I can't wait to go back to try their other menus (especially the other paella varieties).

pics.caption: Caramelized Banana - it's like creme brûlée but healthier...
Sausage-fried Paella with a Poached Egg - YUM

review.des: I usually like trying Spanish restaurants when Im visiting a city, and this was the best decision I made in Chicago. It was authentic Spanish food. Probably the best seafood Paella I have had in the US. The sangria was awesome and the gambas al ajillo are a must. Excellent service as well! Highly recommended.

A fantastic order-by-number place!  Endless tapas!

This place seems to always be very busy so definitely make a reservation in advance.  It is a giant restaurant and very loud.  Fun and upbeat loud though, not a turn-off.

Order the croquets and sangria!

Prices are average ($20 per person)

One of the best meals that I've had in a long time! The tapas were ridiculously good and everything on the menu was delicious. The potatoes were my favorite tapas that we chose, but they all were outstanding! The food was hot, flavorful, and delicious! It's the perfect place for casual dining, spending time with friends, or even a casual date! The servers and staff are SO friendly and definitely knowledgable and helpful when it comes to giving recommendations. I will definitely be coming back!

I am just not a fan of tapas, but where my friends go, I go too. I just hate the idea of paying $8 for a couple of shrimp that everyone has to fight over and being the polite one, I go last and get scraps but then have to split the bill evenly. So, the last two times I've been here, I've ordered my own plates. But that still means I'm spending $30 on two skewers of meat, and a glass or two of sangria. I admit the portions here are a little better than some places, though I think this place is hyped up a bit more and so is more expensive than maybe Cafe Iberico which has even better portions and prices.

The service was slow, and yes they were busy, but so were we. We needed to eat and get out and go do something else. I was waiting on one of my skewers until the very end of the meal when everyone else had pretty much finished eating and I was sitting waiting without any food in front of me. Tapas without the sharing part sucks. Everyone else seems to love it and good for them. But for the price, the food is just not worth it. Bah humbug.

Food was basic, service was ok, wait to get a table was long. All the food sounded good, but the dishes were not executed well. The plating was sloppy and the food lacked flavor. None of the food was hot. The beet salad was very odd looking and was over dressed. The location has potential, but the food need improvement.
Best tapas restaurant in town. Also, the sangria is the best I have had.

My friend loves this place because of its Tapas styled food. The ambience is ok, although I felt the food was overrated and the space is a little crammed. But this place is in high demand and many people frequent it. So like my friend, many people love to visit this place. So if you are into Tapas food, you will love it, if not, then you like me will not be a huge fan.

Blech. Went for brunch and tried several of the tapas dishes. Didn't want to finish any. Dry French toast, tasteless sliders, plus a really pushy waitress who tried several ways to get us to over order, then told us that they don't split bills and charged me twice for an overpriced cappuccino. Also very loud and cold.

This was the best food we have ever had!! The atmosphere is so chill yet elegant at the same time. The food is planned so well and the flavors are unbelievable. We are so glad we found a hip yet delicious place to come for date night

This place lives up to its name. The food was really placed at a good price, the food was fantastic and the service/ambiance was wonderful. Great place to impress your significant other! The only thing I recommend is to make reservations asap. It gets really busy fast.
Hands down best tapas food in the Chicago-land area! I went there for my birthday and our waiter was friendly and delivered solid service.

They claim to be authentic, and it's perhaps authentic enough, but I think it's a bit over rated.  Friends love to go there and I never say no, so it's good enough to go, but it really is just not as authentic as they claim to be.  Years ago Cafe Iberico used to be more authentic but the quality there has gone done.  There used to be a tapas place on Halsted about 3500 N that was owned by a guy from Spain and his Spanish father (who owned a Spanish place around 3000 N Clark).  Those were truly authentic.  So, Ba Ba Reeba... it's fine, just kind of Americanized.

Great graduation celebration with a delicious paella - cooked to perfection w rice perfectly seasoned and crispy. Great selection of savory tapas. Potato salad, curried chicken salad, bacon wrapped dates, shaved Brussels sprouts among others. Amazing desserts, including butterscotch pudding. Highly recommend for a family celebration.

Loved the food! I came here with three people and we ordered eight tapa dishes and all of the 6 pintxos. My faves of the night were the grilled octopus, the seared scallops, fried green peppers (so surprisingly good), and the grilled hanger steak.  In terms of portion, I'd say I was satisfied after the first five dishes+pintxos (which were bite-sized and not particularly shareable), but my party chose to order more. Everything we had were delicious and we finished every bite. At the end of our meal, the manager (?) came by and presented us with four free desserts because "it was our first time here." What a pleasant & sweet surprise!  All of the desserts were delicious, but my fave was the butterscotch pudding shooters.

Would most definitely come back here!

Great place! Food is terrific, staff is friendly, and they take reservations. Parking can be a bit rough, but it's worth the hike.

PS: Their spicy potatoes are amazing!

The food here is excellent. They have a great selection and everything so far has been delicious. Of all the times we've been in, we've always had a friendly and attentive waiter.

I would just definitely recommend having reservations, unless you don't mind waiting 2 hours at a nearby bar... but it's worth the wait
Really one of the first tapas places in Chicago.  great neighborhood.  The food here is always solid.  It's never totally over the top awesome, and it never is bad.  Sangria pretty good too.

I came here on a Friday night with my family for dinner and the restaurant was PACKED. I definitely recommend making reservations ahead of time. We were super hungry when we got there so we started ordering haphazardly. However, we totally missed out on the paella (it takes about 30 minutes to make and we were halfway through our meal before we made that realization). Don't forget to check-in on Yelp--you get a free dessert tapa. :D

Mango sangria we got a pitcher for $24, which was okay, but I think the classic red sangria is better.

Wood-oven roasted vegetables with toasted pinenuts: this was one my favorite dishes of the night. Although the sauce was probably oil-based, it didn't seem oily at all.

Rioja braised short rib, manchego mashed potatoes, charred spring onions: The short ribs are really good

Seared lamb loin with mint salsa verde and pisto manchego: depending on how it's cooked, lamb is usually a hit or a miss with me. I was not a fan of this dish.

Black garlic roasted chicken: my brother basically devoured this dish and mostly hogged it to himself. Needless to say, it was flavored pretty well.

Grilled skewer of marinated pork belly and pork loin: this dish wasn't bad, but it wasn't anything extraordinary.

Meatballs with sherry tomato sauce: my entire family really enjoyed this dish. My brother even saved the tomato sauce as a dipping sauce for his bread.

Grilled octopus: this dish was the easiest to share since it was more plentiful than the others. Although the description includes a "fiery tomato sauce," I don't recall eating it with sauce (which may explain why I think the dish was more on the bland side).

Seared sea scallops: the scallops were cooked just right, but we were disappointed that it only comes with 3 scallops (there were four of us).

Spanish crudo: it comes with a few slices of raw fish soaked in olive oil. This dish got mixed reviews at our table--my mom thought it was good but my brother and I both thought it was forgettable. I probably would have liked it more if it wasn't swimming in olive oil.

Natilla flan: the flan was too rich for my taste and less custard-like than I expected (I think it was made with cream cheese).

Chocolate truffle cake: the title says it all.

Overall, we enjoyed the food and the service was good--we kept stopping our waiter so that we could order more dishes and our water glasses were constantly refilled.

Great spot for a date night or with big groups. They have delicious pitchers of sangria for a affordable price. Their tapas are delicious as well and cater to all types of eaters (vegetarian, seafood, gf)

Let me preface this by saying I am not a huge Tapas guy because generally they are way overpriced and you leave starving due to small portions. Not the case here at all.

Went with a large group and shared an order with one other person and left spending about $25 per person (including tip) and was very full.

Went with the short rib which was extremely succulent and tender and the ham/chorizo and manchego plate. Our side was the spicy potatoes which although were not spicy at all, had a great tomato alioli to go along with it. If you do find yourself hungry they also bring out Bread and Olive Oil to dip which is a huge plus as well.

The main reason preventing me from giving this 5 stars was the sangria. It was extremely mild and at times I felt like I was not drinking wine at all. Not sure why, but it felt a little off for me.

Overall though this place is a great spot for a birthday, date or large group.

This was my first visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba and I will definitely be going back. I went for a date night and this was the perfect spot for that. We made reservations and were seated right away. I enjoyed the atmosphere - very cozy and well decorated. We ordered sangria, the marinara with goat cheese, and seafood paella. Everything was delicious, and we received generous portions. I highly recommend this for a special dinner out!
Great atmosphere and friendly staff!  The food was well seasoned and the bloody bar was not bad.  Will have to try it out for dinner/lunch.  The brunch is definitely highly recommended!

So, I enjoy Tapas, I have just avoided this restaurant for a long while.

The location puts it in the middle of fratboy, congested city- just not my style. However, when a good friend was having a babyshower, I knew I needed to let go of location issues and enjoy the food.  

Enjoy I did!

The food was plentiful and filling!

The roasted garlic potato salad will be in my dreams forever
The curried chicken salad was pretty tasty
I was in love with the croquetas
The short ribs were awesome
There was a goat cheese, garlic bread dish ( I know, I know, my brain is not awake yet) that really hit the spot!
Who could complain about the desserts?

The show stopper (beside the croquetas) was the mango sangria! Keep it coming!

I so wish they delivered that!

Delicious and authentic tapas restaurant in Lincoln Park. The selection was what you'd expect at a tapas restaurant and each dish did not disappoint. The stuffed mushrooms and scallops were a favourite. The short rib was the least favourite. Sangria was delicious. The restaurant is loud and crowded so definitely not a date night spot. Reservations are tough but was able to reserve a spot through Open Table! It can be a bit pricey but not any different from the average tapas dinner. All in all, was very impressed and would recommend to others in the Chicago/Lincoln Park area!

Great for groups and larger gatherings. I love Tapas style eating with a big group and the dishes here never disappoint. Food is good, good location, good ambiance and not too loud - the space is pretty large. The menu is expansive and people can generally find something that makes everyone happy. Good group drinking options as well (the sangria was good!).
We've been here several times for brunch. The small plates format allows us to sample several dishes. Baked eggs and French toast are our favorites. Empanadas are great, too.

I've been coming to Babareeba for a loooong time, and I really truly love it. Some of the favorites include:
-bacon wrapped dates
-goat cheese and tomato sauce
-meatballs
-cheese plate
-beef and blue cheese
-red sangria or the sangria of the day!

They also have small plate desserts so you can order a few (or all of them) and (maybe even) share.

Bonus tip: check in on Yelp and get a free dessert!

Johnny J is the best waiter I can remember in YEARS.  My husband, daughter, brother-in-law & I had dinner here last night.  It had been many years since any of us had been here - for various reasons - location being one.  My last experience here was 'meh' at best, but I'm sooo glad we gave it another try.  4 people is perfect to be able to order a dozen dishes.  Bacon wrapped dates - sublime, the cheese board was a huge hit - there was really nothing left on any plate as we waddled out of there..  But back to the star of the night - Johnny was friendly and knowledgeable and paced us perfectly.  He has a way with people and I wish him all the success in the world, as I have a suspicion he could be an actor.  If I'm wrong, he's just 1/1,000,000 as a waiter.  BTW, we're old timers who used to go the the prior incarnation at that location - Otto's Beer Garden.

Wow. What a good Reasturant.
Each and every order we have was really good.
The combination or "supporting" flavors to the main dish was great success.
We WILL be back

This restaurant was so unbelievably good. I honestly had better paella here than in Barcelona. The chicken paella was to die for. I bet all of their paella's are just as good too; however we tried the chicken empanadas, ham and cheese croquettes, and the white peach sangria.

I wish I would have fasted before this eating may the restaurant so I could have been able to try an extensive array of tapas.

Either way is was FABULOUS. Fabulous. Every time I come back to Chicago I will be eating outside here.

Wow! Every time I come to Chicago to visit my daughter, I think the food can't get any better but this place is really the BEST! Every single bite was perfection.

For drinks we got a half pitcher of the seasonal special sangria apple cider flavored. We each got two glasses from that size.

We got the Brussels sprout salad, goat cheese in marinara (my daughter's favorite), the omelet, and chorizo and chicken skewer.

The dessert was almost free because of the amazing check in offer. We decided to get the seasonal sorbet (mango), caramelized banana, and butterscotch custard. My daughter ordered the custard (I don't even like custard) but I had to try it...it was even delicious!

The waitress(Meredith) and atmosphere were fabulous!! We will be back!

I thought it was pretty good. My GF, who spent 1.5 years in Spain, wasn't quite as impressed (she says she is very picky about Tapas).

The wine was good and food was very reasonably priced. Four of us had 2-4 drinks each and all the food we wanted for ~$45 a person.

Food was mediocre and very bland. Last weekend, their special sangria was a Pear Sangria, but unfortunately, all I tasted was Peach Schnapps. Not good. I used to really like that place, but since my last visit that has changed. I don't think I will be returning.

Perfect brunch.

My girlfriends and I were visiting Chicago for the weekend and stumbled upon this place because we had heard great things. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba did not disappoint one bit.

There is something for everybody on the brunch menu (link: cafebabareeba.com/wp-con…).

Sangria: They are all very sweet. Our personal favorites were the white peach and passion fruit sangrias.

Pintxos: In my opinion they are just even smaller tapas (bite-sized) -- perfect for sharing and allows you to try a little bit of everything. A friend of mine had a Groupon for the pintxos platter (pictured in review) so we were able to try all six pintxos listed on the menu. My favorite would have to be the deviled egg with bacon but they were all great!

Brunch Tapas: Get the sausage-fried paella rice with poached egg! Really. Get it.

Eggs & Omelets: I ordered the chorizo, manchego and vegetable omelet. One of the heavier omelets but it is savory and delicious.

Our service was prompt and friendly. I really liked the ambiance with the white lights draping down from the ceilings. A+. Thank you for a great first brunch in Chicago!

pics.caption: The delicious sausage-fried paella rice with a poached egg on top.

review.des: Delicious food, great prices. Our waitress was very pleasant and patient. The hostess was rude and so were the busboys. They would come by and pick up the plates off the table without asking us if we were finished. Busboy was pushing us around and telling us excuse me in Spanish in a very rude tone. I prefer Bulerias on Ashland over this overrated restaurant. Will not be coming back.

I lived in Madrid for a year, and I really miss the food. Ba-Ba-Reeba's food is amazing, and the most authentic Spanish food I've had in Chicago. The ambiance is also perfect, and really reminds me of traditional Spanish taverns. Highly recommended!

I love cafe ba ba reeba - the sangria is delicious, as are most of the dishes.

The first time I came I had a set menu already set up, but I recently returned and did most of the ordering. The octopus was delicious, as was the shrimp and sausages. The paella was the only thing I didn't love, because it was a seafood paella with not much seafood. Was still great though! I really liked the spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms.

Don't need to leave too much room for dessert because the portions are get small, so you can still try all of it!
Love the happy hour here!  Great way to try a lot of different food. Also got a free dessert per person when I checked in.

Long time Chicago staple.
Great for groups...spicy potates are amazing!

We had a fantastic time celebrating my friend's birthday here last night. We ate at the bar, and had the wonderful Victor as our server. The food was wonderful, especially the deviled eggs, beef empanadas, garlic shrimp, and tenderloin with blue cheese. Every dish we ordered was excellent, but it was really because of Victor that I would describe our experience as outstanding. He was friendly, attentive, and genuinely cared about giving us a wonderful experience.

Atmosphere/Ambiance (10%): 5/5
Cleanliness (10%): 5/5
Service (30%): 4/5
Food (50%): 4/5

Overall: 4.2

Remarks: The paella, oxtail, and spicy potatoes were all good but not extraordinary. The hanger steak and octopus were mediocre. The dessert items (Natilla Flan and Chocolate Truffle Cake) were exceptional.

Ok. This is my second time here and I really enjoyed the service and the food. Everything was spot on!  I had Mezcal Mule and it was awesome - a small kick with the pepper!  Loved it!  Try the goat cheese in tomatoes sauce. It was great!  Don't eat the free bread - it will just slow you down!
Brunch was incredible. The service was excellent and the food was incredible! We will go next time we are in the area.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is hands down one of my favorite places in Chicago. It can get pretty busy so it is nice they take reservations. Try to snag a seat outside in the first room as the natural lighting makes for a perfect afternoon/early dinner. The back is a little more crowded/but oddly romantic if you're looking for that atmosphere.

I find that when I go here it's the best when the table orders a pitcher of sangria to share (possibly more depending on the size). Then we each order two tapas, one for ourselves only and one to split with the table (if you're trying to pay for a normal cost meal). And a dessert to split (despite the small portion) is actually quite perfect to tie it all together. Here are all the items I've tried.

DRINKS:
Sangria is a must, and I highly recommend the White Peach. I've had their Blood Orange Special, and the Passion Fruit, but they don't compare to the White Peach. I could drink a pitcher alone.

FOOD:
Vegetables
-Brussel sprout salad (#22) not a fan of brussel sprouts but it was pleasant (not filling though)
-Wood Oven Roasted Veggies w/Pinenuts (#28) very tasty, good for vegetarians
-Spicy Potatoes (#30) not super spicy but a perfect amount of kick and flavor
-Spinach & Manchego-stuffed Mushrooms (#31) I order these every time! Must have
-Goat Cheese baked in Tomato sauce (#32) great for group sharing but they give you bread anyways so I kind of pass this one unless someone else from my group orders

MEAT:
-Beef Skewer, horseradish (#54) DO NOT SHARE. You will regret it because it is so good you just want it for yourself. This is one of my favorite items!
-Shrimp with garlic, olive oil (#44)- Other favorite if you like seafood, this is good! Just make sure to flick off the red pepper flakes if you aren't into spicy!

DESSERTS:
-Caramelized Banana- Probably one of the most underrated options at the restaurant. THIS IS AMAZING. Probably could make it home but so worth $3.
-Butterscotch custard- small portion, but again just melts in your mouth and the perfect bites.

DISLIKE:

-The only menu item I haven't really enjoyed was the chicken & ham croquetas (#63)- unfortunately my experience was like a few sad soggy corndogs.
-The paella is alright, but honestly I don't find it all that exciting and definitely not worth how much it is.

Tapas Extrordionaire!! This restaurant was packed on a Thursday night when my date and I went for the first time. The service was well organized and we were seated for our reservation early and approached by our server immediately. The menu consisted of 50-60 items in true Tapas style.

There were micro-bites that cost $1 a piece. We started with one of each. They were all delicious. We then started ordering regular tapas. Blue Cheese steak was one of the stand-outs, we ordered some ceviche dish that was great. Honestly all of the tapas were crafted with care and tasted awesome.

I returned a second time with a larger group and had a 5 star experience yet again. This place is boss. If you're looking for some perfect tapas, look now further

Quick Summary
---
Delicious tapas at a great price with consistently some of the best service I've experienced in any restaurant. As with any popular Chicago spot, reservations are highly recommended, as walk-in wait time can be long, but once sat, service is incredibly fast. Highly recommended: #44 (shrimp with garlic), #67 (bacon wrapped dates), seafood paella, and any flavor of sangria.

Intro
---
This has become my favorite restaurant in Chicago, and my 5-star rating isn't a case of severe fanboyism, but is a distinction well-earned through repeated visits. I've been to Spain and loved the food there, so I was very excited to try. The first time I went was with a couple friends, and I was very impressed with the quality of food, drinks, and service. It's not the most authentic Spanish cuisine, but the inspiration and heart is there.

Setting
---
Very warm and cozy. However, the restaurant is huge and there's so much activity going on around it can be loud and hectic. Added bonus: hanging Iberican hams for that authentic Spanish touch!

Service
---
Despite the craziness of all that's going on during a busy night, my table has never been neglected or forgotten. Food comes out in blazing fast times after ordering. The bussers are attentive in clearing your dishes and refilling your drinks. Everyone seems happy to serve you.

Food
---
There are so many different tapas, I will highlight the ones I've particularly enjoyed.

Roast dates with bacon & apple vinaigrette: Bacon wrapped dates has been overdone to oblivion but the apple vinaigrette is a nice complement that sets it apart. Second-best bacon wrapped dates I've had (sorry Ba-Ba-Reeba, but the honor of #1 goes to Avec!)

Seafood paella: Has a generous amount of shrimp, scallops, and monkfish. I despise green beans but I don't even care that they're in this dish, it's absolutely delicious. The rice has the perfect consistency.

Burrata with tomatoes, charred sweet corn, and avocado: A great marriage between all the different ingredients. The char on the corn brings an appreciated depth to the dish, and the cheese is very fresh. Vibrant and light!

Shrimp with garlic: They are unapologetic with the garlic. A blast of flavor will spread over your entire palette as you meditate on the texture of the perfectly cooked shrimp. Dip your bread in the leftover oil. It is liquid gold.

Caramelized banana: I can inhale ten orders of these if I wanted to. All desserts here are delicious but this one in particular is fantastic. Great toasty flavor from the caramel while never overpowering the banana. Texture contrast provided by pistachios. Temperature contrast provided by the ice cream. A delight to the senses.

Sangria: I hate sangria. I love Ba-Ba-Reeba's sangria. Five great permanent flavors with a rotating seasonal flavor. Do yourself a favor and get a pitcher... for yourself.

Other notes
---
What? They have a brunch you say? Admittedly I have not gone there for brunch service. I will have to make the effort to try it out. Check out their rewards program. Though Lettuce Entertain You does require money up front, you receive credit through your first several visits to make up for it.

Conclusion
---
I applaud the staff at Ba-Ba-Reeba, both front-of-house and back-of-house. It is a well-tuned machine that operates efficiently amidst all the chaos. Great service, great food, great memories. If you haven't tried Spanish food, Ba-Ba-Reeba is a great place to go. Have guests coming into Chicago? Hot date? Casual night out? Whatever the occasion, Ba-Ba-Reeba is sure to please.

Grade
---
(1* - never come back, 2* - poor, 3* - good, 4* - excellent, 5* - perfect)
Ba-Ba-Reeba gets a 5*. Way to go!

The environment and the service are really good, severs are very polite and sweet. It is all small plate tapa, some such as beef and seafood are very yummy. I came especially for paella, the paella here is not as good as I expect, it taste a little undercook. But overall, it is a good restaurant.

Cafe Ba Ba Reeba is a true gem.  

My fiance and I have been here only twice (once in 2012 and once in 2014) but it's one of our favorite places in town.  I've been to several other tapas places in Chicago, which you would think might be better since they were smaller and less corporate (CBBR is a Lettuce Entertain You venture) but this is not the case.  CBBR rules over all!

Must orders:

* Fried potatoes w/ spicy aoli - as more than a few yelpers have mentioned, the aoli is off the chain.  I legitimately could eat it by the spoonful (could? I meant to say I DO)

* Bacon wrapped dates - because #duh

* Deviled eggs - I love me some deviled eggs and hate it that many restaurants serve such bland versions.  Not the case here; creamy and well seasoned plus a sprinkle of bacon

* dark chocolate crema (dessert) - this is a stand out.  It tasted like a rich brownie, but the texture of a thick mouse.  My mouth was confused but addicted.

Pro tip: cocktails are better than the sangria and are half price on Mondays.  Peach/whiskey cocktail and raspberry jam cocktail are great.

Bonus points for service... our most recent trip was to celebrate my fiance's birthday.  I merely left a simple note stating as such in our Open Table reservation and you would have thought my lady was a visiting dignitary from the service we received.  Our wonderful server-dude (gah I forget his name!) brought us out free pintxos to start the meal and a complimentary dessert platter with candle at the end.  I was blown away and very grateful for these thoughtful touches.

CBBR FTFW

Won't bother with the paragraphs because those are too hard to sort through when finding your next favorite restaurant. Here's why cafe ba ba reeba is my new go-to:

Service: kind, quick, accommodating
Drinks: delicious sangria with seasonal favorites.  I stuck to sangria but looked around me and saw sizeable cocktails!

Spectacular food: everything we had was great! Some favorites include

Patatas Bravas (you could eat the potatoes plain! They were wonderfully seasoned and the tomato aioli doesn't hurt one bit)

Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce (I've never seen such a healthy serving of goat cheese at a restaurant so well priced! Delicious)

Shrimp with garlic (great garlic oil which you'll want to dip every thing you can find in)

Plato de la case charcuterie plate (comes with pon con tomate it's amazing)

For dessert I had the chocolate truffle cake, it was tiny but incredible. It's worth 3 bucks without a doubt! It's so rich and delicious that you can make it last :)

I'd typically rather have big meals than small bites, but this place completely changed my mind and I sure left with a full belly! We got the spicy potatoes, the short rib, the burratta and the paella. I ate every last bit, it was so good. I would recommend this as a go-to for all visitors of Chicago!

On a recent trip to Chicago my bf and I met up with my cousin's wife for dinner at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. SEVERAL people had recommended it to me, so we were excited to try it!

The food was stellar. Some of the scrumptious plates we shared included the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce with garlic bread; fried green peppers & course salt (YA'LL THESE WERE SO INEXPLICABLY GOOD); spicy potatoes with tomato aioli; and mushroom, toast, aged roncal cheese & sherry gastrique. The food was truly delightful.

Also I apologize for my likely misuse of semicolons in my food descriptor sentence. There's no way that sentence is grammatically correct.

The fun environment and delicious food make for a fantastic dinner!

Great food and great service. I highly recommend for brunch (not well enough known as a brunch place!). The brunch tapas are surprisingly well priced and delicious- the citrus French toast is to die for.

Dinner also good, but a tad pricey for the simplicity of the food you get.

The place exceeded my expectations. The place was packed but me and my friends (we are visiting from NJ/NY) were able to sit at the back bar right away and food came in fast. The service was outstanding and the food itself were delicious.

Best Tapas menu in Chicago! The variety of dishes satisfy your palette because the flavors are there. Must have the bacon wrapped dates & always get the pitcher of sangria! Note: make a reservation regardless of party size.

I've been here so many times , This place has the best Paella I've ever tried in Chicago, I also like the batata brava its so yummy  
Their food is so delicious and clean .
The price is ok
The patios looks nice
AMAZING happy hour from 4-6pm.  Estrella Damm (sp?) beers are only 3 bucks.  Tapas are dirt cheap (the servings are small, but fine for the price).
Best Spanish tapas joint in Chicago! I have been going here for over 15 years and they never, ever disappoint.

Oh my god.  What an amazing place.  Great service.  Great drinks.  Great food. Words cannot express how much I loved the experience here.  Definitely somewhere I recommend to my friends and definitely somewhere I will repeatedly go back to!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is better than your typical tapas bar. There are great savory dishes such as the grilled squid and spicy potatoes. Not to mention a great selection of sangria to get your ass hammered for the day.

However CBBR doesn't really grace me as one of the best tapas place in the world but it is in the tippy top of the list for tapas in Chicago. It's just that the menu is not as expansive as a traditional Catalonian tapas menu. Sure you got your croquettes, kebabs, salt and olive induced choice of food... However it just doesn't have the decadence that other tapas restaurants have made a stable of.

That's mainly the biggest gripe I have for not giving it a fully loaded 5 stars. In the end, I still enjoyed eating at CBBR. If you're still thinking of tapas, you might want to checkout The Purple Pig instead.

pics.caption: Grilled squid with extra virgin olive oil and garlic.
Wood-oven roasted vegetables with toasted pinenuts.

review.des:
Words cannot express how much I love this place! Everything we ordered was super delicious: Croquettas, sangria, aceitunas, patatas bravas ... there is no wrong choice. It tastes like back in Madrid.

I'd give 10 stars if I could.

I wish I could have had one of everything. Went for a large birthday party and everything was outstanding from service to the meal. The dishes came out to the table in time to enjoy and order the next item. And the bread! Restaurants are usually judged by the first thing a diner eats and it's the bread that will make or break for me.

Attracted by the ridiculously cheap prices displayed on the menu outside, my friend and I wandered in thinking this was a nice up-scale cafe in which we could both order a plate and be satisfied. Unfortunately we failed to realize how tiny the portions were because the main focus were the tapas. There's nothing wrong with that, and the small dishes we ordered (spicy potatoes and brussels sprouts salad? or something of that nature) were absolutely delicious. The tapas themselves take a long time to bake and prepare because they make them fresh, but overall really great atmosphere and lovely service.

A day full of bests.

My girlfriend and I took the L over to CBBR and man, it may have just made our entire weekend.  The bloody mary bar itself is probably worth the trip, but literally every thing we had was insane.

I'm a giant dork for Eggs Benedict, and it was probably  the best i've eaten.  And i've had it everywhere.  Super simple, but with a spanish twist.  Delightful.  The deviled eggs were fantastic, the coffee was delightful.  

If you're the type that does brunch, you know who you are.  And you LOVE places like this.  Go.  Get the fattening stuff "for the table" and eat it before they can.  You were going to anyway.

Can't wait to get back to Chicago, so we can get back here.

This was my first time here and overall this place succeeds with tapas. I was part of a large group for a friend's birthday and we ordered a ton of food. Some plates that I enjoyed included: grilled skewer of marinated pork belly and pork loin, beef tenderloin and blue cheese, grilled hangar steak with mojo picon, spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette, garlic potato salad, catalan bread with ripe tomato and the chef's artisanal cheese selection. I was quite full after sampling everything mentioned above. The white peach sangria washed everything down quite nicely.

The restaurant is large and had some nice mood lighting which I appreciated. Service was just ok. Even though our server managed to have the tapas spaced appropriately he did forget a few dishes and a couple of us had to remind him about drinks we ordered. He was lacking a personality. I've noticed over the years that many LEYE restaurants have delicious food but noticeably sullen, robotic or easily agitated servers.  It's one of the greatest mysteries of the modern world. All in all though, this fun place is still worth a visit. xoxo
This place is so consistent it is ridiculous. Great food.  Adequate service and generally the same place that started the Chicago tapas revolution 20 years ago.

Depends on the day you go. The Sangria is pretty good but the tapas options seem lacking lately compared to a few years ago. Take advantage if you get a check-in coupon ever, extra potatoes are worth it!
Cool place! Fun for groups or date night. Love the tapas and they come in a generous portion. Fun outdoor patio as well.

Stopped by here on the way to the Zoolights! We made a reservation, having heard great things but were sad the "latest" time they had for dinner was 3:30pm! We picked this, assuming they were busy and considered it an early dinner. We arrived however and noticed a few empty tables, even past 4:30pm-5pm. Do they not reserve the whole restaurant? Made us feel a little cheated by the system. (Although I guess we could have called in to check.)

While the food was excellent and with great taste, we were a little disappointed by the experience. We were seated at a table right next to the bathrooms and I constantly found myself drawing my chair back and forth to let people pass. The small plate (tapas) experience is indeed unique. Perhaps I'm just too used to the conventional style of dining (starter, main, dessert), but for me, I wasn't a fan of getting each small plate spaced out 5-10 minutes apart. Two tapas plates would show up, followed by a Pintxo ("starter") plate, then a 10-minute wait before another plate. Just seems oddly spaced out. Due to the portion sizes, I just found myself wanting all the plates at once.

However, reasonably priced and great flavour in the dishes we tried. We did get a free dessert since we checked in through yelp which was a big bonus!! Would give it another shot, but perhaps with a bigger party. They seemed to have a few of those on our visit.

Horrible service and the Staff is not that friendly.
I don't recommend this place.

The best tapas bar in all of Chicago! Has a lot of classic Spanish tapas as well as their own creative versions. When I have people in town visiting this is one of my favorite spots to take them. I have been for both dinner & brunch and really enjoyed everything we ordered both times. Always excited to try one of their many Sangria selections which are all tasty & refreshing. Usually there is a longer wait if you don't have a reservation ahead of time, but there are also plenty of bar spots if you are aggressive enough to hawk.
Great food and great service every time. Make sure to make a reservation if you want a table, but there is always room at the bar if you're not picky.

Everything was great.  We started off with a pitcher of Mango Sangria and put in the order for the Seafood Paella.  

32 - goat cheese baked in tomato sauce
30 - spicy potatoes
51 - short ribs
44 - garlic shrimp
67 - dates w/ bacon

And yes...I would do it all over again.  Just enough food for 4.

Four stars for food, but their service ups it to five.

FOOD: Not usually the biggest fan of tapas because I leave hungry, but their portions are huge! For veggies, I liked the spinach & manchengo-stuffed mushrooms. For seafood, I liked the grilled octopus, citrus-cured salmon, and bay scallops empanada. If you really want to be stuffed, get the paella; they claim one order serves two, but the serving size is way bigger. I liked the seafood paella because the bay scallops are so soft and tender; however, my cousins liked the chicken.

DRINKS: Mango sangria, end of story. There's fruit - it's healthy.

DESSERT: Pear sorbet. Again, fruit - healthy. SO healthy.

SERVICE: They accommodated our party of 13 extremely well, even though we stayed past closing. Case in point: They forgot to place one order, but brought it out much later during the meal - on the house. They were also great with us using so many free Yelp dessert check-ins.

Truly never disappoints.  I have been here about 10ish times and always enjoy the food and ambience.  

I am partial to sitting on the indoor patio which has the right amount of mood lights and cannot leave without at least 1 pitcher of red sangria.

Favorite food staples include: spicy potatoes, spinach/manchego stuffed mushrooms, baked goat cheese, braised short rib, shrimp, salmon, meatballs, chicken empanada and OF COURSE the bacon wrapped dates.

If you haven't been here, get here quickly.  And definitely make a reservation since it's a popular (and crowded) spot. Cheers!
I have had better tapas but they obviously focus on their paella. It's amazing! The tastes are straight outta Spain.

There are a million great things to say about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! From their drinks to their wide variety of tapas plates, every thing is fantastic. It is tough to get a reservation on a weekend, so book in advance. I recommend the chef's artisanal cheese selection, warm potato and onion omelet, grilled squid, chicken and ham croquetas, sangria (red and white) and their mojitos. I have only been here for dinner, but I can not imagine them doing any thing sub-par. Amazing restaurant!

I've been here a few times and usually leave pretty satisfied.  The atmosphere is very fun and is great for groups.  Last time I tried the cava sangria, which I found to be very tasty.  The tapas are pretty good, but definitely not the best I've had.  The service is always friendly, which makes for a nice experience.
This was a great place for tapas. Fun dining experience and one of the best desserts I've ever had. Very busy place as well!

We went for brunch on a chilly Sunday morning. The food turned out pretty well and we all ordered a few breakfast items and the cute little breakfast pinxots. They were all delicious except for the chicken and waffle item. It was more like a chicken sausage corn dog. Not my favorite.

The complete star of their brunch is their Bloody Mary bar!!! It was great and they had so many toppings and excellent additions! So delicious. I especially loved their gazpacho option for the tomato juice. Also at $9 for top shelf vodka that's pretty good!

Will definitely return to try their dinner sometime.

Ba-Ba-Reeba is our go-to Birthday dinner location! Born in Spain... I just love a good Tapas place. And Reeba does NOT disappoint!! Every time we go we find new dishes we love and the specials are always phenomenal. Their drinks are DELICIOUS! Every time we bring family here they are always impressed. Highly, highly recommended.

I recently came here on a "first date". The first thing I must say is that it is a great date spot. The restaurant itself is cute, big, nice decor. There are many tables; however, the wait can still be a bit of a challenge. I strongly recommend making a reservation.

After we were seated, the server came promptly and took our drink orders. We chose the half pitcher of their classic sangria. Their sangria, for lack of better terms, is like a fine crack that you will become addicted to as you sip each sip. Be careful. You have been warned. The half pitcher contained a generous amount; enough for two people on a first date trying to ease the pain of the awkward encounter you must hurdle through. I got buzzed, SUCCESS!

The food - Here is what we ordered:

1. Beef empanada - I'm cuban, it's what we do. The dough was flaky and buttery and contained a generous amount of beef filling. However, the taste of the beef lacked seasoning. I would skip this one next time I go.

2. A seafood mixture which had shrimp and scallops: I don't remember what it was called but it almost looked like a ceviche. This was light, refreshing, and tasty. I did not feel guilty while consuming these calories. Yum.

3. Seared scallops: WOW! The highlight of the meal. Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned, hint of garlic and a slightly sweet after taste. mouthgasm at its finest.

4. Stuffed mushrooms: My second favorite; however, a bit too greasy for being a veggie dish.

5. Chicken and spanish chorizo skewer: This was really, really, good too. They definitely know how to cook their meats. Me likey.

I must note that the food came out in "chunks", step by step, one by one. It was strange. It took about 5 minutes between each plate. The last one, the skewer, came out about 20 minutes after we had already consumed the others. This was the only pickle I have about the dining experience.

The server was good; attentive; made recommendations accordingly. A for effort :)

I'd go back again.

Recently dined at Ba-Ba-Reeba during a visit to Chicago and was blown away. My dining companions and I ate at the bar, which had great service.

We enjoyed the bacon-wrapped shrimp, goat cheese croqueta with lemon gastrique, roasted beet crostini with herbed goat cheese and hazelnuts, spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms, fried green peppers & coarse salt, seared bay scallops, and serrano ham plate as well as two pitchers of sangria -- passion fruit and white peach. This was plenty of food for the three of us and our ticket before tip was only $100. I thought the amount of food for the price was a great deal.

My favorite dishes were the two goat cheese options and the scallops, which were cooked perfectly, but everything was really wonderful. Nice size portions and everything came out very quickly. We ordered our food in phases -- 2 or 3 items at a time -- and the service was incredibly prompt.

Highly, highly recommend.

pics.caption: Goat cheese croqueta with lemon gastrique
Roasted beet crostini with herbed goat cheese and hazelnuts

review.des:
Very few places are as consistently good but I returned twice in the past month and enjoyed good food once again! Service was good, ambiance is fun, but this place rocks because of their food!! Their potatoes are excellent, the goat cheese and toast really good, paella awesome, brussel sprouts salad addictive! Vegetarian friendly and tasty!

Their desserts are awesome - only $3 and so yummy!

Tasty and large selection of tapas with a nice atmosphere. However the tapas aren't particularly original and the sangria is lacking. Wish theyd hone the menu down a little and focus on what they do best. The service is slow and they can get very very busy, but the ambiance is fun. We enjoy it but more for the vibe than the food.

This is by far my favorite tapas place in the city. I've been going for 3 or so years now and it really can't be topped. Everything is amazing and the service is always top notch.

I always make a reservation on open table or over the phone. They do often have a decent wait time for tables if you walk in, but this is easily avoided with a bit of planning.

I really recommend the bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese in tomato sauce, and the blue cheese beef tenderloin.

This evening there was a snafu with our reservation (this has NEVER happened in three years) and we had to wait just a bit. They were very honest and helpful with updates and in the end comped our entire meal. That was completely unexpected on our end and we now love this place even more. We're already booked for Sunday brunch :D

This place has a great "feel" to it as far as I'm concerned. it's a lot of fun with a terrific atmosphere in a great neighborhood.  

The food is average to above average.  I certainly don't think it's worth the hype it receives.  The seafood is alright, not fantastic I wouldn't say it's the best available. They do some sincerely unique things with their food and I do love manchengo cheese, but somehow it all just falls short.  The flavors just don't seem to combine as well as they could.  It's like they're "almost there"  but not quite there.  They use lots of garlic, which is admirable.  I would have just hoped for something a little more unique given the reputation.

This isn't my best review, more general than normal, but I believe it's nonetheless accurate.

DEFINITELY worth a visit.  it's a fun place, and a good time.  It is in the ballpark of authentic tapas.  I guess I just had better stuffed dates at Hubbard Inn and of course, Avec, better empanadas at Habana Libre, and better shrimp at the now defunct, "1492".

Let me start off by saying that I was pleasantly surprised with the whole experience I had with this restaurant. I was given the task of picking a restaurant with good drinks by my date. Luckily, I thought ahead and chose one with not only good drinks but good food as well. This place did not disappoint. First off, I was able to make a reservation for two with ease. When we got there it was packed with people for a Sunday night which shocked me even more at how simple it was to make a reservation. When we first arrived, it did not take long to be seated once we walked in the door. I came prepared to eat, and the food had exceeded my expectations. I'm also not big on sangria but it came highly recommended. Needless to say, before I knew it we finished off a pitcher between the two of us. I was expecting a typical "Lincoln park" experience but it definitely held its own with their food and drink menu. I would definitely recommend this place and look forward to returning.

Poor service but excellent food.. Been coming here for 10 years but last night was a major disappointment as far as the service was concerned. The food was excellent as always but part of the dining experience is your waitress and the overall service. Inattentive waitress after she had taken our order. Had to ask for bread twice... Bus boys had to be asked to refill water... And that's after they had passed by our table a few times. Had to track the waitress down to get the check.  Short of staff or bad training ? I'll let the MOD determine that. Wouldn't return in a hurry based on last night.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! was a blast. It is so fun to try all the tapas. The bigger the group the better because then you can order lots of items.

I expecially love the brunch with have little breakfast tapas of small pancakes, waffles, egg dishes, etc.

Fun and Lively and great Sangria too.

Super sweet brunch spot in Chi-town!  Best to go with a group of 4+ that way you can try all the delicious noms!  I don't recall every dish we tried but here were the highlights:

-Deviled Eggs and jamon serrano - our favorite of the Pintxos items! The filling was super smooth and flavorful and the crispy jamon made this over-the-top; we ordered a second round of deviled eggs because they're THAT good.
-Iberico Ham Hash: I shamelessly have a serious love for canned corned beef hash and this dish is the luxe, pimped up version of a childhood favorite.  The poached egg soaks into all the crispy bits of ham and potato and oh my word that HAM.  Iberico Jamon is generally regarded as the best ham in the world so yeah, it's DECADENT.
-Baked Eggs with Romescu Sauce: definitely one of the more unique (and beautiful!) egg dishes I've had which is served with a red pepper sauce from Catalonia. Hearty and healthy!
-Citrus French Toast with goat cheese butter: a slightly lightened up version of traditional French toast and it's a great balance of sweet, tangy, and zesty

Don't forget to wash everything down with a pitcher of their sangria!

This place is perfect for groups and people of all ages, there was even a brunch wedding reception taking place when we were there!  So yes, be sure to roll in with a large entourage.  The more, the merrier at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!

I absolutely loved this place. Sangrias were so good. I highly recommend ordering the papas bravas! Also for dessert try the caramelized banana. I'm only giving 4 stars because the waiter took too long to get to my table. I suggest they hire more staff.

I've been coming here for years and I love, love love it.  Of all the tapas bars in the city, I find the food here to be the most consistent and delicious, and the atmosphere the most fun.  Grab a bunch of friends and make a party out of it!  This is a great place for any type of celebration.

My favorite dishes on the menu (I've tried basically everything!) are the patatas bravas (best I've ever had outside of Spain), shrimp in garlic, bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, spinach & manchego stuffed mushrooms.... I could go on and on.  That's why it's best to go with a large group, so you don't feel weird ordering 12 dishes (though I've gone with one other person before and done it... you'll just have a lot of leftovers!).

The sangria is also delicious, with the white usually being my favorite (they will have different fruit options available depending on the season).

The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is that they recently started doing delivery.  Having dined at the restaurant for many years, I know the food and the portion sizes, and though the prices were the same, both times I ordered for delivery the portions were greatly reduced.  I've seen other restaurants do this and I think it's fucking rude - just because they don't have to look you in the eye when they drop off the food, they think it's okay to cheat the customer?  I ordered the tomato goat cheese and it literally came with two tiny pieces of garlic bread, for $10 bucks - when you order this at the restaurant, it's like a cauldron of tomato and cheese with a whole basket of bread.  Anyway, I spent about $100 bucks on a delivery order for several people and we were all hungry when the food was gone, which is just a shame.  So, for that reason, I remove one star to punish you, Cafe Ba Ba Reeba!  Don't cheat your delivery customers!

But if you go to the restaurant, you'll be in tapas heaven!

This place is awesome! We over did it the first time,but we were able to try out a good amount of food. They have a nice wine selection, we also had the sangria. We ordered a variety of tapas and the paella as well. The paella is really delicious, the seafood is fresh and plentiful with bits of charred pieces of rice.
Fun atmosphere.  Really good food- probably the best tapas in Chicago.  Solid drinks.

I went here during restaurant week and their tapas are amazing! Great for sharing in large groups. The ambience is relaxed, and the staff is attentive. They give you great suggestions if it's your first time dining with them.

Wonderful place!! We love the Spanish wine :-) food selection is amazing, leaving us with full bellies.
Will for sure be coming back again!

I absolutely loved our experience here. We made reservations earlier in the week for a Friday seating at 6 p.m. Good thing we did because the place was fairly packed and busy the entire time we were there.

We came to celebrate my recent promotion and it was the perfect spot - very fun atmosphere and ambiance. It was just my boyfriend and I but this would be great for a group.

We got seated right away and ordered the blackberry sangria. We each had about three glasses and I thought it was well worth the price. For the two of us we ordered the following off the menu:
-patatas bravas: amazing and flavorful. Not too spicy but stills packs a punch.
- goat cheese in marinara sauce: a personal favorite. I love the combination between the two and with some toasted bread you can't go wrong.
-dates wrapped in bacon: everyone talks about these and they are not to be missed. The savory sweet aspect is awesome.
-beef short rib with potatoes and brussels sprouts: short rib was fork tender and melt in your mouth
-scallop dish: broth is great and very fragrant.

With both of us checking into Yelp, we each got a dessert tapas for free. We tried the chocolate truffle cake and chocolate crema. Perfect sizes and the chocolate was fairly rich.

The bill was around $60, but we left full, satisfied, and in a sangria haze. Only recommendation would be to order 2 tapas at a time. Our 5 came out pretty fast and we were feeling a tiny bit overwhelmed with a table full of food!

pics.caption: Dates wrapped in bacon with apple vinaigrette.

review.des:
Immediate reaction after eating: Eat the octopus and buttermilk chicken, get the paella to fill up and take home. Service is professional and attentive and not overly friendly which is actually how I like it , glad I went and I ate it all and am taking paella home.

Full Review: Stopped in at 2pm on a Sat, busy but we (party of 2) was seated immediately. I really wanted a paella and though the menu was half brunch and did not list the regular paella, had no problem ordering the chicken paella. Also we got the octopus, spicy potatoes and the buttermilk chicken. the tender octopus and the buttermilk chicken....whoa whoa!!! I started closing my eyes while eating those, the dishes were off the chain, I could have passed on the potatoes but they were great with the sauce...the paella came and was hot and the chicken was tender, too much Lima beans but that is just me....we also did a check in and got the free dessert and we picked flan from the dessert list. Nice small tapas size of flan perfect for 2 people to share, I am glad it didn't taste lipgloss cause flan sometimes can do that. We also had the passion fruit sangria and it was solid but not something I will likely remember..if you want good sangria go to nandos
The biggest problem I have here is deciding what I want. There are so many great options and everything is always so great!!! One of the best spots in Lincoln Park

Get the bacon wrapped dates, your life will be forever changed.

Always amazing food and service.

Me and my husband had a great experience the food was awesome and the service was great. Our server was very nice but what made our night memorable was the bus boy Miguel he was great had great feed back on the food and what to try since it was my first time here. He was so nice and really made us feel at home! Thank you Miguel!!

Bloody Mary bar rocks!!!  I have been here twice visiting Chicago.  My first time there...
