I left wanting more.  The food was just absolutely fantastic.  That visit was a year ago.  This time around I came in for brunch again.  And I was a little disappointed.  The food wasn't as incredible as the first time.  I heard that they change up the menu often.  I was not as impressed with the changes.  They also removed some items from the menu too.  I did however super enjoy my bloody mary.  Also, we had a 21 person group.  I am not sure if maybe the food was affected for that reason.  We originally made a reservation for 15 and increased it by 6 people last minute.  Somehow, they allowed it!  We didn't all sit together, but it's ok, we were still close to one another.  I also checked in on Yelp for a goody.  Four Square also has check-in specials... you can't combine though.
I love love love this place. D-LISH-ES-NESS. I take everyone here. I have a new phone so I can take pictures again !!!!:) gogogo

This place is so delicious. We tried..
Bacon wrapped dates ( best I've had)
Burratta cheese - pretty good
Chorizo wrapped date- get like 5 of these...
Spicy potatoes - reallll good
Stuffed mushrooms - I'm not a huge mushroom fan, but they were pretty tasty
Beef empanadas - good, not great
Pork paella - YUM YUM YUM

Oh, and make sure you check in on Yelp for your free dessert. I got the banana and it was delightful.

One tip on the sangria, it tastes like fruit juice. I'm pretty sure there was no alcohol in there, and for that price, I should at least feel a little buzz. Next time, I'll stick to regular wine.

Went here for drinks on Sunday afternoon and the place was relatively busy. CHECK IN and you get a free desert tapa.

We sat at the bar. I really enjoyed my glass of wine, my friend ordered a cava but got cava sangria which the one bartender on point, Nico, fixed quickly! There were limited draft options. We also had the vanilla chai bourbon desert tapa which had tasty ice cream but the fig cookie was subpar. Ordered a double shot espresso got a single by accident then they brought out an adtl double for free. Some of the other bartenders seemed loss and over staffed since we were checked over every 3 mins.

I think the reputation of this place as an authentic Spanish tapas bar is very strong so it was disappointing to find the atmosphere more corporate and bland.

I was definitely very satisfied with my first visit to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! and am looking forward to my next visit because I really liked the food.

Firstly, I had no trouble doing my reservation through Opentable, and we were taken and seated immediately when we got there. It is really easy to get to the place, although I do not recommend going with your own car because parking might be hard.

The exterior of the place is not very enticing but once you are inside it is a whole different story. The place was packed and the atmosphere was great. We did not wait long to be served, and the server made some really good recommendations. She was very nice andcattentive overall and answered all of our requests pretty quick. Me and my companion decided to drink sangria with the dinner. I would say it was ok.

For the food, I wanted to order some really typical Spanish stuff so we went with Tortilla, Croquetas, Calamares, and Jamon. Overall, they were really good and they were close to the flavours of my country. The only one that fell a bit short was the jamon, but it was still good. It certainly met my expectations.

I will definitely go back, considering how much I miss Spanish food and how good this place is, and also I highly recommend it.
This place is amazing! The goat cheese and tomato garlic bread is to die for and the atmosphere is really fun. It is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.

This place was so cool!  Honestly I was so stuffed when I went that I didn't try the food, but it was really nice inside with great decor.  I loved the hanging meats!  Seriously it looks cool.  The drinks were tasty, and the service was great.  Though the bartender took a while to get us our waters like we asked, and I was parched AF.

Years ago my soon to be wife told me that I had to try this place out. Seven years later, We finally made it here and it was worth the wait.

Everything was amazing that we tried. We were able to pick the selections to our liking and the menu was put together very well so i was able to know if I was going to like something right away from reading the menu as I was unfamiliar with the menu or the cuisine. It has been over 15 years since I have been to a Tapas place.

A special shout out and kudos to the peach sangria - You were delicious and complimented my food well.

A special shout out to our server who ROCKED by the way! She was very helpfu in offering her recommendations. As I was completely unfamiliar with anything there. She was very helpful friendly and efficient.

Who wants to join me there for dinner some night???

Love, love, love!!! Best tapas place in the city. The sangria is legit fire. Portions are pretty big so 3-4 plates is more than enough for 2 people. I love their weekend brunch menu to be specific. Make sure you order the bacon wrapped dates and spicy potatoes. Servers are awesome!

Amazing place! Spain is one of my favorite countries in the world and I was glad to be there as it almost felt like I was in Spain. It must be the smell of jamon haha. Anyway... My friend and I ordered white classic sangria, which was so good! I'd definitely recommend and also paella valenciana, patatas bravas, and garlic shrimp. Honestly, didn't finish the paella because we were already so stuffed on tapas, so we ended up taking most of it to go. Overall I'd give 10 out of 10

Fun lively environment, the interior of the restaurant is much nicer and bigger than the exterior would make you think.  Staff was friendly, they had a small gluten free menu and bread which was nice, although gluten free bread was nothing special.

Pork shoulder was not too impressive for $14 for 4 small slices.  However the beef tenderloin and seared scallops were really good, worth ordering again.  Brussels sprout salad and roasted veggies were also nice and refreshing.

Next time I'll want to try the jamon plate.

Overall great, I'll be back!
The atmosphere was idle for summer. The restaurant has a hip/ comfortable vibe. Highlights were the honey milk chicken and chorizo dates. The dessert menu was dynamite!!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! has become a tradition during our Chicago visits. Nashville doesn't have tapas and I need to get my fix. One thing I really love about Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is the consistency- our favorites remain our favorites and just how we remember them. The menu changes pretty regularly and we try to order a few new things as well as our standards. The sangria is always good but you can't beat Mondays with 1/2 prices cocktails!

Our favorites:
-Goat Cheese baked in tomato sauce- served with crusty bread
-Burrata with heirloom tomato and charred sweet corn- what summertime dreams are made of.
-Brussel sprout salad- shaved sprouts, toasted nuts, cheese. Fresh and delicious!
-the short rib dish (prep varies, but always delicious)
-calamari fritti-- super light and crispy batter
-The Chocolate Truffle Cake dessert and the Butterscotch pot de creme are dreamy.

The atmosphere is great- sit on the patio with the retractable roof if you can!

This place won't revolutionize your tapas world, but it's a great and dependable restaurant for a tasty spanish-influenced dinner with friends or family!

I've been here a few times as it is my favorite Tapas spot in Chicago, and I have yet to be disappointed in any way. It is no wonder that Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! is so popular.

Having spent a considerable amount of time in Spain, and having eaten a considerable amount of food in Spain, I can say with conviction that the food is authentic. If you are familiar with the cuisine, you will realize that nothing on the menu surprises you in terms of creativity, and that is OK, considering:

The tapas are quick to come out in an order that makes sense to the palate. They are always soooo tasty. The Sangria is phenomenal. And the best part of all of this is that everything is reasonably priced.

The space is deceptively massive, and it is rare that you will be waiting in line for a large amount of time, even if you don't have a reservation.

I'll come back whenever I am feeling in the mood for tapas and Sangria!

I have been here three times.  Each time just as excellent as the others.  As most have mentioned, if you eat pork, the bacon wrapped dates are a must.

I was also very happy with the fish, especially the grilled octopus and seared salmon.  The grilled hangar steak is also a solid choice.  The atmosphere is nice and cozy with a warm feel, even though it is a rather decent-sized restaurant in terms of capacity.

Used to be the top place in town for Tapa's, recently it's just carbo-load central with a lot of salt and cheap sangria.

Will do in a pinch, but now that the "shared plates" scene is in full swing, there are much better options around town.

Nothing too daring on the menu, pretty run of the mill choices.

I really enjoy Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. The bacon wrapped dates are the best. The potatoes brava are also amazing. The white and red sangria are both good. Everyone I go with likes the bloody mary bar and it looks great but I'm not a bloody mary fan.
The paella is also great and a good meal to share. I've always had friendly and efficient service. It has a nice atmosphere and is good for small or bigger groups.
Great place for a large group! The red sangria was delicious. The scallops, short rib and potatoes were also a table favorite! The paella is huge even for the  smallest serving.

So I've travelled to Spain.. Barcelona, Valencia, Madrid Sevilla & this by far blows foods in those countries out of the water. Seriously. Everything was extremely flavorful & delicious. Best Spanish placed I've eaten so far & surpasses Cafe Iberico.

I highly recommend the seafood paella. I had seafood paella in Valencia (where paella originated) & this restaurant surpasses Valencia's 110%. I loved the garlic potatoes, octopus, spicy shrimp tapas. (Sorry I can't be more specific) Everything on the menu is great honestly. You can't go wrong.

Definitely get the pitcher of Mango Sangria. You don't taste the alcohol & it has just the right amount of apples & lemons to deliver a delicious balanced taste.

In addition, service was great. The waitress accidentally gave away our octopus to the table behind us and she immediately reordered & took it off the bill for us.

Definitely a great place to go for a celebration/client lunch outing/fancy - casual dinner!

Ba Ba Reeba is just one of those places that I don't really think, "Oh! We should go to Ba Ba Reeba!"... but when I do end up here, I always love it.

It's great for a huge group... you get to try a ton of stuff & it usually ends up being easy on the pocketbook! The last big group I went with (~15 or so), we ended up paying roughly $20/person and we had all the sangria & food, so that's always exciting.

While it's your standard tapas-fare, I've never disliked any dish here. Shrimp, chicken, paella, etc. ... it's all good. And don't forget about the garlic potato salad & bacon-wrapped dates! Holy crap.

Make a reservation. Bring your LEYE membership card. And check in on Yelp for a free dessert!

My absolute favorite place in Lincoln Park! I always bring friends here when they come to town! Everything is delicious, not too expensive ... and the sangria is amazing!!! Make sure to make a reservation well in advance.

Come here twice in two weeks. This place is awesome !
For drinks, my personal favorite is white peach. More fruit flavor in wine, and tastes more sweet.
For food, you must try bacon wrapped dates. Tastes like heaven ! My friend dislikes anything sweet, but she really enjoys this dish. The heat maximizes the sweetness and softness of dates, while the crispy grilled bacon adds some salt to this dish.
Grilled pork is a bit over medium this time. But still the quality of meat saves everything.
Grilled squid is so tender, as I almost doubt it is served directly from the market without cooking.
We also try garlic shrimp, spicy potato, friend chicken, citrus cured salmon, They all worth you to have a try.,
The only dish I dislike is beef empanada. Too dry and too plain.
For dessert, chocolate truffle cake is quite amazing. You can taste rich chocolate flavor, but not over sweet at all. Small bite, but enough for dessert.
I will definitely come back again to try some new dish and order bacon wrapped dates once more !

This place not only has AMAZING food and sangria BUT their staff is amazing!!!!  I had a party of 17 for dinner reservations at 5:30...we were not able to be seated until a little after 6:00.  This was not their fault...there was a party there that had paid and sat for over 45min.  The manager and staff felt so bad that when we sat down there was pitchers of sangria waiting for us and also tons of appetizers (on the house).  We ordered tons and drank tons...the staff was wonderful and on it all night.  When we got our bill there was over $100 taken off our bill due to our inconvenience.  The food was FAB and we will all be coming back!!!  Thank you for a great night with our "ugly Christmas sweater" work party!!!

So good!!

We went for my best friends birthday dinner and I nearly exploded, we ordered so much.

First, get the BLOOD ORANGE SANGRIA. You will kick yourself if you don't. So sweet. The best part is the alcohol-y fruit.

The tapas were really great and authentic. Totally brought me back to Spain! Loved the cheeses and meats. The paella was rather good and not too heavy.  We ordered about one plate per person at the table plus an order of the chicken paella, and it was far more than enough--almost too much.

Overall, it was a bit expensive but worth the money. The extra few bucks were definitely made up for with the quality.
Papaya was too hard and salty. Scollop was good. Bacon and dates was good but a bit salty. Octopus was my favorite.

Best tapas in Chicago. This place has great service, nice atmosphere, and the food is great. Wide variety of dishes, which are all flavorful and great. I would suggest the Paella - it takes 30-40 min, so order some tapas meanwhile; it's worth the wait.

Great place to take friends from out of town.

Food is fantastic. So is the service. Brought a date, it was very crowded, but we were seated right away. Lovely atmosphere.

Get the sangria. Made in house I believe. Delicious. Go here.

We waited 20 minutes even tho we made a reservation. They were running behind so that part was a little annoying but overall great restaurant. Good atmosphere. Got two pitchers of sangria both were great. Would recommend the bacon wrapped dates! The bar is open seating but if you want a table be sure to make a reservation.

pics.caption: This is very filling and perfect to share

review.des:
Passion Fruit Sangria - I recommend!

Seafood Paella - Order this first cause it takes time, and keep this in mind before you order as this portion is very healthy.

Burrata - Good cheese, good blend.

Roasted Dates with Bacon & Apple Vinaigrette - Interesting blend, tasty dates!

Beef Empanada - I liked the flour of the empanada!

Grilled Octopus - Octopus wasn't extremely flavorful

Serrano Ham - My god, this was some amazing meat.

The service was top notch, the atmosphere was energetic, and the experience was great.
Love this place! Their seafood paella is amazingggg!!! I usually go just for that! Of course I've tried plenty of things on the menu and everything is delicious!

I have developed a long distance love affair with this place... wasn't quite sure what to expect because I've had some mediocre tapas in the past. Our waiter was enthusiastic and friendly, and extremely helpful in answering our questions.

Some highlights:
- seafood paella. You must order a minimum of 2 servings. We ordered 4 servings but had trouble finishing amongst our group of 7.
- seared scallops. Baby scallops are used but they are cooked perfectly
- bacon wrapped dates. I have avoided dates since the dawn of time but this classic dish is the perfect marriage of sweet and savory.
- braised short rib with mashed potatoes and veggie of the day. Meat is tender and juicy, rips right apart.
- spicy potatoes. I do love my potatoes and the spicy sauce is to die for.

The meh:
- Sangria. Tastes more like Franzia and the fruit isn't left in the wine so the flavor doesn't absorb as well
- Calamari. Just so-so, wasn't anything worth raving about

All in all, this was such a delicious meal and I always enjoy the concept of shared dining + small plates to enjoy a wide variety of food. Atmosphere is lovely - roomy but still cozy and very romantic lighting.

I was recently introduced to this place when visiting town. We were told the reservation list was full, but we could call ahead and put our name on a wait list, which we did. We arrived a bit earlier than they had told us to and they were able to seat us within five minutes. The place is huge and knows how to manage a busy Fri night!

We had trouble deciding what to order, there are so many great options, I don't think you can go wrong! The sangria was amazing (we tried the classic red); seriously, the best I've ever had. There were three of us in our group; we split about 8 plates: from pinxtos platter to goat cheese in tomato sauce, brussel sprout salad to spicy potatoes, and three different meat plates (Spanish sausages, beef skewer and short ribs). It was all amazing. I'd order those plates again, except that I would also want to try new things!! With that said, my favorites were the roasted dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette (coming from someone who doesn't usually like dates - they were heavenly), rioja-braised short ribs, spicy potatoes and the brussel sprouts. It was a great dining experience. I look forward to coming back!
Great food, great service! The bacon wrapped dates are a must have as well as the Pork Shoulder with chorizo stew!

It is absolutely always a pleasure to be at Cafe BABAREEBZ!

Everyone always talks about the sangria because its true: its so refreshing that you will forget that you need to drive later. Heck, one might go as far as giving it to their children on accident because it takes you back in time to the good ol days of sipping on some juice. If you live near walking-distance or are above the law, try all three pitchers! You wont regret it (maybe later).

There are these pork ribs that are some of the best I've ever had! They satisfy all of rib criteria: crispy shell WITH a glaze + a true fall-off-the-bone texture. These really dont need any tooth effort for separation. Someone could pass gas in your general direction and the force of that small current of pleasant air could send the meat FLYING off these bad boys.

Spicy tomato aioli potatoes are a must at these places. Loved it. Again, crispy outside and soft center in that sauce.

Beef tenderloins w/ blue cheese + potato chips. I'm quite sensitive to blue cheese so I typically dont like ones that are super strong and overbearing. Here, they've got that balance between the cheese and the beef. Remarkably good!

Rioja-braised short ribs broke apart when introduced to the fork. They nailed this one!

Other dishes that we tried were the croquetas (get em all!), short-rib stuffed peppers, fried calamari, and empanadas (get em all!). They were are great and served as awesome fillers.

Octopus a la plancha w/ fingerling potatoes and olives was probably the least favorite of the night. Perhaps we got a bad portion due to the fact that it was tough and chewy. No good! However, there were some portions of the dish that were really tender so it wouldn't be wise to dismiss this entirely.

Did I mention the paella? When we had it, it was restaurant week so I'd imagine that they were mass producing the hell out of these guys. Needless to say, it wasn't memorable (I dare say that Cafe Ibierco put up a fight). Will try again though!
This was great! Best thing was the buratta for sure. Their sangria was delicious as well. Garlic shrimp was also amazing. I will definitely be back.

After visiting Spain my heart has been yearning for paella and tapas. Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has stepped up to the plate! Their menu is fantastic! Super authentic!

The ambiance is laid-back yet festive. Their service is great as well. You get waited on the right amount of times, so you can have a conversation without constant interruptions.

sausage fried paella with egg
iberico ham hash
buttermilk waffle with berries
patatas bravas
bacon wrapped dates
chorizo stuffed dates
red sangria

tried and true spot
from those college days.
tapas style dishes.
great place to dine with a group
and taste a bunch of dishes.

I've been a fan of Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! for years. They have all the best foods and all the best drinks. Server Amber is amazing and accommodating, so I recommend you to request her to be your server! From the sangria (black raspberry!) to the final taste of dessert, I'll keep coming back. Thanks Baba!

Great bloody mary bar!  If you're a fan of tapas, definitely a fun place to go with a group.... just be sure to plan ahead and make reservations.  Very cool atmosphere, great for taking out-of-towners to show them a unique Chicago joint without breaking the bank!

Amazing food, great service and really cool atmosphere. The goat cheese & garlic bread, grilled hanger steak, pork paella (2 servings for 4 people was plenty), and the calamari were all AMAZING. Oh and they make a really tasty gin & tonic (THE Gin & Tonic) that has mint & cucumber in it.

I went here for dinner late night with GF.
We had several dishes from each of the tapas sections.
Everything was good.  
$1.50 pinxtos are all delicious and a good way to sample a lot of flavors.

Bacon wrapped dates are always phenomenal but dates here are wrapped with chorizo. Amazing.

Didn't try the Paella.
Would come back for brunch.
Yelp check in is a free dessert. One for each person who checks in!

It was a wonderful spot to come to after a stressful day at work. I was immediately greeted with smiling faces and a great waitstaff. The atmosphere was full of great energy and people seemed happy to be there.

The food was fantastic. This is the type of place that's great to come with a group of people. Mixing and picking at each other's tapas is the best way to experience the menu.

I definitely recommend the Roasted Dates wrapped in Bacon and Apple Vinaigrette. The Chicken & Ham Croquetas were incredibly tasty as well. I mean, I was pretty much crying at my table.

Also, don't forget to try dessert. I got the caramelized banana and wasn't disappointed one bit.

Came here for a bday dinner and we ordered a bunch of stuff: octopus, squid, croquettas, braised beef, lamb, beef tenderloin, potatas bravas and some other stuff I cant remember. All that tried was decent but nothing standout, and everyone else felt the same. On the plus side, I like the ambiance, its fun for a group event, and street parking is usually available.

Cool atmosphere and delicious tapas but service was a little spotty. We ordered 4 tapas (baked goat cheese, mushroom soup, garlic shrimp and grilled hanger steak). We received the steak first, approximately 5 minutes after we ordered it, and it was cold. It must have been sitting out before we ordered, and it just got given to us. Not cool! It was yummy, though, but I wish it was hot. All of our tapas came out quickly, but then we waited 45 minutes before we saw our waiter again to order dessert. He had a lot of tables and the tables around ours were looking for him, too. Strange. Overall a good experience, and I would go back. I just wish the timing of the service was a little better!
Came here last weekend for my bachelorette dinner. Everything was great, from the service to the sangria, the food to the area we sat in. Thanks Baba Reeba for an amazing start to a fun weekend.
Try the sangria, very good.  Also in no order of greatness, octopus, fried chicken, and meatballs.  Make sure to make a reservation as it gets very busy.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is always a great place to bring people who are visiting the city. Fantastic atmosphere, delicious sangria (we got the red, but I am sure the fruity ones are equally delicious), and a smorgasbord of great tapas to please everyone's tastebuds. I went with a group of six people, so we were able to try many different items. I loved the bacon-wrapped dates, the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, and the spinach-manchego stuffed mushrooms. The endive salad and the brussel sprout salad were a nice, light choice to balance the heavier dishes.

We also checked in on Yelp and got free dessert tapas. The gala apple empanada was warm and sweet -- perfect for a snowy, winter evening.

Our server was great -- he provided helpful recommendations and was patient with our indecisive group.

Overally, yay! I'm a fan :)

We stopped in today, a Sunday, for lunch to celebrate a family member's birthday. In addition to being busy as a weekend day, it's in the second week now of Restaurant Week, so I know that's a crazy, harried time for all the staff. Despite that! our server (Daniel) was fantastic. Knowledgeable, prompt, and very friendly. The food itself was delicious - I particularly recommend the Seared Salmon with cucumber crema and squash. It was melt-in-your-mouth good, and the crema plus roasted squash was an awesome combination. The serving sizes are bigger than we all expected, to boot! Daniel even took it upon himself to bring my brother, whose birthday it was, a dessert on the house with a little candle in it. Adorable.

Basically: Awesome, delicious food for totally reasonable prices for the quality, plus charming, friendly staff who are invested in your having a great visit. Easy, accessible location right off Armitage and Halsted. Definitely going back here for more.

Average food with bad service. We went on a Wednesday when it wasn't super crowded and it still took 5-10 minutes before our sever came over to see us. We ordered a bottle of wine and every time he filled my glass he reached across me and nearly elbowed me in the face and just left his arm inches from my face - I'm not a wine-o but learn how to pour man! We ordered a shrimp dish and it came out severely undercooked, sent it back and they brought out a new one where one one or two shrimp were still pretty questionable. Overall I expected the food to be better and with subpar service I'm not sure I'll bother to go back.

I originally was going to Summer House for dinner with a friend, but the wait was 1 hr and 15 minutes. Hold on, WHAT! We decided to walk a block over to Café Ba-Ba-Reeba. What a blessing in disguise!! This place is awesome.
We obviously wanted to try some of the sangrias. Our waiter told us that we can order half pitchers, which was great because we just could not decide! We chose the sangria of the day, mango, and cevé I believe it was called, which was a sparkling sangria. Both were great, but I preferred the mango one, which we ordered a second pitcher of.
We ordered a WIDE array of foods, which they brought out as they were ready. We were also told if we wanted paella, it would take ~35 minutes to make, and you need to order at least two servings. Glad to know it is all prepared fresh!!
First up was the bacon wrapped dates (in some kind of apple glaze) and shaves Brussels sprout salad. The bacon wrapped dates were unreal! The apple glaze paired very well with it, and it wasn't too sweet. The Brussels sprout salad was also delicious. It was light. The dressing wasn't too much. And it had some kind of tangy cheese thrown into it, which I was a huge fan of.
Next out was some kind of steak with bleu cheese with chips and stuffed mushrooms. The chips were crisp and browned, just as I like them. The steak was cooked perfectly - the waiter said the chef usually cooks it medium, but we can choose how we like it cooked. We told him however the chef recommends, we will do that! The bleu cheese was a bit much, though, so both my friend and I scraped it off. The mushrooms were stuffed with spinach and cheese of some kind and topped with bread crumbs. They were cooked to perfection. Still had a little bite to them but the mixture inside- YUM!
Next up was a short rib of some kind with mashed potatoes and onion bulbs. The short rib melted in your MOUTH. I can't remember the taste of the sauce off the top of my head, but holy COW- it was delicious. The mashed potatoes were creamy and whipped. And the onion bulbs were soft but crisp at the edges.
The paella came out last of the food. It was warm and a flavor explosion. The rice was divine, and it had chicken pieces and green pepper in it. At this point I was pretty full, so I ate the chicken and green peppers out of it with some of the rice. I had a lot left over, but whatever! Still glad I ordered it.
I needed a wheelbarrow at this point, but we decided to indulge in a flourless chocolate cake dessert. It was the PERFECT size. Very small. But that sucker was DENSE. Very rich chocolate. It had the texture of fudge. And it came with some kind of whipped cream thing. Goodness. I couldn't help myself. I ate a few bites, although I was full.
My friend got an iced latte, and he said it was also good.
They were busy, and our server was pretty busy, as well. Usually, I don't like when servers don't check on you often, but honestly the type of intimate environment in there calls for slow service. It's a place that you go to relax, slowly eat, drink, chat, etc. When our server did stop by, he was friendly, helped answer any questions we had, etc. The only thing that I noticed was when we asked for recommendations, I felt like he pulled an answer out of his ass and didn't really give a genuine response. With that said, we had a GREAT experience here. Tapas can get very pricey, so be prepared to spend a lot. But it's all worth it in this cute, candlelit hot spot.

pics.caption: 2 half pitchers of sangria (cevé and mango) YUM
Bacon wrapped dates in an apple sauce of some kind

review.des: A very nice selection of small plates, served quickly. We shared a number of the tapa offerings and they were all very good. Often times the calamari (squid) is rubbery but this dish was very well prepared and flavorful. Not rubbery at all. We shared a pitcher of sangria and really enjoyed the fact that we were able to taste a few of the offerings before finally landing on the preferred flavor. The servers were all very pleasant and efficient. I'd go back if I were in that neighborhood again.

Great place to go with friends.

Love their margaritas and their tapas are pretty decent too. Price is reasonable as well. My only complaint is not food related -- they have a long long wait typically, so be aware. However, if you're going with a few buddies, it's fun to hang out by the bar and wait for your table.

My bestfriend and I seriously had a great time here. The service is exceptional and the food was great and flavorful! To me, it's a bit over priced for us college students but there really should be some sort of discount for us students.

pics.caption: Starting off with their mango sangria! Scrumptious!

review.des: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was SO incredibly busy and such a HUGE place that I was overwhelmed when walking in. But we got a couple spots at the bar in the back and settled in quite quickly. I was surprised at the volume level for the mass amount of people that were occupying the restaurant, which was nice. Service was great we were served drinks almost immediately upon sitting down and had food orders in shortly after. There were three of us and we each ordered three tapas items from the menu. Everything we tried was excellent. My favorite, strangely enough, was the spicy seasoned potatoes. So simple, yet so delicious! One can never go wrong with a bacon wrapped date either. Highly recommended. I would come here again.

Great place for tapas! I had the goat cheese and tomato sauce dip and the patatas braves and both were delicious. The service could use a LOT of work. We kept having to look for the waiter and wave him down - it was a little annoying because we didn't want to have to do that, but he would not come by us and we had no choice. The food is great though and I don't want to fully rate a place on bad service. Check it out!

One of my all-time-favorite girls-night-out spots, date-night-spots, group-spots, you name it. Never had a single bad experience.

Recommendations: Bacon wrapped dates (mouth is watering), queso de cabra, and shredded brussel sprout salad.

Keep it up Cafe Ba-Ba!

Such a fun, different place to go get dinner especially when you have people visiting you from out of town. The food is always delicious and you get to try new things every time because of the large menu and wide variety. Brunch is also great and the diy Bloody Mary bar (though a little expensive) makes for awesome bloodies overflowing with shrimp and bacon.

I like it here. It's relaxed and unassuming, and the food is good too. It can get loud and crowded, but that doesn't bother me. They have some interesting cocktails and a bunch of sangrias. It has a low, red tinted lighting. Try the goat cheese in tomato sauce.

Came to Chicago for a work trip and found this restaurant on yelp. It has a great cozy atmosphere, the service is great, and the food is amazing! We loved every bite and the tapas experience is so much fun. I would definitely come back here again on another trip.

Went on a Saturday night for dinner.  Had a reservation through open table and did not have to wait. Great atmosphere. Food was very good.  We enjoyed the burrata, octopus and short rib the most.  Service was good.

Our second trip here and we were not disappointed. Samantha our waitress was awesome and she gave our daughter a fantastic dessert plate....This place is cozy well designed and I beg someone who is In the rest biz on long island NY open one of these up Pleeeez.....

The staff was very accommodating. We didn't have a reservation and there was a two hour wait but the hostess told us about their full service bar area and we were able to find a table. Cafe Ba-ba-reeba is cute. It looks small from the outside but much bigger once you go inside. There is an outside area that's covered. Food is tapas style. So we started with spicy potatoes with alioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce with bread, grilled hanger steak with charred green chili chimichurri & fingerling potatoes, shrimp with garlic, olive oil and red pepper flakes (least fav), buttermilk fried chicken thighs, piri-piri sauce and shaved vegetable salad (my fav). We also ordered the chicken paella which takes 40 minutes to cook and it was so good! Usually places only have seafood paella or paella with pork...they have those plus vegetarian or chicken so I had to try it! Cafe ba-ba-reeba is located in Lincoln Park. Overall an enjoyable experience. I will go there for Spanish food any day!

This place is pretty cool if you like tapas style food.  This place is definitely lively and energetic for certain. Our waiter was very kind, patient and informative.  

There was a group of us and so we went around the table and ordered chicken, spicy potatoes, a little salad, drinks and some dessert after wards and the taste was good.  It's definitely a new experience for me since I've never been to a tapas place before.  

The highlight for me was the spicy potatoes. Very good and had a very unique taste to them and highly recommend them.

Parking the night we went was very tough, but I got lucky and finally found a spot after looking for 45 minutes.  Definitely leave early if you're gonna try make your reservations on time.

Fantastic tapas! Loved the goat cheese with tomato  and the spicy potatoes. Also the shave Brussels sprouts salad was delicious-lots of texture with the addition of the nuts they add for flavor. The sangria was tasty but definitely a bit weak. Celebrated a birthday and they brought out delicious dessert tapas as well...the chocolate cake one (can't think of the exact name) was amazing. Cute place and friendly service-a great place to celebrate with a group or a fun date.
Absolutely love this restaurant, one of my favorite places to eat in Chicago. There's something on the menu for everyone, and I've yet to try something that isn't delicious.
Had a great time. Food was excellent.  Go with a bunch of people so you can try multiple tapas.

I went with a friend to this place on a busy Friday night and found two seats at the bar. We started with their half bottle red wine blend with Syrah and Cabernet, which had a dry, almost pepper like aftertaste. Very nice! The tapas we had were:

Bacon dates (I want these at my wedding)
Goat cheese in tomato sauce
Burrata with tomato marmalade
Short rib with manchego mashed potatoes
Grilled Pork
Fried chicken thighs

All were quite delicious! Be aware that the portion sizes are not typical for a tapas restaurant. They are quite generous and each plate is good for two people.

I'm giving 4 stars because the service was so so. Our desert (espresso ice cream) took over 20 minutes to get to us and we had to wait over 20 minutes to get our check. No apology from our server, either. I would come back again though for those bacon dates. Those were incredible!

A friend of mine John suggested that I try this restaurant and I said what the heck I'm always trying new things this is a very pleasant experience. When we entered the restaurant we were greeted by very friendly person and was given our seats the waiter was extremely friendly very helpful and explained every detail of any questions I had regarding their entrees that they serve being this is my first experience here. We decided to order about five or six different items off the menu and I must say the shrimp with garlic sauce was by far the best ! During the course of our meal a gentleman named Mark Sotelino and asked how things were doing . Which I thought was really great experience to see that later that I found out that he was the general manager and he took the time and consideration to make sure all his customers were 100% satisfied with the service here :-) . This is a restaurant that I would recommend to my friends and family and especially to someone who wants to take your girlfriend for a nice romantic dinner which I'm going to do some time in the near future with my girlfriend
We had a private party here once and it was great. Their service and food are impecable. We also been here for dinner and brunch.

I lurvvv you. To prove my feelings for you, I've brought every visitor I've had here AND have introduced coworkers to you. Going to a subpar overpriced tapas place in San Francisco just made me appreciate you that much more.

The prices here are very reasonable. A pitcher of sangria was under $25. They weren't very strong but they were still delicious and filled with fruit.

Portions are very reasonable. Before you know it, you're completely stuffed. I've tried a number of items on their menu. My three must haves here are the brussel sprout salad, tortilla espanola, and paella. The paella is huge and two servings was definitely more than enough for five of us. Unless the paella is your entree and you have no desire to try anything else on their menu, I would use 2-3 people per serving of paella as a guide.

Food is flavored very well, cooked well, and came out hot. The spicy garlic shrimp was truly garlicky. I don't normally like squid but even that was delicious. It wasn't gummy or tough. It was tender and while I still don't like squid, I would try it again.

If you need further proof of how truly stellar this restaurant is, it won over my 70 year aunt and 60 year old mom, who both gravitates towards Asian food. Not only did they love cafe ba-ba-reeba, this place trumped ALL restaurants that I had brought them to during their trip here. They even ranked this above the three Asian-inspired places that I thought would rock their world.

Two weeks after my visit here, I brought my mom to a tapas place in San Francisco. She could not stop comparing it against Cafe ba-ba-reeba, which is now her gold star standard!
Pleasant ; ate in far back room - quiet - nice .  Appetizer sample tray was the best !

My favorite restaurant in Chicago! Every time I go I have to get the bacon wrapped dates and patatas bravas. I recently tried their brunch items and they are also great. Perfect ambiance for a date or night out with friends.

Went here for a birthday last night at 8pm. I was worried about finding parking because of other Yelpers' reports but I got very lucky in finding a spot right outside. Score!

I started with the one bite Pintxos (pinches) which are just $1.50 each. I tried the
1. Chorizo Wrapped Medjool Date & Cheese - this one was just okay to me. The date flavor overpowered this bite. My friends got the date dish which was a bit better then mine, apparently, so I suggest going for that instead of teh $1.50 bite.    
2. Ahi Tuna Poached In Olive Oil On Avocado Toast -  Again just okay, not bad but not spectacular.
3. Goat Cheese Croqueta - Super tasty bite! Filled with creamy, succulent goat cheese. Loved it.      
5. Spanish Artisanal Cheese & Quince -Not a fan of this at all. The quince is a strange fruit...tastes good but has an awfully strange consistency to it.    
6. Mushroom & Rice Croqueta Loved this bite as well. It had some flavoring that was almost curry like in taste. Really lovely taste.

For my main tapas I tried the Spinach & Manchego Stuffed Mushrooms at $5.95. My favorite item of the night! They looked so good and tasted so very good! I was kind of sad my friends tried 2 so I was only left with 2 for myself. Selfish me. :P  I also had the Chicken & Ham Croquetas at $5.95. These were so filling and I could barely finish them but they were just fantastic.

Our service was excellent and they gave my buddy some chocolate & ice cream with a candle in it for her birthday. It looked good but I was so stuffed from all of my bites I couldn't even taste the dessert!

Ambiance was fun like your usual tapas restaurant, sound level was loud and it was hard to hear people at my table.  I would defintiely go back to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba to try more dishes but will probably steer clear of the $1.50 pintxos next time.

Went for brunch this morning and got the Citrus French toast and the big portion of the palatas bravas. they were amazing ! Wish there was a little more of the goat cheese butter and honey but I'd order this again and the potatoes too! The potatoes are the perfect amount of crispy and seasoned and whatever the sauce is that they put with it-mayonnaise based and a little spicy? I'm not sure but we almost ordered a third order because of how delicious it was. I've been for dinner too but that was a year ago and I can't even remember what I got but it was quite tasty that I came back willingly! They are good about splitting checks too.

pics.caption: Citrus French toast and palatas bravas (bigger option) AMAZING

review.des:
We recently dined at Café Ba-Ba-Reeba on a Saturday evening. Our server was very attentive, and all of the other people involved on serving our table were very friendly and concerned we had a great experience.
The tapas menu was extensive, and our server very knowledgeable of all of the items. The restaurant quickly filled up, so we were glad we got there early.
We enjoyed everything. The only negative was that it was noisy and crowded.

Love, love, love this place!!! I have been here twice, once with just the hubby We went with a large group for a gluttonous dinner and tried a huge variety of tapas. All of them were fantastic. While there, we also sampled 4 types of sangria. My favorite was the raspberry. Service was excellent and the price was more than reasonable.

I really liked this place! Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba has brunch options along with everything else. It's so perfect. I went for their brunch but also ordered a couple of dinner options. I ordered the hash (amazing with the egg and oozing yolk on top!), scallops (this was okay), beef short rib (really tender), pork belly kabob (pretty good), and the octopus (this was my favorite). I also ordered their sangria and a chocolate tart cake with vanilla ice cream. Service was also very good!

pics.caption: Hash with egg (yolk oozes out!) on top
Chocolate tart and vanilla ice cream

review.des:
I am 100% OBSESSED with this restaurant. I am not one to go to the same place again and again unless I find it exquisite, which I do. First let me start with how you need to go on a day that they serve brunch. I can't go to ba ba eeba and not get one or two deviled eggs with crispy jamon serrano. They are out of this world!!! Second, do yourself a favor and get the passion fruit sangria. Amazing. You really can not go wrong with any of the tapas. If it is your first time I recommend getting the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, but again every tapa I have ordered I have thoroughly enjoyed.
The only reason I didn't give five stars is because the service is always slow. It always takes my server a long time to get to my table, which means that you should put as many tapas as you can in right away because they do not all come out at the same time.
Cafe ba ba reeba i loooooove you and i am sure ill see you this weekend.

I'm surprised I've never reviewed CBBR before because I'm such a big fan of it! The numerous options are great for foodies and trying things with friends. There are plenty of options for picky eaters as well, if you've got someone with vegetarian/GF type restrictions or who is just plain picky. They do a great job of accommodating large groups as well so if you plan a group outing here it is easily doable!

This is my favorite tapas place. We come here every year for our work holiday party and are never disappointed. I've been to other tapas restaurants that seem to favor quantity over quality of food. I consider the food here to be gourmet tapas that is a cut above many of the other places I've tried.

My absolute favorite dishes are the braised short ribs, paella valenciana, and chicken curry salad. I also enjoy the serrano ham & cheese platter, spinach & manchengo stuffed mushrooms, goat cheese in tomato sauce, and seafood paella.

This place was simply amazing for a weekend brunch. Start by mixing your own Bloody Mary to your liking. They have all the fixings you could possibly want in your drink. Add a beer back for $1. Order a pitcher of sangria to share with some friends. The tapas were all so good. My favorite was the grilled octopus. I never knew octopus could be so soft to the point that it melts in your mouth. The fried calamari were great. Bacon wrapped dates give you something salty and something sweet. Lamb kabob was tasty. Top everything off with some dessert. I very much enjoyed my flan. You can't go wrong with brunch here. Just know that you'll have to wait to get seated but you can always grab a seat at the bar first-come first-served.

pics.caption: Instructions to mix your bloody mary

review.des: The food itself is just average as well as the sangria. But the dining experience is always a pleasure and its great to be able to share and sample a bunch of small plates. When trying to do dinner with picky eaters, this is highly recommended. There's bound to be something for everyone.

My first time at a Tapas restaurant and it was WONDERFUL! For those who aren't familiar, Tapas are appetizer-like dishes combined with a paella to make a full meal.

A group of 5 of us tried the Pintxos platter, the spinach and manchego-stuffed mushrooms (5 only), grilled squid with olive oil and garlic (large portion), spicy potatoes with tomato alioli (large portion) and 2 other tapas I forgot and the seafood paella. I was very impressed with all the tapas but liked the GRILLED SQUID and SPICY POTATOES the most. You can't really go wrong with any of the tapas. Also, don't let my picture of the pintxos platter fool you - everything on there is DELICIOUS and my favorite one was the GOAT CHEESE CROQUETA WITH LEMON GASTRIQUE.  My only mild complaint was that the seafood paella was saltier and stickier than I would have liked. TIP: TWO SERVINGS of paella is able to satisfy 5 people (2 guys, 3 girls).

TRY THE PASSION FRUIT SANGRIA! The alcoholic taste is minimal and is a fresh complement to the meal.

The servers are attentive but not overly hovering. The front of the restaurant is also deceptive; it is quite spacious inside. Be sure to make RESERVATIONS! This place is always hopping!

(As a side note, to get the faucet to turn on in the restroom, stick your hand behind the faucet opening and underneath the pipe.)

pics.caption: Spinach & manchego-stuffed mushrooms, grilled squid, spicy potatoes

review.des: ehhh.... it's ok. I like the bloody mary bar and small plates are fun, but I don't ever think to myself "oooo let's go there!" Good place if you're in the area though!

Fantastic food in subtle Spanish ambiance. Our server Erika was on point and table touched the perfect amount. Everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and very flavorful. The chorizo wrapped medjool dates were so good that I ordered seconds. The next time we visit Lincoln Park we will absolutely come here for a meal.
Overhyped. Great service, but every dish was mediocre at best.  Not sure if I would go back.

pics.caption: Red Pepper Stuffed with Beef Short Rib

review.des: This place is alright for like a first date.  The food is ok not exceptional.  You can however always count on it having great service and the food will always be cooked well.  The main reason for that is because it is a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant and they always have their stuff together no matter what.

This was an AMAZING dining experience. Recently moving to Chicago, this is definitely my new go-to tapas and drinks spot. Absolutely love the atmosphere, very upbeat and the service is friendly and attentive. Was here with friends, we tried tons of apps, not one we didn't love. Also had a house margarita and couple pitchers of different sangrias. Thank you for an amazing night!

pics.caption: Finish one flavor, onto the next!

review.des: Went for brunch a few weekends back and totally fell in love. We order a ton of tapas plates but I was totally obsessed with the Nutella and banana waffle. I've dreamt about it ever sense. We called ahead and got seated right when we sat down so I definitely advise that. When we told our waitress that it was our first time she gave us the most delightful truffle dessert on the house. Overall I left full and happy. You should for sure stop by.

Fun place, good food, great drinks. This is THE Chicago tapas institution and theres a reason. It is a happy place to be and the ambiance is great. Even the old standard of goat cheese in tomato sauce is still delish. Good octopus, olives, potatoes. Yum.
Liked their traditional dishes, but not very quiet and cozy place to seat down and relax...

pics.caption: Eggs Benedict with some vegetables...very tapas!)
Baked eggs with pumpkin seed pesto....not so small for tapas...

review.des: We LOVE this place! Perfect for sharing and tasting lots of items to try. Their sangria is to die for! So so great!

The food was pretty good, but it was served with dirty plates and silverware!  Our waitress was understanding when I sent back a stack of plates, but then even some of the replacements had stuck-on food (and most were wet- gross).  Same with the silverware.  There are plenty of other tapas restaurants that take a little more pride in their presentation and cleanliness.  I won't be back.

Great tapas and sangria! I loved all the dishes we tried from the spicy potatoes to the bacon wrapped dates. The short ribs were amazing and tender and the chicken and ham croquette were scrumptious. Make sure you go early because the place is alway packed.

Eh.

Seriously. We were all excited to check this place out after hearing such glowing praise. Not impressed.

Their wine selection was surprisingly mediocre. We caught the douchey hipster staff pointing at us and laughing at our wine choice- but they were right... it was awful, even though I'd had a very similar Tempranillo and really enjoyed it.

These tapas were overpriced and overhyped. Absolutely not worth the money we spent. Their cheese selection was again... mediocre. And when paired them with our two mediocre wines? More general 'meh'.

We made it a point to order the more popular tapas and trusted our snobby server. Mistake. I've had better, more authentic tapas; for less money and better service.

There are plenty of places that I'd felt I'd visited on an off day. Not Ba-Ba-Reeba. It was just pretty blah, and we left unimpressed.

On-point tapas place. Go here for dinner, then kingston mines for drinks and live music.

Didn't get 5 stars because they don't have goat cheese baked in tomato sauce.

Can I please rate this place 10 stars.

I cannot say how much I love this restaurant. I don't consider myself a food snob.  I just like good food and this place has GOOD food! I have never had anything bad here. Every dish that comes out is better than the last.

If you don't get bacon wrapped dates, just kill yourself. I mean really.

GO HERE!

I love this place, it's  one of my favorite restaurants and also the best Tapas restaurant I have ever been to. You wouldn't think the same items at different tapas restaurants would be so different .. but it is very noticeable to me, that this place just does everything a notch better. You definitely need a reservation though. Even though the place is huge, it is always packed.

A bit pricey but otherwise excellent tapas. Between four people, we ended up ordering nine tapas and also got two free desserts thanks to Yelp. A couple of my favorite tapas were the burrata, the grilled octopus with green harissa, beef tenderloin with blue cheese, and the bacon-wrapped dates. Of course, you can't go wrong serving a hunk of burrata, and the grilled octopus was tender and had a delicious char to the outside. The beef tenderloin with blue cheese was a bit of a strange request, but ended up being delicious. The blue cheese topping was a perfect salty complement a well-cooked and tender beef tenderloin. Personally, I am a huge sucker for bacon-wrapped dates and have to order them whenever I am out for tapas. There is something so special about crispy, salty bacon wrapped around a warm, gooey, and sweet yet slightly crisp on the outside date. Perfect combination and Ba-Ba-Reeba's dates certainly did not disappoint! I found tapas like the waffles with banana and nutella and the hangar steak to just be okay. Nothing really special or super flavorful going on. For dessert, we had a mango sorbet, which was good, and a flan with nitilla, which was also good, although it was fairly runny in the center. Overall, this is definitely a classic tapas restaurant and never a bad choice. The menu is extensive and pretty much all of the dishes were ordered were tasty. The restaurant itself has a great atmosphere/vibe and drink list looked excellent so it's definitely a great place to come by and have meal with friends/family.

This place is amazing! it is huge and has tons of space to accommodate a large group or if you're looking for a table for 2.  I've only been here for brunch, never another meal.  If their dinners are anything remotely close to brunch, you're in luck.  The food is always on point and you cannot go wrong with the make your own Bloody Mary Bar.  Seriously, do it! Its Awesome! Try all the food as its great and if you go with friends and share plates, it won't hit you in the wallet too much either.  Enjoy!

This was a great spot for brunch with friends! Because their menu is tapas, we were able to order many small plates and sample lots of different food. The food was good, the service was good, and I liked the atmosphere and neighborhood of this place. We also enjoyed a pitcher of their sangria. A great, fun place for groups.

Don't forget to check-in on Yelp.  You can get a free tapas dessert.

portions are small, but they are delicious.  a little bit pricey, but what can you expect.

if you are a student, then find somewhere else to eat.  if you work and have pretty good financial background, come here and enjoy the meal.

We let the server pick our dishes and they were pretty amazing.

-scallops
-chicken/ham/cheese fried stick things
- caprese dish
- stuffed mushrooms
- beef something
- buffalo chicken pieces

I'm a generally unimpressed food-spoiled-I've-eaten-better/everywhere person and this was a great meal. Refreshing that they don't slack despite their popularity.
Delicious Sangria! Delicious food (a little salty but worth it regardless). Great atmosphere.

Can you say bacon wrapped dates? I mean it's so good. The sangria is always a crowd pleaser. Try the peach.
It's tapas, it's yummy, it's always crowded. The service is on par. The lay out of the tables is annoying but the beef tenderloin makes up for any annoyances.

I'm a tapas virgin therefore reading all the great reviews I was super excited to try Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!

We were sat promptly and the host was very friendly. Our server seems to be kind of out of it and confuse about something.

I understand the concept of getting small dishes to share with everyone, but when 1 dish only gives a very, very small taste to 1 out 3 of us, then I don't think it's worth it especially when I can get a whole meal for the same price that tastes better.

Luckily I got a free redemption of stuffed mushrooms on my FB check in or else we would of still been hungry! The stuffed mushrooms and short ribs were very good. The scallops with concus and chicken empanada were okay. The shrimp and scallop paella wasn't good. It had some slimy tangy, extremely salty mixture with huge peapods and not enough shrimp or scallops. Bleh.

The food isn't worth the price and I wasn't even full.

pics.caption: seared scallops, raisins, couscous & pine nuts

review.des:
LOVE Cafe Babareeba! Between the food, atmosphere, and sangria, it is simply amazing!! Have been there about 5 times and will definitely be back for more.

The spicy potatoes, salmon, and white peach sangria are all MUSTS.

Terrific Tapas! Definitely try the $2 Tapas on the top of the menu. We did the platter of all 6 for $11. What fun to have two bites of 6 different things. The dates and the beef/apple bruschett were our favorites. Garlic Shrimp is my favorite Tapas always. Theirs was good. The Paella was okay, be warned it's a full pan, not a small plate. The atmosphere is very festive and fun. Service was terrific

Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!
We were in town and met some friends here, been craving a good tapas place and we will be back every time we come to Chicago! We had so many things and every single thing we ordered was delicious! I don't think you can go wrong with any item on the menu!

My favorite restaurant in Chicago! Must order the goat cheese with marinara and a pitcher of sangria. One glass is never enough. ;) Don't have reservations? No worries!!! There is open seating at the bar and plenty of options for your gluten-free friends.

I almost had to come back in here and write a review on how the USED to be my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Tonight we went there for my birthday (as we always do) and were sat 40 minutes after our 6:00 PM reservation. Around 6:25 PM, I started writing my livid Yelp review in my head. However, once we were finally sat, managers Arther and Brian apologized profusely and explained the situation. I completely appreciated the explanation because it made total sense. They brought us two free tapas. The first unknowingly being my favorite, the goat cheese and marinara, which I would have ordered anyway. Our server, Erika, took good care of us. Overall, the wait was completely made up to us. Cafe Ba-ba-reeba is still my favorite restaurant in Chicago.

There's really nothing I can say about this place that hasn't been said already. Amazing tapas restaurant known for their sangria and paella, everything is good on the menu, an absolute MUST eat here for anyone in Chicago
Miss this place sooo much! What a unique dinning experience! It's definitely worth trying! Beautiful patio. Terrific food & culture! Very romantic!

We finally got a chance to visit this place after having it bookmarked for almost 6months...
Have to say totally worth the visit, beautiful ambience with skylights, great menu (also avail GF) and superb food!!
Highly recommend: Bloody Mary (make your own Bloody Mary bar with great garnishes)
Tapas- shrimp, fried calamari, chicken skewers, short ribs.. And caramel bar for desserts :)

Enjoy!!!!!
Great restaurant! Service was great, atmosphere is very nice as well. Must have the peach sangria, but everything on the menu is good.

pics.caption: Paella was delicious! Great service as well.

review.des: I used to go here back in the 90s and it was like no other place I had been before. Of course, it was my first experience with tapas. The fact that they let you sit there and enjoy your food (which was excellent) and drink for hours without rushing you out was completely novel to me. The last time I went there, everything was awful. The food was barely passable (overdone, lacking flavor). We had to be moved from our original table because the noise was absolutely deafening. The service was also barely passable. I have no desire to go back. Not when there are tapas places now that provide an enjoyable experience where you don't have to feel your head vibrate from the screeching drunk women surrounding you and you can get fresh, flavorful food.

Love this place!  The menu is always so delicious, and honestly is so large that you can come back here so often that there is usually something you will have never tried before.

I recently ordered it from Grubhub and it's just as delicious.  

I recommend coming early in the week so it's not too busy and they usually have great sangria specials as well!

Excellent service, excellent food, and excellent drinks. We had a large party, and they accommodated very appropriately, and everything we ordered was beyond expectations. The service was impeccable. 5 stars!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba broke my tapas cherry and I feel like I'll never really get over this place.

We checked this place out mid-afternoon on a Saturday and it was relatively busy. We had reservations, so we were seated immediately. The staff was extremely friendly and had a lot of great recommendations for different plates to try.

While our table was swamped with a variety of delectable dishes, the two that stuck out were the Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce and the Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli. I strongly recommend trying them.

This place not only has good food and service, but it's also located in a great spot; perfect place to stop after doing some shopping. I look forward to eating there again!

After having dined here a few months back with my husband, I wrote a review about our not-so-stellar experience. We were unimpressed and likely would not return. Immediately after posting my review, I was contacted by a manager at Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba. He was very receptive to the feedback I had provided and assured me our experience did not live up to their standards. He invited us back to give them another try. We redeemed his offer Saturday night and are happy to say we were really enjoyed our dinner.

Unfortunately we didn't start off well since we waited 40 minutes to be seated even though we had a reservation. We weren't seated until my husband went and inquired about it to the host and apparently they had overlooked our names and were seating people with 8:45 reservations even though ours was at 8:00. We were not feeling optimistic to start. One of the managers working there stopped by once we were seated to apologize and in fact bought our pitcher of sangria, which was so nice that all was forgiven.

Our service was good, the food was delicious, and it was well timed. Stand out dishes we thought were the lamb kebobs, meatballs, bacon wrapped dates and the endive and blue cheese salad. The last dish seriously I want to eat an entree size portion of it right this second it was so good. We also tried the sangria of the day, pomegranate, and it was amazing.

The customer service at this restaurant in and of itself deserves 5 stars. We had some bad luck here but it didn't go unnoticed, and management bent over backwards to make our experience something positive. That is huge in my book.

I'm already looking forward to my next visit. In particular, the endive salad.
We hosted our daughters party here  great staff and food , everything was perfect .
Fantastic tapas! The brussel sprout salad and bacon wrapped dates are always phenomenal

I've had my eye on this place for a while and I'm so glad I finally went. We ordered about 11 different tapas for 5 of us total which was just right.

We really enjoyed the spicy potatoes, shrimp, goat cheese, hanger steak, fried calamari, and beef skewers. For dessert we ordered chocolate truffle cake and caramelized banana.

The only thing we didn't like were the fried green peppers.

Also be sure to check in on Yelp and get a free dessert tapas! :) It will be very small though so you may want to think twice about splitting one..

We got 10 dishes and some white sangria..

Chorizo wrapped dates- Yum!
Short ribbed stuff pepper- okay
House marinated spanish olives- waste of money... just plain olives... we didn't finish it
Spicy tomato with aeoli sauce- Yum!!! probably the best dish.
Spinach and manchego stuffed mushrooms- okay... would taste better with meat inside
Grilled squid- not bad!
Scallops- pretty good
Roast dates with bacon and apple vinegrette- very good
Braised pork belly- it was like all fat....
Catalan bread with ripe tomato- very good!
Great brunch menu and tapas! Love the vibe, but do think it's still a little overrated. There are better restaurants in Chicago to be hyped about, but still a great place!

Cute Mediterranean tapas spot.  It's huge inside but was still very crowded at 5 pm on a Saturday.  We enjoyed a pitcher of white sangria (okay) and a few different dishes, which were mostly great.  The beef skewers were too tough/stringy but the scallops wrapped in prosciutto were tangy and flavorful and some type of goat cheese tomato spread was amazing.  My favorite dishes were the bacon wrapped dates and the papas bravas--spicy potatoes with some addictive sauce.  We also got the Brussels sprouts salad which was definitely decent.  I wish we'd spaced our order a bit different since by the time the dates and potatoes came out I was nearing capacity.  I also would stick to red sangria--but definitely a good spot for tapas!
This place is amazing. Hip, fun, and convenient. Great vibes already want to go back. Staff was so sweet too. Pretty people and great music.
Love this place! Always get the spicy shrimp, patas bravas, brussel sprout salad. Can't really go wrong here.

Vegetarian review--We didn't get the paella, so if I had maybe I'd have been happier. We weren't too impressed. And I was disappointed because it's been around so long and I felt like the only one left who hadn't been there yet. I have to say, when I ordered the roasted peppers I  didn't expect to just get literally 8 little peppers, roasted. That's it. $6. Seriously. No sauce or even 1 other thing on the plate. That was a condiment, not a dish. The garlic potato salad was ok, but isn't that American grocery store stuff? I only ordered it because I ran out of choices. Didn't say "Spain" to me. The waiter said paella takes 45 minutes...so after the first round its too late for that. Wish i knew that...45 minutes!!! Really? So people wait 45 minutes for a meal here? I was starving still after about 5 shared dishes that were sooo small, so I ordered the omlet. Two of them. They were huge and it was toward the end of the meal...I didn't want an omlet for dinner, but after trying pretty much the whole veggie section, they were they same price as the meat items and there was not enough food. Why on earth would there be an omlet on the dinner menu? Chick pea stew was pretty good and a decent size. They need to get something with some substance on the veggie menu. And get rid of the omlet, it wasnt even very good. But at least it made me full. The good: spicy potatoes, the mushrooms and chick pea stew. The bad: roasted peppers, potato salad, omlet, brussel sprouts salad (no taste). The ugly: $50 each with tip and only getting full because of the omlet. Now, I've been to other tapas places, and they were amazing. This place IMO, is not much, at least for a vegetarian.

Friendly staff. Great place to have brunch on Sundays. You can get items off of the dinner menu if you ask. Beef dishes are always a sure thing such as the blue cheese crusted filet or the beef skewer with grilled onions and horseradish sauce.
Croquettas are far better than Cafe Iberico. Great place for a group.

The lady and I came about an hour before closing- wow! We ordered the octopus, the salmon, the olives, the shrimp, and the croquettes. The octopus could've had more meat and less potatoes but the shrimp, oh my lord the shrimp. Perfect. Ordered a few cocktails as well. The service was impeccable and the entire atmosphere of the place was vibrant, fun, and happy.
Went there before a night out on the town when visiting Chicago.  Sangria, lots of good portioned tapas, and delicious paella.  Wonderful experience.  Went with a group of 9.
Best tapas place around! Great ambiance with the outside patio and very knowledgeable staff. The chicken thighs are my new favorite dishes.I come here at least once a month!

Finally got to try this place out!
They take reservations, woo hoo!
Tapas style, meaning, small plates, maybe order  an average of between 2-3 plates per person. Great way to share and try different stuff!

The plates that stood out to me, sorry, I'm listing a description not the Spanish name:

Spicy Potatoes, I love potatoes, so automatically it's one of my faves, comes with a yummy sauce, and no, it's not spicy at all

Bacon Wrapped Dates - sweet and salty, yum.

Garlicky Shrimp - delicious and garlicky indeed

Stuffed Mushrooms - tasty and I liked that they weren't just covered in cheese

Asparagus with egg - anything with an egg on it is another default winner!! And asparagus is one of my faves

Diver Scallops - I'm a sucker for scallops too, and Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba did a pretty good job on their scallops

Dessert: Coconut flan - pretty good, check in on yelp and you get a free dessert!

I need to go back and try their breakfast/brunch menu. Attentive service, everyone was nice and our water glass was never empty. Super cute place, great place to bring a date.

We came here on a Sunday night with reservations. Upon checking in, we were told we can sit by the bar and we will get called. We waited about 5 to 10 minutes even though we were on time for our reservation. I guess that is how they operate, but I think 5 to 10 minutes is a little too long for a restaurant that was about half full/ half empty.

Our waitress came over and took our drink order and we were deciding what size we wanted; she seemed like she was in a hurry to leave our table and said our 1/2 pitcher of sangria was good and we can always order more. I would have liked for her to at least tell us about the sangria of the day but thats okay.

Our food arrives with a decent amount of time in between each one except for the spicy potatoes which are my favorite! We were almost done with the last 2 dishes when it finally did arrive and that was the last dish we were working on. I like to have switch between dishes when I eat here so that was a bummer. After a couple potatoes, i actually got tired of it.

Overall, it was a good meal but I think the service could have been better and I'm so upset about the spicy potatoes coming out last.
Haven't been here in a while, decided to give it another go. Happy to say the food is as delicious as I remember, they keep their standards high... And as long as they do I'll keep coming back

Unfortunately, in Chicago there is not a great selection of Spanish food. In my opinion, I feel that Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba offers the best paella and patatas bravas available in town!

The rest of the tapas are ok. I went there several times and I think I have tried a large varieties of their tapas. I feel they are ok, but I would not go crazy for any of them. I like the cuban sandwich a lot!! It is really good.

The environment is really nice, large, spacious, you can see the big jamon cerrano hanged as in Spain!

The sangria is pretty tasty too!

We had three tapas: garlic shrimp, hanger steak, and a squid. The garlic shrimp and the squid were quite good, and I will probably order them again next time. We also had two servings of paella (we really wanted to order one, but two is the minimum), which was very good. The sangria was just mediocre, not impressive at all. But I have to say, everything is overpriced here...

The food here is very tasty. I came here on a double date. For food we had the bacon wrapped dates and they were probably the entire table's favorite. We next did the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce which was paired with garlic bread- no complaints there! The short rib was very tasty and cooked tenderly-we all loved this one too. We all also enjoyed the shrimp with garlic. I really liked the calamari since it was really crispy.  The chicken empanada was also very flavorful and we all liked that more so than the beef one. We finished with the meatballs which were nothing special and not worth it with so many other delicious items on the menu! The portions were small but it was sufficient for 4 of us to taste everything and still leave stuffed. I had a virgin sangria which I thought was very good and I couldn't tell the difference. The boys felt the drinks were a little too fruity since sangria is pretty much the only option here. The other downside was that the food came out super fast and our meal went very quickly so take your time with ordering if you want to relax and spend time with your friends/family. One tip we would give to this tapas restaurant is to provide serving spoons for the dishes. We were luckily seated next to the food service area and could grab spoons as we pleased but it really is a necessity when you are sharing plates.

I came here several years ago and didn't love it, but I enjoyed it this time! Everything was very good - the chorizo-wrapped dates w/ goat cheese, chicken paella, butterscotch dessert, special sangria (pear), etc.

Such a fan. Went with a group of my coworkers and everyone got to try a little bit of everything. You can't leave here without trying at least one sangria, because I swear they are so good that you'll want to go back just for the sangrias.

Amazing! There's no other word for this place. This is my first time to this place, and I'm glad I waited till I was able to afford this place with my own hard earned money. LoL!

Forget the decor.. It's too hipsterish for my taste and the chairs in the patio are not made for comfort.

Our waitress Marilyn was prompt and checked up on us at the perfect times.. But the food was so good, it was hard for us to have any type of conversation during our dinner.

For drinks, white preach sangria.. enough said.

The three of us ordered 2 plates each.. It was more than enough

Tapas:
1) fried calamari, tomato crudo, jalapeno alioli
2) beef tenderloin & blue cheese
3) spicy potatoes with tomato alioli
4) seared octopus, padron peppers, shallots, salsa verde
5) spiced lamb kebabs with lemon, mint, and tomato
6) scallops a la plancha, jamon iberico vinaigrette

Dessert:
1) Chocolate truffle cake with Kahlua
2) Caramelized banana with vanilla ice cream topped with pistachios
3) Marona caramel almond bar with butter crust

Get reservations.. You will not regret.

One of my favorite spots for tapas! I've been here too many times to count and they  never disappoint.  Some advantages that they have over other popular tapas places is that they're great for groups, reservations are easy to make, and they're moderately priced.  

Some of my favorites:
SCALLOPS! Very good here.
Short ribs with mashed potatoes
Endive and blue cheese salad
Goat cheese with tomato sauce
Paella with pork

They have a Bloody Mary bar for Sunday brunch and some great brunch items.  If it's your birthday, make sure you get your free birthday treat!

Food was very inconsistent and not to say potatoes came with every dish instead of enough food to share.  Prices are very high.  I'm use to tapas in Spain where it's $3 not $12.  Would never come back here.

Went here for a birthday dinner with 8 girls and had a blast! Thanks to Yelp perks we got desserts for free! Our waiter was very, very nice and accomodating.

My friends and I all stuck to the seafood options. I got the chicken moorish dish and the grilled squid! Both were so so delicious. The squid came in a simple olive oil sauce that was slightly heavy but great nonetheless. The chicken dish had golden raisins, pinenuts and cauliflower- perfect! The desserts were all small but my friends loved them and the atmosphere was gorgeous. Huge restaurant. Can't wait to go back sometime soon but making reservations at least 2 weeks in advance would be recommended.

pics.caption: Grilled squid tapas with olive oil

review.des:
Went here on a visit to Chicago - a great spot to check out, close to transit.

The food was of course, amazing. The patatas bravas were a favorite, as were some of the by piece tapas.

Also, both red and seasonal sangrias were fantastic. We had a group of four, and thought they were very busy, service was on point and friendly.

We really enjoyed this restaurant. The prices were reasonable and the service was good. It was our anniversary and the waiter surprised us with a complimentary desert. No complaints here at all. If we're in the area again, we'll definitely be back!
Delicious! This place took me right back to Spain - very authentic food. And the sangria was incredible! Don't miss this place if you're in Chicago. It's worth the wait times!

I recently ate here with 3 other friends, and really enjoyed my experience! We made reservations since it was a Saturday night, which I highly recommend since the place was packed. We started out with a full pitcher of their red sangria and a half pitcher of their white peach sangria. Both were delicious. Next the bread came, and even that was delicious. It was the perfect combination of crusty and soft.

For our tapas, we ordered the shrimp with garlic, olive oil, and red pepper flakes (#44), very delicious. We also ordered the calamari (#45), which is some of the best calamari I've ever had. It wasn't too greasy, making you feel too full.  We also ordered the grilled salmon with herb almond pesto (#47), also very tasty. We also ordered the spicy potatoes with tomato aioli (#30) which I loved! The sauce that came with this one was to die for. We also ordered the rioja-braised short ribs with mashed potatoes (#51) Oh my goodness, the meat was so tender that it melted in your mouth. The mashed potatoes appeared bland but were jam-packed with flavor! We also ordered the spinach and manchego-stuffed mushrooms (#31), which I liked even though I don't like mushrooms. Lastly we ordered the paella with shrimp, scallops, green beans, and cherry tomatoes -- yum!
